Alternatively, Tera Blast + Tera Fighting lets Magnezone remove Kingambit, potentially forcing it to Terastallize as well. Hidden Power Fire hits foes such as the aforementioned Mega Scizor, Kartana, and Ferrothorn. Toxic is another alternative that punishes switch-ins such as Gastrodon, Ting-Lu, and Hippowdon, though it can be difficult to justify over other alternatives, as it hinders Magnezone's effectiveness as a trapper. Magnezone should only Terastallize when it can trap and eliminate Kingambit, since teammates such as Dragapult and Dragonite take advantage of Tera better. The given EV spread allows Magnezone to survive an unboosted Sacred Sword from Kartana. Teammates such as Dragonite and Kartana appreciate Magnezone removing foes such as Skarmory and Ferrothorn, allowing them to sweep easier. The former can also safely switch into Ground-type attacks for Magnezone, while the latter threatens troublesome Ground-types such as Hippowdon and Gastrodon. Teammates such as Dragapult and Landorus-T provide pivoting support for Magnezone, granting it free entry against foes such as Skarmory and Kingambit to ease prediction. Dragapult in particular appreciates Magnezone trapping and removing Kingambit, allowing it to sweep without fear of being Pursuit trapped.

Choice Specs (Electric).description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot.description:
• Magnezone stands out as one of the best pivots in the metagame, having the tools to deal with dangerous threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Dondozo, and Corviknight.

  • Mirror Coat: If using Sturdy, Mirror Coat can get a shocking KO on powerful Special Attackers that Magnezone struggles to KO, such as Chi-Yu and Iron Moth.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is insanely powerful if sacrificing Magnezone's life is worth it.

Tera Types

  • Water: Offensively, Water Tera Blast nails Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon. It also gives Magnezone a much-appreciated Fire resistance for Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Skeledirge, and Volcarona, and lets Magnezone take on Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Flying: Flying has wonderful defensive synergy with Magnezone, reversing its Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and lets Tera Blast hit Grass-types harder.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera Blast is very useful against common Dragon-types, most notably Garchomp and Roaring Moon, and hitting bulky Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Umbreon hard.

  • Fighting: Gaining a resistance to Dark allows Magnezone to surprise and defeat Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon, in addition to dealing plenty of damage to Ting-Lu.

  • Grass: Grass has excellent defensive and offense synergy with Magnezone, especially through its utility against Ground-type attackers and Spore immunity. Most notably, Tera Blast Grass can OHKO max SpD Hippowdon with Choice Specs.

  • Steel: The boost from Tera Steel makes Steel Beam absurdly powerful, with Analytic letting Choice Specs Magnezone OHKO even offensive Multiscale Dragonite!

  • Ground: Tera Ground helps against opposing Magnezone, OHKOs Iron Moth, and deals good damage against Gholdengo and Kingambit.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: Magnezone's excellent typing means investing in bulk is a great idea. However, note that some important targets such as Corviknight and Skeledirge are a tad faster than it.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: With maximum Special Defense investment and Assault Vest, Magnezone becomes a good soft check against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, and one of the best pivots in the metagame.

  • 252 HP / 76 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: While this spread sacrifices a large amount of power, in exchange it outspeeds Adamant maximum Speed Kingambit, who can threaten to deal massive damage otherwise.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: If using Sturdy, Magnezone can run maximum Speed to outspeed unexpected foes, such as Specially Defensive Annihilape.

Items

  • Assault Vest: The increase in special bulk helps Magnezone against the myriad of Choice item special attacking Dragon-types, like Hydreigon and Dragapult. If using Calm, Magnezone can even take on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle!

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs gives Magnezone a devastating amount of power, with even Clodsire having trouble handling it.

  • Air Balloon: The temporary Ground-type immunity helps Magnezone against foes like Garchomp and Dragonite without Terastallizing.

Abilities

  • Analytic: A Magnezone boosted by both Choice Specs and Analytic is incredibly hard to switch into, making it easier for Magnezone to generate momentum.

  • Sturdy: With Sturdy's guaranteed survivability and Magnezone's high damage output, Magnezone will very likely take down at least one Pokemon per game. Sturdy also helps Magnezone play around Dondozo, as it can safely come in on Fissure and use Volt Switch against it, which renders Yawn moot. However, if Magnezone switches into a Yawn and not Fissure, it should be noted that Dondozo often runs Protect to block Volt Switch and ensure Magnezone falls asleep.

Tank.description: Attack for a jump point + extra point. Max Special Defense investment to take hits with leftover HP investment, Speed investment for Tangrowth and Mega Aggron

Choice Band.description:
Speed investment is for neutral base 60s (Swampert, Magnezone, Primarina). Can lower to hit neutral base 50s (Registeel) and increase bulk.

These are sample sets, stay tuned for future updates!

Physically Defensive.description: Tangrowth's excellent natural physical bulk, crucial resistances, and variety of utility options at its disposal come together to make it a solid physical wall, being an effective stop to the likes of Mega Tyranitar, Iron Hands and Excadrill. Regenerator only serves to further complement the aforementioned defensive traits, blessing it with the longevity needed to repeatedly switch into and answer these Pokemon. Knock Off allows Tangrowth to cripple incoming switch-ins by removing important held items, such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Cinderace and Leftovers from Clefable and Celesteela, making them far easier to wear down in the long-term. Hidden Power Fire allows Tangrowth to deal high amounts of damage to Steel and Grass-type Pokemon in a pinch, most notably 2HKOing Scizor. Alternatively, Focus Blast greatly improves Tangrowth's matchup against Dragon Dance variants of Mega Tyranitar, Excadrill, and Bisharp, being able to OHKO the latter, although its lack of accuracy can be somewhat irritating. Sleep Powder allows Tangrowth to neutralize incoming targets it would otherwise be unable to threaten, such as Iron Moth, offensive Celesteela, and Skarmory while also shutting down setup sweepers like Iron Hands, Calm Mind Clefable, and Mega Altaria. However, Toxic can be used instead to permanently cripple Pokemon such as Buzzwole, Salamence, and Slowking, limiting their ability to pivot into Tangrowth throughout the game. Rocky Helmet allows Tangrowth to punish contact moves from the likes of U-turn as well as Buzzwole, whereas Heavy-Duty Boots can be used to provide Tangrowth with greater longevity against entry hazards, allowing it to take advantage of Regenerator more effectively; it also helps keep Tangrowth out of KO range of wallbreakers it may try to switch in against, such as Iron Hands and Terrakion when entry hazards have been set. Tangrowth fits best on balance teams that appreciate its longevity and diversity in crippling opposing teams via its utility options. Entry hazard setters such as Ting-Lu, Clefable, and Toxic Spikes Iron Moth appreciate Tangrowth's ability to deter opposing hazard removal options such as Tapu Fini and Salamence while further capitalizing on Tangrowth's tendency to remove various items from targets, such as Cinderace and Amoonguss, with Knock Off. Specially defensive teammates such as Slowking, Gastrodon, and Celesteela have excellent defensive synergies with Tangrowth, compensating for its low Special Defense by providing a solid backbone against threats such as Latios, Hydreigon, and Alakazam; Slowking and Gastrodon also help Tangrowth play around with the likes of Keldeo, utility Clefable, and Victini, which can overwhelm it easily. In return, Tangrowth can help check the likes of Iron Hands and Bisharp, which may threaten them. Besides the aforementioned Pokemon, offensive teammates such as Cinderace, Choice Specs Enamorus, and both Thundurus formes appreciate Tangrowth's ability to sponge Knock Off from Pokemon that they may be forced out by, such as Mega Tyranitar, Clefable, and Scizor.

Tangrowth serves as a near-immovable physical wall and defensive pivot courtesy of its valuable defensive profile accentuated with Regenerator. It can safely switch into and check physical threats like Mega Lopunny, Mega Swampert, Kartana, and Great Tusk as well as scout for Choice item users such as Urshifu-R and Zamazenta. Knock Off provides further utility by crippling switch-ins like Tornadus-T, Toxapex, and Heatran, and it hits Dragapult and Gholdengo super effectively. Hidden Power Fire pressures Kartana, Ferrothorn, and Mega Scizor—the former of which can use Tangrowth as setup fodder otherwise—while Hidden Power Ice dents Landorus-T, Garchomp, and Dragonite. Earthquake is an option to threaten Steel-types hard, including Heatran, as well as Tapu Koko and Clodsire. Stun Spore or Sleep Powder cripples foes like Tornadus-T, Volcarona, and Iron Valiant, preventing Tangrowth from being taken advantage of by them, especially if not running the appropriate coverage move. Nature Power—if paired with Tapu Koko's Electric Terrain—immediately pressures Flying-types like Tornadus-T and Mega Charizard Y. Rocky Helmet chips down the physical attackers that Tangrowth checks, especially pivot attempts from the likes of Mega Swampert and Landorus-T, but Heavy-Duty Boots makes it a sturdier pivot in the face of entry hazards. Tera Steel improves Tangrowth's matchup against foes like Weavile, Tornadus-T, and non-Close Combat Mega Scizor, and it prevents it from being crippled by Toxapex, Clodsire, and Glimmora's poison. Teammates like Clodsire, Heatran, and Garganacl compensate for Tangrowth's exploitable special bulk by checking Pokemon such as Volcarona, Tapu Lele, and Tornadus-T, respectively; in return, Tangrowth handles the likes of Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Mega Swampert. Due to its reliance on Regenerator for longevity, non-Heavy-Duty Boots variants enjoy hazard removal support from teammates such as Tornadus-T, Rotom-W, and Great Tusk, with Tornadus-T in particular forming a sturdy Regenerator core with Tangrowth.

Assault Vest.description: Assault Vest Tangrowth is a solid defensive pivot that checks threats such as Iron Valiant, Mega Diancie, and Kartana thanks to its typing, Regenerator, and well-rounded bulk. Knock Off cripples common switch-ins such as Heatran, Ferrothorn, Tornadus-T, and Volcarona, both impairing their longevity and increasing their susceptibility to entry hazards. Earthquake hits the likes of Heatran, Iron Moth, Kingambit and Gholdengo. Alternatively, Sludge Bomb can be used instead to hit Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Tapu Lele while threatening to cripple switch-ins like Tornadus-T and Mega Charizard Y. Focus Blast can also be used to snipe Kingambit, or even Rock Slide to remove unsuspecting Volcarona that try to set up on the switch—the effectiveness of both options are highly matchup dependent, however. Hidden Power Ice hits bulky Ground- and Dragon-types in Garchomp, Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Gliscor, while Hidden Power Fire hits Steel-types such as Ferrothorn, Mega Scizor, and Kartana. Tera Steel is preferred to turn Tangrowth's common weaknesses into resistances, helping it sponge Ice coverage from Weavile, Baxcalibur, and Mega Swampert and Hurricane from Tornadus-T and Zapdos. Moreover, it can be used in a pinch to resist Moonblast from Iron Valiant and Tapu Lele. Alternatively, Tera Water turns the tide against threats such as Weavile and Heatran while maintaining Tangrowth's ability to check rain wallbreakers such as Mega Swampert. Tangrowth fits best on bulky offense teams, which appreciate its ability to check Pokemon like Landorus-T, Garchomp, Rotom-W, and Tapu Koko. Heatran receives strong support from Tangrowth, as Tangrowth checks threats such as Great Tusk, Landorus-T, and Garchomp and pivots into foes with super effective coverage against Heatran, such as Tapu Lele and Mega Diancie. In return, Heatran checks Weavile, Volcarona, and Tornadus-T. Toxapex and Tornadus-T both benefit from Tangrowth's ability to pivot into threats such as Tapu Koko and Rotom-W, with the former receiving the same level of support from Tangrowth as does Heatran. This trio comprises a formidable Regenerator core, with Toxapex removing Toxic Spikes and checking Pokemon like Mega Charizard Y, Volcarona, and Weavile, and Tornadus-T providing valuable entry hazard removal to reinforce the longevity of the core. Tangrowth is susceptible to entry hazards, which can often put it into 2HKO range of certain attacks; therefore, it appreciates entry hazard removers like the aforementioned Tornadus-T, as well as Rotom-W. Defensive cores supported by Tangrowth can fall victim to Kyurem as a result of its lethal coverage. Volcarona and Mega Scizor are teammates that can take advantage of Kyurem with their ability to set up and reliable recovery. With Tornadus-T forcing Tangrowth out, Rotom-W and Tapu Koko make for stellar teammates with their resistance to Hurricane and ability to pivot. In return, Tangrowth forces out Gastrodon, which otherwise checks the aforementioned teammates.

Wish.description:
X-Scissor hits opposing Grass-types like Flapple and Gogoat; if these Pokemon aren't a concern, Leafeon can run Yawn to force switches, Leech Seed for additional recovery, or Swords Dance to make up for its relative passivity.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Flying

A spread of 244 HP / 16 Def / 188 SpD / 60 Spe with an Impish nature can also be used, notably allowing Gliscor to function as a good switch-in against Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine and Ceruledge. The EVs allow Gliscor to take Head Smash twice from Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine and tank +2 Poltergeist from Ceruledge. U-turn is an alternative over Toxic to preserve momentum and scout switches. 16 Speed EVs can be used instead of 60 to invest more in Gliscor's special bulk while still outspeeding Modest Pelipper and Adamant Scizor, allowing Gliscor to more comfortably duel foes such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Specs Iron Valiant.

Ground

Taunt can be used over Protect to prevent foes such as Iron Defense Zamazenta, Iron Defense Corviknight, and Sinistcha from using Gliscor as a setup opportunity, as well as allow Gliscor to act as a stallbreaker against Quagsire and Corviknight. An EV spread of 244 HP / 116 Def / 132 SpD / 16 Spe with an Impish nature can be used to turn Gliscor into an unparalleled physical wall, allowing it to duel foes such as Meowscarada, Ogerpon-H, and Iron Defense Zamazenta; this spread makes Choice Band Meowscarada's Flower Trick a 3HKO and prevents Gliscor from being OHKOed by Pawmot's Ice Punch. However, this comes with the trade-off of making Gliscor far more vulnerable to special attackers such as Choice Specs Dragapult and Flutter Mane. 148 Speed EVs can be used to allow Gliscor to fly past Dragonite and Adamant Hoopa-U and remove their Choice Bands before they can attack, but this will impinge on Gliscor's bulk.

Entry Hazard Support (Flying).description:
Gliscor is one of the best entry hazard setters for Flying teams, owing to its ability, typing and bulk. The combination of Toxic Orb and Poison Heal gives Gliscor excellent passive recovery and immunity to status from moves like Spore from Amoonguss and Will-O-Wisp from Sableye. Furthermore, Gliscor's Ground / Flying type combination gives it an immunity to Electric-type moves like Thunderbolt from Regieleki and Sandy Shocks, which its teammates are weak to, and a neutrality against Rock-type moves like Stone Axe from Kleavor and Stone Edge from Tyranitar. Gliscor's typing combined with Special Defense investment and Poison Heal also allows it to sit on Pokemon such as non-Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Iron Moth that do not have Ice-type or strong Water-type moves. Access to Stealth Rock and Spikes allows Gliscor to wear down walls like Toxapex and Clodsire and fast threats like Greninja and Basculegion-F throughout the game, and Toxic allows it to spread status against bulkier threats like Dragon Dance Dragonite, Mandibuzz, and Ursaluna-B. Taunt pressures Defog users like Corviknight and opposing entry hazard setters like Clefable and Quagsire. Knock Off hits Air Balloon Gholdengo and removes Leftovers from Corviknight. Earthquake offers decent STAB damage against Poison- and Steel-type Pokemon, which are immune to Toxic, like Clodsire and Gholdengo and prevents foes from setting up in Gliscor's presence. Protect helps Gliscor activate its Toxic Orb against faster enemies with access to Knock Off or status-spreading moves. It also allows Gliscor to scout super effective moves like Ice Spinner from Great Tusk and Iron Treads, and diminish Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon PP by using Protect on Blood Moon turns and walling Ursaluna-B on the cooldown, and safely recover HP from Poison Heal. 60 EVs in Speed serve to outspeed Modest Volcanion and Timid Magnezone.

Gliscor appreciates teammates like Articuno, which can use Freeze-Dry to force opposing Gliscor and Water-type Pokemon like Manaphy and Walking Wake to switch. In addition to that, Articuno can easily switch into Ice Beam from threats like Greninja and Frosmoth and other special attacks due to its naturally high Special Defense and neutrality to Ice-type attacks. In return, Articuno appreciates Gliscor's ability to threaten Steel- and Fire-types with Earthquake and block Toxic. Articuno also enjoys Gliscor's ability to absorb Knock Off and prevent the removal of Articuno's Heavy-Duty Boots. Iron Defense Corviknight is also a great teammate for Gliscor, as it serves as an answer to Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur. Corviknight's great physical bulk and access to Body Press allow it to comfortably switch into Icicle Crash from these Ice-type Pokemon and force them out with the threat of super effective damage. Corviknight also checks Dragon-type wallbreakers like Dragonite and Dragon Dance or Choice Band Dragapult, which Gliscor may struggle against. Articuno, Corviknight and Gliscor thus synergize well with each other and limit the opponent from sweeping through the team with Gliscor's Electric-type immunity. Gliscor also appreciates teammates like Thundurus-T and Zapdos that serve as an answer to Corviknight and threatening Water-type Pokemon like Barraskewda, Urshifu-R, and Basculegion-F, which cause problems for Gliscor. Thundurus-T and Zapdos in return appreciate Gliscor spreading Toxic and setting entry hazards, as the accumulated chip damage lets them break other Pokemon with ease. Dragonite can switch into Water-type attacks from Pokemon like Choice Band Barraskewda and Urshifu-R. In return, Dragonite appreciates Gliscor's ability to absorb status moves like Will-O-Wisp and Toxic, which can otherwise greatly hamper its wallbreaking ability. Moltres helps Gliscor spread status against various physical threats like Kingambit and Chien-Pao, with the help of Flame Body and Will-O-Wisp while also pivoting in the rest of the team safely with the help of U-turn. Gliscor supports Choice Scarf Enamorus's cleaning ability due to its hazards and status allowing Enamorus to OHKO offensive threats like Choice Specs Greninja and Choice Specs Walking Wake. Gliscor also boosts Enamorus and Galarian Moltres's wallbreaking potential by serving as an answer to their common checks like Alolan Muk, Clodsire, and Galarian Slowking, thus enabling them to sweep late-game. Gyarados pairs well with Gliscor, as it can act like a check for Urshifu-R, Baxcalibur, and Chien-Pao, owing to its type combination and Intimidate ability. Gyarados can also rack up entry hazard damage with Dragon Tail, thus working well with Gliscor's entry hazards. Landorus is also a great teammate for Gliscor, as it can run Stealth Rock to allow Gliscor to run Spikes instead and threatens physical walls such as Galarian Weezing, Kommo-o, and Great Tusk with its coverage.

Swords Dance (Ground).description:
Swords Dance Gliscor is an excellent bulky sweeper for Ground teams, being able to use its superb bulk, status immunity, and Poison Heal recovery to easily set up Swords Dance multiple times and quickly snowball against more passive team archetypes such as Steel, Poison, Water stall, and opposing Ground. Knock Off serves as Gliscor’s secondary attacking move to accompany Earthquake, hitting targets immune to Earthquake such as Landorus and Air Balloon Gholdengo while also removing foes’ items, cutting off foes such as Corviknight and Galarian Weezing from Leftovers or Black Sludge recovery and offensively neutering threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant. Alternatively, Facade can be used as a strong neutral coverage option that smacks Enamorus, Galarian Moltres, and Galarian Weezing; however, running Facade means that Gliscor will be walled by Air Balloon Gholdengo and will be unable to remove foes' items. Protect allows Gliscor to safely use Poison Heal to recover while scouting foes’ moves, which can be especially useful against Choice item users such as Iron Moth, Dragapult, and Dragonite. Additionally, Protect is particularly valuable against Ursaluna-B, as Gliscor can void its Blood Moon and use the following turn to set up Swords Dance. The given EVs maximize Gliscor’s Poison Heal recovery, allow Gliscor to outrun Modest Pelipper and Adamant Scizor, and maximize its ability to duel special attackers such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Ursaluna-B, and Choice Specs Dragapult.

Clodsire is an extremely useful teammate to Gliscor due to its Water immunity via Water Absorb, serving as a crucial check to foes such as Walking Wake, Urshifu-R, and Basculegion-F. Moreover, Clodsire can offer Gliscor Toxic Spikes support, which synergizes brilliantly with Gliscor’s Protect and makes Gliscor even more threatening as a sweeper. In return, Gliscor can absorb burns and Knock Off for Clodsire, deal with threats such as Landorus, Hatterene, and Iron Treads without Ice Spinner, and provide a Ground immunity to counteract Clodsire's weakness. Mamoswine complements Gliscor excellently by offering an Ice resistance to compensate for Gliscor’s weakness, and with a Choice Band it can easily take care of impediments to Gliscor such as Corviknight, Articuno, and Dragonite. In exchange, Gliscor can absorb burns from foes such as Sableye and Moltres and offer a Fighting resistance to answer foes like Iron Valiant and Sneasler. Ursaluna-B is another great pairing to Gliscor, acting as a special wallbreaker that can blast through physical walls such as Quagsire, Dondozo, and Slowbro. Furthermore, with Vacuum Wave, Ursaluna-B can act as a check to Chien-Pao, and if using Calm Mind, it can overwhelm Corviknight variants that do not use Iron Defense. Gliscor returns the favor by taking on Iron Valiant, Choice Band Zamazenta, and Assault Vest Iron Hands for Ursaluna-B. Ursaluna-B can additionally tackle Hex Dragapult and Spectrier, which are otherwise very deadly to Gliscor. Landorus is another option for a special wallbreaker that can use Gravity to ground and threaten Corviknight. As another option, Landorus can also run a Choice Scarf, threatening Ogerpon-W, Chien-Pao, and Zamazenta and providing safe entry for Gliscor with U-turn. Choice Scarf Great Tusk can revenge kill Chien-Pao and can also handle Baxcalibur, Hisuian Samurott, Hydreigon. With Ice Spinner, Great Tusk can further eliminate Dragonite and Swords Dance Garchomp and, if using Megahorn, tear through Ogerpon-W. Alternatively, Choice Scarf Iron Treads can additionally beat Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur while also OHKOing Alolan Ninetales, Flutter Mane, and Enamorus. Quagsire can serve as a defensive answer to key menaces to Gliscor such as Azumarill and Swords Dance Chien-Pao and stack entry hazards to facilitate Gliscor’s sweep. Sandy Shocks can zap Corviknight and Slowbro for Gliscor, provide Gliscor with safe entry points with Volt Switch, and layer entry hazards for Gliscor.

Defensive Utility (Ground).description:
Outspeeds Adamant Dragonite and removes its Choice Band with Knock Off. Is never OHKOed by +2 Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel or +2 Jolly Ceruledge's Poltergeist after Stealth Rock. If dropping Knock Off, the alternate EV spread invests more in Special Defense while still outspeeding Adamant Scizor.

This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Glis.description:
• With its great typing and incredible longevity thanks to Poison Heal, Gliscor is a frustratingly potent defensive threat in Regulation E.

  • Toxic: Gliscor is one of few Pokemon to be given Toxic via TM, allowing it to put opposing walls on a timer while it stays healthy itself.

  • Protect + Substitute: Stalling turns with Protect + Substitute allows Gliscor to keep itself healthy despite not having access to a manual healing move. This also pairs well with Toxic to keep Gliscor safe as the opponent succumbs to poison.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake allows Gliscor to threaten Steel- and Poison-types that are otherwise immune to its Toxic-stalling antics.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: Knock Off’s item removal can allow Gliscor to be more of a team player, removing items such as Leftovers and Rocky Helmet to assist a teammate’s sweep.

  • Baton Pass: Gliscor’s immense longevity makes it particularly well suited to passing Substitutes, bolstering its team’s defense while giving them turns to set up.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 180 Def / 76 Spe with Impish: This Spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom while maintaining good physical bulk.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe With with: Maximizing Speed allows Gliscor to be more of a nuisance against faster-paced teams at the cost of some survivability.

Tera Types

  • Water: Tera Water gives Gliscor crucial Ice- and Water-type resistances, allowing it to get emergency Toxics off against threats like Baxcalibur and Urshifu-R.

  • Steel: Tera Steel allows Gliscor to resist Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-type moves, giving it increased survivability against a wider array of threats, but Steel leaves it more vulnerable to Fighting-types like Urshifu and Fire-types like Ogerpon-H.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Gliscor a Dragon immunity, allowing it to stand in the way of threats like Garchomp and Baxcalibur, and block attempts to bypass Substitute with Scale Shot while maintaining its Fighting-type resistance for Urshifu.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Gliscor is a great pivot in Ubers thanks to its many positive traits. Poison Heal grants it excellent passive recovery and a status immunity, meaning that it can sit on Pokemon like non-Ice Beam Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, Groudon, Clodsire, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Ting-Lu, after its Toxic Orb has been activated. Its excellent bulk lets it tank hits from and trade hits with metagame beasts like Zacian-C and Koraidon, with Protect giving Gliscor the ability to scout moves and stay healthy throughout the game. Lastly, its very useful Ground immunity lets it annoy common Ground-type Pokemon like Groudon and Landorus-T while also being Spikes-immune.
  • Unfortunately for Gliscor, its low base Special Defense means it gets exploited and forced out by many common special attackers, namely Kyogre, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Calm Mind Arceus formes. The aforementioned Zacian-C and Koraidon can also overwhelm Gliscor after a Swords Dance, forcing it to Terastallize to not succumb to their attacks. Lastly, Gliscor's offenses are mediocre, meaning that Taunt Pokemon like Arceus formes and Koraidon can effectively shut it down, as they take very little damage from Earthquake.
  • Gliscor is a good user of Spikes, as it commonly annoys most Defog and Rapid Spin Pokemon, such as Giratina-O and Great Tusk, with Toxic. Corviknight stands out as the only Pokemon that is immune to Toxic, is immune to Earthquake, and can stall out Spikes with Defog and Pressure.
  • Knock Off can be used instead to cripple Pokemon like Landorus-T, Kyogre, and Ting-Lu, as well as opposing Gliscor if it doesn't use Protect before its Toxic Orb has been activated. Knock Off can also cripple Heavy-Duty Boots Pokemon like Eternatus, and it is best used with Pokemon that can lay Spikes, like Ting-Lu and Clodsire, both of which appreciate Gliscor's ability to cripple and wear down hazard removal Pokemon like Giratina-O. However, with Arceus formes everywhere in the tier, which can absorb Knock Off without losing their items, Knock Off is usually unable to cripple most Pokemon. Nonetheless, said Arceus formes still fear Toxic from Gliscor.
  • Lastly, Taunt is also an option for Gliscor to deny entry hazard attempts from slower Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, opposing uninvested Gliscor, and Clodsire while also denying recovery from Arceus formes and Clodsire on the switch.
  • The given spread lets Gliscor outspeed uninvested base 100 Speed Pokemon. The remaining EVs maximize bulk, allowing Gliscor to avoid the 2HKO and OHKO from Zacian-C's +1 and +3 Behemoth Blade, respectively.
  • Another possible EV spread is 244 HP / 80 Def / 140 SpD / 44 Spe with a Careful nature. This makes Gliscor able to survive an unboosted Ice Beam from support Arceus formes from full, letting it use Toxic on them. This can come in handy, as support Arceus formes can be an annoyance to the teams Gliscor usually sees play in. However, this spread leaves Gliscor 2HKOed and OHKOed by a +1 and +3 Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C, respectively, and OHKOed by +2 Scale Shot from Koraidon.
  • Tera Water lets Gliscor resist the Water- and Ice-type attacks that are commonly thrown at it such as Ice Beam from Arceus-Ground, Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I, and Kyogre's moves. Tera Water also allows it to resist Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Koraidon's Flare Blitz, which is equally important. However, Terastallizing leaves Gliscor unable to switch into Ground-type Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground. Furthermore, it makes Gliscor become affected by Spikes and take super effective damage from Miraidon's Electro Drift instead of being immune to it.
  • Gliscor wants to activate its Toxic Orb as soon as possible in order to continuously be able to check and switch in on threats, so it is advised to quickly get it in the field and use Protect to ensure it gets poisoned. Gliscor is an annoyance for teams that have multiple physical attackers like Koraidon and Zacian-C, so its HP should be preserved in order to comfortably tank their hits. However, Gliscor should not be the only switch-in to the aforementioned Pokemon, as it can get overwhelmed fairly easily, due to them commonly running Swords Dance.
  • Gliscor's Special Defense is on the lower side, with Pokemon like Calm Mind Arceus formes, Miraidon, Kyogre, and Eternatus taking advantage of this to wreak havoc with powerful attacks or, in Eternatus's case, threaten to set Toxic Spikes. Because of this, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Water Absorb Clodsire are recommended teammates. Pokemon like Arceus-Water and Kyogre can take on the Ice-type attacks that OHKO Gliscor while also helping it not get potentially overwhelmed by Koraidon and Zacian-C.

Stallbreaker (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Hazards Support.description: Thanks to its respectable bulk and fantastic passive longevity with Poison Heal, Gliscor occupies a fantastic niche on defensive teams. Its lack of use for its item slot after its activation combined with its Spikes immunity allows Gliscor to withstand weaker Knock Off attempts from Tornadus-T, Toxapex, and Ferrothorn. Gliscor can use its longevity to act as an excellent Defog user, as it can outlast common Stealth Rock setters such as Landorus-T, Ting-Lu, and Garganacl. Alternatively, Gliscor can opt for Stealth Rock if its team prefers it over Defog. Roost keeps Gliscor healthy alongside Poison Heal, allowing it to drain the PP of moves such as Heatran's Magma Storm and Garganacl's Salt Cure. Toxic allows Gliscor to pressure common entry hazard setters and Ground-immune Pokemon, such as Landorus-T, Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Tornadus-T. It also allows Gliscor to cripple offensive Pokemon such as Dragapult and Tapu Lele in a pinch. Tera Fairy gives Gliscor a generally solid defensive typing with few weaknesses, although at the cost of its Spikes immunity. The given HP EVs maximize Gliscor's recovery from Poison Heal and special bulk, with the remainder in Speed to outspeed Rotom-W. Gliscor fits best on defensive teams that appreciate its immense survivability and great support options. As such, Gliscor pairs well with sturdy physical and special walls, such as Skeledirge, Skarmory, Buzzwole, and Clodsire, since its relatively unremarkable bulk puts it at risk of being overwhelmed often. In return, it can switch into weak attacks with problematic secondary effects, such as Toxapex's Scald and Garganacl's Salt Cure, as well as help teammates keep their held items by absorbing Knock Off. Pokemon weak to entry hazards such as Nasty Plot Tornadus-T and Garganacl pair well with Gliscor's Defog support, while they act as threatening late-game wincons after Gliscor has worn down their checks. Gliscor pairs exceptionally well with Toxapex, as they form an incredibly sturdy pivoting core due to their incredible passive recovery.

Swords Dance.description: Swords Dance Gliscor is an incredibly potent wincon, using its incredible longevity and solid bulk to effortlessly setup on passive Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Toxapex, and Clefable. Facade provides Gliscor with an excellent alternative move to hit Ground-resistant and -immune Pokemon such as Skarmory, Zapdos, and Buzzwole, with its ample PP ensuring that it can outstall their recovery PP if necessary. Roost provides Gliscor with instant recovery, allowing it to check Pokemon like Mega Diancie and Heatran. The given EVs allow Gliscor to fulfill this purpose with Special Defense investment, with the HP maximizing its recovery from Poison Heal. Tera Fairy allows Gliscor to leverage a typing with few exploitable weaknesses, given Steel-types such as Kingambit and Gholdengo fear its Earthquake, while Tera Water improves Gliscor's matchup against Pokemon like Volcarona and Urshifu-R. However, it comes with more exploitable weaknesses, given the prominence of Tapu Koko, Rotom-W, and Ferrothorn. Gliscor fits best on balance and fat teams, which appreciate its ability to tear through opposing defensive cores while providing enough of a defensive backbone in return to facilitate this. Pokemon like Toxapex, Skarmory, and Gholdengo can exploit Gliscor's temporary checks such as Great Tusk, Skarmory, and Buzzwole, generating progress of their own. On the flip side, revenge killers such as Mega Lopunny and Dragapult can threaten offensive teams, given Gliscor's tendency to be overwhelmed when facing multiple strong wallbreakers. Gliscor appreciates Pursuit support from Mega Tyranitar or Kingambit, as it removes Gliscor's few true walls in Tera Ghost Rotom-W and Air Balloon Gholdengo.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Ice

If dropping Smack Down in favor of Icicle Crash, a more offensively oriented EV spread can be used due to the given EVs being only particularly useful when running Smack Down. In particular, 252 Speed EVs allow Mamoswine to outspeed and smash slower Gholdengo sets. Knock Off is a decent choice that allows Mamoswine to open up Heavy-Duty Boots users such as Skeledirge and Toxapex to hazard damage, but it is difficult to fit over generally more useful alternatives.

Ground

Stone Edge slices through Articuno, Moltres, and Baxcalibur. A Jolly nature lets Mamoswine outrun maximum Speed Heatran and Cloyster and Speed tie with maximum Speed Hoopa-U and Gallade at the cost of considerable power, no longer guaranteeing a 2HKO on Quagsire for instance. Heavy Slam can make Galarian Weezing an unsafe switch-in as well as OHKO Hatterene.

Entry Hazard Support (Ice).description:
Mamoswine is a staple pick for Ice teams, offering many useful traits, including a Fire neutrality via its ability Thick Fat, an Electric immunity that nullifies Thunder Wave and Volt Switch, and access to Stealth Rock. Mamoswine's primary attacking move is its strong STAB Earthquake, allowing it to threaten bulky Steel-types such as Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, Empoleon, and Magnezone, which is of great importance for Ice. Mamoswine's Earthquake finds further use as Ice's best way of dealing with Iron Hands, Toxapex, and Okidogi. Ice Shard lets Mamoswine circumvent its middling Speed and pick off weakened offensive threats such as Dragapult, Dragonite, Meowscarada, and Enamorus, as well as OHKO Landorus after Stealth Rock. Smack Down gives Mamoswine the capacity to threaten Corviknight with its powerful Earthquake and force it out, making it adept at keeping Stealth Rock up against Flying teams by making it difficult for Corviknight to use Defog. Smack Down provides further utility by allowing Mamoswine to ground and threaten Zapdos, 2HKO Articuno, and crucially OHKO defensively uninvested Volcarona. As an alternative to Smack Down, Icicle Crash can be used as a broadly powerful Ice-type STAB move that allows Mamoswine to better pressure targets such as Mandibuzz, Ursaluna-B, and Amoonguss, at the cost of making the Flying matchup more difficult. The given EVs render physically defensive Corviknight's Body Press a 3HKO against Mamoswine after Leftovers recovery while maximizing attack power, making Mamoswine much more effective at threatening Corviknight. Furthermore, they allow Mamoswine to live a +1 Flamethrower from offensive Volcarona and OHKO it in return with Smack Down, as well as outpace Adamant Kingambit and Iron Hands.

Baxcalibur forms a fantastic offensive core with Mamoswine, providing a burn immunity via Thermal Exchange and a resistance to Water to compensate for Mamoswine's weaknesses. To complement Baxcalibur, Mamoswine sets Stealth Rock and removes bulky Steel-types, such as Empoleon and Corviknight, in order to pave the way for Baxcalibur's sweeping or wallbreaking. Alolan Ninetales pairs excellently with Mamoswine, setting snow and Aurora Veil to improve Mamoswine's defenses even further and dealing with the Fighting-types that threaten Mamoswine such as Urshifu-R and Iron Valiant. In return, Mamoswine can comfortably take Heavy Slams aimed at Alolan Ninetales under snow and threaten their users, including Hisuian Goodra, Iron Hands, and Iron Treads. Froslass can set Spikes to compound the offensive pressure that Mamoswine's Stealth Rock creates while also serving as a Fighting immunity and a spinblocker. Chien-Pao appreciates Mamoswine's Stealth Rock bringing foes down to KO ranges and breaking Ceruledge's Focus Sash to enable its sweeping and wallbreaking; it supports Mamoswine in turn by threatening problematic foes such as Gholdengo and Spectrier, as well as Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-W if using Choice Band. Frosmoth similarly benefits from Mamoswine setting Stealth Rock and breaking Steel-types such as Heatran, while it threatens physical walls such as Quagsire and Great Tusk in exchange. Alolan Sandslash can neutralize Toxic from foes such as Toxapex aimed at Mamoswine, threaten Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant, and use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Amoonguss and Toxapex and open them up to being chipped by Stealth Rock. Moreover, both Alolan Sandslash and Avalugg can help prevent Mamoswine from being worn down by entry hazards by spinning them away. Cetitan and Cloyster are other sweepers on Ice to accompany Baxcalibur that benefit from the offensive pressure that Mamoswine's Stealth Rock creates. Cloyster greatly appreciates Mamoswine's Electric immunity, and Cetitan can only OHKO Corviknight at +6 after Stealth Rock.

Choice Band (Ground).description:
Mamoswine is a great offensive option for Ground teams thanks to its huge Attack stat, access to priority, and unique STAB combination. Mamoswine's ability, Thick Fat, also allows for it to act as an extremely valuable resistance to Ice, meaning it can switch into foes like Articuno. Icicle Crash shreds Grass-type Pokemon, such as Amoonguss and Sinistcha, and Flying-type Pokemon, such as Mandibuzz and Gliscor, that would otherwise resist or be immune to Ground-type moves. Icicle Crash is extremely threatening to Flying-type teams in particular, as most Flying-type Pokemon are 2HKOed by Icicle Crash, meaning there are no safe switchins. Ice Shard is a fantastic priority move that allows Mamoswine to stand its ground against faster Pokemon such as both Landorus formes, Cyclizar, Meowscarada, and Dragapult. Knock Off is a good final option to help deal with walls that may take a bit more time to whittle down, such as Dondozo and Corviknight, as well as create permanent progress against Pokemon such as Baxcalibur and Articuno, which both rely heavily on their items, whether it be offensively or defensively.

Mamoswine greatly appreciates entry hazard support from Pokemon like Quagsire, as the extra damage could be the difference between a 2HKO or an opportunity for an OHKO on lots of Pokemon such as Flutter Mane and Meowscarada with Ice Shard, Icicle Crash on Corviknight, and Earthquake on Toxapex and Amoonguss. Clodsire is a good teammate for Mamoswine, as it can switch in to Water- and Fighting-type attacks from Pokemon like Urshifu-R, Sneasler, and Walking Wake that would otherwise make quick work of Mamoswine, as well as provide Toxic and entry hazard support. Iron Treads is another good teammate for Mamoswine, as it keeps hazards off the field in order to prevent Mamoswine from being chipped down, as well as setts up hazards of its own. Alternatively, Choice Scarf Iron Treads outspeeds and hits Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane, which both threaten Mamoswine, for super effective damage. Choice Scarf Great Tusk is another teammate that pairs well with Mamoswine. Great Tusk is able to outspeed and OHKO Pokemon that check Mamoswine such as Choice Specs Greninja and Cinderace. Once faster threats have been taken care of, Mamoswine will have an easy time breaking the opposing team with its extremely powerful attacks. Ursaluna-B is a great teammate for Mamoswine, as it can absorb status conditions from Pokemon like Rotom-W and Sableye, as well as threatening them back with its extremely powerful Blood Moon. Ursaluna-B is also capable of using Vacuum wave to snipe Chien-Pao. Gliscor can also absorb status moves, as well as absorbing status moves and Fighting-type attacks that Mamoswine does not want to deal with. Gliscor is also able to support Mamoswine with Spikes and Toxic. Landorus forms a potent offensive core with Mamoswine, destroying Physical walls such as Quagsire and Slowbro, while Mamoswine deals with special walls such as Gliscor and Gastrodon. Additionally, Landorus can set Gravity for Mamoswine so that it can freely spam Earthquake. Lastly, Sandy Shocks is capable of dealing with Pokemon such as Pelipper and Corviknight, as well as providing hazard and Gravity support. Mamoswine easily takes care of the Ground-types that would wall Sandy Shocks.
This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance.description: With a sky-high Attack stat and a powerful STAB Close Combat, Mega Gallade serves as a potent wallbreaker in the tier, able to pressure common defensive cores featuring Pokemon such as Skarmory, Ting-Lu, and Mega Venusaur. Mega Gallade's good Speed tier also allows it to notably get the jump on threats like non-Choice Scarf Enamorus, Keldeo, and Galarian Zapdos. After a Swords Dance boost, Mega Gallade can OHKO a majority of the tier, including bulky Pokemon like Iron Hands, Hippowdon, and Mega Latias. Close Combat OHKOes threats like Mega Tyranitar, Excadrill, and Hydreigon while 2HKOing bulkier Pokemon like Celesteela and Gastrodon. Zen Headbutt threatens Mega Venusaur, Amoonguss, and Iron Moth while also being its strongest move against Fairy-types like Tapu Fini and Clefable. Triple Axel threatens Flying-types like both Thundurus formes and Enamorus as well as Dragon-types like Salamence, Mega Latias, Mega Latios, and Mega Altaria while also being its strongest move against Mega Sableye. Knock Off threatens switch-ins like Skeledirge, Slowking, and Slowbro while also hindering foes that Mega Gallade struggles to break through like Unaware Clefable. Physical cleaners like Mega Aerodactyl and Scizor appreciate Mega Gallade being able to threaten or weaken their switch-ins such as Mega Venusaur and Skarmory, respectively, potentially allowing them to sweep late-game. Mega Gallade's frailty means it's OHKOed by faster threats like Mega Aerodactyl and Choice Scarf Galarian Zapdos, so teammates that can handle them like Celesteela and Slowbro are appreciated. Mega Gallade struggles to break through Pokemon like Mega Sableye, Skeledirge, and Unaware Clefable, meaning it can struggle versus bulkier teams as a whole. Therefore, teammates that can assist in these matchups while threatening the aforementioned walls such as Enamorus and Ceruledge are appreciated.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Gallade is the premier Choice Scarf user on Psychic teams due to its great coverage options and incredible ability, Sharpness. Being able to fire off Sharpness-boosted Sacred Sword is incredibly valuable, as it hits the Steel- and Dark-type Pokemon that give Psychic teams trouble for super effective damage, such as Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hisuian Goodra. Knock Off is a great way to make progress against bulkier teams, as well as dissuade Ghost-type Pokemon from switching in on a potential Sacred Sword. Night Slash is also an option to deal more consistent damage to Skeledirge and Gholdengo. Leaf Blade is used to threaten bulky Water-type Pokemon like Quagsire and Rotom-W, as well as OHKO Belly Drum Azumarill. Aqua Cutter is an option over Leaf Blade to hit Pokemon like Landorus, Volcarona and Moltres for super effective damage, but Leaf Blade is often better due to the amount of targets it hits. A Jolly nature is preferred over Adamant, as it allows Gallade to outspeed and still OHKO Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Sneasler, while the extra attack from Adamant is not necessary as most of the moves Gallade uses receive a Sharpness boost.

Espathra is a nice compliment to Gallade, as it appreciates Gallade's ability to deal with Steel- and Dark-type Pokemon like Gholdengo, Hisuian Goodra, Kingambit, and Ting-Lu, which Espathra has little way of hitting for even neutral damage, as well as its ability to remove special walls such as Galarian Slowking and Alolan Muk. Hoopa-U is also a great teammate for Gallade, as the speed of Gallade and sheer power of Hoopa-U synergize nicely to deal with both bulky and fast teams. Hoopa-U is able to threaten an OHKO on defensive staples such as Amoonguss, Toxapex, and Rotom-W with entry hazard support, while Gallade outspeeds Pokemon that would otherwise shut Hoopa-U down, such as Sneasler and Greninja. Armarouge is a strong partner for Gallade, as it provides a nice resistance to Fairy-type attacks and complementary coverage to Gallade's. Armarouge appreciates the removal of special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Slowking, allowing it to set up and apply pressure to the opposing team, and it returns the favor by taking out physically bulky foes such as Dondozo, Zamazenta, and Corviknight. Hatterene is Psychic teams' best form of hazard control, which Gallade appreciates as it tends to switch in frequently and can otherwise get chipped. Hatterene also lures in Steel- and Poison-type Pokemon like Iron Treads and Sneasler, which Gallade can take care of. Indeedee is another good teammate for Gallade, as it sets up Psychic Terrain, further strengthening Gallade's Psycho Cut and protecting it from priority moves like Shadow Sneak and Sucker Punch. Indeedee also provides a valuable Ghost immunity, which prevents foes like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo from freely spamming Shadow Ball. Scream Tail is a great defensive teammate for Gallade, as its incredible bulk allows it to switch in to common Choice Scarf users such as Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Meowscarada, which would otherwise outspeed and OHKO Gallade. Scream Tail's access to a myriad of utility moves, such as Thunder Wave and Wish, allows it to support Gallade nicely by slowing down the aforementioned threats and increasing its longevity. Mew is a good teammate for Gallade on more offense-oriented teams, as lead Mew is the premier hazard setter for Psychic teams, and Gallade greatly appreciates the support. Galarian Slowking is a great teammate for Gallade as well, as it is able to safely switch into special attacks, as well as Fairy-type attacks that would otherwise give Gallade trouble. Galarian Slowking can also utilize Chilly Reception to give Gallade a free switch in.

Choice Scarf (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

All-out Attacker.description:
• With its wide range of moveset options and its offense-boosting ability Sharpness, Gallade is excellent at dueling a wide variety of threats.

  • Shadow Sneak versus Feint: Shadow Sneak is far more consistent as a priority move and deals good damage to targets like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Feint is used mostly for winning Focus Sash duels against Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Sucker Punch.

  • Night Slash versus Knock Off: Night Slash's consistent power is best for pure offense, potentially 2HKOing targets like Bold Gholdengo, assuming they can't stall with Recover and Rocky Helmet. If more utility is desired, Knock Off can be used for removing opposing items.

  • Leaf Blade: Fully invested Sharpness Leaf Blade has a 75% chance of OHKOing 252 HP Azumarill and is Gallade's best hope of muscling past Dondozo.

Other Options

  • Aqua Cutter: Aqua Cutter benefits from Sharpness, but it doesn't add a lot of extra coverage.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Gallade uses Focus Sash or Assault Vest as its main tool for cushioning a big hit and has great natural coverage. Therefore, Tera is reserved mostly for emergency situations.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost's immunity to Normal- and Fighting-type moves can thwart revenge kill attempts from Mach Punch users and Extreme Speed Dragonite, giving Gallade an opportunity to break Multiscale on the latter.

  • Grass: Tera Grass improves the lead matchup versus Breloom; if Gallade successfully baits a Spore, most sets can beat Breloom without losing Focus Sash. Leaf Blade also becomes an easy 2HKO on Dondozo.

  • Steel: Tera Steel flips Gallade's weakness to Fairy-type attacks to a resistance. The Ice resistance can also be used in a pinch to keep Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear from OHKOing Gallade through Focus Sash.

Items

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Gallade duels opposing Focus Sash users with its hard-hitting STAB attacks and priority moves.

  • Assault Vest: Gallade has enough Special Defense to make good use of Assault Vest if Focus Sash is already taken, comfortably surviving unboosted hits from targets like Chi-Yu. Furthermore, Assault Vest isn't rendered useless by Stealth Rock chip, making Gallade a safer mid- or late-game option.

  • Scope Lens: While Scope Lens is risky due to Gallade's average bulk and Speed, it pairs well with the increased critical hit ratio many of Gallade's attacks have.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: A maximum offense spread is standard for Focus Sash and Speed ties with offensive Adamant Dragonite.

  • 196 HP / 252 Atk / 60 Spe with Adamant: For sets that run Assault Vest over Focus Sash, this slower spread avoids the OHKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after Stealth Rock damage. The Speed investment gets the jump on 4 Speed Rotom formes, letting Gallade deal as much damage as possible before getting hit with a burn.

Choice Scarf.description:
• With both Trick and Knock Off, Gallade is a decent anti-lead against several early-game setups.

  • Trick: Trick with Choice Scarf lets Gallade permanently cripple setup Pokemon like Annihilape and Garganacl.

  • Knock Off versus Night Slash: Knock Off remains a strong disruption move with or without Trick, provided you exercise caution if you've already used Trick. Night Slash has more offensive presence than Knock Off and is a good choice if you really need to hit Gholdengo with consistent damage.

  • Leaf Blade: Leaf Blade is a great coverage option and, if Trick isn't available, your best move against Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Choice Scarf Gallade normally isn't a strong user of Tera. It is best used in situations where Gallade already has momentum and needs to preserve it.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost grants immunity to Mach Punch and Extreme Speed, letting Gallade keep its speed advantage against several targets.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can surprise Spore users like Breloom, letting Gallade score an easy KO or cripple them with Trick. Leaf Blade also becomes a 2HKO against Dondozo.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a no-nonsense option for making Sacred Sword hit harder.

  • Psychic: Tera Psychic boosts Psycho Cut while removing Gallade's Fairy weakness.

Swords Dance (Fighting).description: For Fighting teams, Mega Gallade is one of the best choices, courtesy of its incredible offensive power, typing, and Speed, being the best counter to Fighting's biggest roadblock, Toxapex. Swords Dance increases Mega Gallade's power to the maximum, letting it freely overpower the likes of Mandibuzz and Celesteela. Zen Headbutt beautifully complements a Fighting-type STAB move, as it lets Mega Gallade easily break through any opposing Poison-types that may be annoying walls such as Mega Venusaur, Toxapex, and Clodsire. Knock Off is another tool in Mega Gallade's arsenal, which lets it take care of Psychic- and Ghost-types—such as Gholdengo, Slowbro, and Aegislash—and wears down Celesteela into range of Close Combat finishing it off. Triple Axel is another option to easily take care of Flying-types such as Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Enamorus. Shadow Sneak can also be considered to pick off faster weakened threats such as Gengar, Choice Scarf Blacephalon, and Mega Alakazam. With all its benefits, Mega Gallade has a few checks in Skeledirge and defensive Gholdengo; hence, offensive Great Tusk and Urshifu-R are great partners in helping take these down. Defensive Great Tusk also helps in setting and removing entry hazards, which is appreciated by Mega Gallade. Mega Gallade is also easily revenge killed by faster offensive threats such as Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf Blacephalon, so Assault Vest Iron Hands is a good check to stop these in their tracks and deal good damage back while also being able to pivot in Mega Gallade with Volt Switch. Breloom and Lilligant-H also helps significantly in the Water matchup against the likes of Mega Swampert and Barraskewda; they can also put opposing foes to sleep to make Gallade's setup easier. Choice Scarf Sneasler helps in the Fairy matchup against the likes of Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Tapu Koko while also being able to set and absorb Toxic Spikes and can U-Turn to pivot in Mega Gallade safely. Iron Valiant is also an amazing partner in the form of a specially offensive threat, complementing Mega Gallade, as it can easily take care of Mega Sableye. Choice Scarf Iron Valiant also outspeeds Mega Swampert under rain and Regieleki under Electric Terrain, making it a great revenge killer if Mega Gallade gets knocked out.

Swords Dance (Psychic).description: Mega Gallade is a potent wallbreaker on Psychic teams thanks to its greatly appreciated Dark neutrality and good coverage in Knock Off and Triple Axel. Swords Dance allows Mega Gallade to grab a boost on a forced switch and potentially win the game with its high base Speed and astronomical Attack after one boost. Knock Off is crucial to hit opposing Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Slowbro and Gholdengo that would otherwise wall this set, and its item removal is always handy in breaking defensive teams reliant on Heavy-Duty Boots down with Stealth Rock damage and removing key items from Celesteela and Toxapex. Finally, Zen Headbutt does massive work against Poison teams after a single Swords Dance and deals high amounts of damage to Fighting-resistant Pokemon such as Buzzwole and Toxapex. Triple Axel is another alternative, allowing Mega Gallade to hit Flying- and Dragon-types such as Landorus-T and Garchomp. Shadow Sneak can allow Mega Gallade to outspeed and take out Ghost-types such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Choice Scarf Blacephalon that could otherwise beat it. Tapu Lele forms a wallbreaking core with Mega Gallade, as they both threaten common checks to each other. Tapu Lele beats Mega Sableye with Moonblast, while Mega Gallade crushes Steel-types such as Heatran and Celesteela that trouble Tapu Lele with Close Combat. Jirachi can take Fairy-type attacks such as Tapu Lele's Moonblast aimed for Mega Gallade, as well as paralyze threats and beat them down with Thunder Wave and Serene Grace-boosted Iron Head, letting Mega Gallade break through them with a timely paralysis. Finally, Jirachi provides Stealth Rock support and a safe pivot in with U-turn. Victini provides speed control with Choice Scarf and defeats Steel-types such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo that Mega Gallade is forced out by while appreciating Mega Gallade's ability to pound Heatran to dust. Deoxys-S provides entry hazard and dual screens support, which Mega Gallade can take advantage of with Knock Off and Swords Dance to break through bulkier teams. Slowbro provides crucial momentum with Teleport while also being able to annoy teams with Scald burns and Future Sight and switch in repeatedly through Regenerator. Celebi can break through troubling physical walls such as Hippowdon and Dondozo that Mega Gallade struggles to make progress against. Finally, Choice Scarf Latias can both remove entry hazards with Defog and use Healing Wish to give Mega Gallade a second chance to break through the opposing team.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

Spikes Utility.description:
With excellent Speed, a diverse utility movepool, and Spikes, Froslass is an elite Spikes setter and spinblocker. Taunt shuts down opposing entry hazard setters like Qwilfish, Blissey, and Sandaconda while also preventing Defog from the likes of Braviary and Lurantis. Ice Beam puts additional pressure on the aforementioned Defoggers and targets other walls like Sandaconda and Appletun. Shadow Ball provides higher damage on targets like Mesprit and Ghost-types like Rotom and opposing Froslass. Will-O-Wisp cripples physical attackers like Coil Dudunsparce, Hisuian Sneasel, and Scyther. While Tera Dark is situational, it can become a Knock Off sponge and wall Sableye while inverting its Dark and Ghost weaknesses.

Stealth Rock setters like Bombirdier and Sandaconda contribute to the hazard stacking Froslass provides, with the former removing opposing Heavy-Duty Boots with Knock Off. Wallbreakers like Bruxish and Pyroar can put foes into KO range faster thanks to the extra chip damage. VoltTurn users such as Scyther, Jolteon, and Magneton can not only help bring Froslass in safely, but also wear down other walls like Muk, Appletun, and Umbreon. Defensive walls like Blissey and Sandaconda can circumvent Froslass's low bulk with their reliable recovery and can sponge status moves.

Entry Hazard Lead (Ice).description:
Froslass is a great addition to Ice-type teams as it not only provides an immunity to Fighting-type moves and Rapid Spin, but also serves as a fantastic lead that is able to both set up its own entry hazards and prevent the opponent from doing the same. Taunt prevents hazards and status from foes such as Toxapex, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire, and is also used to deny Defog from Corviknight or Talonflame. However, it must be careful as most Corviknight and Talonflame can simply attack Froslass for super effective damage. When paired with Focus Sash, Taunt increases the chances of Froslass taking an opponent down with Destiny Bond, but it can also be used in tandem with Mental Herb to punish opponents like Sableye, Grimmsnarl, and opposing Froslass that attempt to Taunt Froslass, Taunting them in return. Spikes serves to punish switches on the opponent's side and weaken their team, allowing for Froslass's teammates to clean late-game. Shadow Ball is Froslass's answer to Hatterene, 2HKOing it as it comes in to bounce Spikes back, and it's Froslass's main source of damage to prevent it from being too passive. Froslass's last moveslot can utilize Destiny Bond to take an opponent down with it, but Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave are also options to consider as they allow you to status Pokemon that like to play around Destiny Bond, such as Kingambit and Volcarona. Focus Sash is the preferred item as it ensures that Froslass will always get at least one layer of Spikes up, but Mental Herb can also be used to ignore Taunt from faster leads while Heavy Duty-Boots allows Froslass to safely switch back in to block spinners such as Cyclizar and Quaquaval.

All of Froslass's teammates appreciate it spreading Spikes on the opposing field and preventing hazards from going up on theirs. After Spikes, Choice Band Chien Pao 2HKOes Iron Hands, while Shell Smash Cloyster and Belly Drum Cetitan can attempt to set up and sweep without fear of getting stopped by an opposing Focus Sash. Baxcalibur benefits from Froslass paralyzing faster threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant, enabling it to outspeed and take them out, though Froslass needs an intact Focus Sash for this. Similarily, Dragon Dance Baxcalibur and Iron Defense Avalugg also benefit from the opportunities to set up against foes that have been burned by Froslass and no longer pose much of a threat to it. Avalugg can also support Froslass by switching into strong physical attacks to scout. Abomasnow's Snow Warning increases Froslass's physical bulk and makes it less wary of other attacks coming from spinners, such as Great Tusk's Knock Off.

Entry Hazard Lead (Ghost).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf.description:
Thunderbolt is stronger than Volt Switch and doesn’t force Rotom out. Nasty Plot lets Rotom bolster its offensive presence after using Trick. Will-O-Wisp punishes foes like Arboliva and Morpeko for trying to switch in on Rotom and also slows down physical attackers like Hisuian Sneasel. Tera Electric and Tera Ghost both boost Rotom’s STAB moves, but Tera Fairy helps out against Dark-types like Morpeko and Skuntank.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Utility.description:
Tera Steel offers Rotom several useful resistances, including to Stealth Rock, and makes it neutral to Dark and immune to Poison, which lets it trade with threats like Passimian and +2 Hisuian Sneasel.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Nasty Plot.description:
Discharge is weaker than Thunderbolt but has a higher chance of paralyzing foes, which can support both Rotom and slower teammates. Volt Switch lets Rotom wear down its checks while also generating momentum for its team. Substitute shuts down passive foes like Naclstack. Protect lets Rotom scout for moves and gain extra Leftovers recovery. Tera Electric and Tera Ghost both boost Rotom’s STAB moves, but Tera Fairy helps out against Dark-types like Morpeko and Skuntank.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Choice Scarf.description: Rotom stands out as a fantastic user of Choice Scarf thanks to its nearly unresisted STAB combination, high Speed tier, and three immunities. Will-O-Wisp lets Rotom cripple opposing physical sweepers such as Passimian, Medicham, and Scyther on top of Toxicroak using Sucker Punch. Trick is very useful to dismantle walls that rely on their item like Sandaconda, Eelektross, and Chansey. Tera Electric and Tera Ghost boost Rotom's STAB attacks even further with no drawbacks, though note that Tera Ghost exposes Rotom to Sandaconda's Glare. Tera Dark is useful for beating Sucker Punch Toxicroak and making Rotom a good lure for Zoroark. Thanks to Rotom's ease switching into opposing Sandaconda, teammates weak to it like Toxicroak, Lycanroc, Perrserker, and Scyther make for great partners; the latter two can even form a VoltTurn core with it. Bruxish, Medicham, and Mabosstiff help Rotom get around common special walls like Umbreon, Muk, and Chansey. Some walls that Rotom benefits from teaming up with include Umbreon, Vaporeon, and Muk thanks to their ability to take on common wallbreakers that can revenge kill Rotom such as Mabosstiff, Bruxish, and Pyroar.

Nasty Plot.description:
Rotom takes advantage of common Pokemon such as Sandaconda and Chansey that typically can't threaten it to set up. Will-O-Wisp eases setup and helps weaken checks such as Eelektross and Appletun. Tera Ghost helps Rotom get by Eelektross and Muk while retaining its Fighting immunity, whereas Tera Fairy can catch Dark-type revenge killers like Zoroark and Choice Scarf Mabosstiff off guard.

Rotom's quite customizable: Substitute / Nasty Plot / Thunderbolt or Discharge / Shadow Ball limits revenge killers and makes it easier to choose an offensive Tera type. Protect can be used instead of Will-O-Wisp to scout Choice item revenge killers like Zoroark, Passimian, and Bruxish. These options lack the same consistency as the listed set, though.

Pivots like Passimian, Scyther, and Oricorio formes are great to bring Rotom in against Sandaconda and Chansey, affording it easy setup opportunities. If Rotom is running Volt Switch, pair it with physical wallbreakers such as Bruxish and Toxicroak that can take on blanket special walls like Muk and Umbreon that commonly try to check it.

Utility.description: Rotom is an excellent bulky pivot, forcing out common staples like Scyther and Qwilfish with Volt Switch while having a positive matchup against Sandaconda, the most common Volt Switch absorber in the tier. Will-O-Wisp neuters physical attackers such as Passimian and Toxicroak and powers up Hex to chunk special walls like Eelektross and Muk. Protect racks up Leftovers recovery and burn damage while scouting moves from Choice item users such as Zoroark, Bruxish, and Passimian. Tera Electric powers up Volt Switch and removes Rotom's weaknesses to Dark and Ghost, improving its matchup against Mabosstiff, Umbreon, Haunter, and opposing Rotom. Tera Steel gives Rotom a great defensive typing with Levitate, which allows it to shrug off Sandaconda's Ground- and Rock-type coverage as well as take resisted damage from common moves like Lurantis's Leaf Storm and Lycanroc's Stone Edge. Because of Rotom's vulnerability to chip damage, it benefits greatly from reliable entry hazard removal from Pokemon such as Scyther and Lurantis. Powerful wallbreakers such as Ursaring and Medicham appreciate Rotom pivoting them safely into play. Rotom is quite vulnerable to faster attackers such as Zoroark and Bruxish, so it appreciates being paired with defensive stops to these threats, such as Muk and Umbreon. Passimian is a fantastic partner that forms a VoltTurn core with Rotom and revenge kills its offensive checks; it also appreciates Rotom weakening Sandaconda.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting. When compared to Rotom-W, it is also much more effective at pressuring Flutter Mane, Gholdengo and Wo-Chien.

  • Trick: Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Using a neutral nature with a Timid mint: Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Other Options

  • Discharge: While weaker than Thunderbolt, the 30% paralysis chance can be devastating for some of Rotom-H's more troublesome matchups, such as Chi-Yu. Do note though that Choice Scarf Rotom-H will have a much harder time 2HKOing Assault Vest Azumarill and certain variants of Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If not running Tera Blast, Rotom-H normally wants to keep its unique typing for defensive purposes, allowing it to switch into several key threats. The most common exception to this is sets that run Tera Fairy for Dragon-type matchups.

  • Electric: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp, Roaring Moon, and Dragapult.

  • Fire: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, but at the cost of retaining all of its normal weaknesses.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-H outspeed normally problematic threats such as Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Specs: The extra power makes Rotom-H far more difficult to wall, with defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Thunderbolt.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Rotom-W's defensive set might be the more known one, but Rotom-H's key resistances to Fairy-type attacks and U-turn, plus its ability to put serious pressure on Gholdengo, make it a good alternative as a bulky pivot.

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is a must-have, as otherwise, Rotom-H is extremely passive against Baxcalibur, which is likely to switch in for an Attack boost from Overheat.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp is the preferred status move, potentially shutting down major physical threats such as Dragonite, Mimikyu, and Iron Hands. Thunder Wave is still a reasonable choice, though, stopping special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Iron Moth in their tracks.

  • Trick and Flame Orb: This one-use method of burning may seem silly, but taking away important items can be devastating against certain Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, and Rotom-H can use this to get rid of troublesome Choice items if it's taken a Trick as well. Note that Rotom-H will burn itself if it Terastallizes while holding Flame Orb, which is generally not good outside of blocking sleep or Toxic poison.

  • Using a Neutral Nature with a Bold Mint: If using Trick, it's best to run a neutral nature such as Serious and change the stat boosts with a Bold Mint. This way, Rotom-H won't get confused by any Berry it receives.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-H's defensive typing is very valuable, so Tera is normally reserved for very specific situations.

  • Steel: Tera Steel with Levitate is a sublime defensive typing, letting Rotom-H better handle huge threats like Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an alternative option to soak up Dragon-type attacks, and it also gives Rotom-H a better matchup against Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Ghost: While this unfortunately makes Gholdengo a much bigger issue, Tera Ghost is still worth considering for making Rotom-H immune to Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Iron Valiant's Close Combat. It also lets Rotom-H switch out of trapping moves without using Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is Rotom-H's ticket to staying around the longest, usually avoiding 2HKOs from powerful unboosted attacks such as Dragonite's Outrage and Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rotom-H's typing makes it a good user of Rocky Helmet, passively punishing physical Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Iron Valiant and making it a good response to expected uses of U-turn.

Offensive Pivot.description: 44 Defense EVs as a benchmark to avoid the 2HKO from Adamant Life Orb Mamoswine whilst maintaining speed.

Physically Defensive.description:
Rotom-W is one of the metagame's best defensive pivots thanks to its unique typing accentuated with Levitate, allowing it to check prominent Pokemon like Dragonite, Kingambit, Scizor, and Garchomp. Aside from gaining momentum, its STAB Volt Switch threatens common Pokemon like Corviknight, Dondozo, and Toxapex. Hydro Pump pressures Garganacl, Cinderace, and Skeledirge, but most importantly, it dents Ground-types like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu that attempt to block its Volt Switch. Moreover, its immunity to Spikes and Toxic Spikes make it an even more effective pivot in the face of entry hazards. Aside from gaining valuable Leftovers recovery, Protect scouts for Choice item users like Meowscarada, Iron Valiant, Dragapult, and Greninja, potentially stalls out burn damage, and punishes Cinderace's High Jump Kick. Thunder Wave cripples Dragapult and special Iron Valiant. Will-O-Wisp punishes physical attackers such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, Azumarill, and Kingambit, and it chips down switch-ins like Amoonguss and Clodsire in the long-term. Tera Steel improves Rotom-W's matchup against Dragonite, Dragapult, and Meowscarada, prevents it from being crippled by Clodsire and Toxapex's Toxic, and makes it resistant to Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Tera Water can be run as a purely offensive option, improving Hydro Pump's damage to 2HKO Garganacl through Leftovers, Unaware Clodsire, and potentially Tera Fairy Skeledirge. The Speed EVs let Rotom-W outspeed uninvested Great Tusk and paralyzed Dragapult.

Rotom-W finds a place on bulky offense teams, especially VoltTurn teams, that maximum its potential. Offensive pivots like Dragapult, Cinderace, Meowscarada, and Scizor form a sturdy pivot core with Rotom-W; Cinderace appreciates being brought in safely on Amoonguss, while Dragapult and Meowscarada similarly like being brought in on Pokemon like Toxapex, opposing Rotom-W, and Garganacl. Entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu, Garchomp, and Great Tusk take advantage of the multiple switches that pivot teams tend to force, crumbling the opposing team slowly just by keeping up momentum; in return, Rotom-W helps check entry hazard removers like Corviknight, Great Tusk, and Iron Treads. Due to Rotom-W's nature of constantly pivoting, spinners and Defoggers like Great Tusk and Corviknight are appreciated; Great Tusk, in particular, can threaten Clodsire, one of Rotom-W's sturdiest answers, while Corviknight's U-turn complements Rotom-W's pivoting duties. Defensive Pokemon like Amoonguss, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu are viable options to cover threats like Breloom, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult, respectively; in return, they enjoy Rotom-W checking Cinderace and Garchomp. Pokemon that can switch into Meowscarada and Great Tusk's Knock Off, such as Corviknight and Amoonguss, are valuable to maintain Rotom-W's longevity from its Leftovers.

Specially Defensive.description:
With its unique typing backed up by a good Special Defense stat and access to Volt Switch and Levitate, Rotom-W is one of the best defensive pivots and Ground immunities in the tier. Rotom-W's STAB Hydro Pump lets it threaten Ground-types such as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, and Sandy Shocks aiming to block its Volt Switch. Its bulk in Special Defense lets it sponge attacks from special attackers such as Walking Wake, Hisuian Zoroark, and Iron Valiant and cripple them with Thunder Wave. Protect lets Rotom-W gain Leftovers recovery as well as scout the intentions of Choice item users like Gholdengo and Greninja. 12 Speed EVs lets Rotom-W outspeed 0 Speed Great Tusk and paralyzed Dragapult. Tera Fairy grants Rotom-W an immunity to some of the tier's most powerful special attacks in Walking Wake's, Dragapult's, and Garchomp's Draco Meteor, allowing it to handle them more easily. Tera Steel provides Rotom-W with a resistance to said Dragon-type attacks and an immunity to Toxapex's and Clodsire's Toxic, making for an excellent defensive typing in conjunction with Levitate. Tera Steel also improves Rotom-W's matchup against Dragonite, letting it cripple it with Thunder Wave and pivot out into one of its teammates.

Bulky offense teams appreciate Rotom-W's defensive profile and ability to pivot while maintaining an offensive presence. Cinderace appreciates Rotom-W's ability to threaten Great Tusk, Ceruledge, and Skeledirge, and in return, it threatens Grass-types such as Amoonguss, Breloom, and Meowscarada that resist both of Rotom-W's STAB moves. Great Tusk can rely on Rotom-W to take Water-type attacks from Walking Wake and Greninja and in return provide hazard removal to keep Rotom-W healthy throughout the game, as well as threaten Water Absorb Clodsire, which completely walls Rotom-W. Rotom-W threatens both Dondozo and Great Tusk, which Kingambit can struggle to break past, and enjoys Kingambit checking Calm Mind Hatterene and Dragon Dance Dragapult that may use Rotom-W as a setup opportunity. While Rotom-W struggles to beat Walking Wake, Dragon Dance Dragonite, and Roaring Moon one-on-one, its ability to cripple them with Thunder Wave lets teammates like Dragapult and Iron Valiant deal with them more easily. Defensive teammates such as Corviknight and Amoonguss can check the aforementioned Grass-types that are troublesome for Rotom-W, and provide bulk for Rotom-W to not get overwhelmed by repeated hits.

Choice Scarf.description:
Equipped with a Choice Scarf, Rotom-W provides excellent utility as a fast pivot thanks to its Volt Switch, devastating status moves, and high-Base Power STAB move in Hydro Pump. Volt Switch keeps up momentum during the game, and it can super effectively hit Corviknight, Dondozo, Toxapex, and Greninja, which Rotom-W now outspeeds thanks to its Choice Scarf. Hydro Pump is the strongest move it has, meaningfully hurting a wide range of Pokemon, and it punishes Ground-types such as Greak Tusk, Clodsire, and Garchomp that attempt to block Volt Switch. Rotom-W can outspeed the entire unboosted metagame with its Choice Scarf, allowing it to reliably hit Cinderace, Iron Moth, and Garganacl. Trick is essential to cripple walls that can recover from Rotom-W's attacks, like Toxapex and Tera Fairy Garganacl. Thunder Wave can be used to cripple threats such as Dragapult and Iron Moth, especially since Choice Scarf Rotom-W outspeeds them.
