Covert Cloak allows Cresselia to negate secondary effects from Garganacl's Salt Cure and status from the likes of Toxapex, Sneasler, and Zapdos, while Leftovers provides passive recovery that makes Cresselia less exploitable and forced to heal. Maximum Speed EVs allow Cresselia to consistently outspeed Heatran and Gholdengo, which could otherwise irritate it, although more Defense investment could be used instead to better withstand attacks from the likes of Urshifu-R and Zamazenta. Cresselia fits best on either bulky balance or hyper offense teams, both able to provide support in different ways; the former give Cresselia a defensive core to fall back on should its sweep fail, while the latter pressure opposing defensive teams and can provide dual screens support via Tapu Koko and Dragapult to bolster its bulk even further. Both playstyles can reliably keep up Spikes using Skarmory, Clodsire, Mega Diancie, or Garchomp, which Cresselia mandates in order to wear down its checks such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Heatran. Similarly, Knock Off support from the likes of Toxapex and Iron Valiant helps Cresselia pressure the aforementioned checks more effectively. Cresselia has difficulty withstanding rain teams due to them cutting Moonlight's healing, so defensive partners that match up positively against them such as Toxapex and Tera Water or Dragon Garganacl are appreciated. Cresselia struggles with bulkier playstyles that can neutralize it with the likes of Haze Toxapex and Unaware Tera Dark Clodsire, so Pokemon that can break defensive teams such as Swords Dance Gliscor and Gholdengo make for good partners.

Unaware.description: Unaware Cresselia is an effective mixed wall and unorthodox setup sweeper with the ability to surprise opponents with its combination of Calm Mind and Stored Power. Cresselia is a reliable stop to powerful setup sweepers like Zamazenta-C and Garchomp, which can even be setup fodder for Cresselia. Once set up, Stored Power is Cresselia's main offensive option, dealing ridiculous damage against any non-Psychic-immune foes after two or three Calm Mind boosts. Additionally, Moonblast lets Cresselia threaten Dark- and Dragon-types like Chien-Pao and Garchomp. Because of Cresselia's passive stature and inability to make progress early-game, it shouldn't attempt to set up Calm Mind and sweep until physical attackers with super effective moves like Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Slither Wing have been removed from play. Additionally, Cresselia fails to effectively defeat some special walls like Unaware Scream Tail and RegenVest Meloetta and Alolan Muk, making offensive teammates that threaten a 2HKO on either of these foes like Kingambit necessary to create openings for Cresselia to sweep. In addition to offensive pairings, this Pokemon appreciates defensive teammates like Intimidate Corviknight that can prevent it from being overwhelmed by Choice item users. Finally, Cresselia appreciates entry hazard removal from teammates like Corviknight, letting it preserve Moonlight's PP for the late-game.

Trick Room.description: This EV spread survives a Dark Pulse from Timid Choice Specs Chi-Yu.

Rain Wallbreaker.description: Manaphy functions as an articulate wallbreaker on rain teams, with its Tail Glow boosted attacks capable of destroying Water-resistant Pokemon such as Ferrothorn, Toxapex, and Alomomola that give other rain wallbreakers a hard time. Rest + Hydration gives Manaphy immediate recovery and lets it exploit passive Pokemon like Gastrodon and the aforementioned Toxapex that attempt to status it. Energy Ball hits Pokemon like Tera Water Garganacl and Gastrodon, while Psychic prevents Toxapex from pivoting around Manaphy. Pelipper is an obvious teammate that provides rain for Manaphy, letting it perform more effectively. Manaphy has issues with offensive Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Kartana, and Baxcalibur, so rain Pokemon that can either outpace or naturally check them like Mega Swampert, Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Ferrothorn make for good teammates. Mega Swampert appreciates Manaphy breaking through Pokemon like Ferrothorn and Alomomola, while it deals with offensive threats like Iron Valiant and Tapu Koko in return. Utility options like Ferrothorn help Manaphy as well, since it deals with Pokemon such as the aforementioned Tapu Koko while also providing entry hazards to support Manaphy’s wallbreaking capabilities.

Tail Glow + 3 Attacks.description: Manaphy serves as a good wallbreaker with Tail Glow, letting it boost its power to substantial levels, in tandem with its solid coverage. Scald is an alternative to Surf that lets Manaphy fish for burns on Pokemon like Rillaboom and Dragonite without missing any important damage benchmarks with Scald’s power decrease. Ice Beam can hit both Pokemon along with Mega Latios for super effective damage. Energy Ball or Psychic lets it beat its checks like Gastrodon, Tera Water Garganacl, and Toxapex. Substitute can let Manaphy exploit common defensive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Alomomola, allowing it to accumulate boosts and fire off strong attacks at little to no cost. Waterium Z + Rain Dance lets Manaphy get a Speed boost, making it easier to clean up mid- to late-game. with Tera Grass lets Manaphy turn the tables on Pokemon like Ferrothorn and Kartana, while Tera Steel does the same and gives Manaphy a Toxic immunity. Screens setters like Tapu Koko and Alolan-Ninetales help Manaphy have an easier time setting up. Teammates like Baxcalibur, Sneasler, and Gholdengo all break through Pokemon like Toxapex and Ferrothorn for Manaphy, while it breaks through opposing Gholdengo, Ting-Lu, and Mega Scizor in return.

Take Heart.description: With Take Heart, Manaphy can become a great wincon with its solid natural bulk, good defensive typing, and Scald to threaten the Pokemon that would try to break through it. Take Heart + Acid Armor lets Manaphy alleviate status conditions and accumulate boosts to help it stay in the game and fire off strong boosted attacks. Stored Power takes advantage of that and allows Manaphy to break through Pokemon like Toxapex with ease. Substitute can be used over Acid Armor, but leaves Manaphy vulnerable to physical revenge killers. Tera Poison and Steel give Manaphy a Toxic immunity and Grass- and Fairy-type resistance, letting it set up easier in front of Choice-locked Iron Valiant and Kartana. Pokemon that support Manaphy with screens like Tapu Koko ease Manaphy in setting up. Teammates like Dragonite and Volcarona that can deal with Pokemon like Rillaboom and Tapu Koko, which threaten Manaphy even when it's boosted, are appriciated.

Tail Glow.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs.description: This is a sample set; if you're interested in writing an analysis for it, check out our reservation index!

Choiced Attacker.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Nasty Plot.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Extreme Killer (Swords Dance).description:
• The combination of Swords Dance and STAB Extreme Speed turns Arceus into a deadly setup sweeper.
  • Shadow Claw hits Giratina-O and Skeledirge hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type.
  • Taunt denies opposing recovery and blocks status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O and Skeledirge, but Recover can let Arceus acquire multiple boosts, making it nigh unstoppable.
  • Earthquake hits Toxapex and Zacian-C hard while doing respectable damage to Skeledirge.
  • A Silk Scarf lets Arceus secure important benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +2 with Extreme Speed. Alternatively, Leftovers offers more longevity, while Lum Berry offers extra insurance against status effects.
  • The given EV spread and nature maximize Arceus's damage output and let it outspeed Adamant Rayquaza, with the rest of the EVs going into HP to facilitate setup.
  • Tera Normal boosts Extreme Speed to absurd levels, letting Arceus OHKO offensive Koraidon at +2 if holding a Silk Scarf.
  • Alternatively, Tera Ghost is useful for preventing Koraidon and Zacian-C from revenge killing it. It also boosts Shadow Claw against targets such as Giratina-O and Skeledirge.
  • Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to burn, which is helpful against Skeledirge and Giratina-O.
  • Swords Dance Arceus is a good fit on hyper offense and bulky offense, working best as a late-game sweeper when checks such as Corviknight, Zacian-C, and Skeledirge are weakened or removed. With Extreme Speed, Arceus also serves as an emergency check to opposing sweepers.
  • Good teammates for Arceus include Zacian-C, Groudon, and Koraidon, which share similar checks such as Corviknight and Skeledirge and can wear them down for Arceus to sweep.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Arceus to outspeed opposing Arceus formes as well as turn the tables on faster Normal-resistant or immune Pokemon such as Zacian-C, Flutter Mane, Arceus-Ghost, and Tera Ghost Pokemon.
  • Extreme Speed is a powerful priority move that lets Arceus revenge kill opposing sweepers as well as clean weakened teams late-game.
  • Shadow Claw OHKOes Flutter Mane and hits Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and foes that have Terrastalized into the Ghost-type hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type itself.
  • Flare Blitz is a powerful coverage move that OHKOes Zacian-C at +1 and deals heavy damage to Corviknight and Tera Steel Giratina-O. Earthquake has no recoil and also has a good chance to OHKO Zacian-C at +1 after Stealth Rock, but it cannot hit Corviknight. Recover keeps Arceus healthy throughout a match and potentially lets it set up more than once.
  • Silk Scarf is recommended to boost the power of Extreme Speed to secure benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +1 with Tera Normal. Leftovers is another good option, especially alongside Recover, to let Arceus accrue multiple boosts. Lum Berry is useful for giving Arceus additional insurance against status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O or Skeledirge.
  • The given EV spread maximizes Arceus's damage output while giving it enough Speed to outrun max Speed base 90 Pokemon, as well as uninvested Koraidon and Miraidon.
  • Tera Normal with a Silk Scarf gives Extreme Speed the extra power needed to OHKO Miraidon and offensive Kyogre at +1 after Stealth Rock. However, Tera Ghost is also an option to boost the power of Shadow Claw and avoid being revenge killed by Koraidon and Zacian-C. Finally, Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to Will-O-Wisp.
  • Arceus fits best on hyper offense and bulky offense, where it keeps opposing sweepers in check with its powerful priority while threatening to sweep itself.

Offensive Setup.description: Arceus is a potent revenge killer, wallbreaker, and setup sweeper thanks to its excellent movepool and powerful Extreme Speed. Swords Dance can be used to break past Pokemon like Landorus-T, Giratina-O, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes and limit revenge killers like Koraidon, while Dragon Dance is a more niche option that lets Arceus outspeed Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and opposing Arceus formes. Shadow Claw hits Ghost-types like Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and Calyrex-S and provides good neutral coverage. Recover can provide Arceus with more opportunities to set up and makes it harder to revenge kill; alternatively, Earthquake hits Skeledirge harder, as well as hitting Toxapex and Zacian-C, and Taunt can deny opposing recovery, status-inducing moves, and Haze from Pokemon like Arceus formes, Skeledirge, and Toxapex, respectively. Silk Scarf has no drawbacks, but unlike Life Orb, it means +2 Extreme Speed needs a layer of Spikes to 2HKO defensive Arceus formes, OHKO Miriadon, and 2HKO Zacian-C. Additionally, Life Orb lets +2 Extreme Speed OHKO Koraidon after a layer of Spikes, +1 Earthquake OHKO Zacian-C, and unboosted Earthquake 2HKO Skeledirge and Toxapex. Tera Normal OHKOes Koraidon with +2 Extreme Speed and enables Silk Scarf Arceus to achieve the damage thresholds Life Orb sets can. Tera Ghost makes Arceus harder to revenge kill by opposing Arceus and Koraidon and lets Life Orb-boosted Shadow Claw OHKO defensive Giratina-O after Stealth Rock at +2, OHKO Zacian-C after some chip damage at +2, and 2HKO Skeledirge. Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to Will-O-Wisp, helping against Skeledirge and opposing Arceus formes, and lets it resist Zacian-C's STAB moves, Arceus-Fairy's Judgment, and Calyrex-S's Grass Knot. Arceus fits well on offense and bulky offense teams, being able to revenge kill dangerous threats and clean up late-game. Thanks to Arceus's Normal typing, it's immune to Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, which can help against Choice Specs sets, Koraidon and Zacian-C pair well with Arceus, as they help overwhelm shared checks with Arceus like Landorus-T, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes. Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Kyogre also threaten its checks and make good teammates. On bulky offense teams, Landorus-T and Ting-Lu make good partners, as Landorus-T can switch into Pokemon that can revenge kill Arceus like Zacian-C and Koraidon, chipping them with Rocky Helmet in the process, and Ting-Lu crucially sets Spikes and helps check Calyrex-S, which offensive Arceus does poorly. On hyper offense teams, Pokemon like Grimmsnarl, Glimmora, and Ribombee support Arceus, and Pokemon like Arceus-Fairy and Arceus-Ground can take advantage of Koraidon and Zacian-C for it.

Bulky Extreme Killer.description: Extreme Killer Arceus is a stellar revenge killer, wallbreaker, and cleaner that also crucially checks Calyrex-S thanks to its great defensive profile; this phenomenal combination of traits makes Arceus one of the best Pokemon in the AG metagame, and it should be seriously considered on every team. Swords Dance is the preferred setup move to break through checks like Giratina-O and Landorus-T and limit revenge killers like Koraidon and Zacian-C, while Bulk Up is an alternative on hyper offense with dual screens support from Pokemon like Grimmsnarl, making Arceus a brutal sweeper that stifles common forms of counterplay like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and opposing Extreme Killer Arceus. Shadow Claw OHKOes Calyrex-S, hits Giratina-O, and provides good neutral coverage. The longevity Heavy-Duty Boots provides lets Arceus more reliably check Calyrex-S and more safely set up. Leftovers is an alternative to Heavy-Duty Boots, making Arceus harder to stop once set up. Tera Ghost turns the tables on Koraidon, lets Arceus consistently beat opposing Extreme Killer Arceus, and greatly improves Shadow Claw's damage against Giratina-O and Skeledirge, while Tera Normal boosts Arceus's power to ridiculous levels; at +2, Extreme Speed OHKOes Koraidon after Stealth Rock and 2HKOes Zacian-C. Tera Fire and Steel are more defensive options, blocking status and improving the matchup against threats like Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S as well as opposing Extreme Killer Arceus in the case of Steel. 236 HP EVs always survive a hit from Choice Specs Miraidon. Alternatively, a spread with 124 HP / 252 Atk / 8 Def / 124 Spe and an Adamant nature outspeeds Timid Kyogre and always avoids a 2HKO from Life Orb Calyrex-S's Psyshock. Arceus can struggle to break through Giratina-O, Skeledirge, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes, so teammates that can take advantage of them, like Calyrex-S and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, or weaken them, like Koraidon and Zacian-C, make for good partners. Choice Scarf Koraidon can also revenge kill Pokemon Arceus cannot like Zacian-C and Calyrex-S. Encore Calyrex-S can switch into any of Arceus's moves besides Shadow Claw and use Encore, so Ting-Lu is a great partner to help check it. Koraidon and Zacian-C highly threaten Arceus, so strong counterplay to them, like Landorus-T on offense or Toxapex or Skeledirge on balance, is crucial.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Dark is a decent defensive Pokemon that checks Arceus and soft checks Calyrex-S, Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, and offensive Giratina-O while being immune to Trick. Will-O-Wisp prevents Pokemon like Koraidon and Zacian-C from safely switching in on Arceus-Dark. Foul Play is the main way of hitting physical attackers. Alternatively, Judgment can be ran to ignore Will-O-Wisp's burn to effectively hit the likes of Skeledirge and Giratina-O, allowing Arceus-Dark to switch into Will-O-Wisp from them. Judgment also does decent damage to Terastallized Calyrex-S and Toxapex. Taunt shuts down Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards, namely that of Spikes and Toxic Spikes, prevents setup sweepers from setting up, and blocks recovery, which Judgment variants appreciate. Tera Poison gives Arceus-Dark a much-needed resistance to Koraidon's Low Kick, Zacian-C's Play Rough, and Calyrex-S's Grass Knot while also letting it absorb tedious Toxic Spikes. Arceus-Dark fits best on balance and bulky offense teams, which appreciate its ability to check Extreme Killer Arceus and soft check Calyrex-S. Arceus-Dark struggles with physical attackers such as Koraidon and Zacian-C, so checks to them such as Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Toxapex are appreciated. Since Arceus-Dark can't run Heavy-Duty Boots, it fails to effectively check Calyrex-S in the long run, so Ting-Lu and Arceus help check Calyrex-S more effectively throughout the game, which is appreciated. Arceus-Fairy can use Arceus-Dark as setup fodder with Calm Mind, which makes Zacian-C a good teammate to pair with Arceus-Dark.

Calm Mind.description:
• Thanks to the combination of Fairy- and Ground-type attacks, which has excellent neutral coverage, Arceus-Fairy is a very strong Calm Mind user.
  • Arceus-Fairy's powerful Fairy-type Judgment discourages Ting-Lu from coming in, giving it a niche compared to other Calm Mind Arceus formes.
  • With Earth Power and the given Special Attack investment, Arceus-Fairy can 2HKO Leftovers Clodsire at +2 and 2HKO Skeledirge outright.
  • The Speed investment is used to outspeed base 90 Speed Pokemon, while the rest is dumped into HP and Defense. This allows Arceus-Fairy to be a utility switch-in to Dragon-types and physical attackers in general, and it works well with Calm Mind's Special Defense boost.
  • An alternative EV spread of 108 HP / 148 SpA / 252 Spe with a Timid nature still lets Arceus-Fairy 2HKO Clodsire at +2 whilst having maximum Speed to have a better matchup against opposing Arceus with Taunt. Do note that the loss of physical bulk makes taking on Clodsire, Koraidon, and Zacian-C much more difficult.
  • Either Tera Poison or Tera Steel is critical to prevent Clodsire and Eternatus from landing a Toxic on Arceus-Fairy. Tera Poison has the additional benefit of absorbing Toxic Spikes and gives Arceus-Fairy fewer weaknesses than Tera Steel, so it is generally preferred. Tera Steel can be useful against Zacian-C, and it also can be used as a backup option against Cresselia thanks to the Stored Power resistance it provides.
  • Arceus-Fairy works fantastically on a countless number of balance teams, as not only does it provide a strong wincon, but it is one of the few Pokemon to have a Dragon-type resistance in the tier, making it a good backup check to Koraidon and Miraidon. Its general physical bulk and good Special Attack also allows it to be a good burn absorber against Groudon and Giratina-O.
  • While Arceus-Fairy can damage Zacian-C on the switch with Earth Power, Zacian-C's strong Behemoth Blade is the greatest obstacle for Arceus-Fairy to overcome. As a result, solid Zacian-C checks like Skeledirge, Groudon, Toxapex, and Corviknight are recommended partners.
  • Giratina-O can provide Defog and status support, and in return, Arceus-Fairy can provide a Dragon-type resistance and take on Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Urshifu-S, and Arceus-Dark.

Utility.description:
• Arceus-Fairy is one of the best Stealth Rock users in the metagame thanks to its good matchup against common entry hazard removers in Ubers like Giratina-O, Corviknight, and Great Tusk. Arceus-Fairy also has a positive matchup against opposing entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu and Groudon, as it can comfortably deny entry hazards thanks to Taunt. Taunt also allows Arceus-Fairy to deny entry hazards from Pokemon like Clodsire that, by virtue of their typing and bulk, would have no problems setting them up against it.
  • Arceus-Fairy can also run options like Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave over Stealth Rock, giving it a way to punish Pokemon like Zacian-C and Clodsire even harder as they switch into it.
  • The given spread allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed threatening Pokemon like Arceus and Palkia-O without a Speed-boosting nature. The remaining EVs are used to maximize physical bulk, which can let Arceus-Fairy better switch into attackers like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Chien-Pao. Another option is to run max Speed, which gives Arceus-Fairy a better matchup against opposing Calm Mind Arceus formes. However, the loss of bulk is very noticeable.
  • Tera Water allows Arceus-Fairy to have a better matchup against not only Fire-type moves like Flare Blitz from Tera Fire Koraidon, but also Ice-type Pokemon like Calyrex-Ice and Chien-Pao. It also turns Arceus-Fairy's Steel-type weakness into a resistance, which can come in handy against Zacian-C, especially if Arceus-Fairy is running a status move.
  • Arceus-Fairy will be regularly switching in, as thanks to its good typing and stats it can, at the very minimum, soft check Pokemon like Koraidon. Koraidon needs to use Tera Fire in order to beat Arceus-Fairy one-on-one, which in general is a positive trade for Arceus-Fairy's team.
  • That being said, Arceus-Fairy appreciates teammates like Skeledirge, Groudon, and Toxapex, as they also check Koraidon and can help Arceus-Fairy against other threats like Zacian-C. Groudon in particular is a good teammate, as it forms an hazard-stacking combination with Arceus-Fairy.
  • Pokemon with access to Taunt like Miraidon and Koraidon are also good teammates for Arceus-Fairy, as they can, combine with it to shut down walls like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Toxapex and win the entry hazard game.
  • Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire can also provide entry hazard support for Arceus-Fairy while checking Pokemon that can overwhelm it like Miraidon, and, in Clodsire's case, Flutter Mane and Eternatus.

Bulky Calm Mind.description:
• Arceus-Fairy is one of the best setup sweepers in the tier thanks to its very good bulk, typing, access to utility moves like Will-O-Wisp that discourage common Arceus-Fairy checks like Zacian-C from switching into it, and STAB move that nothing is immune to. What differentiates Arceus-Fairy from other Calm Mind Arceus formes is its Dragon immunity, which grants it an invaluable defensive niche against some of the metagame's top threats, like Koraidon, and its Judgment being at least a neutral hit on the vast majority of the metagame, as Pokemon that resist Fairy are scarce.
  • The given EV spread allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed Adamant Rayquaza while maximizing bulk. This allows Arceus-Fairy to avoid the 2HKO from Pokemon like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Jolly Life Orb Rayquaza.
  • Tera Poison is essential to prevent Clodsire and Eternatus from poisoning Arceus-Fairy with Toxic; it also allows Arceus-Fairy to absorb Toxic Spikes. It also retains Arceus-Fairy's ability to check Fighting-type attacks from the likes of Koraidon in a pinch, which can be useful for pivoting. In conjunction with Will-O-Wisp, Tera Poison Arceus-Fairy can potentially take on Zacian-C one-on-one if it has enough Calm Mind boosts.
  • Arceus-Fairy should be spreading Will-O-Wisp before attempting to sweep, as Pokemon like Clodsire and Zacian-C can stop Arceus-Fairy on its tracks before it accomplishes anything. Arceus-Fairy can be overwhelmed fairly easily by strong powerhouses like Tera Fire Koraidon and Choice Specs Miraidon, so taking care of them first before attempting to sweep is advised.
  • Skeledirge is the best counter to Arceus-Fairy, as it ignores Calm Mind boosts with Unaware, can break through it with Torch Song, and is naturally immune to Will-O-Wisp. Because of this, Pokemon like Eternatus, Kyogre, Miraidon, and Clodsire are good teammates, as they can comfortably sit on Skeledirge and force it out.
  • Pokemon like Skeledirge can check Zacian-C and Koraidon for Arceus-Fairy and spread burns with Will-O-Wisp; the combination of Skeledirge + Arceus-Fairy checks Koraidon pretty well. Similarly, Landorus-T can act as a soft check to Koraidon and Zacian-C that can also provide both entry hazard and Taunt support. Pokemon that can check special attackers for Arceus-Fairy, like Ting-Lu and Clodsire, are recommended, as they also can set up entry hazards on the field for Arceus-Fairy to have an easier time sweeping late-game.

Ice Scales.description: Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy is a good wall to Pokemon such as Mega Diancie, Mega Sceptile, and Arceus-Ghost. Calm Mind and Take Heart boost Arceus-Fairy's offensive pressure, allowing to it sweep teams after checks like Mega Steelix and Primal Kyogre have been removed; the Special Defense boosts are also useful against boosting foes like Arceus-Ghost and Torch Song users. Mortal Spin can help wear down Pokemon such as Lunala and opposing Arceus formes. Spirit Shackle traps and eliminates Imposter users, allowing Arceus-Fairy to Imposter-proof itself. Calm Mind should be used with Mortal Spin and Take Heart with Spirit Shackle. Arceus-Fairy struggles against Pokemon like Mega Garchomp because of Gigaton Hammer, so Fur Coat Pokemon like Miraidon and Yveltal pair well with it. Arceus-Fairy can also struggle to remove bulky Pokemon like RegenVest Mega Steelix and Primal Kyogre, so it can pair well with Pokemon like mixed Mega Diancie. In return, Arceus-Fairy can help deal with threats such as Mega Diancie and Pheromosa, which threaten these allies. Mortal Spin variants of Arceus-Fairy can poison Imposter users with Mortal Spin and is immune to the move itself thanks to Covert Cloak, although it almost never threatens the Imposter user directly, so Steel-type teammates like RegenVest Mega Steelix are recommended.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Fairy is a good option that compresses a wall and entry hazard remover into one slot. Tidy Up provides unblockable hazard removal and potentially allows Arceus-Fairy to sweep late-game when walls like Mega Steelix have been removed. Spirit Shackle allows Arceus-Fairy to Imposter-proof itself, as trapping Imposter users almost always means a KOed Imposter and a +6 Arceus-Fairy, and it also hits Fairy-resistant foes slightly harder than Magical Torque; alternatively, Toxic puts Fur Coat switch-ins on a timer, but Arceus-Fairy can't reliably beat Imposter in this case. Covert Cloak offers extra security against Magical Torque confusion from Imposter users, while Heavy-Duty Boots makes it more flexible as a hazard remover. Arceus-Fairy is mortally threatened by Kartana and Mega Beedrill, so checks to these like Miraidon and Ho-Oh are highly recommended if not mandatory. Arceus-Fairy also appreciates allies that can remove Steel-types like Mega Steelix and Celesteela in order to facilitate a late-game sweep. Spirit Shackle Arceus-Fairy Imposter-proofs itself, while Toxic variants require a Steel-type that can dissuade the Imposter user from staying in and boosting.

Utility.description: Arceus-Fairy provides good utility with Stealth Rock and Taunt while blocking Koraidon from using Scale Shot and also threatening common Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Giratina-O, and Landorus-T. Utility Arceus-Fairy is generally seen on more offense-oriented teams, but it can be ran on balance teams occasionally. Will-O-Wisp prevents Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C from safely switching in on Arceus-Fairy. Taunt prevents Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards and opposing Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, and Tera Fire physical attackers such as the aforementioned Will-O-Wisp targets.Both Tera Fire and Tera Water give Arceus-Fairy key resistances to attacks like Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, with Tera Water additionally helping against Kyogre's STAB moves and Tera Fire improving the matchup against opposing Arceus-Fairy. Tera Poison removes Arceus-Fairy's Steel-type weakness, lets it block Toxic from Pokemon like Eternatus and Toxapex, and lets it absorb Toxic Spikes. On hyper offense teams, Arceus-Fairy appreciates Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Arceus-Ground, Swords Dance Koraidon, and Extreme Killer Arceus, which benefit from it countering their checks in Ting-Lu and Landorus-T. On more balance-oriented teams, physical attackers such as Koraidon and Zacian-C can overwhelm Arceus-Fairy, so defensive checks to them in Landorus-T, Toxapex, and Skeledirge are appreciated. Arceus-Fairy also struggles with Calyrex-S, which makes Arceus and Ting-Lu great teammates.

Offensive Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy is an excellent, self-sufficient wallbreaker and sweeper that matches up well against Koraidon and Ting-Lu. Earth Power hits foes like Zacian-C, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, as well as Tera Fire Pokemon such as Arceus and Koraidon. Tera Water gives Arceus-Fairy a resistance to attacks like Koraidon's Flare Blitz, Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, and Choice Scarf Kyogre's Water Spout, making it harder to revenge kill and giving it more opportunities to set up. Tera Poison removes Arceus-Fairy's Steel weakness, provides it with an immunity to Toxic from foes like Toxapex and Eternatus, and lets it absorb bothersome Toxic Spikes. Tera Ground removes Arceus-Fairy's weakness to Behemoth Blade and lets +1 Earth Power OHKO Zacian-C and Toxapex. Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy fits on balance, bulky offense, and hyper offense teams that appreciate its ability to block Koraidon's Scale Shot and be a dangerous setup sweeper. Unlike bulkier Arceus-Fairy sets, Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy is unable to switch into Koraidon, and Pokemon like Zacian-C and Choice Specs Calyrex-S can revenge kill it, so on balance and bulky offense teams, it appreciates teammates such as Toxapex, Skeledirge, Landorus-T, and Ting-Lu checking these foes. On hyper offense teams, teammates like Calyrex-S and Arceus can take advantage of Zacian-C and opposing Calyrex-S for Arceus-Fairy. Hyper offense teams can also run an entry hazard lead like Glimmora or Ribombee to weaken Pokemon for Arceus-Fairy with Spikes or let it outspeed foes such as Choice Specs Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and Choice Scarf Koraidon via Sticky Web, respectively. On all team playstyles, Calyrex-S appreciates Arceus-Fairy taking advantage of Ting-Lu and Choice Scarf Koraidon.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Fairy's typing allows it to reliably check Koraidon and Giratina-O, and its fantastic bulk and access to Will-O-Wisp let it also check several other physical attackers, including Arceus and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground. Additionally, Arceus-Fairy threatens common defensive staples such as Ting-Lu, Arceus-Dark, and Landorus-T with Judgment. Defensive Arceus-Fairy is particularly difficult to switch into, as Will-O-Wisp can cripple Zacian-C, which would otherwise be able to switch in safely on Arceus-Fairy. Taunt prevents entry hazards from being set and stops Clodsire, Eternatus, and Toxapex from using Toxic; it also prevents recovery, giving Arceus-Fairy the upper hand against other Arceus formes and stopping its checks such as Clodsire and Eternatus from taking advantage of forcing it out. Alternatively, Calm Mind, which can be used against the many Pokemon Arceus-Fairy forces out, turns it into a dangerous setup sweeper and troubles special wallbreakers that could otherwise muscle through it, such as Kyogre, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. 16 Speed EVs allow for Arceus-Fairy to outrun neutral-natured base 90 Speed Pokemon, such as Kyogre and Giratina-O. Tera Poison complements Calm Mind well, as it allows Arceus-Fairy to set up on Poison-types such as Toxapex, Clodsire, and Eternatus that otherwise check it. Tera Poison also maintains a useful resistance to Koraidon's Fighting-type moves and lets Arceus-Fairy remove Toxic Spikes, but the weaknesses it gives are often exploited by Calyrex-S and Arceus-Ground. Tera Water offers crucial resistances to Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Koraidon's Flare Blitz, as well as a resistance to Kyogre's STAB moves, but it creates weaknesses to Miraidon's Electric-type attacks and Kyogre's Thunder. Arceus-Fairy is an outstanding choice on balance and bulky offense teams, which benefit from its defensive utility and remarkable offensive capabilities. Calyrex-S highly appreciates support from Arceus-Fairy, as Arceus-Fairy beats several of its checks in Ting-Lu, Arceus, Wo-Chien, and Arceus-Dark, as well as beating Pokemon that can revenge kill it in Giratina-O and Choice Scarf Koraidon. In turn, Calyrex-S can break through Arceus-Fairy's Poison-type defensive checks. Powerful Ground-type Pokemon, such as Arceus-Ground and Groudon, make great teammates for Calm Mind variants of Arceus-Fairy, since they threaten many of Arceus-Fairy's biggest obstacles in Eternatus, Clodsire, and Toxapex. Landorus-T, defensive variants of Arceus-Ground, Skeledirge, and Groudon can switch in to one of Arceus-Fairy's biggest offensive threats in Zacian-C. Ting-Lu is a valuable defensive teammate for Arceus-Fairy, as it can check powerful special wallbreakers such as Miraidon, Calyrex-S, and Eternatus. Kyogre is an exceptional teammate for Calm Mind variants of Arceus-Fairy, as it helps to wear down the pair's mutual defensive checks in Eternatus, Clodsire, and Toxapex. Kyogre can also switch in easily on Skeledirge, which Arceus-Fairy would otherwise struggle against.

Utility Desolate Land.description: Fixes Desolate Land Arceus-Fire's main issue, being Imposter users, with Spirit Shackle. Offers additional utility with either entry hazard removal or the ability to easily dispatch Dondozo and Groudon.

Fur Coat.description: Arceus-Fire's great defensive typing and base stats make it a solid Fur Coat wall. Lava Plume's burn heavily cripples common physical attackers like Koraidon and Groudon and forces chip damage on opponents. Heal Bell allows Arceus-Fire to support its teammates by removing status conditions like paralysis, burn, and poison. U-turn allows Arceus-Fire to safely bring in offensive teammates to exploit passive Lava Plume switch-ins, such as Dondozo and Giratina; alternatively, Knock Off allows Arceus-Fire to remove items like Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots, as well as an Imposter user's Eviolite. Arceus-Fire best fits on balance teams that appreciate a reliable check to V-create users and a bulky pivot. Teammates like Palkia-O and Koraidon appreciate Arceus-Fire's pivoting and ability to bring in and force damage on passive walls. Imposter-proofing can be done with any Pokemon immune to burn, such as a Covert Cloak user. Tera Flying gives Arceus-Fire an immunity to Ground-type attacks from Groudon and Ursaluna, on top of gaining a Spikes immunity.

Desolate Land.description: Arceus-Fire's Desolate Land-boosted V-create is a brutally strong attack, letting it force out most Pokemon by threatening an OHKO. Arceus-Fire's niche over other V-create users is its powerful Solar Beam, which removes common physical walls such as Dondozo and Groudon. Growth enables Arceus-Fire to set up on passive walls, whereas Glacial Lance targets Dragon-types such as Eternatus and Giratina. Life Orb increases Arceus-Fire's power to absurd levels, OHKOing Arceus formes that don't resist its moves and 2HKOing most resistant targets with V-create. Heavy-Duty Boots, on the other hand, allows Arceus-Fire to take better advantage of its resistance to common Fairy- and Fire-type attacks. Arceus-Fire has difficulty breaking past Fire-immune foes, most commonly Well-Baked Body Steel-types, so it pairs well with teammates that can handle these targets like Groudon and Headlong Rush Enamorus. Imposter-proofing is done with Well-Baked Body Steel-types or Primordial Sea users. Tera Fire boosts the power of V-create even further, while Tera Grass grants a Ground resistance and a much stronger Solar Beam.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Ghost acts as both a bulky physical wall and a potent setup sweeper. Spooky Plate + Judgment allows Arceus-Ghost to Imposter-proof itself while blocking Knock Off's item removal. Strength Sap has more PP and lets Arceus-Ghost handle powerful physical threats like Kyurem-B and Mega Garchomp better, while Shore Up provides reliable healing that is not neutered by Pokemon like Magic Bounce Mega Audino. Take Heart and Nasty Plot increase Arceus-Ghost's otherwise middling offensive presence, with the former removing crippling status effects like paralysis and poison, while the latter allows Arceus-Ghost to be more threatening after one boost. Knock Off helps remove key utility items from opposing walls, such as Covert Cloak from Arceus-Fairy and Mega Audino and Heavy-Duty Boots from Yveltal, allowing teammates to break through them easier, and it can also remove the rare Spooky Plate from opposing Imposter users. Mortal Spin is an option when running Take Heart, as Arceus-Ghost is effective at pressuring Steel-types like Mega Steelix and Celesteela seeking to spinblock. Thunder Cage hits Yveltal hard while providing chip damage on special walls like Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy. Sludge Wave provides coverage against Fairy-types like Arceus-Fairy and Mega Audino, preventing the latter from blocking Arceus-Ghost's Strength Sap with Magic Bounce. Other physical attackers like Kartana and Mega Garchomp can appreciate Thunder Cage variants trapping and eliminating Fur Coat Yveltal, as well as being Imposter-proofed by Arceus-Ghost. Arceus-Ghost generally Imposter-proofs itself, but a teammate that can also Imposter-proof against Spooky Plate Imposter users is recommended, such as Chansey or Yveltal.

No Retreat.description: Simple + No Retreat turns Arceus-Ghost into a threatening setup sweeper that is hard to revenge kill. Spooky Plate + Judgment allows Arceus-Ghost to Imposter-proof itself and block Knock Off's item removal. Triple Arrows provides perfect neutral coverage with Spooky Plate Judgment and keeps Arceus-Ghost Imposter-proof. The secondary effects also allow Arceus-Ghost to break past walls like Yveltal and Ice Scales Pokemon. Low Kick has more PP and consistently does more damage than Triple Arrows, but it can't be used to luck past non-Covert Cloak foes, and Mega Audino walls Low Kick variants. Noxious Torque is an option to hit common checks to Arceus-Ghost like Mega Audino, Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy, and Ice Scales Ho-Oh hard. Jungle Healing removes crippling status conditions while also acting as a form of recovery to mitigate chip damage. Its lower healing compared to alternatives like Strength Sap is valuable for breaking through Imposter users, although, in a pinch, these can use No Retreat and attempt to stall Judgment. Arceus-Ghost highly appreciates Knock Off users like RegenVest Pokemon to help remove Imposter Chansey's Eviolite, weaken opposing RegenVest Pokemon, remove Covert Cloaks for Triple Arrows, and remove Heavy-Duty Boots from Yveltal and Ho-Oh; in return, Arceus-Ghost acts as a decent Knock Off and status absorber. Arceus-Ghost can struggle against Pokemon like Fur Coat Yveltal and Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy, so offensive teammates like Mega Diancie and Teravolt Kartana pair well with it.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragon Claw is used to hit Giratina-O while also giving you coverage for other Ground-immune foes. On the other hand, Gravity bypasses the need for super effective coverage to hit Ground-immune Pokemon such as Corviknight and is commonly paired with Tera Ground. Flare Blitz paired with Tera Fire can be used to hit Tera Steel Giratina-O and Flying-types such as Corviknight. Ice Beam is an option to heavily damage Landorus-T and Gliscor, who would normally sit on Arceus-Ground. Lastly, Extreme Speed can be used to revenge kill potentially faster threats such as Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon while also giving you fast priority attack against threats like Chien-Pao and Arceus-Normal.
  • Taunt works better on offensive teams to block Will-O-Wisp or recovery attempts from Pokemon like Skeledirge, while Recover usually benefits from being on a more balanced build, allowing Arceus to have more defensive utility and check threats such as Miraidon and Zacian-C.
  • While using Recover on your moveset you should consider using bulkier spreads that benefit from the longevity for more defensive utility or easier setup opportunities; for example, a spread of 248 HP / 144 Atk / 48 SpD / 68 Spe can work for this purpose.
  • Tera Fire is mainly used to absorb Will-O-Wisp without relying on Taunt, freeing up a moveslot; it also helps against Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Play Rough.
  • Tera Ground gives Arceus-Ground an immense power boost to Earthquake, which allows it to OHKO Koraidon, Palkia-O, and Mewtwo, 2HKO defensive Groudon with a boost, and threaten to OHKO bulky Kyogre variants and Calm Mind Arceus after a boost and entry hazard damage.
  • Tera Fairy aids in the Miraidon matchup by making it immune to Draco Meteor while also giving a solid defensive typing that benefits from specially bulkier spreads.
  • Ground-immune Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Giratina-O, and Corviknight and bulky walls like Giratina and Dondozo are its best answers, so Arceus-Ground appreciates teammates that can threaten them like Miraidon, Kyogre, and Eternatus.
  • Other physical attackers like Zacian-C, Rayquaza, Koraidon, Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I help Arceus-Ground by threatening damage on their checks and allowing a later sweep by Arceus-Ground on a weakened foe.

Calm Mind.description:
• Calm Mind enables Arceus-Ground to set up and become a strong cleaner that sweeps through most teams with a largely unresisted Ground-type STAB Judgment while being able to better take hits from Miraidon.
  • Ice Beam allows Arceus-Ground to hit Giratina-O, Arceus-Grass, and Corviknight, which can otherwise force it out.
  • Arceus-Ground's Special Attack investment allows it to OHKO Skeledirge, as well as OHKOing Zacian-C after a Spike. The bulk allows for it to take two Flare Blitzes from Jolly Koraidon, while the Speed investment outruns neutral-natured base 90 Speed Pokemon such as Kyogre and Groudon.
  • Tera Fairy allows Arceus-Ground to be immune to Koraidon and Miraidon's Dragon-type moves and prevents Giratina-O from phazing it with Dragon Tail but comes at the expense of now being OHKOed by Zacian-C.
  • Tera Water allows Arceus-Ground to set up in front of Kyogre and comfortably survive a Flare Blitz from Koraidon, but this does come at the expense of becoming weak to Miraidon's Electro Drift.
  • Arceus-Ground is best used alongside Pokemon that reliably weaken Ting-Lu and Kyogre, such as Choice Specs Miraidon and Mewtwo. It also appreciates partners that can weaken Kyogre, such as Koraidon, Kyogre, and Zacian-C.
  • Defensive teammates such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, Corviknight, Kyogre, and Eternatus can help check Koraidon, Kyogre, and Zacian-C, which Arceus-Ground can struggle with prior to getting a Calm Mind up.
  • Arceus-Ground is best saved for the end game, ideally once the opponent's Tera has been revealed or their Koraidon has been removed, as it is the most reliable revenge killer to Arceus-Ground after a Calm Mind. It can get setup opportunities against most Arceus formes that are not carrying Taunt; defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Corviknight; and Miraidon.
  • While this set can be overwhelmed by fast offensive threats such as Koraidon and Zacian-C, it is still one of the premier threats in the tier and can quickly snowball out of control if its handful of checks such as Ting-Lu and Kyogre get chipped throughout the course of the game.
  • Arceus-Ground can afford to drop its Defense or Special Attack investment and run more Speed if it wishes to try to outrun opposing Arceus formes that are running Taunt.

Ice Scales.description: Ice Scales Arceus-Ground is a good special wall that can reliably tank hits from most special attackers in the tier. Strength Sap can slow down most physical Pokemon. Tidy Up provides unblockable entry hazard removal and boosts Arceus-Ground's offensive capabilities, allowing it to clean late-game provided roadblocks like Ho-Oh and Celesteela have been removed. Toxic bypasses Covert Cloak, extering pressure on defensive Pokemon like opposing Arceus formes. Arceus-Ground pairs well with Ho-Oh and RegenVest Primal Kyogre, as these provide a good option against Chloroblast users and Palkia-O, respectively. Arceus-Ground can struggle against the likes of Kyurem-B because of the latter's Glacial Lance, so it pairs well with bulky Water-types like Fur Coat Arceus-Water and Mega Slowbro which, can help manage the aforementioned Pokemon and bring Arceus-Ground in on their checks with Flip Turn, forcing them out. Arceus-Ground can be Imposter-proofed by the likes of Celesteela and Magic Guard Ho-Oh.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Ground's useful utility movepool, bulk, and typing make it a good defensive Pokemon that checks foes like Arceus, Zacian-C, Koraidon, Choice Scarf and Double Dance Miraidon, and Eternatus and pesters common walls. Earthquake hits Calm Mind Arceus formes, Miraidon, and defensive Eternatus harder than Judgment, but running Judgment makes Arceus-Ground less bothered by Will-O-Wisp. Taunt prevents Toxapex and Skeledirge from healing and spreading status, offensive threats such as Arceus from setting up, and Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T from setting entry hazards. 16 Speed EVs let Arceus-Ground outspeed Adamant Groudon and Modest Kyogre. Tera Water helps Arceus-Ground tank attacks like Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, as well as removing its Ice- and Water-type weaknesses, helping against Kyogre in a pinch. Tera Poison can be used to patch up Arceus-Ground's weaknesses to Calyrex-S's Grass Knot, Koraidon's Low Kick, Zacian-C's Play Rough, and Arceus-Fairy's Judgment; let it absorb Toxic Spikes; and make it immune to Eternatus's Toxic. Tera Fairy mainly helps against Koraidon, Miraidon, and Eternatus. Arceus-Ground fits best on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to check physical attackers such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus and hinder walls like Skeledirge and Toxapex. However, Arceus-Ground can get overwhelmed by the aforementioned physical attackers, so on balance teams, a secondary check such as Toxapex makes a good teammate. Since Arceus-Ground can reliably deal with walls, revenge killers like Calyrex-S, Choice Scarf Koraidon, and Arceus make for good teammates. Arceus-Ground is also threatened by Calyrex-S and Kyogre, so checks to them in Ting-Lu and Clodsire are appreciated.

Defensive Calm Mind.description: Defensive Calm Mind Arceus-Ground is a good sweeper and wallbreaker that also provides solid defensive utility against foes like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus. Will-O-Wisp improves Arceus-Ground's ability to check physical attackers. Ice beam hits Landorus-T, Giratina-O, Wo-Chien, and Tera Grass and Tera Flying Pokemon such as Calyrex-S and Skeledirge, respectively. Alternatively, Taunt can be run to prevent Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards, phazing Arceus-Ground, and spreading status, and it also prevents sweepers like Extreme Killer Arceus and Calm Mind Arceus formes from setting up. 16 Speed EVs let Arceus-Ground outspeed Modest Kyogre and Adamant Groudon. Tera Fairy gives Arceus-Ground a much-needed immunity to Koraidon's Dragon-type moves, Miraidon's Draco Meteor, and Giratina-O's Dragon Tail, as well as a resistance to the former's Low Kick, making it more difficult to revenge kill and phaze. On the other hand, Tera Water lets Arceus-Ground resist Water-type attacks from Arceus-Water and Choice-locked Kyogre, allowing it to set up on them with relative ease, resists Flare Blitz from Koraidon, and Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C. Tera Poison allows Arceus-Ground to resist Judgment from Arceus-Fairy, Low Kick from Koraidon, and Grass Knot from Calyrex-S; absorb tedious Toxic Spikes; and become immune to Toxapex's and Eternatus's Toxic. Defensive Calm Mind Arceus-Ground fits best on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to soft check physical attackers while being a potent sweeper itself. Ting-Lu is a great check to Arceus-Ground, which makes Calyrex-S a great teammate as they both wear down Ting-Lu for each other, potentially enabling one to sweep. Calyrex-S and Kyogre revenge kill Arceus-Ground, and the physical attackers it checks may overwhelm Arceus-Ground, so checks to them such as Ting-Lu, Eternatus, Toxapex, and Landorus-T are appreciated. Potent revenge killers like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Extreme Killer Arceus are also appreciated. Arceus-Ground struggles with Grass Knot from Calyrex-S, and also struggles with Giratina-O, so Arceus can check Calyrex-S while also pressurizing Giratina-O with Swords Dance boosted-Shadow Claw, which makes it a great teammate for Arceus-Ground.

Dragon Dance.description: Arceus-Ground is a powerful setup sweeper that utilizes its good bulk, useful utility moves, and STAB-boosted Earthquake to pressure common defensive Pokemon such as Toxapex, Skeledirge, Eternatus, and Ting-Lu. Ice Beam smashes Landorus-T, which would otherwise wall Arceus-Ground. Dragon Claw is primarily used to hit Giratina-O and Landorus-T, while Gravity is a similar option to hit them as well. Taunt shuts down Skeledirge and Toxapex while preventing Ting-Lu from phazing Arceus-Ground. Substitute eases prediction versus Terastallization while also blocking status from the aforementioned Pokemon. Recover lets Arceus-Ground set up on Pokemon such as Landorus-T and have a longer term presence throughout the game but is generally outclassed by the prior two options. Tera Fairy lets Arceus-Ground take Koraidon's Low Kick and Dragon-type attacks, take Miraidon's Draco Meteor, and, when paired with Substitute or Taunt, use Giratina-O as setup fodder. At +1, Tera Ground lets Earthquake OHKO Koraidon and 2HKO defensive Arceus formes and Ting-Lu. Tera Steel is another option for resisting Calyrex-S's Grass Knot, Miraidon and Koraidon's Dragon-type attacks, both of Zacian-C's STAB attacks, and Extreme Speed from Arceus. However, Tera Steel leaves Arceus-Ground open to Choice Scarf Koraidon. Arceus-Ground acts as a wincon after wallbreakers such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S have broken down its checks in Landorus-T and defensive Arceus formes. Extreme Killer Arceus is another solid partner for forcing damage on Giratina-O, opening up Arceus-Ground late-game. Arceus-Ground can be revenge killed by the likes of Choice Scarf Koraidon, Arceus, and Choice Scarf Calyrex-S, so checks to these such as Landorus-T and Arceus formes are appreciated. Support from Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl, Glimmora, and Ribombee can faciliate Arceus-Ground on hyper offense teams.

Offensive Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Arceus-Ground is a excellent wallbreaker and sweeper that leverages its great natural bulk and near-perfect coverage to become extremely hard to stop. Ice Beam is the preferred coverage to hit Giratina-O, Landorus-T, Wo-Chien, and the occasional Tera Grass or Tera Flying Pokemon, such as Zacian-C. Tera Fairy blocks Miraidon's Draco Meteor and gives Arceus-Ground a resistance to Koraidon's Low Kick, making it more difficult to revenge kill. Tera Water instead provides it with a resistance to Water-type attacks from the likes of Kyogre and Arceus-Water—allowing Arceus-Ground to turn the tables against them—and Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade. Tera Ground boosts Arceus-Ground's power greatly; with a layer of Spikes, it 2HKOes Ting-Lu at +1 and OHKOes opposing Arceus formes at +2. An alternative spread of 120 HP / 252 SpA / 136 Spe with a Timid nature outspeeds neutral-natured Arceus formes and always survives an attack from Choice Band Koraidon but no longer outspeeds Adamant Koraidon. Arceus-Ground best fits on hyper offense and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to check Miraidon while being a dangerous sweeper itself. Ting-Lu is the most effective check to Arceus-Ground, so Calyrex-S is a very potent teammate, as they both wear down Ting-Lu for the other to take advantage of. Zacian-C, Koraidon, and opposing Calyrex-S can all revenge kill Arceus-Ground, so checks to them like Landorus-T and Ting-Lu on bulky offense or teammates that can take advantage of them like Calyrex-S, Arceus-Fairy, and Extreme Killer Arceus on hyper offense are greatly appreciated.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Poison is a pretty good wall thanks to its typing, which gives it an edge against foes like Kyurem-B, Pheromosa, and Mega Diancie. Earth Plate + Judgment provides a solid way to hit most Steel-types and synergizes well with Mortal Spin, which can remove entry hazards against most teams; alternatively; Thunder Cage can trap and remove Imposter users while also hitting Celesteela. Strength Sap slows down most physical threats, provides an advantage against Imposter users, and offers some leeway against Ground-type coverage like Headlong Rush. Support against Ground-type attackers, like Ho-Oh and Fur Coat Yveltal, is highly recommended. Arceus-Poison also appreciates allied hazard removal, as Celesteela completely shuts Mortal Spin variants down, and Steel-types like Mega Steelix can spinblock if Arceus-Poison doesn't have many boosts. Arceus-Poison Imposter-proofs itself thanks to Earth Plate, although it usually takes a while to win the one-on-one; Jungle Healing Chansey can also deny opposing Imposter user's healing and shake off poison.

Fur Coat Arceus-Water is a strong defensive wall thanks to its great typing and bulk. Scald reliably spreads burns, helping spread chip damage and neutralize physical attackers. Knock Off removes items like Covert Cloak and Leftovers, making its burns easier to spread and more damaging, and also boosts Arceus-Water's own survivability by removing Choice Band; alternatively, Spikes can force passive damage on foes, which offensive teammates can exploit. Flip Turn allows Arceus-Water to bring in dangerous offensive teammates against Scald switch-ins like Dondozo and Giratina. Covert Cloak allows Arceus-Water to stop status from moves like Magical Torque, Nuzzle, and Scald, while Leftovers boosts its longevity. Arceus-Water's best fit is on balance teams, which appreciate a reliable physcial wall and a pivot. Offensive teammates, like Koraidon and Flutter Mane, are recommended as they enjoy the safe pivoting Arceus-Water provides and the chip damage it inflicts. Arceus-Water is best Improofed by itself, as Knock Off sets can threaten Imposter users with item removal and Scald burns.

Defensive.description: A pure Water typing and good Defense make Arceus-Water a decent check to Arceus-Ground, Choice Scarf Koraidon, and Zacian-C. It also acts as a soft check to Kyogre, discouraging Choice Scarf variants from spamming Water Spout. Due to Koraidon's sun weakening Judgment, Arceus-Water is more passive than other Arceus formes. Ice Beam allows Arceus-Water to hit Miraidon and Koraidon for super effective damage, whereas Judgment is used to hit Ting-Lu, Skeledirge, and Arceus-Ground. Taunt is an alternative option that prevents Arceus formes such as Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy and Extreme Killer Arceus from setting up and Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards. However, losing Judgment in exchange for Taunt can be problematic, as Ice Beam is relatively weak. Will-O-Wisp cripples physical attackers, whereas Thunder Wave punishes switch-ins such as Calm Mind Arceus formes and Calyrex-S. 20 Speed EVs allow Arceus-Water to outspeed Modest Kyogre. Tera Fairy is used to ease the matchup into Choice Band and Swords Dance variants of Koraidon, preventing them from breaking through Arceus-Water with their STAB moves. As Arceus-Water allows Calyrex-S and Miraidon to switch in with relative ease, checks to them such as Arceus and Ting-Lu are appreciated. Offensive teammates include Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, which appreciate Arceus-Water threatening Ting-Lu for them. Similarly, Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Extreme Killer Arceus appreciate Arceus-Water threatening Skeledirge and Landorus-T for them. As Arceus-Water cannot completely prevent Swords Dance Koraidon and Wild Charge Zacian-C from breaking through it, teammates such as Landorus-T and Skeledirge are appreciated. Non-Taunt variants of Arceus-Water can, however, be used as setup fodder by opposing Calm Mind Arceus formes, so teammates that can deal with them—such as Ting-Lu as a defensive check that can phaze them with Whirlwind, revenge killing options such as Zacian-C and Koraidon, and Calyrex-S with Encore—are appreciated.

Z-Celebrate.description: Z-Celebrate turns Victini into a powerful and difficult to revenge kill setup sweeper capable of setting up against and threatening large portions of the metagame. After using Z-Celebrate, Victini outspeeds the entire unboosted metagame as well as common Choice Scarf users such as Tapu Fini. The boost to Victini's defenses eases setup and makes it more difficult for priority moves such as Shadow Sneak from Ceruledge and Sucker Punch from Bisharp to revenge kill it; in addition, it lets Victini survive attacks such as Earthquake from Excadrill, giving it the option to set up against them. At +1, Victini's Searing Shot OHKOes most Steel-types such as Excadrill. Stored Power pairs nicely with Z-Celebrate, reaching 120 BP after the latter move is used, enabling Victini to deal massive damage to Fire-resistant foes such as Mega Aerodactyl and Tapu Fini, OHKOing the former after Stealth Rock. Stored Power's Base Power rise after setting up also enables Victini to 2HKO Unaware users such as Quagsire and physically defensive Skeledirge. Focus Blast pairs well with Victini's STAB moves, hitting top threats such as Mega Tyranitar, and its poor accuracy is mitigated somewhat by Victory Star. Alternatively, Energy Ball lets Victini destroy specially defensive Gastrodon, which otherwise takes little from even a boosted Stored Power. Z-Celebrate Victini fits best on hyper offense teams as a late-game cleaner. Entry hazard support from Mew and Excadrill can help wear down foes such as Tapu Fini and Slowbro into range of Victini's attacks. Excadrill also offers Rapid Spin to remove hazards for Victini. Good offensive partners for Victini include Swords Dance Scizor and Autotomize Celesteela. Finally, Celesteela and Victini share similar checks in specially bulky Pokemon like Gastrodon and Mega Latias, so they can weaken each other's checks to enable one of them to sweep.

Choice Band.description: Victini is a great wallbreaker with Choice Band, packing a V-create strong enough to 2HKO Fire-resistant Pokemon as bulky as Gastrodon, offensive Tyranitar, and Tapu Fini. U-turn generates momentum against foes such as Tyranitar and Mega Latias, wearing them down over the course of a game. Trick lets Victini cripple an opposing physical wall such as Slowbro by giving it a Choice Band. Bolt Strike targets Water-types, notably 2HKOing Slowbro and physically defensive Tapu Fini Choice Band Victini fits best on offensive and bulky offense teams, where it serves as a powerful early- or mid-game wallbreaker. Victini is vulnerable to all forms of entry hazards and therefore appreciates entry hazard removal from Excadrill, Hydreigon, or Tapu Fini. Excadrill and Mega Tyranitar can also set Stealth Rock to weaken Victini's checks such as Slowbro into range of its attacks. Victini also greatly enjoys U-turn or Teleport support to let it hit the field to launch its powerful V-create. Scizor and Slowbro are all good Pokemon that fulfill this role. Scizor can even trap some of Victini's checks, such as Mega Latias, with Pursuit. Since Victini can struggle to reliably pressure some of its aforementioned checks, like Slowbro thanks to Regenerator, a partner that can take advantage of them, such as Nasty Plot Hydreigon, is also appreciated. Finally, a good late-game cleaner such as Autotomize Celesteela can finish off a team weakened by Victini. On sun teams, Venusaur is a good option for a cleaner that pairs well with Victini and enjoys its ability to punish Pokemon used to check it, such as Blissey.

Choice Band (Psychic).description: Victini is a great wallbreaker on Psychic teams due to its well-rounded coverage and signature move in V-create, easing the matchup against Steel, Grass, and Ice teams. Bolt Strike threatens bulky Water-types such as Toxapex, Slowbro, and Tapu Fini that resist V-create. U-turn preserves Psychic's momentum and allows Victini to switch out of Pokemon that wall it like Dragonite and Mega Altaria. Trick cripples common switch-ins such as Storm Drain Gastrodon, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, while Brick Break lets Victini further threaten Steel and Dark teams by hitting Heatran and Mega Tyranitar hard. Choice Scarf Tapu Lele is an excellent teammate due to its ability to check Dark- and Dragon-types like Weavile, Kommo-o, and Hydreigon. It also sets up Psychic Terrain, protecting Victini from priority moves from the likes of Mimikyu and Azumarill. Jirachi and Celebi aid in Victini's wallbreaking by setting up Stealth Rock and replenishing its HP with Healing Wish. Furthermore, they form a pivot core with Victini that deals sizable chip damage while keeping momentum. Latias also provides Healing Wish support and removes entry hazards with Defog to preserve Victini's longevity. Mega Gallade and Victini can each weaken certain physical walls for the other to dispose of such as Ting-Lu and Skeledirge. Deoxys-S breaks through roadblocks like Toxapex, Garchomp, and Swampert and aids in cleaning weakened Flying and Water teams. Slowbro switches into most Water- and Ground-types that threaten Victini, like Urshifu-R and Excadrill, and it brings Victini into the field with Teleport.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned

Choice Scarf.description: Choice Scarf Victini is a potent revenge killer, capable of picking almost any foe to trade with using Final Gambit including Zamazenta and Landorus-T while also having the option to cripple other switch-ins with its remaining movepool. U-turn is useful to pivot out of checks that shrug off V-create like Toxapex and defensive Landorus-T, although Victini should be wary of Rocky Helmet on the latter. Trick is used to cripple tanks like Garganacl and Slowbro, reducing their longevity while receiving Heavy-Duty Boots or Leftovers in return. V-create's explosive power needs little Attack investment to perform effectively, still easily 2HKOing most neutral targets including defensive Volcarona and Tornadus-T. Thus, 248 HP EVs are instead used to maximize the potential of Final Gambit while minimizing damage from Stealth Rock. Tera Fire is used to fuel V-create, notably OHKOing Tornadus-T, and remove Victini’s weakness to Pursuit, but this comes at the cost of a comparably worse defensive typing against foes like Iron Valiant and Zamazenta. Victini's ability to threaten any foe allows it to very easily pivot into wallbreakers like Tapu Lele and Urshifu-R, which appreciate having annoying defensive Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex crippled or removed with Trick or Final Gambit. Setup sweepers also benefit greatly from Victini's presence, as it can surprise and KO defensive threats that would otherwise impede their progress; allies like Mega Medicham and Garchomp enjoy having threats like Gliscor and Landorus-T removed, and the clean field left after Victini KOes itself also affords them a free point of entry. However, Victini must be kept as healthy as possible to ensure that Final Gambit can OHKO what it needs to. Thus, allies that can soak up Water- and Ground-type moves like Gastrodon and Rotom-W make for valuable partners. Entry hazard removal from allies like Zapdos is also useful to ensure hazards do not hamper Victini’s effectiveness.

Z-Celebrate.description: Victini is a potent user of Z-Celebrate, as its already decent natural bulk and typing greatly appreciate the defensive boosts, not to mention the offensive power gained. STAB-boosted Stored Power easily 2HKOes many defensive foes like Gliscor and even Unaware users including Clodsire and Skeledirge. Searing Shot is another STAB option to target Steel-types like Corviknight and Ferrothorn. Focus Blast allows Victini to target pesky Dark-types like Mega Tyranitar and Ting-Lu along with Heatran, with its low accuracy somewhat offset by Victory Star. Victini can leverage its bulk to set up on many fast threats such as Mega Lopunny, and its buff after omniboosting lets it survive super effective moves from more passive enemies like Gliscor, making it a perfect fit on hyper offense. It is also naturally resistant to priority moves like Bullet Punch from Scizor, Vacuum Wave from Iron Valiant, and Grassy Glide from Rillaboom. Z-Celebrate Victini pairs well with entry hazard suicide leads like Landorus-T and Garchomp, as their Stealth Rock and potentially Spikes support is invaluable; with Stealth Rock, an OHKO on Tera Water Great Tusk and Ogerpon-W are near guaranteed; Stealth Rock also notably breaks Ogerpon-C’s Sturdy along with stray Focus Sashes. Victini also appreciates teammates like Close Combat Iron Valiant luring Blissey and Tera Dark Clodsire, and they also help soften up Ting-Lu for Victini. Tapu Lele is another useful ally that can boost Stored Power with its summoned Psychic Terrain, which also prevents priority including Mega Lopunny’s Fake Out and Hisuian Samurott’s Sucker Punch for a limited time. After Victini heavily weakens foes and potentially forces them to Terastallize, Tapu Lele can also clean up, since any remaining Psychic-resistant foes would be heavily chipped.

Pivot.description: Victini is a pivot with a unique defensive typing, allowing it to soft check threats such as Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Mega Charizard Y, although its lack of recovery leaves it vulnerable over the course of a long game, even equipped with Heavy-Duty Boots. Instead, Victini makes explosive use of each opportunity it gets to blast through foes with V-create, leaving a massive dent in many defensive cores once it manages to pivot in. Bolt Strike is used for coverage, targeting Water-types like Pelipper, Alomomola, and Toxapex. U-turn allows Victini to pivot out of bad matchups like Great Tusk and Rotom-W or after using V-create, pivoting in teammates to help it wallbreak. Encore can lock greedy setup sweepers like Gliscor and Garganacl into moves like Swords Dance or Iron Defense, allowing Victini to give its ally a free switch in or simply hit something hard with V-create. Toxic is an alternative to wear down defensive threats like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T into range of Victini or an ally and also cripple other switch-ins like Garchomp and Dragonite. Tera Fire cranks up the power of V-create, turning Victini into a wallbreaker capable of scorching most neutral targets for a 2HKO, like Tera Fairy Garganacl and Ting-Lu, and also notably OHKOing Tornadus-T. However, it then loses valuable resistances to Fighting- and Psychic-type moves, leaving it unable to check Tapu Lele and Mega Medicham after Tera. Victini suits bulky offense teams that appreciate its role compression both offensively and defensively. Wallbreakers like Weavile, Urshifu-R, and Mega Charizard Y all appreciate Victini's ability to give them free points of entry with U-turn, and the latter also boosts V-create with sun. However, due to its weakness to Stealth Rock if its Heavy-Duty Boots have been removed, as well as its weakness to Knock Off and Pursuit in general, Victini appreciates having teammates that can beat Dark-types like Mega Tyranitar and Weavile; Fighting-types like Zamazenta and Mega Lopunny are good partners to check them and in the latter's case also absorb Knock Off. Victini is also vulnerable to Water-type moves from the likes of Mega Swampert and Basculegion especially when they are in rain, so allies that can soak up these moves like Gastrodon and Ferrothorn are good partners. In return, Victini takes Grass- and Fire-type moves for them, respectively. Finally, Tornadus-T, Landorus-T and Gliscor can help switch into Ground-type moves from the likes of Great Tusk, opposing Landorus-T, and Garchomp, and in return Victini tanks Ice-type moves from Alolan Ninetales and Kyurem for them.

SubGlare.description: Serperior's unique ability to snowball with Leaf Storm in conjunction with Contrary makes it a menacing late-game cleaner. Substitute allows Serperior to fish for a full paralysis, giving it free opportunities to attack while also taking advantage of passive Pokemon and those that rely on status conditions, such as Garganacl, Rotom-W, Clodsire, and Toxapex. Glare cripples common checks such as Tornadus-T, Volcarona, Skeledirge, and Victini, allowing Serperior or its teammates to muscle past them late-game. Hidden Power Fire hits common Grass-resistant Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and Mega Scizor. Alternatively, Hidden Power Ground threatens Heatran and Victini, although Tera Grass Heatran can still wall either variant. Both crucially provide it coverage to hit Gholdengo. Leftovers provides Serperior with longevity to use Substitute more freely and fully take advantage of Glare. Tera Grass amplifies the power of Leaf Storm, allowing Serperior to break past Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Toxapex with greater ease. The given EV spread ensures Rotom-W's Hydro Pump and Ferrothorn's Power Whip never break Serperior's Substitute. Serperior fits best on offensive teams that enjoy it crippling common defensive staples while providing avenues for it to sweep late-game. Wallbreakers such as Mega Mawile, Mega Medicham, and Kingambit enjoy Serperior slowing down teams with Glare, giving them more opportunities to outspeed and KO the opposition. Serperior pairs very well with entry hazard setters such as Landorus-T, Heatran, and Garchomp. Not only does it bait in and cripple the most common Defogger in Tornadus-T, but it also punishes general Defog attempts with Contrary's evasion boost, making it even more nightmarish to take down through paralysis and Substitute. Serperior can struggle to break past Pokemon like Heatran, Dragonite, Zapdos, and Clodsire even when they are paralyzed, so Pokemon that pressure them such as Urshifu-R, Garchomp, and Tapu Lele make for good teammates.

Lead.description:
Courtesy of its Spikes-setting signature move, Ceaseless Edge, Hisuian Samurott is a good lead for hyper offense teams. With Sharpness, Razor Shell is Hisuian Samurott's strongest move, dealing high damage to many opposing leads such as Great Tusk and Glimmora. Surf is an alternative over Razor Shell that trades overall power for the ability to hit Great Tusk's lower Special Defense and avoid activating Glimmora's Toxic Debris. Knock Off allows Hisuian Samurott to make progress against the enemy team by removing items, especially Heavy-Duty Boots, but Taunt is another option that denies opposing entry hazards and prevents Defog. For the last slot, Aqua Jet is useful for finishing off faster leads such as Great Tusk, while Sucker Punch is a stronger but less reliable Aqua Jet alternative that hits Pokemon like Dragapult and Walking Wake. Finally, Encore is useful for locking opposing Pokemon into undesirable moves such as forcing an opposing lead to use Stealth Rock repeatedly, allowing Hisuian Samurott to stack more Spikes with Ceaseless Edge. Taunt and Encore also prevent Hisuian Samurott from becoming setup fodder from Pokemon like Iron Defense Zamazenta and Tera Water Garganacl that attempt to exploit Hisuian Samurott's relative passivity. Focus Sash ensures Hisuian Samurott can take any one hit and set up at least one layer of Spikes. Tera Ghost is the preferred option to block Rapid Spin. However, Tera Water can also be considered to power up Hisuian Samurott's Water-type STAB moves, especially if running Aqua Jet. Sharpness is generally the preferred ability to boost the power of both Ceaseless Edge and Razor Shell. However, if Hisuian Samurott is using Surf instead, Torrent can also be considered for greater power against bulky variants of Great Tusk when at low health, which works extremely well with Focus Sash.

Hisuian Samurott fits best on hyper offense teams looking for a suicide lead to start the game off with entry hazards. This set is useful, as it virtually guarantees that a layer of Spikes will go up, since Ceaseless Edge is not affected by Taunt and Hatterene's Magic Bounce. Gholdengo is highly recommended to deny opposing Rapid Spin and Defog. A Stealth Rock setter such as Great Tusk or Sandy Shocks can further supplement the team's hazard pressure. In particular, Sandy Shocks has a strong matchup against Zapdos and Glimmora, while Hisuian Samurott can cover Ting-Lu for Sandy Shocks. A Knock Off user such as Meowscarada, Great Tusk, or Iron Valiant can remove Heavy-Duty Boots from enemy Pokemon to make them vulnerable to Spikes. Powerful sweepers that can take advantage of the hazard pressure Hisuian Samurott creates are good teammates. Such Pokemon include Kingambit, Dragonite, Sneasler, Roaring Moon, and Iron Valiant. These Pokemon all appreciate Spikes support to wear down bulky targets such as Dondozo, Garganacl, and Ting-Lu. Strong wallbreakers such as Ursaluna also enjoy Hisuian Samurott's Spikes to make them even harder to wall.

Swords Dance.description:
Swords Dance allows Hisuian Samurott to go far beyond its presumed role of just an entry hazard setter, boosting its attack to obscene levels and letting it pose a wallbreaking threat as well. Aside from its reliability and higher critical hit ratio, Aqua Cutter's main benefit is to avoid Static from Zapdos and Rocky Helmet from the likes of Great Tusk and Landorus-T; on the other hand, Razor Shell can be used for its Defense drop alongside slightly higher Base Power. Aqua Jet rounds off Hisuian Samurott's moveset by providing ever-so-useful priority to clean up weakened teams with faster threats and either revenge kill or discourage Pokémon like Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and offensive Great Tusk from coming in. Sucker Punch is a much stronger alternative and hits Water-resistant foes like Walking Wake and Dragapult, but it's less reliable due to poor interaction with status moves like Will-O-Wisp, Thunder Wave, and Substitute. Mystic Water can be used boost Hisuian Samurott's damage output on its Water-type moves without the cost of its HP like Life Orb would; Heavy-Duty Boots, on the other hand, helps give Hisuian Samurott more longevity so that it gets more chances to spread hazards via Ceaseless Edge and wallbreak early-game. Tera Water serves a similar purpose to Mystic Water, being potentially useful to sweep a team or generally increase the damage of Aqua Jet and Aqua Cutter; on the other hand, Tera Dark significantly boosts Ceaseless Edge and Sucker Punch. Both Tera types can also have defensive impacts, like Tera Water allowing Hisuian Samurott to stomach a hit from Zamazenta or Iron Valiant and Tera Dark doing the same for Zapdos.

Hisuian Samurott is a great fit on bulky offenses and balances that appreciate its entry hazard stacking ability and wallbreaking prowess all condensed in one slot; more well-rounded team styles can afford giving Hisuian Samurott more turns to click Ceaseless Edge or apply raw offensive pressure between Swords Dance and Aqua Cutter. To aid in that, teammates that can help provide momentum are very welcome, such as U-turn users like Cinderace, Dragapult; Volt Switch users like Zapdos; and even Eject Pack users like Close Combat Great Tusk. Pokemon that appreciate their checks getting worn down by Spikes are also fantastic teammates; Dragapult and Gholdengo deserve a mention, as their most common check in Kingambit especially dislikes coming into Spikes if it's not holding an Air Balloon, but almost any wallbreaker strongly appreciates Hisuian Samurott's Spikes and offensive pressure, with examples including Kingambit, offensive Zapdos, and Walking Wake. Hisuian Samurott may have trouble with its work being undone by hazard removers like Great Tusk, Defog Corviknight, and Court Change Cinderace. Gholdengo is a good help with the first two, whereas for the latter, having a team with strong momentum options like the aforementioned U-turn, Volt Switch, and Eject Pack users as well as Pokemon that take advantage of pivot Cinderace like Heatran or Volcanion are welcome.

Choice Scarf.description:
Equipped with Choice Scarf and excellent Sharpness-boosted STAB moves in Ceaseless Edge and Razor Shell, Hisuian Samurott is able to serve as both a fast entry hazard setter and a great offensive threat against slower Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, Cinderace, and Ting-Lu. Knock Off removes valuable items from Pokemon that rely on them, such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Dragonite as well as Leftovers from Corviknight and Toxapex. Sacred Sword is a great coverage move for Hisuian Samurott, allowing it to OHKO Pokemon such as Kingambit and opposing Hisuian Samurott. Tera Water boosts the power of Razor Shell, allowing it to OHKO Pokemon like Ursaluna and Great Tusk. On the other hand, Tera Dark boosts Ceaseless Edge and Knock Off, allowing Hisuian Samurott to OHKO Skeledirge.

Hisuian Samurott shines on various balance and offense teams, as it serves a unique role of being able to deal damage while also reliably setting Spikes. This allows said teams to punish switches and more easily wear down bulky archetypes. Gholdengo is a great partner for Hisuian Samurott due to pressuring faster offensive threats such as Sneasler and Iron Valiant, and thanks to its ability, it can block Defog attempts from Corviknight. Hisuian Samurott also has great type synergy with Gholdengo, with it being able to pressure Dark-types Gholdengo tends to struggle with like Kingambit, Ting-Lu, and opposing Hisuian Samurott. Heatran and Ting-Lu both make for good partners, since they can stack hazards alongside Hisuian Samurott while also checking Zapdos, which otherwise forces it out. In return, Hisuian Samurott can pressure Ground-types that Heatran and Ting-Lu both tend to struggle with, like Great Tusk and Ursaluna. Walls such as Amoonguss, Toxapex, Dondozo, and Corviknight can force Hisuian Samurott out, so it pairs well with offensive teammates that can beat them, like the aforementioned Gholdengo as well as Choice Specs Hoopa-U and Zapdos. Lastly, sweepers such as Iron Valiant, Dragonite, and Sneasler appreciate Hisuian Samurott laying down hazards and beating Pokemon they can struggle with, like Air Balloon Gholdengo.

Assault Vest.description:
The name of the game with Hisuian Samurott is finding as many opportunities as possible to use Ceaseless Edge in order to repeatedly set up Spikes. This set aims to leverage Hisuian Samurott's natural resistances by equipping an Assault Vest, allowing it to come in on Gholdengo, Heatran, and Kingambit lacking Low Kick and Tera Blast Fairy.
