Nasty Plot Wallbreaker.description: A colorful movepool, a great Speed tier, and Regenerator make Tornadus-T one of Flying's best wallbreakers. Bleakwind Storm can be used if Tornadus-T is paired with Mega Charizard Y, as its accuracy is not affected by sun. Focus Blast grants Tornadus-T excellent neutral coverage and is able to hit most Steel- and Rock-types, like Heatran and Tyranitar, hard. Heat Wave, however, has the benefit of nailing Jirachi, Gholdengo, and Corviknight, which makes it a better option against Psychic, Ghost, and, if using Knock Off, Steel teams. In the last slot, Taunt is preferred, so Tornadus-T can safely set up on walls like Toxapex and Ting-Lu, but Knock Off's ability to cripple the likes of defensive Heatran and Galarian Slowking is worth considering. Tornadus-T has a very poor matchup against Electric-types, so Pokemon that can deal with them, such as Landorus-T and Gliscor, are must-haves. They're also able to lay down Stealth Rock and have access to Defog, making them incredible teammates. Similarly, Corviknight and Celesteela stomach most Ice-type attacks aimed at Tornadus-T, thanks to their bulk and Steel typing. Mega Charizard Y forms a terrifying wallbreaking duo alongside Tornadus-T that breaks down shared checks such as Heatran and Blissey. Setup sweepers like Dragon Dance Dragonite and Agility Thundurus-T greatly appreciate Tornadus-T weakening or removing walls for them. 88 HP and 8 Special Defense EVs can be used over Special Attack to ensure Tornadus-T lives an Ice Beam from Choice Scarf Greninja from full health.

Assault Vest.description: These sets are currently up for reservation for a revamp; please check out the C&C thread for more information!

Nasty Plot (Electric).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Nasty Plot.description: Thundurus is a good setup sweeper and wallbreaker on offensive teams thanks to its great Special Attack and good offensive movepool, which can make it threatening even after one boost. It can be used over Thundurus-T due to its higher Speed, outspeeding foes like Iron Moth, Keldeo, and Enamorus. Thunderbolt helps against the plethora of bulky Water- and Flying-types, 2HKOing Celesteela, Tapu Fini, and Slowbro. It can also threaten 2HKOs on bulky foes like Magic Guard Clefable and Mega Sableye at +2. Focus Blast helps against the tier's numerous Dark- and Steel-types, OHKOing Tyranitar and Excadrill and having good odds to OHKO Hydreigon and Mega Tyranitar after Stealth Rock. Hidden Power Ice hits Dragon-types that resist Thunderbolt, 2HKOing Latios, Mega Altaria, and unboosted Mega Latias at +2, its also more spammable against Grass-types than Focus Blast and can hit Pokemon like Amoonguss super effectively. Psychic is an alternative that helps against Poison- and Fighting-types, 2HKOing foes like Choice Band Iron Hands, Amoonguss, and Buzzwole. Fightinium Z can provide Thundurus a way to OHKO targets like Mega Tyranitar, help break through neutral targets like Gastrodon, and bypass Focus Blast's accuracy. Thundurus can have a hard time breaking through specially defensive Pokemon, notably Mega Latias, which can set up on it even if Thundurus uses Nasty Plot, as well as Tapu Bulu and Mega Venusaur when lacking Hidden Power Ice or Psychic; it pairs well with other offensive Pokemon like Hydreigon, Cinderace, and Ceruledge that can threaten these foes. In return, Thundurus can help to deal with their checks like bulky Scizor, Tapu Fini, and Iron Hands. Thundurus can pair well with pivots like Cinderace, which can bring it in against Water-types it threatens like Tapu Fini as well as help against Pokemon that wall it like Mega Venusaur. Due to Thundurus's Stealth Rock weakness that can make it harder for it sweep, hazard removers like Tapu Fini, Excadrill, and Hydreigon make for good teammates. Thundurus can also pair well with entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu, Mega Tyranitar, and Skarmory, which can help it to guarantee an OHKO on foes like Hydreigon and Tyranitar. In return, Thundurus can threaten out common hazard removal options like Tapu Fini and Excadrill, and it can even set up on some of them like Tapu Fini. Thundurus is very prone to getting revenge killed by faster foes like Mega Aerodactyl, Cinderace, and Choice Scarf Galarian Zapdos, so it pairs well with bulky partners like Slowbro, Tapu Fini, and Clefable.

Thundurus's excellent Special Attack, good Speed and coverage, and access to Nasty Plot allow it to function as a great wallbreaker. Focus Blast threatens RegenVest Roaring Moon, Hisuian Goodra, and Volt Absorb Empoleon. Psychic threatens Kommo-o, Great Tusk, and Iron Moth, while Sludge Bomb threatens Scream Tail. Sheer Force offers more power, letting Thundurus OHKO Garganacl with Focus Blast. Magic Guard lets Thundurus avoid chip damage and lets Sludge Bomb potentially poison switch-ins such as Kommo-o, specially defensive Garchomp, and Volt Absorb Mandibuzz; however, the drop in power significantly compromises its ability as a wallbreaker in exchange for utility. Fast cleaners like Meowscarada and Roaring Moon appreciate Thundurus being able to pressure their walls like Corviknight and Great Tusk, opening up the way for them to sweep late-game. Thundurus appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Empoleon, Garchomp, and Sandy Shocks, as the chip damage from hazards allows Thundurus to secure OHKOs against Pokemon such as Hisuian Goodra and specially defensive Garchomp after a Nasty Plot, as well as Kommo-o, Iron Moth, and Volt Absorb Empoleon. Thundurus's poor bulk means it's OHKOed by most Pokemon faster than it, so walls such as Corviknight and Manaphy that can take hits for it and pivot it in are appreciated. Thundurus is prone to being worn down by Stealth Rock if not running Magic Guard, so entry hazard removers such as Great Tusk and the aforementioned Corviknight are appreciated.

Pivot.description: These are sample set(s) as we wait for the metagame to settle before working on new analyses. They will be updated as the metagame continues to develop, so stay tuned!

Offensive Pivot.description: Thundurus-T functions as a powerful offensive pivot, able to capitalize off the forced switches it generates by bringing in its teammates with Volt Switch. Volt Switch threatens Flying-types like Celesteela and Galarian Zapdos while allowing Thundurus-T to pivot out of problematic matchups such as Tangrowth and Mega Altaria. Grass Knot threatens Ground-types like Hippowdon and Gastrodon. Knock Off hinders switch-ins like Clefable, Blissey, and Chansey. Psychic 2HKOes Iron Hands and would-be walls like Mega Venusaur and Amoonguss, while Focus Blast threatens Dark-types like Mega Tyranitar and Hydreigon as well as Steel-types like Excadrill. Thunderbolt better pressures Celesteela, Slowking, Mega Sableye, and Scizor while also providing Thundurus-T a STAB move that doesn't force it out. Special wallbreakers like Latios, Enamorus, and Keldeo appreciate Thundurus-T being able to threaten their switch-ins, such as Mega Tyranitar for the former and Slowking for the latter two. The aforementioned wallbreakers also benefit from Thundurus-T luring in bulkier Pokemon they can deal with, such as Amoonguss, Mega Latias, and Blissey, respectively, in addition to Knock Off's removal of Heavy-Duty Boots and Assault Vest from the likes of Skeledirge and Tangrowth. Thundurus-T is susceptible to being revenge killed by faster threats like Latios and Choice Scarf Hydreigon, so teammates that can check them such as Cinderace and Mega Altaria are appreciated. Entry hazard support from the likes of Ting-Lu and Iron Moth is also appreciated due to the forced switches Thundurus-T generates, letting it better pressure foes like Clefable; in return, it can aid its teammates by using Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Skeledirge and Amoonguss.

Nasty Plot.description: With a sky-high Special Attack stat and access to Nasty Plot, Thundurus-T is a powerful wallbreaker, able to threaten special walls like Mega Tyranitar, Celesteela, and Slowking. After a Nasty Plot boost, Thundurus-T can OHKO many bulkier Pokemon in the tier, including Mega Venusaur, Magic Guard Clefable, and Mega Sableye. Focus Blast hits Dark-types like Mega Tyranitar, Hydreigon, and Ting-Lu as well as Steel-types like Excadrill. Hidden Power Ice hits Dragon-types that resist Thunderbolt like Latios, Mega Latias, and Mega Altaria, while Psychic can 2HKO Iron Hands, Amoonguss, and Mega Venusaur. Fightinium Z turns Focus Blast into All-Out Pummeling, bypassing Focus Blast's low accuracy in a pinch against threats like Tyranitar, OHKOing Hisuian Goodra and Blissey after a boost, and dealing significant damage to walls like Gastrodon and Hippowdon, potentially OHKOing them after slight chip damage. Fast special cleaners like Choice Scarf Hydreigon, Enamorus, and Speed Booster Energy Iron Moth appreciate Thundurus-T's ability to pressure their switch-ins, such as Celesteela, Slowking, and Mega Tyranitar, respectively, potentially allowing them to sweep late-game. Mega Altaria appreciates Thundurus-T's ability to check foes that threaten it, such as Scizor and Celesteela; in return, Mega Altaria can deal with Mega Latias, which outspeeds and 2HKOes Thundurus-T while avoiding a 2HKO from +2 Hidden Power Ice. Thundurus-T's middling Speed leaves it prone to being revenge killed by faster Pokemon like Latios and Mega Aerodactyl; Mega Tyranitar can switch into Latios and trap it with Pursuit, while Slowbro can deal with Mega Aerodactyl. Thundurus-T is also weak to Stealth Rock, so entry hazard removers like Tapu Fini and Hydreigon are beneficial.

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Pivot.description:
• Thanks to Volt Absorb, Thundurus-T is an excellent offensive pivot that makes masterful use of Terastallization!

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is highly recommended for dealing massive damage to Ground-types, such as Ting-Lu and Ursaluna, without Terastallizing in addition to being a secondary attack to hit Urshifu-R while Choice locked into an attack.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast has reliability issues, but it's Thundurus-T's best shot of dealing big damage to Hisuian Goodra and Wo-Chien.

  • Sludge Bomb: Sludge Bomb is a more niche option, giving Thundurus-T a more reliable way to deal damage to Wo-Chien and Meowscarada at the cost of doing nothing to Hisuian Goodra.

  • Timid versus Modest: Timid is the best nature, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed key threats, such as Urshifu-R, and at least Speed tie with opposing Thundurus-T. Modest is usable with Choice Specs, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed up to Jolly Baxcalibur and Great Tusk, and the extra power can be handy in some situations, such as usually 2HKOing specially defensive Clodsire with Tera Blast Flying.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Thundurus-T is perfectly fine with its base typing, it makes such good use of Terastallization that it'll often Terastallize.

  • Flying: Tera Flying makes Tera Blast a powerful STAB option with very few resistances while gaining no extra weaknesses thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Ice: Not only does Tera Ice give Thundurus-T powerful coverage against Ground- and Grass-types like Landorus-T and Wo-Chien, it also gives an important resistance to Iron Bundle's and Chien-Pao's Ice-type attacks.

  • Water: Tera Water is a fantastic defensive option, turning Thundurus-T into an excellent check against Regieleki and Zapdos while still giving it a good coverage option against Landorus-T. However, it still retains Thundurus-T's weakness to Freeze-Dry.

Items

  • Choice Specs versus Choice Scarf: Choice Specs makes Thundurus-T difficult to wall without an extremely sturdy special wall, with even Pokemon like Clodsire and Cresselia at risk of a 2HKO. Choice Scarf, on the other hand, allows Thundurus-T to double as a good revenge killer, outspeeding major threats like Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao.

  • Assault Vest: While Thundurus-T isn't known for its bulk, Volt Absorb means Assault Vest makes Thundurus-T more effective at checking other Electric-types, especially when using bulkier EV spreads.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 228 Spe with Timid: This Assault Vest spread outspeeds both Urshifu formes and takes 70% maximum from Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without sacrificing power.

  • 188 SpA / 68 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest**: This spread is optimized for Assault Vest, letting Thundurus-T survive Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without Terastallizing.

Minor Optimizations

  • 0-3 Attack IV: Foes that commonly run Foul Play such as Amoonguss and Rotom-W have more powerful moves to use against Thundurus-T, but there's no drawback to minimizing Foul Play's damage.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Thundurus-T's massive Special Attack stat and array of immunities make it a good user of Nasty Plot.

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is integral for potentially OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu after a boost and usually OHKOing offensive Ursaluna.

  • Life Orb versus Sitrus Berry: Life Orb is great for wallbreaking, allowing Thundurus-T to potentially OHKO Ting-Lu with a boosted Grass Knot. Sitrus Berry is still a good option, though allowing Thundurus-T to instantly restore some health after being hit by Ruination, as long as its maximum HP is an even number.

Other Options

  • Substitute: When paired with Tera Water, Substitute lets Thundurus-T set up on Garganacl.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast's unreliability makes it hard to recommend for most teams, but it's the only way Thundurus-T will break through Hisuian Goodra without Terastallization.

  • Taunt: Giving up coverage is risky, but Taunt shuts down a lot of defensive counterplay against Thundurus-T such as Whirlwind Ting-Lu and Toxic Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Thundurus-T's typing is totally functional for sweeping and wallbreaking, but Terastallization makes it far harder to revenge kill thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gives Thundurus-T a powerful STAB option, letting it cleave through specially bulky foes, like Water Absorb Clodsire, particularly easily.

  • Water: While Tera Water does leave Thundurus-T vulnerable to certain Pokemon, such as Water Absorb Clodsire and Hisuian Goodra, it's a fantastic defensive Tera type that lets it deal with other common Electric-types that Terastallize like Regieleki and Zapdos.

  • Ice: Tera Ice is a great offensive option, letting Thundurus-T cleave through most Ground-types that aren't weak to Grass such as Landorus-T and Clodsire. Thundurus-T even makes good defensive use of it, resisting Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread lets Thundurus-T survive Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, if it doesn't have an offensive item, making it a good choice for more defensive items Thundurus-T may use such as Sitrus Berry.

Minor Optimizations

  • 0-3 Attack IV: Thundurus-T isn't getting hit by Foul Play that often, but a lower Attack IV is marginally useful regardless.

A sky-high Special Attack stat combined with powerful coverage moves boosted by Sheer Force and access to Nasty Plot makes Thundurus-T a dangerous wallbreaker, able to threaten many common special walls such as Empoleon, RegenVest Manaphy, and Roaring Moon. Focus Blast threatens an OHKO on Volt Absorb Empoleon and a 2HKO on Blissey, RegenVest Roaring Moon, and Hisuian Goodra. Psychic threatens an OHKO on Kommo-o, Great Tusk, and Iron Moth. Fast cleaners like Azelf and Hisuian Electrode appreciate Thundurus-T being able to pressure their walls like Empoleon and Hisuian Goodra, respectively, opening up the way for them to sweep late-game. Thundurus-T appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Kommo-o, Garchomp, and Sandy Shocks letting it more reliably OHKO specially defensive Garchomp and Hisuian Goodra after a Nasty Plot. Thundurus-T is prone to being chipped down by Stealth Rock and put in KO range of strong priority moves from threats like Dragonite and Ceruledge, so hazard removers like Great Tusk and Corviknight are appreciated. Thundurus-T is also easily revenge killed by most Pokemon that are faster than it like Chien-Pao and Meowscarada due to its low bulk and middling Speed, so walls such as Manaphy and the aforementioned Corviknight that can take a hit for it and safely pivot it in are appreciated.

Wallbreaker (Ground).description:
Landorus is a ferocious wallbreaker on Ground teams, as it boasts great stats, a destructive ability, and a wide array of coverage moves, making it a crucial Pokemon to have in the Dark and Fairy matchups. Landorus's preferred ability, Sheer Force, in conjunction with Life Orb raises its offensive potency to great heights, allowing it to 2HKO nearly every wall in the metagame, including Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Corviknight with Focus Blast. Sludge Bomb hits Grass-types like Rotom-C and Breloom as well as easing the Fairy matchup alongside Iron Treads and Clodsire, while Psychic threatens Urshifu-R and Air Balloon Glimmora and pops Gholdengo's Air Balloon, as Landorus is walled by it otherwise. Nasty Plot renders Landorus completely unwallable, notably letting it OHKO Corviknight. Alternatively, Rock Slide can be used to catch Volcarona, Zapdos, and Frosmoth off guard; however, it forces Landorus to use the suboptimal Naive nature and should only be used if teammates don't have answers for the listed targets. Substitute is a great option on Landorus because of the amount of switches it forces as well as making Kingambit's Sucker Punch easier to outplay.

Landorus appreciates Water Absorb Clodsire and Storm Drain Gastrodon switching into Water-type Pokemon like Barraskewda, Walking Wake, and Basculegion-F. Choice Scarf Great Tusk threatens Pokemon with Ice-type coverage like Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Greninja. Iron Treads provides support in the Fairy matchup and provides pivoting with Volt Switch, luring switch-ins like Corviknight and Volcarona for Landorus to take advantage of. Furthermore, Iron Treads removes Stealth Rock with Rapid Spin and enhances Landorus's wallbreaking with Knock Off, removing recovery items like Leftovers and Black Sludge from Rotom-W and Amoonguss. Additionally, Choice Scarf Iron Treads is a great asset in the Fairy matchup and threatens Ice-types like Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur. Sandy Shocks is a great teammate in the Flying and Water matchups, providing Gravity support and additional pivoting with Volt Switch. Quagsire is able to check Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur as well as providing entry hazards and chip damage with Toxic. Ting-Lu provides entry hazards and phazing to wear down the opponent's team for Landorus and appreciates the removal of Fighting-types. Ursaluna can switch into Ghost-type moves from faster opponents like Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Hisuian Zoroark as well as aiding in heavily denting teams alongside Landorus. In return, Landorus provides a Fighting-type resistance and threatens Fighting-types with Psychic.

Choice Scarf (Ground).description:
Access to Sheer Force, a variety of coverage moves, and a phenomenal Speed tier thanks to Choice Scarf make Landorus an elite revenge killer on Ground teams, taking out Choice Specs Greninja and all Ogerpon formes after entry hazard damage. Focus Blast tears apart Dark-types and Ground-immune Steel-type Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, Hydreigon, and Orthworm. Psychic makes the Fighting matchup a lot easier, OHKOing Great Tusk, Urshifu-R, and Iron Valiant, as well as taking out Galarian Weezing after Stealth Rock damage, making the Poison matchup extremely one sided. Sludge Bomb aids in the Fairy matchup, OHKOing Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Azumarill, and helps greatly against Grass-type Pokemon that Ground-type teams would otherwise struggle to break, taking out prominent threats such as Breloom and Hisuian Lilligant. U-turn is a great pivot option for Landorus, gaining momentum by scaring out Pokemon it threatens while inflicting damage on the replacement and getting switch initiative.

Landorus cowers in fear at the thought of a single snowflake, which is why Quagsire is a great teammate for it. Quagsire is able to stand up to terrifying Ice-type move users such as Swords Dance Chien-Pao, Swords Dance Urshifu-R, Azumarill without Trailblaze, and Baxcalibur, as well as providing entry hazard support via Spikes and Stealth Rock and spreading Toxic to soften foes up for Landorus. Iron Treads forms a wonderful core with Landorus as well, switching in on foes that attack with Ice-type moves, such as Articuno, Frosmoth, and Alolan Ninetales, and hitting back with a very powerful Heavy Slam or Iron Head. Iron Treads can also remove Stealth Rock via Rapid Spin and remove items via Knock Off, increasing Landorus's longevity and wallbreaking capabilities. Ice Spinner is also an option to take out opposing Landorus and Gliscor. In turn, Landorus can switch into a weakened Ogerpon-H as well as Ground- and Fighting-type attacks that would make quick work of Iron Treads. Landorus also appreciates Pokemon such as Water Absorb Clodsire and Storm Drain Gastrodon, as they can switch in to Water-type attacks from Pokemon such as Walking Wake, Barraskewda, and Basculegion-F. Clodsire is a very good special wall, while Gastrodon takes neutral damage from Ice Beam as well as walling Choice Scarf Greninja and providing a myriad of hazard support. Both Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B complement Landorus nicely, as they are able to switch into Ghost-type attacks from Pokemon that Landorus would otherwise struggle against, such as Flutter Mane and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Ursaluna-B is also capable of picking off weakened Dark-type Pokemon such as Kingambit, Greninja, and Chien-Pao with Vacuum Wave. In turn, Landorus can switch in on the Fighting-type attacks that would trouble Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B, and threatening the foe with Psychic. Gliscor is another great teammate for Landorus, as it is able to whittle down opponents via Knock Off and Toxic. Mamoswine is able to take down the Flying-type Pokemon that Landorus would otherwise be ineffective against and can also make use of its Thick Fat ability to tank some additional Ice-type moves. Sandy Shocks not only can set hazards but also can pivot around with Volt Switch, allowing Landorus to come in on an easy target.

Gravity (Ground).description: Due to its potent ability, admirable offensive stats, and great coverage, Landorus cements itself as a staple wallbreaker on Ground teams. Sludge Wave hits Grass-types like Tapu Bulu and Celebi as well as other Fairy-types such as Tapu Lele and Clefable, easing the Fairy and Grass matchups due to unresisted coverage. Focus Blast breaks through Kyurem, Ting-Lu, and Ferrothorn. Rock Polish enables Landorus as a late-game cleaner, shutting down revenge killing abilities from faster foes like Tapu Koko, Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, and Greninja, while Nasty Plot allows Landorus to easily break past the likes of Blissey and Mega Sableye and become terrifying with Gravity-aided Earth Power spam. Rock Slide is another option to hit Volcarona, as it is dangerous once set up, as well as Mantine, Zapdos, and Araquanid; however, using it is very situational and forces Landorus to use an unpreferred nature. Gravity allows Landorus to ease the Flying and Steel matchups and easily spam Earth Power, increasing its potential to new heights and also supporting its teammates like Choice Band Sand Rush Excadrill. Gastrodon is a great teammate due to its ability to soak up Water-type moves from foes like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert, while Gastrodon appreciates Landorus's ability to threaten Grass-types with Sludge Wave. Mamoswine is heavily valued as a sponge for Ice-type moves due to its ability Thick Fat, taking on SubRoost Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales. In return, Mamoswine cleans up Flying teams once Landorus deals with Celesteela, Corviknight, or Skarmory. Choice Scarf or Bulk Up Great Tusk forms a great wallbreaking core, taking out threats like Triple Axel Mega Lopunny and Dragonite, while also appreciating Gravity support. Clodsire provides entry hazards to chip down walls for Landorus, switches into revenge killers like Meowscarada and Tapu Koko, and counters Volcarona with Unaware so Landorus doesn't need to use Rock Slide. Mega Steelix is valued in the Ice and Fairy matchups, taking on Alolan Ninetales, Tapu Koko, Azumarill, and Weavile. Mega Garchomp and Garchomp threaten specially defensive walls like Slowking, Blissey, and Mantine while also providing a Water neutrality with decent defensive stats.

Defensive.description:
• Thanks to Intimidate and its useful typing, defensive Landorus-T is a good temporary measure against threatening physical attackers like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus-Ground.
  • Rocky Helmet is the preferred item for punishing the use of contact moves from Pokemon like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus-Ground, giving Landorus-T a better chance to beat them one-on-one.
  • However, Leftovers grants Landorus-T passive recovery, allowing it to somewhat offset Stealth Rock damage.
  • Tera Fairy gives Landorus-T an immunity to Scale Shot from Koraidon, allowing it to deny Koraidon a Speed boost and potentially allow a teammate like Koraidon or Zacian-C to revenge kill the opposing Koraidon. Tera Fairy also has the added benefit of making Landorus-T immune to Draco Meteor, potentially allowing it to turn the tables on Miraidon.
  • Tera Water lets Landorus-T better take Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C and Flare Blitz from Koraidon, potentially allowing it to beat them with higher HP than normal, as well as possibly allowing it to check Calyrex-I.
  • Defensive Landorus-T is best used on bulky offense teams as a mid-game stopgap against physical threats, which lets its offensive teammates take advantage of them later in the game.
  • Landorus-T is commonly used on teams that stack physical attackers and need a temporary measure against dangerous threats like Zacian-C and Arceus-Ground. Pokemon like Scale Shot Koraidon, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C are good partners, as they appreciate Landorus-T's ability to stave off threats and preserve their HP.
  • Ting-Lu is a fantastic partner, as it can switch into Pokemon Landorus-T cannot hope to stand up to, like Miraidon and various Calm Mind Arceus formes. Ting-Lu also doubles down on Landorus-T's Stealth Rock with its own Spikes, making its offensive teammates even more threatening later in the game.
  • Kyogre is also a great partner, as it can threaten Pokemon that can give Landorus-T trouble or take advantage of its presence, like Calyrex-I, Gliscor, and opposing Landorus-T.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Landorus-T is a decent Choice Scarf user thanks to its typing, access to U-turn, and a great ability in Intimidate, making it a good offensive pivot.
  • Unlike other common Choice Scarf users, Landorus-T has the benefit of being immune to entry hazards like Toxic Spikes and Sticky Web from Glimmora and Ribombee, respectively. This allows Landorus-T to be an excellent anti-offense tool against hyper offense teams.
  • U-turn is useful to generate momentum and bring in teammates safely when foes are forced to switch out.
  • Due to the pressure Landorus-T applies on the opposing team such as when forcing out Zacian-C and Miraidon, it can also easily set up Stealth Rock.
  • Stone Edge hits Flying-types and Tera Flying foes like Rayquaza and Zacian-C, respectively, providing good coverage alongside Earthquake. Tera Ground boosts Earthquake's power, notably allowing a 2HKO on neutral Arceus formes.
  • Landorus-T fits well on bulky offense teams that require speed control and appreciate its ability to generate momentum. Wallbreakers such as Miraidon and Kyogre appreciate being brought in safely with U-turn.
  • Special attackers such as Giratina-O are problematic for Landorus-T; therefore, specially defensive Ting-Lu is a solid teammate to help deal with it. Ting-Lu also grants hazards support, which Landorus-T is able to utilize well to pressure neutral targets, while Landorus-T is faster than many unboosted threats, granting it the ability to pressure them offensively.
  • Kyogre is also an issue for Landorus-T, so pivots like Eternatus and Toxapex are good partners.
  • Since Landorus-T does not run bulk in this set, secondary walls such as Groudon and Toxapex can be used to check physical attackers.
  • Koraidon is also an excellent partner for Landorus-T, forming a good pivoting core with it to eliminate each other's checks in Giratina-O and Skeledirge, respectively.

Landorus-T is an effective Choice Scarf user thanks to its high Attack stat and useful movepool. This, combined with its typing, natural bulk, and exceptional ability in Intimidate, makes it a good offensive pivot. U-turn is useful for generating momentum and bringing in teammates safely when the foe is forced to switch out. Stone Edge hits Flying-types such as Enamorus, Zapdos, Dragonite, and Moltres, notably providing good coverage alongside Earthquake. Grass Knot is crucial for hitting Great Tusk, which would otherwise comfortably take Landorus-T's physical attacks. It is also the best option for hitting Dondozo and Tera Water, Curse, or Iron Defense Garganacl. Tera Ground can be used to boost Landorus-T's already strong Earthquake, potentially helping it clean late-game when all Ground-immune foes have been removed. Tera Blast can be used alongside Tera Flying, as it still hits Great Tusk hard while also hitting Amoonguss and Zamazenta for super effective damage. It also guarantees an OHKO against Iron Valiant. Becoming pure Flying-type also lets Landorus-T potentially survive priority moves such as Aqua Jet from Hisuian Samurott in a pinch.

Landorus-T fits well on balanced and bulky offense teams that appreciate speed control and the ability to generate momentum. Wallbreakers and setup sweepers such as Iron Valiant, Dragapult, and Enamorus appreciate being brought in safely with U-turn. Choice Specs Enamorus and Choice Specs Dragapult especially appreciate being in against certain Pokemon that commonly switch into Landorus-T, such as Great Tusk and defensive Zapdos. Offensive Zapdos can also take advantage of these Pokemon while forming a potent VoltTurn core with Landorus-T. Faster special attackers such as Booster Energy Iron Valiant and Choice Scarf Enamorus are problematic for Landorus-T. Therefore, specially defensive Galarian Slowking is a solid teammate to help deal with them. It also consistently switches into Rotom-W, which takes very little from Landorus-T's attacks. Furthermore, Galarian Slowking forms a momentum-generating core with Landorus-T and provides Future Sight support, making Landorus-T more difficult for foes to switch into. Great Tusk forms a strong core alongside Landorus-T to deal with physical attackers such as Sneasler and Cinderace that tend to be overwhelming for one of them to take on alone. Notably, Landorus-T outspeeds Cinderace and can threaten it before getting burned by Will-O-Wisp.

Defensive.description: Defensive Landorus-T is a reliable pivot on balance and bulky offensive teams, leveraging its good typing, bulk, and Intimidate to serve as a roadblock to common threats such as Kingambit, Sneasler, and Great Tusk without Ice Spinner. Its Spikes immunity and neutrality to Stealth Rock allow it to comfortably switch in and check the aforementioned Pokemon. Landorus-T is also an excellent Stealth Rock user thanks to its good matchups against key entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and Cinderace. U-turn enables Landorus-T to pivot out of bad matchups and safely bring one of its teammates in. The last slot is flexible depending on a team's needs. Grass Knot deals high damage to Great Tusk, Dondozo, and Tera Water Garganacl, which could otherwise switch in and set up on Landorus-T, and it is useful to open up for teammates such as Kingambit to reliably clean late-game. However, Grass Knot also leaves Landorus-T quite exploitable to key Flying-types and Tera Flying Pokemon such as Moltres, Dragonite, and Kingambit, which can either cripple it with status or setup on it. Taunt is a useful utility move to stop entry hazards from Ting-Lu and Great Tusk and to prevent Enamorus-T and Garganacl from setting up. Finally, Smack Down deals decent damage to Landorus-T's common Flying-type switch-ins as well as Rotom-W, either leaving them vulnerable to Earthquake or forcing them out. 4 Speed EVs are used to outspeed Jolly Kingambit and deal good damage to it with Earthquake. As Landorus-T is a support Pokemon, it will often be more valuable to use Terastallization with other teammates. However, Tera Water lets Landorus-T resist Ice- and Water-type moves from Pokemon such as Greninja, Alolan Ninetales, and Walking Wake. Alternatively, Tera Ghost can be run to spinblock against Great Tusk while still maintaining its positive matchup against Fighting-type moves. Rocky Helmet is the preferred item, as it forces valuable chip damage on key targets such as Sneasler, Great Tusk, and Kingambit. Leftovers can also be run to grant Landorus-T a bit more longevity. Landorus-T typically fits quite well on teams with multiple pivot move users such as Sneasler, Cinderace, and Zapdos, as they can continually apply pressure to each other's counters, especially if entry hazards are up. Zapdos and Rotom-W have the added benefit of having good matchups against Flying-types, which Landorus-T struggles with. Galarian Slowking matches up quite well against strong special attackers such as Zapdos and Enamorus and appreciates Landorus-T's ability to pivot into physical attackers such Great Tusk, Kingambit, and Swords Dance Iron Valiant. Spikes setters such as Ting-Lu and Hisuian Samurott form a potent hazard-stacking core with Landorus-T and can pressure entry hazard removers such as Cinderace and Great Tusk. Strong wallbreakers such as Choice Specs Dragapult, Choice Specs Iron Valiant, and Choice Band Hoopa greatly benefit from Landorus-T's U-turn support, as it can position them to fire off their powerful attacks with little risk and can wear the opposing Pokemon down over time to be in their KO range. Landorus-T is quite exploitable by fast Water-types such as Battle Bond Greninja and Walking Wake; bulky Water-types such as Toxapex can help alleviate the pressure from these Pokemon. Landorus-T's ability to lure and overwhelm physical walls such as Dondozo and Great Tusk with Grass Knot is greatly appreciated by various physical setup sweepers such as Kingambit, Swords Dance Iron Valiant, and Hisuian Samurott.

Substitute + 3 Attacks.description:
This more offensive set allows Landorus-T to take advantage of its varied movepool and high attacking stats to cause headaches to common teambuilding structures in SV OU while still retaining its usefulness as an Intimidate pivot; as such, Substitute is essential mostly to ease prediction, but it can also catch unsuspecting players trying to use a status move on Landorus-T, such as Moltres's Will-O-Wisp or Amoonguss's Spore. Smack Down is important to let Landorus-T threaten a KO on Corviknight, Rotom-W, Zapdos, Moltres, or even Enamorus the next turn with Earthquake, and even if the opponent switches out, Earthquake is likely to strongly dent their team, unless they're running more than one Pokemon immune to Ground. Stone Edge, on top of its great coverage with Earthquake, provides a more immediate hit on Zapdos, which is useful for more offensive variants that outpace Landorus-T, as these force Landorus-T to take damage before being able to KO Zapdos. Stone Edge also OHKOes Moltres and Enamorus, but it comes at the price of being unable to dent Corviknight or Rotom-W, which is undesirable. Grass Knot rounds out Landorus-T's coverage as a way to do massive damage to Great Tusk; Garganacl after Iron Defense, Curse, or Tera Water; and Dondozo. Tera Water allows Landorus-T to turn its Ice and Water weaknesses around and thus better check Ice Spinner Great Tusk and Hisuian Samurott. A Naive nature is best alongside maximum Speed investment to make sure Landorus-T outpaces Great Tusk and most defensive Zapdos variants and Speed ties with other Landorus-T. 24 Special Attack EVs allow Landorus-T to 2HKO physically defensive Garganacl with Grass Knot if its Leftovers has been removed, but maximum Attack EVs can also be run instead.

Substitute Landorus-T is commonly found on bulky offense and balance teams, bringing the gap between a wallbreaker and a bulky pivot. To aid its wallbreaking efforts, however, Landorus-T strongly appreciates Spikes support from the likes of Hisuian Samurott and Ting-Lu to help wear down its switch-ins, as Landorus-T commonly causes the opponent to switch around, and, most importantly, put Great Tusk in range of going down to a single Grass Knot. While Landorus-T has great coverage for most of the tier and is a strong wallbreaker against most balance and bulky offense teams, there are still a few Pokemon that it gives free switches to. Iron Defense Zamazenta doesn't take much from Landorus-T's Earthquake, especially with Dauntless Shield activated, and can use Landorus-T as setup fodder with Iron Defense. Physically defensive variants of Galarian Slowking, Moltres, and Zapdos help remedy this, and the former three also help bring Landorus-T for wallbreaking opportunities via Chilly Reception, Volt Switch, and U-turn. Calm Mind Cresselia is another dangerous setup sweeper that Landorus-T allows to come in for free. Kingambit and Encore Tera Dark or Steel Iron Valiant pose great answers to it while also appreciating Landorus-T spreading damage around for them to clean up, especially if an unsuspecting Great Tusk is taken out via Grass Knot. Great Tusk itself is also a great partner, as going with a more offensive set on Landorus-T makes it less reliable of a check to physical attackers, which Great Tusk helps handle; in return Great Tusk appreciates opposing Great Tusk being taken out via Grass Knot, making it easier for defensive variants to win the hazard game and offensive variants to sweep or dent the opposing team.

Suicide Lead.description: These sets are currently up for reservation for a revamp; please check out the C&C thread for more information!

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Landorus-T is a specially defensive pivot with respectable offensive power to boot. Earthquake is its main STAB move, threatening offensive Steel- and Fire-types like Heatran and Iron Moth that fail to OHKO Landorus-T. U-turn allows Landorus-T to gain momentum and switch out, giving powerful-but-frail attackers like Chien-Pao and Iron Moth the ability to switch in for free. Rock Tomb and Sludge Bomb are used to whittle down Earth Eater Fire-types like Skeledirge and defensive Fairy-types like Scream Tail, respectively, with Rock Tomb being able to heavily damage Zapdos. Alternatively, Smack Down can be used to threaten switch-ins like Corviknight, (add comma) while Sandsear Storm can burn pivots like Garchomp. A Sassy nature with 0 Speed IVs lets Landorus-T underspeed defensive pivots like Garchomp, Scream Tail, and non-minimum Speed Corviknight with U-turn. RegenVest Landorus-T can form a powerful defensive VoltTurn core with physically defensive pivots like Corviknight and Iron Treads. Additionally, fast revenge killers and late-game sweepers like Chien-Pao and Hisuian Electrode benefit from slow pivots that can get them on the field without having to absorb an attack themselves. Due to its typing, Landorus-T does not act as an adequate switch-in to Water-type attackers like Volcanion; Water-resistant teammates like Dondozo and Water Absorb Iron Treads help mitigate this weakness.

Fluffy.description: Fluffy makes Landorus-T a decent defensive pivot that can take hits from physical attackers such as Slither Wing, Kingambit, and Ursaluna. Stealth Rock + Smack Down makes Landorus-T a decent entry hazard setter against Corviknight, the most common hazard removal option; Smack Down also ensures that Talonflame can't use Landorus-T as setup fodder. Taunt can also be used to deny recovery to Corviknight and Scream Tail and setup opportunities to foes, such as Talonflame and Roaring Moon. Landorus-T best fits on balance and bulky offense teams, where it can provide defensive support against the aforementioned physical attackers. Common defensive Pokemon such as Corviknight, Hisuian Goodra, and Scream Tail are good teammates that can switch into Pokemon that threaten Landorus-T, such as Chien-Pao, Zapdos, and Quaquaval; Scream Tail can also provide Wish support. Landorus-T struggles to beat offensive Pokemon one-on-one, but its ability to safely pivot into teammates benefits fast offensive Pokemon such as Iron Moth, Greninja, and Chien-Pao.

Well-Baked Body.description: With an added immunity to Fire, Landorus-T becomes a fantastic check to many of the Fire-types in the tier such as Cinderace, Ceruledge, and Iron Moth that also doubles as an entry hazards setter and a pivot. It differentiates itself from Garchomp as a Fire-type answer with its immunity to Will-O-Wisp as well as access to U-turn and Smack Down, allowing it to generate momentum and pressure Corviknight and other Flying-types. It can further capitalize on this added offensive presence with Swords Dance, especially if it has activated Well-Baked Body beforehand. Alternatively, running Hammer Arm over Smack Down allows it to still beat Earth Eater Heatran by itself and potentially hit Earth Eater Iron Treads hard on the switch. As a Fire-type answer, it makes a fantastic partner for Corviknight, which also appreciates its Fighting resistance to help against Pokemon like Slither Wing and in turn can handle many strong wallbreakers such as Roaring Moon and Chien-Pao that Landorus-T lacks the bulk and recovery to answer. Landorus-T also benefits RegenVest Pokemon such as Hisuian Goodra and Meloetta by preventing them from getting overwhelmed by strong Fire-type attacks and, in the case of Hisuian Goodra, helping against Ground-types such as Sandy Shocks and Landorus, while in return they handle the many special attackers in the tier. Water-immune partners, such as Desolate Land Heatran and Ceruledge, make good teammates for Landorus-T as well. Frail wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao and Cinderace also benefit from its pivoting ability to enter the battlefield safely as well as the hazards its sets to wear down their checks.

Choice Scarf (Flying).description: Choice Scarf Landorus-T is one of the best revenge killers Flying teams have access to, outrunning threats like Tapu Koko, Mega Diancie, and Terrakion while boasting great firepower. It's also very desirable thanks to its defensive traits, which include an immunity to Electric-type attacks and Intimidate. U-turn takes advantage of the switches Landorus-T forces, allowing it to pivot out of walls that come in on it such as Corviknight and Mega Venusaur. Similarly, Knock Off cripples some of the bulky Pokemon it invites in, like Porygon2 and Ferrothorn, by removing their items. Stone Edge notably hits Kyurem the hardest and is Landorus-T's best move versus Flying-types like Zapdos and Pelipper. Alternatively, Explosion lets Landorus-T score a surprise KO against an offensive threat it normally cannot OHKO, such as Keldeo or Mega Lopunny. Special wallbreakers like Galarian Moltres, Tornadus-T, and Mega Charizard Y are great partners to deal with the aforementioned physical walls Landorus-T draws in. Thundurus-T relieves pressure from Landorus-T by acting as a secondary Electric immunity and is a great asset against the Water and Flying teams Landorus-T can't do much to. Mega Aerodactyl is able to form a powerful revenge killing core alongside Landorus-T while providing Stealth Rock support for it to clean teams more easily. Corviknight switches into most Ice-type attacks aimed at Landorus-T, removes Stealth Rock with Defog, and is able to bring Landorus-T safely onto the field via its slow U-turn.

Bulk Up (Ground).description:
Ferrothorn's Power Whip does not break Substitute at +1 Def or -1 Atk from Intimidate.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defensive Pivot.description: Landorus-T is an excellent physically defensive pivot that checks foes such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, Arceus, and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground thanks to its rare Spikes immunity, Intimidate, and U-turn. Taunt denies entry hazards and status from Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Toxapex and prevents foes like Arceus from continuously setting up in front of Landorus-T. Rocky Helmet punishes foes like Koraidon and Zacian-C for attacking by potentially putting them into range of attacks such as +2 Arceus's Extreme Speed, Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, and Giratina-O's Shadow Sneak. Tera Water grants a resistance to attacks such as Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, while Tera Fairy grants an immunity to Dragon, denying Scale Shot Koraidon a Speed boost and less importantly blocking moves like Miraidon's Draco Meteor. Landorus-T best fits on bulky offense teams, where it can support offensive teammates such as Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, Arceus, and Miraidon by setting Stealth Rock, safely pivoting them in to wallbreak, and checking revenge killers like Zacian-C and Choice Scarf Koraidon. Ting-Lu checks Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground for Landorus-T and provides its offensive teammates with Spikes support; Landorus-T checks strong physical attackers for it in return. Landorus-T lacks recovery, so partners like Arceus-Fairy, Arceus-Ground, and Zacian-C can assist it by checking Koraidon, opposing Zacian-C, and Arceus, respectively, with help from Intimidate; Choice Scarf Koraidon can also revenge kill these foes. Teammates like Koraidon, Giratina-O, and Eternatus deter Kyogre from using its STAB moves to an extent, but Kyogre can still force you to predict whether it will use a Water-type move or Ice Beam in the face of Landorus-T.

Heavy-Duty Boots.description:
Heavy-Duty Boots Kyurem is an incredibly powerful Pokemon with very few switch-ins, leveraging its hefty natural bulk and monstrous offensive stats to threaten a large portion of the tier with its perfect coverage. Both Ice Beam and Freeze-Dry are fantastic STAB options, with the raw power of Ice Beam supplemented by Freeze-Dry's super effective coverage into bulky Water-types such as Toxapex and Dondozo. Earth Power is a great coverage move that allows Kyurem to hit common switch-ins like Galarian Slowking, Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Heatran, and Draco Meteor rounds out the set with a powerful nuke that tears through neutral targets like Darkrai, Deoxys-S, and Terastallized Ting-Lu while securing a notable OHKO on Gouging Fire. Scale Shot is a weaker alternative that boosts Kyurem's Speed to patch up its middling Speed tier and thwart revenge killing attempts by otherwise faster Pokemon such as Dragapult and Zamazenta. It also targets special walls like Blissey on their frailer Defense and hits Volcarona hard to prevent it from using Kyurem as setup fodder. A Naive nature is selected for a mixed set with Scale Shot in order to still survive Iron Boulder's Mighty Cleave from full HP. A Hasty nature can also be considered for a better matchup into Volcarona and to avoid an OHKO from Iron Valiant's Moonblast. Tera Ice synergizes with Kyurem's double Ice-type STAB attacks to blast holes through teams, allowing it to 2HKO both physically defensive Clefable and Corviknight with Ice Beam. Tera Ground can be used instead to change Kyurem's defensive profile entirely while giving it a STAB boost to Earth Power, securing crucial 2HKOs on both Galarian Slowking and Skeledirge along with dropping offensive Gholdengo in a single hit. Additionally, both Tera types drop Kyurem's weaknesses to Dragon- and Fairy-type attacks from Pokemon like Dragapult and Enamorus, with Tera Ground also removing its Fighting- and Rock-type weaknesses to block revenge killing attempts from Zamazenta and Iron Boulder.

Kyurem is a perfect fit for entry hazard-stacking teams that opt to neglect removal in favor of putting hazards up on both sides, as Heavy-Duty Boots allows Kyurem to switch in freely, and its lack of power from no boosting item is made up for by switch-ins being forced to take chip damage on entry. Good defensive hazard setters that pair well with Kyurem include Skarmory and Gliscor with their Steel- and Fighting-type resistances, respectively. Faster teammates are also appreciated to help cover for Kyurem's mediocre Speed, with fast Knock Off users such as Meowscarada and Weavile being great picks for balance teams and Iron Boulder as a good pairing on more offensive builds. Another partner that works particularly well is Knock Off Clefable, which switches into Dragon- and Fighting-type attacks from Dragapult and Zamazenta and invites in Kyurem's defensive checks like Galarian Slowking, Air Balloon Gholdengo, and Air Balloon Heatran to remove their items, making them more susceptible to chip damage and allowing Kyurem to hit the latter two with Earth Power. Galarian Slowking itself is a bulky pivot that has great synergy with Kyurem, as it stifles revenge killing attempts with Fighting- and Fairy-type attacks from checks like Iron Valiant and Enamorus, and it can not only can bring in Kyurem freely with Chilly Reception but also sets up snow to make it significantly harder to revenge kill. Offensively, Kyurem pairs well with threats that can force in walls weak to it such as Gliscor, Skarmory, and Great Tusk, making Kingambit a natural partner.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description: Choice Specs Kyurem is a terrifying wallbreaker with an impeccable STAB combination and coverage movepool, beating threats to Dragon teams like Toxapex, Dragonite, and Mamoswine. Draco Meteor is Kyurem's most powerful move, notably wearing down typical switch-ins like Mega Sableye and Volcarona. Freeze-Dry is highly effective in the Water matchup by answering would-be checks like Swampert, Gastrodon, and Slowking. Focus Blast catches Ferrothorn and Tyranitar off guard should they expect a STAB move, while Earth Power hits Alolan Muk, Galarian Slowking, and Heatran for more damage. Mega Altaria is heavily appreciated as an answer to Dragon-types like Kommo-o, Roaring Moon, and Walking Wake. Garchomp provides entry hazards like Stealth Rock and Spikes to ease Kyurem's wallbreaking. Latias checks Fighting-types such as Iron Hands, Galarian Zapdos, and Terrakion, is able to replenish Kyurem's health with Healing Wish, and removes troublesome entry hazards—especially Stealth Rock, given Kyurem's Rock weakness—with Defog. Dragalge sets up Toxic Spikes and checks Fairy-types like Tapu Koko and Clefable. Kommo-o checks Steel-types like Heatran and defensive Celesteela and blocks attempts to set hazards with Taunt.

Substitute + Roost (Ice).description: Kyurem is a stellar stallbreaker for Ice teams by utilizing Pressure, Substitute, and Roost to beat or force out walls such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Mega Sableye. Kyurem's good bulk and typing also allow it to function as a defensive pivot, consistently checking threats like Heatran, Rotom-W, and Rillaboom. Moreover, it shrugs a hit from and beats the likes of Galarian Zapdos and Urshifu-R one-on-one if using a Chople Berry. Freeze-Dry lands a strong hit on Water-types like Toxapex and Gastrodon, turning Kyurem into a valuable asset in that matchup. Alongside it, Earth Power grants Kyurem near-perfect neutral coverage by nailing Steel- and Fire-types such as Magnezone and Skeledirge. The given EV spread allows Kyurem's Substitute to live one Seismic Toss from Blissey. Alolan Ninetales provides Snow and Aurora Veil support, bolstering Kyurem's defensive utility while preventing Celesteela and Heatran from breaking its Substitute. Defensive Cloyster is able to remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin, set up Spikes to help Kyurem stallbreak more easily, and switch into physical Steel-type attacks from Mega Scizor and Melmetal. Similarly, Piloswine lays down Stealth Rock and deals with Fire- and Rock-types that Kyurem loses to, such as Volcarona and Mega Diancie. Setup sweepers like Swords Dance Weavile and Shell Smash Cloyster greatly appreciate Kyurem wearing down walls so they can clean up late-game.

Dragon Dance.description: These sets are currently up for reservation for a revamp; please check out the C&C thread for more information!
These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Kyurem-B is a threatening wallbreaker. Its main advantage over the competition, being Kartana and Mega Garchomp, is its STAB-boosted Glacial Lance, which is more spammable than Gigaton Hammer and Headlong Rush and grants it a natural advantage into Fur Coat users like Yveltal. V-create threatens to OHKO Steel-types like Mega Steelix, which can otherwise scout Kyurem-B's move choice and heal off about half of the damage with Regenerator. U-turn offers dangerous teammates like Mega Mewtwo X a safe window to switch in if Kyurem-B can't secure a KO, and it can be used early-game to scout for potential Fur Coat switch-ins. Kyurem-B fits best on balance teams that can grant it opportunities through pivoting and can make room for counterplay against the few things it can't instantly get past, such as Arceus-Poison. Kyurem-B's lack of recovery and weakness to Rock mean Stone Axe is a major pain, so multiple entry hazard removers like Miraidon, Mega Steelix, and Primal Kyogre are recommended; the latter two also function as slow pivots, which Kyurem-B also appreciates. Fur Coat Arceus formes not weak to Kyurem-B's attacks, such as Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fairy, also aren't afraid of it when healthy; as a result, it appreciates an ally that can block their Strength Sap, such as a Magic Bounce user like Mega Audino, significantly cutting into their longevity. A faster offensive teammate like Mega Mewtwo X or Deoxys-A is recommended to clean weakened teams, as Kyurem-B's poor Speed inhibits it in this regard. Imposter-proof Kyurem-B with a Fur Coat user not weak to its attacks, like Arceus-Poison or Arceus-Fairy.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Keldeo is an excellent wallbreaker, utilizing its solid Speed and high Special Attack to break through many defensive Pokemon like Blissey, Jirachi, and Clefable. Hydro Pump is preferred due to its incredible power, giving Keldeo solid odds to 2HKO special walls like Celesteela and Jirachi and guaranteeing an OHKO on offensive threats like Enamorus and Thundurus-T. Alternatively, Surf can be used for its better accuracy, though it significantly hurts Keldeo's damage output against the aforementioned Pokemon. Secret Sword hits the weaker Defense of special walls like Gastrodon and Chansey while also hitting Pokemon that could pivot into Water-type attacks like Volcanion and Hisuian Goodra. Flip Turn allows Keldeo to maintain momentum and switch out of bad matchups like Slowbro and Mega Latias. Alternatively, Toxic can be used to cripple these checks instead. Hidden Power Ice is used in the final slot to hit many Pokemon that resist its STAB combination like Salamence, Latios, and Mega Altaria for super effective damage. Focus Blast can be used instead to deal massive damage to neutral targets like Rotom-W and Assault Vest Tangrowth. Choice Specs Keldeo invites in Pokemon that resist its STAB combination such as Slowking, Mega Latias, and Amoonguss. It therefore pairs well with teammates that can take advantage of these switch-ins such as Bisharp and Ceruledge for the former two and Iron Moth for the latter. Additionally, it can take advantage of Future Sight support from Slowbro or Slowking to limit the ability of Poison-types like Amoonguss and Mega Venusaur to switch in. Pursuit from Pokemon like Mega Tyranitar and Scizor is also helpful for removing Psychic-type checks to Keldeo like Slowbro and Slowking. Keldeo also appreciates entry hazard support from Pokemon like Excadrill and Ting-Lu to push checks like Tapu Fini and Mega Venusaur into range for Hydro Pump to 2HKO. Finally, Keldeo struggles against faster offensive threats like Mega Latias and thus pairs well with partners like Celesteela that can switch into these threats.

Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Keldeo is a threatening sweeper, thanks to its ability to break past many defensive cores. Scald is usually chosen because of its high PP and burn chance, allowing Keldeo to slowly wear down checks like Mega Venusaur while crippling physical attackers like Iron Hands, Tapu Bulu, and Salamence. Scald is especially potent in tandem with Substitute and Leftovers, as it allows Keldeo to set up on many defensive Pokemon that struggle to break its Substitute like Slowking, Celesteela, and Gastrodon lacking Earthquake while dodging status and Leech Seed. Alternatively, Hydro Pump in combination with Waterium Z allows Keldeo to blow past common answers to itself such as Mega Venusaur, Tapu Fini, and Slowbro if they are weakened. When using Hydro Pump, Taunt is used over Substitute to prevent Pokemon like Mega Venusaur and Unaware Clefable from recovering their HP, though Keldeo must be wary of moves like Giga Drain and Moonblast in return. Secret Sword hits the lower Defense of many common checks to special attackers like Blissey and Gastrodon. Calm Mind Keldeo fits best on balance and bulky offense which appreciate its ability to effectively take on defensive team styles. Keldeo is threatened out by faster offensive Pokemon that can hit it super effectively like Latios and Mega Latias if it does not have a Substitute up. Therefore, it pairs well with Pokemon that can switch into them like Celesteela and Scizor. They are also valuable for their ability to switch into checks to Keldeo like Tapu Fini and Mega Venusaur. Keldeo pairs well with entry hazard support from Pokemon like Mega Tyranitar, Skarmory, and Excadrill that can push its checks into range of a boosted Hydro Vortex.

Choice Scarf.description: Choice Scarf allows Keldeo to act as a decent revenge killer with its strong STAB moves and high Speed. Its decent natural bulk and useful typing also allow it to check Dark-types like Tyranitar and Bisharp while also giving it a Stealth Rock resistance. Hydro Pump is chosen for its high power, OHKOing Pokemon like Victini while giving Keldeo a high chance to KO Choice Scarf Enamorus and Nasty Plot Thundurus after Stealth Rock damage. Secret Sword hits the weaker Defense of common special walls like Blissey and Gastrodon. Flip Turn allows Keldeo to pivot out of bad matchups while maintaining momentum for its team. Toxic is used to status common checks to Keldeo such as Mega Altaria and Mega Latias. Hidden Power Ice can be used as an alternative to allow Keldeo to revenge kill threats such as Dragon Dance Salamence while also doing solid damage against Mega Altaria and Latios. Choice Scarf Keldeo struggles against bulkier teams, which take little damage from its attacks with Pokemon like Tapu Fini, Amoonguss, and Slowking. Therefore, it appreciates strong offensive Pokemon like Choice Band Galarian Zapdos and Z-Happy Hour Jirachi that can handle those teamstyles. Furthermore, Keldeo itself is threatened by faster Choice Scarf users like Latios and Hydreigon and therefore requires checks to these Pokemon like Celesteela. Keldeo also appreciates entry hazard setters like Excadrill and Mew that can push Pokemon like Scizor and Enamorus into Hydro Pump range.

Calm Mind (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs (Normal).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Battle Bond.description:
Battle Bond Greninja is an extremely powerful cleaner thanks to its great STAB moves, wonderful coverage, and solid Special Attack and excellent Speed, which are boosted to astronomical levels the first time it KOes an enemy. After Battle Bond activates, Greninja can outpace threats that are already considered very fast, including Choice Scarfers like Enamorus and Sneasler and Booster Energy users like Iron Valiant, Walking Wake, and Iron Moth. Hydro Pump is extremely powerful, always OHKOing uninvested Kingambit after Battle Bond activates and having a significant chance to OHKO it with just Tera Water while at worst 2HKOing much of the tier with both Battle Bond and Tera Water active, but Surf is a more consistent alternative; Greninja will need to rely more on entry hazard support to secure OHKOs against threats like the aforementioned Kingambit, but it is still more than capable of OHKOing many offensive threats with Battle Bond and Tera Water active. Grass Knot rounds out Greninja's coverage by OHKOing Tera Water Garganacl and opposing Greninja with Battle Bond active, having a high chance to OHKO Hisuian Samurott after Stealth Rock even without Battle Bond active, and 2HKOing Dondozo. Water Shuriken can pick off weakened faster threats like +1 Iron Valiant, Unburden Sneasler, Choice Scarf Enamorus, and +1 Great Tusk, and in a pinch it can act as insurance against greatly weakened threats like Dragapult. With a Modest nature and rain support from Pelipper, it also OHKOes Iron Valiant after Stealth Rock with a Battle Bond Boost as long as it hits at least three times, which makes up for the loss in Speed from foregoing a Timid nature. Water Shuriken also helps deal with Kingambit's Sucker Punch, which can otherwise greatly threaten Greninja if it has been weakened or shed its Dark resistance with Tera Water. Ice Beam, on the other hand, reliably handles Water-resistant threats like Dragonite, Amoonguss, Rillaboom, Meowscarada, and Tera Grass Galarian Slowking.

Battle Bond Greninja greatly appreciates entry hazard support from Ting-Lu, Glimmora, and Hisuian Samurott to wear threats down over the course of a game; for instance, enabling it to KO Kingambit with Tera Water Surf and take out Amoonguss more easily once Battle Bond is already active. Moreover, the chip damage from entry hazards can help wear down faster threats like Booster Energy Iron Valiant Choice Scarf Enamorus, putting them into Water Shuriken range. In that vein, Gholdengo is another excellent teammate due to its ability to prevent hazard removal; it can also use its powerful STAB moves alongside Choice Specs or a Nasty Plot boost to wallbreak and wear down the opposing team, allowing Greninja to finish the job. Other powerful offensive threats like Iron Valiant and especially Kingambit greatly appreciate Battle Bond Greninja's ability to break past various threats like Corviknight, Dondozo, Great Tusk, Heatran, and Landorus-T to assist their late-game sweeps; in return, they can help weaken threats like Walking Wake and Dragonite. Kingambit in particular can handle threats like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Terastallized Galarian Slowking, which Greninja may struggle to muscle past. Lastly, Battle Bond Greninja is a natural fit on rain teams, as the boost from Pelipper's Drizzle alongside a Modest nature, Tera Water, and Battle Bond allows Greninja's Hydro Pump to accomplish ludicrous feats such as outright OHKOing specially defensive pivot Galarian Slowking, OHKOing Roaring Moon after Stealth Rock, and even 2HKOing Assault Vest Toxapex more reliably. Basculegion is another rain staple that synergizes well with Greninja, as one can weaken their shared checks like Rotom-W and Walking Wake to enable the other's sweep. Lastly, Zapdos offers rain teams an effective means of dealing with Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Tera Water Galarian Slowking, ensuring that Greninja doesn't have to waste precious turns attacking them and getting worn down by their attacks alongside Life Orb recoil.

Choice Specs.description:
When equipped with Choice Specs, Greninja becomes a potent wallbreaker thanks to its great coverage and Protean. Since Choice Specs ensures it only uses one attack per switch-in, even though Protean only activates once per switch-in, Greninja will have STAB every time it attacks. Hydro Pump is Greninja's most powerful move, pummeling both offensive and defensive Water-weak Pokemon like Cinderace, Skeledirge, and Great Tusk. Dark Pulse hits the likes of Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Hisuian Zoroark super effectively while also dealing the most damage to Toxapex and Rotom-W. Dark Pulse's flinch chance can also come in clutch against the aforementioned walls. Ice Beam eviscerates Amoonguss, Water Absorb Clodsire, and Dragon-types like Dragonite and Roaring Moon. Grass Knot can OHKO Dondozo, Garganacl, and Walking Wake after minor chip damage, and it deals good damage to lighter Water-types like Quaquaval and Azumarill. Alternatively, Spikes lets Greninja wear down checks like Toxapex while taking advantage of the switches it often forces. In addition, Greninja also beats common entry hazard removers such as Great Tusk and Corviknight, making Spikes easy to maintain. Tera Water further enhances Greninja's already powerful Hydro Pump to extreme levels, letting it OHKO Pokemon like Corviknight, Hatterene, and Unaware Clodsire. Meanwhile, Tera Dark lets Greninja 2HKO Toxapex and Rotom-W with Dark Pulse.

Choice Specs Greninja fits best on hyper offense and bulky offense teams as a menacing wallbreaker. Stealth Rock setters like Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, Garchomp, and Glimmora are amazing for Spikes Greninja, as it can create a hazard-stacking core with them. Alternatively, these Pokemon can also let Greninja drop Spikes for Grass Knot, as they can set up hazards and Grass Knot overwhelming Dondozo and Walking Wake. Strong offensive Pokemon like Kingambit and mixed Iron Valiant make for excellent partners, as Greninja threatens their checks like Great Tusk, Dondozo, and Garchomp for the former, and Skeledirge, Gholdengo, and Clodsire for the latter. They can also threaten Pokemon that would otherwise revenge kill Greninja, such as Dragapult and Meowscarada, granting Greninja more consistency against teams with these Pokemon.

Lead.description:
Greninja is an excellent dedicated lead due to its high Speed tier alongside Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and valuable utility options. It differentiates itself from Meowscarada due to its better matchup against other leads as well as entry hazard setters and removers such as Glimmora, Iron Treads, Garchomp, Toxic Spikes Iron Moth, and Court Change Cinderace. Taunt has various applications; it blocks Amoonguss's Spore, prevents entry hazards from the likes of Ting-Lu and leads like Glimmora and Iron Treads, stops Defog from Corviknight, and prevents setup from Pokemon Roaring Moon, Kingambit, and Tera Water Garganacl that attempt to exploit Greninja's relative passivity. Greninja can choose to run Toxic Spikes to punish offensive teams filled with setup sweepers like Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant better, but Ice Beam OHKOes Garchomp and dents Water-resistant Pokemon like Dragonite, Meowscarada, Dragapult, Tera Grass Glimmora, and Water Absorb Clodsire, especially if its Focus Sash is still intact for the former three. Focus Sash guarantees that Greninja can set at least one layer of entry hazards and works extremely well to safely put it into Torrent range, which allows Surf to OHKO Hisuian Zoroark and provides significant odds to OHKO Iron Valiant, one of the biggest threats to offense teams. Alternatively, Protean improves Ice Beam's damage and allows Greninja to block Volt Switch from Rotom-W, Iron Treads, and Sandy Shocks when using Spikes, maintaining offensive momentum. Tera Water boosts Greninja's Surf, notably netting the OHKO on specially defensive Garganacl and 2HKO on Tera Fairy Skeledirge with Torrent, as well as the 2HKO on Gholdengo and Corviknight after Stealth Rock.

Greninja is perfectly suited for hyper offense teams. Offensive teammates like Iron Valiant and Roaring Moon put further pressure on entry hazard removers such as Corviknight, Iron Treads, and Great Tusk to maintain Greninja's Spikes throughout the game and enjoy Spikes chipping down their checks like Garganacl, Clodsire, Amoonguss, and Dondozo. They also appreciate Spikes invalidating Focus Sash from Pokemon like Hisuian Zoroark, Ceruledge, and Meowscarada. Aside from possessing insane late-game potential themselves, Kingambit and Iron Moth particularly help against Meowscarada—one of the few leads that can easily beat Greninja—and Hatterene, which can freely switch into Greninja and reflect its Taunt and entry hazards with Magic Bounce, with Calm Mind variants using it as setup fodder as well. Kingambit in particular appreciates Greninja's tendency to faint early-game to accumulate Supreme Overlord boosts. Knock Off from Bulk Up Great Tusk and Swords Dance Iron Valiant can remove Heavy-Duty Boots from walls like Dondozo, Slowking, and Tera Fairy Skeledirge, making them susceptible to Greninja's Spikes. Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Dragon Dance Dragapult can spinblock the likes of Great Tusk and Iron Treads in a pinch to keep Greninja's Spikes up; Gholdengo in particular does it exceptionally well by blocking Defog and Glimmora's Mortal Spin as well, and it has the added benefit of threatening Hatterene and crippling walls like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu with Choice item + Trick, making them more vulnerable to Greninja's entry hazards.

Battle Bond Sweeper.description: Greninja serves as a potentially lethal cleaner due to the significant boost to Speed and Special Attack granted by Battle Bond, being able to slice through weakened defensive cores and outspeed revenge killers such as Choice Scarf Kartana, Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, and Tapu Koko. Surf, despite being weaker than Hydro Pump, is a solid option due to its reliability, while Hydro Pump is a stronger alternative despite its lower accuracy, as it allows Greninja to OHKO targets such as Mega Charizard Y under sun. Dark Pulse gives Greninja a strong neutral STAB move to hit common Water-resistant Pokemon such as Ferrothorn, Toxapex, and Rotom-W, additionally wielding a nasty flinch chance to potentially break through them. Water Shuriken gives Greninja a priority option, crucial for revenge killing weakened targets that outspeed it like Tapu Koko and Mega Lopunny, as well as getting the jump on other priority moves such as Weavile's Ice Shard and the aforementioned Mega Lopunny's Quick Attack. Ice Beam is Greninja's coverage move of choice, being its strongest option versus Pokemon like Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Dragonite. Tera Water is the preferred Tera type, giving a significant boost to both of Greninja's Water-type STAB moves to potentially secure KOs on targets like Mega Charizard Y in sun and Tapu Lele after a Battle Bond activation with Surf. Greninja can also serve as a potent albeit niche wallbreaker on rain teams, with rain boosting the power of its Water-type STAB moves to ridiculous levels. This allows teammates like Mega Swampert and Zapdos to clean up the weakened defensive cores consisting of Pokemon like Rotom-W and Galarian Slowking. However, Greninja alone can struggle to break through sturdier Water-resistant foes like Tera Water Garganacl, Toxapex, and Ferrothorn, so teammates like Tapu Koko, Gholdengo, and Heatran that can capitalize on Greninja forcing these foes in function well as teammates on certain offensive compositions.

Choice Scarf.description: Greninja is the fastest Choice Scarf user in the metagame, taking advantage of its blistering Speed tier and colorful Protean-boosted coverage to be a strong revenge killer and offensive pivot. Gunk Shot decimates Pokemon like Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Tapu Koko. Ice Beam covers a plethora of Pokemon, including Tornadus-T, Dragapult, Kartana, and Landorus-T. Rock Slide deals with Volcarona and Mega Charizard Y. Aside from enabling Greninja to pivot, U-turn also provides coverage against Mega Tyranitar, Mega Gyarados, and opposing Greninja. The Special Attack EVs guarantee the OHKO against Kartana with Ice Beam. Terastallizing is mainly used to improve its offensive capabilities; for instance, Tera Poison gives Gunk Shot significant odds to OHKO specially defensive Tera Grass Heatran, Clefable, and Tera Fairy Garganacl after Stealth Rock, while Tera Ice boosts Ice Beam to OHKO Dragapult and physically defensive Tangrowth and Great Tusk. Wallbreakers like Garchomp, Zamazenta, Tapu Lele, and Mega Charizard Y appreciate Greninja's U-turn bringing them in safely on foes like Heatran, Garganacl, Toxapex, and Gholdengo, respectively. Garchomp also provides entry hazards to punish Greninja's forced switches, chipping down the likes of Garganacl and Heatran. In return, Greninja outpaces faster threats like Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult that would otherwise overwhelm them. Greninja can form a VoltTurn core with Pokemon such as Tornadus-T, Rotom-W, and Mega Scizor; the former two also provide Defog so Greninja can pivot more freely, especially if running Tera Ice.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Battle Bond (Water).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs (Dark).description:
Greninja is a staple for Dark teams thanks to its blitzing Speed tier that outpaces Cinderace and Iron Valiant. Protean + Choice Specs allows it to take full advantage of its coverage moves to OHKO and 2HKO common threats. Hydro Pump 2HKOes specially defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock; however, Surf is a safer option while still OHKOing Iron Valiant after Stealth Rock. Ice Beam targets threats such as Dragonite and Clodsire. Grass Knot can 2HKO Ting Lu and Gastrodon while OHKOing Dondozo after Stealth Rock. Extrasensory targets Poison- and Fighting-types such as Toxapex and Quaquaval.

Meowscarada forms a dual Protean core with Greninja to break each other's checks; Greninja can break Toxapex for Meowscarada, while Meowscarada can break Iron Hands for Greninja. Chien-Pao and Greninja form a dangerous core that shatters teams without a proper Ice-resistant Pokemon. Chien-Pao is also capable of breaking Steel-types such as Kingambit with Sacred Sword. Kingambit can take on Fairy-type Pokemon for Greninja, such as Flutter Mane and Hatterene, while it can break past physical walls such as Quagsire in return. Ting-Lu can stack Stealth Rock and Spikes allowing Greninja to more easily score OHKOs such as against Corviknight and Dondozo and take care of Hatterene and Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam for Greninja. Sableye switches into Fighting-type attacks such as Great Tusk's Close Combat; additionally, it can block Rapid Spin, keeping entry hazards up for Greninja. Skuntank is amazing in the Fairy matchup, as it can check threats such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and trap Klefki with Fire Spin. Skuntank also absorbs and sets Toxic Spikes for Greninja.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
Thanks to a wide array of coverage options alongside Protean, Choice Specs Greninja is a devastating special wallbreaker that can dismantle several types, including Grass, Ground, Water, and Poison. Its naturally high Speed tier is invaluable to outpace and threaten fast foes such as Iron Valiant and Sandy Shocks. Aside from hitting Psychic- and Ghost-types like Bronzong and Gholdengo, Dark Pulse's lack of immunities makes it a spammable attack that can be used to muscle past neutral Pokemon such as Corviknight with flinches. Ice Beam covers a large portion of the metagame, including Dragon, Ground, Grass, and Flying teams, decimating prominent foes like Hydreigon, Clodsire, Amoonguss, and Iron Jugulis. It's also Greninja's hardest hitting attack against Skuntank, which is important in the Poison matchup. Extrasensory pressures Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex and Assault Vest Iron Hands and prevents Greninja from being picked off by Breloom's Mach Punch. Grass Knot rounds out its coverage, significantly damaging Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Water-types such as Gastrodon and Dondozo.

Choice Specs Greninja appreciates being paired with other wallbreakers like Barraskewda and Quaquaval that can handle Normal and Steel teams. They break through bulky Pokemon like Blissey and Kingambit that Greninja struggles with; they are also potent late-game cleaners that enjoy Greninja's ability to threaten Storm Drain Gastrodon and their physically defensive checks like Amoonguss, Toxapex, Slowbro, and Dondozo. Moreover, Barraskewda under rain excels at tearing down fast offensive teams that Greninja can struggle with, as it can threaten out Meowscarada, boosted Volcarona, and Choice Scarf Iron Moth. Quaquaval can also run Rapid Spin to let Greninja enter the field multiple times to wallbreak without worry, preventing it from being chipped down into KO range of priority attacks like Dragonite's Extreme Speed, Scizor's Bullet Punch, and Baxcalibur's Ice Shard. Pivot support from Slowking is helpful to bring Greninja in safely on foes like Dragalge and Gastrodon, letting it fire off attacks freely. Defensive teammates such as Toxapex, Dondozo, Gastrodon, and Quagsire can switch into potential revenge killers like Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, Dragapult, and Slither Wing, respectively; notably, Gastrodon and Quagsire also provide entry hazards to take advantage of the countless switches that Greninja forces, putting the likes of Ting-Lu, Toxapex, and Assault Vest Iron Hands into Greninja's KO range, as well as switch into and check Electric-types such as Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks and Assault Vest Iron Hands.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Greninja is a powerful offensive threat and pivot that uses its rain-boosted attacks to break past most neutral foes. Dark Pulse helps deal with common Desolate Land users like Iron Moth and Cinderace. Ice Beam provides coverage against Dragon-types like Goodra and Roaring Moon, while Surf lets Greninja clean up weakened teams without relying on the low PP and accuracy of Hydro Pump. U-turn lets Greninja switch out from its checks while still maintaining momentum, forming a VoltTurn core with physical wallbreakers like Galarian Zapdos and Cinderace that can threaten the specially defensive Pokemon that wall Greninja like Blissey and Hisuian Goodra. Greninja pairs well with entry hazard setters such as Ting-Lu and Garchomp, which can help it wear down its checks. Greninja also appreciates hazard removal from Pokemon like Corviknight and Iron Treads to avoid getting worn down when switching in; these two Pokemon can also pivot in Greninja.
