  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Maximizing Ursaluna's physical defense means Tera Water will usually avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Urshifu's Close Combat after Leftovers recovery.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: A female gender is slightly optimal for avoiding infatuation from the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

Assault Vest.description:
• Ursaluna's excellent power and bulk make it a good, if unexpected, user of Assault Vest.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch's bit of extra healing is useful even without being a STAB move.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best option for punishing Urshifu-R switching in.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is preferred due to its reliable base power, but Avalanche can threaten to damage Multiscale Dragonite past the ability to recover HP back with Roost.

  • Facade: While Facade is rather weak without the reliability of Flame Orb, it's a devestating way to punish status moves and Toxic Spikes.

  • EV Spread: The bulk investment allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage. Some other Special Attacks it takes on include avoiding a 2HKO from defensive Rotom-W's Hydro Pump, avoiding a 2HKO from two consecutive Make It Rains from Choice Specs Gholdengo, and avoiding an OHKO from Tera Water Iron Bundle.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization isn't needed for Ursaluna to make good use of Assault Vest, but it can help against some common physical threats.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Ursaluna's big Water and Ice weaknesses, helping a great deal against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Ursaluna's best choice for a Fighting resistance, in addition to helping against powerful users of Outrage such as Choice Band Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Ghost: If using Bulletproof, Tera Ghost is a good way to flip the tables on Fighting-types without compromising Ursaluna against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Guts: Even if Guts isn't guaranteed to be activated, switching Ursaluna into status moves like Will-O-Wisp can turn it into a wallbreaker in a pinch.

  • Bulletproof: Bulletproof gives Ursaluna a very useful immunity to some attacks that hit it hard, such as Bullet Seed and Focus Blast. The Sludge Bomb and Shadow Ball immunity is also fantastic when Terastallized.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: While Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare, there's no drawback in using a female gender to become immune to this ability.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Normal

Ursaluna-B can utilize a Chople Berry to lure in and surprise Fighting-types like Sneasler and Iron Valiant, taking less damage from their Fighting attacks while being able to OHKO them back with its STAB attacks. Heavy-Duty Boots is also an alternative for Ursaluna-B if you do not opt to run entry hazard removal options in Braviary or Cyclizar to avoid Spikes and Toxic Spikes hindering Ursaluna-B's ability to take hits and set up Calm Mind. Ursaluna-B can also opt to run Silk Scarf to boost Blood Moon's damage output even further. However, the longevity that Leftovers provides is generally preferred.

Calm Mind (Normal).description:
Ursaluna-B is one of the best setup Pokemon on Normal teams thanks to its high damage output and its great physical bulk complemented by recovery in Moonlight. Calm Mind allows Ursaluna-B to boost its power while improving its middling special bulk, allowing it to take on Pokemon like Hisuian Goodra one-on-one and beat Corviknight variants without Iron Defense or Bulk Up. Blood Moon is Ursaluna-B's strongest attack and is able to cleanly OHKO most offensive threats such as Dragapult and Ogerpon-H after a Calm Mind boost. Hyper Voice is the alternative over Blood Moon to provide Ursaluna-B with a more spammable STAB option, letting it beat foes that use Protect like Gliscor more easily. Earth Power lets Ursaluna-B attack on the turn after it uses Blood Moon, threatening defensive options like Clodsire and Toxapex, and can also OHKO Okidogi after a Calm Mind boost. Vacuum Wave is also an option that can notably threaten Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Furthermore, Vacuum Wave gives Ursaluna-B a priority option to circumvent its low Speed to defeat weakened foes like Meowscarada and Greninja. 68 Speed EVs allows Ursaluna-B to outspeed uninvested base 60 Pokemon such as Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Weezing, with the remaining EVs going into HP and Defense to maximize Ursaluna-B's physical bulk. A Bold nature lets Ursaluna-B survive super effective attacks from Pokemon such as Adamant Sneasler and Choice Band Zamazenta's Close Combat and Choice Band Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash from full HP. Alternatively, a Modest nature allows Ursaluna-B to deal more damage at the cost of not surviving the aforementioned attacks. Leftovers is Ursaluna-B's preferred item to keep it healthy throughout the game and works well with Moonlight.

Hisuian Zoroark is one of Ursaluna-B's best offensive teammates for its ability to check opposing Fighting-types like Zamazenta and Iron Hands with its Fighting immunity and access to utility options in Will-O-Wisp. In return, Ursaluna-B can break down specially defensive Pokemon that can handle Hisuian Zoroark such as Clodsire, Gliscor, and Hisuian Goodra. Staraptor is also a good partner for Ursaluna-B thanks to its ability to threaten opposing Grass-types like Ogerpon-H and Rillaboom with a Choice Scarf. Braviary is a bulkier partner that uses its Fighting neutrality to switch into opposing Fighting-types like Great Tusk and Quaquaval. Braviary also offers entry hazard removal with Defog to assist in Ursaluna-B's longevity and a slow U-turn to get it in safely. Cyclizar can also provide hazard removal with Rapid Spin, getting rid of Toxic Spikes, which hinder Ursaluna-B's ability to clean late-game. Furthermore, Cyclizar can use Shed Tail on passive Pokemon like Quagsire to bring in Ursaluna-B safely, allowing it to use Calm Mind freely once. Snorlax's physical wallbreaking ability is also appreciated to chip down specially defensive Pokemon like Articuno. Thick Fat also gives it a pseudo-Ice resistance in order to check Pokemon like Frosmoth, which Ursaluna-B struggles against, and it also checks other threatening special attackers like Greninja and Flutter Mane. Choice Scarf Ditto is able to copy setup sweepers that attempt to force out Ursaluna-B like Swords Dance Ogerpon-W and Chien-Pao and can threaten a reverse sweep. Blissey is a defensive partner that checks most special attackers that threaten Ursaluna-B such as Choice Specs Greninja and Galarian Moltres. Blissey also provides hazard support in Stealth Rock, which gives Ursaluna-B an easier time wallbreaking and winning one-on-one against Ogerpon-H by guaranteeing the OHKO with Blood Moon, as well as cripple incoming switch-ins with Thunder Wave. Indeedee provides support to Ursaluna-B with Healing Wish to improve its longevity if it has been badly poisoned or chipped to low HP. Indeedee's Psychic STAB also threatens opposing Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, Zamazenta and Iron Hands. Arboliva can switch into Water-type moves from foes such as Ogerpon-W, Dondozo, and Barraskewda while setting Grassy Terrain to improve Ursaluna-B's longevity.

Wallbreaker (Ground).description:
Boasting a great Special Attack stat, substantial physical bulk, and access to recovery, Ursaluna-B is a premier wallbreaker on Ground teams, offering major support in the Dark, Ghost, and Dragon matchups. Blood Moon paired with Mind's Eye allows Ursaluna-B to OHKO Ghost-type threats like Brambleghast, Dragapult, and Spectrier while also doing considerable damage to walls such as Rotom-W, Gliscor, and Gastrodon. Earth Power nails Steel-types such as Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, and Empoleon, forming a nearly unresisted combination of coverage with Blood Moon. Vacuum Wave prevents Ursaluna-B from being revenge killed by faster Ice-type threats, OHKOing Alolan Sandslash and having a chance to OHKO Chien-Pao. Wise Glasses may be used instead of Heavy-Duty Boots to secure an OHKO on Chien-Pao as well as make it easier to clean up weakened Meowscarada, Greninja, and Darkrai. However, Ursaluna-B is often pivoted in due to its bulk, putting it at risk for chip damage if not running Heavy-Duty Boots. The given EV spread allows Ursaluna-B to outpace uninvested Hisuian Goodra, Clefable, and Empoleon while maximizing power and bulk.

Gliscor is an excellent teammate due to its resistance to Fighting, switching into Great Tusk, Infernape, and Sneasler for Ursaluna-B. Furthermore, Ursaluna-B recieves a plethora of utility support from Gliscor via Toxic, Spikes, and pivoting with U-turn, enhancing Ursaluna-B as a wallbreaker. In return, Ursaluna-B picks off Chien-Pao and swaps into Ghost-type moves from Hisuian Zoroark, Skeledirge, and Spectrier. Furthermore, Ursaluna-B can sponge Ice Spinner from Great Tusk and Iron Treads using Gliscor's Protect to scout them. Iron Treads is appreciated due to its entry hazard removing ability and Steel typing, warding off Ice- and Fairy-types, such as Alolan Ninetales, Flutter Mane, and Frosmoth, as well as switching into Toxic. In return, Ursaluna-B breaks past Ground-types like Gliscor, defensive Great Tusk, and Quagsire. Clodsire and Gastrodon offer an immunity to Water-type attacks from Barraskewda, Greninja, and Walking Wake while also setting up a mix of entry hazards to wear down teams for Ursaluna-B. Additionally, Clodsire is a very bulky specially defensive wall, capable of fighting off Grass- and Fairy-types such as Meowscarada, Iron Valiant, Sinistcha, and Alolan Ninetales, while Ursaluna-B threatens Sableye and Hatterene for Clodsire. Choice Scarf Great Tusk outpaces and removes threats like Baxcalibur, Mamoswine, and Ogerpon-W. Great Tusk, in return, appreciates the removal or weakening of Slowbro, Rotom-W, and Gliscor. Choice Scarf Landorus provides a Fighting-type resistance and an adequate Speed tier threatening Great Tusk and Zamazenta while also removing Dragon Dance Baxcalibur lacking Ice Shard. Mamoswine is heavily valued due to its ability Thick Fat, allowing it to combat Alolan Ninetales, Articuno, and non-Choice Band Chien-Pao as well as Grass-types like Meowscarada and Hisuian Lilligant using Ice Shard. In return, Ursaluna-B threatens Rotom-W and Skeledirge. Garchomp is a valued wallbreaker due to its ability to take out Kommo-o, Ogerpon-W, and Baxcalibur lacking Ice Shard while appreciating Ursaluna-B removing physically defensive walls. Quagsire provides chip damage buildup with Stealth Rock and Toxic as well as checks threats such as Chien-Pao, Zamazenta, and Azumarill. Sandy Shocks is a great asset in the Water and Flying matchups, threatening Urshifu-R, Corviknight, Basculegion-F, and Pelipper as well as stacking entry hazards for Ursaluna-B's wallbreaking.

Calm Mind (Ground).description:
68 Speed EVs lets it outspeed uninvested Magnezone and Hisuian Goodra.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Freddy (Assault Vest).description:
• With its great bulk, power, and coverage thanks to high-powered Normal-type STAB moves and amazing ability in Mind’s Eye, Ursaluna-B is a formidable special attacker.

  • Blood Moon: Blood Moon gives Ursaluna-B incredibly high neutral damage. It's a great way to cover a switch or predicted Terastallization, but it requires some forethought to maximize efficiency because it cannot be used on consecutive turns.

  • Vacuum Wave: Vacuum Wave is highly valuable for revenge killing foes, notably hitting Chien-Pao. It can hit Gholdengo due to Mind's Eye.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power gives great coverage against the Steel-types that resist Blood Moon, making Ursaluna-B nearly unwallable except by non-grounded Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Hyper Voice: Hyper Voice is a more spammable Normal-type STAB move that can bypass Substitute, allowing Ursaluna-B to thwart attempts to Substitute + Protect stall it by the likes of Gliscor, who can otherwise Protect on the turn it uses Blood Moon.

Other Options

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast can provide Ursaluna-B with coverage to hit foes that might otherwise wall it when making use of an offensive Tera type.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest remedies Ursaluna-B's middling Special Defense, allowing this slow but hard-hitting Pokemon to survive longer.

  • Silk Scarf: Silk Scarf can be used instead of Assault Vest to boost the power of Ursaluna-B’s Normal-type STAB attacks, making it more difficult to switch into.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna-B often uses Terastallization to compensate for its lackluster defensive typing; however, it is often capable of functioning without Tera. Because many different Tera types are viable on it, it can play guessing games with opponents.

  • Normal: Tera Normal removes all weaknesses associated with Ursaluna-B’s Ground typing and boosts Blood Moon to phenomenal levels of power, making it ideal on Trick Room teams.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy allows Ursaluna-B to handle the Urshifu formes better while generally being a very solid defensive Tera type.

  • Poison: Tera Poison improves Ursaluna-B’s matchup against all Ogerpon formes' Horn Leech and all Urshifu formes.

  • Water: Tera Water allows Ursaluna-B to fare better against the likes of Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Fire: Fire is a primarily offensive Tera type. When used with Tera Blast, it allows Ursaluna-B to hit non grounded Steel-types like Corviknight. However, the defensive benefits of the Fire typing are also notable, allowing Ursaluna-B to go head-to-head with Ogerpon-H in particular.

Smarter than the Average Bear (Calm Mind.description:
• With its immense defensive profile and access to reliable recovery, Ursaluna-B lends itself very well to a Calm Mind set.

  • Hyper Voice: Because of the increased power with Calm Mind boosts, it is worth considering Hyper Voice as Ursaluna-B's sole Normal-type STAB move, since Blood Moon's power is less needed and Hyper Voice can be used on consecutive turns. It also bypasses attempts to stall out Blood Moon with Substitute.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt can be used to shut down utility moves and attempts to stall out Ursaluna-B from the likes of Cresselia and slow Dragonite.

  • Yawn: While hard to fit, Yawn pairs well with Ursaluna-B’s prodigious bulk, allowing it to accrue more boosts or force out a foe that may otherwise beat it, such as Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

Items

  • Kee Berry: Kee Berry boosts Ursaluna-B's physical bulk, allowing it to keep pace with physical threats such as Dragonite.
  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus berry allows Ursaluna-B to recover a significant chunk of health, which can be useful to set up boosts against special attackers.
  • Leftovers: Leftovers improves Ursaluna-B's general longevity.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid can be used as an alternative EV spread to out-speed walls like Cresselia, Umbreon, and Wo-Chien. It synergizes well with Taunt.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite its immense bulk, Ursaluna-B’s typing leaves it vulnerable to many common attacks, so a good defensive Tera type is essential for survivability and durability.

  • Normal: Tera Normal boosts the power of Blood Moon, which improves the matchup against opposing Calm Mind Flutter Mane. It leaves only a Fighting weakness, making Ursaluna-B quite hard to KO.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a good defensive typing that synergizes well with Ursaluna-B's natural weaknesses, allowing it to stick around.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting boosts the power of Ursaluna-B's Vacuum Wave, allowing it to deal more damage while outprioritizing foes.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants an immunity to Toxic, allowing Kee Berry Ursaluna-B to better set up on the likes of Gliscor. It also grants a Fighting resistance, allowing it to better handle Urshifu.

  • Steel: Tera Steel grants a Toxic immunity and important resistances to Normal-, Grass-, and Fairy-type moves, allowing Ursaluna-B to better handle other Ursaluna-B and the likes of non-Hearthflame Ogerpon and Flutter Mane.

Choice Band (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band.description: Swift Swim in conjunction with powerful STAB Wave Crash backed by a high HP stat to offset recoil makes Basculegion-M a premier rain wallbreaker in the tier. Choice Band is the preferred item for more power so long as it has pivots to fall back on, such as Pelipper, Ferrothorn, and Zapdos. Tera Water is the premier Tera option to pump as much power into Wave Crash as possible, allowing it to 2HKO even Water-resistant foes such as Rotom-W and Ferrothorn. Tera Water also removes its weakness to Sucker Punch from the likes of Hisuian Samurott and Mega Mawile, and it maintains its resistance to Bullet Punch from Mega Scizor, although it removes its immunity to Fake Out from Mega Medicham. This also leaves Basculegion-M susceptible to Wave Crash's heavy recoil damage, so Liquidation is used to mitigate this, and it should be used once Basculegion-M’s checks have been worn down in order to ensure that it does not KO itself with recoil. Basculegion-M thus benefits from an offensive partner like Mega Swampert, which can finish off threats weakened by Basculegion-M. Pelipper is necessary to set up rain for Basculegion-M and also serves as a pivot to give it a free switch, something Basculegion-M has trouble doing, as it prefers to preserve its HP for recoil. Other pivots like Eject Button Ferrothorn and Tornadus-T are also helpful to support Basculegion-M by giving a point of entry to start breaking.

Choice Specs.description: These are sample set(s) as we wait for the metagame to settle before working on new analyses. They will be updated as the metagame continues to develop, so stay tuned!

Basculegion-F finds itself a useful niche on rain teams, that being one of few special rain exploiters in the tier. Its access to Swift Swim as well as strong STAB options in Surf and Shadow Ball allows it to be immensely threatening once it's brought in, and its ability to hit hard on the special side allows it to pick up 2HKOs on many common Water resistances in the tier such as Rotom-W or Toxapex. Swift Swim is a fantastic ability for Basculegion-F, as it allows the capability to run a Modest nature over Timid, boosting Basculegion-F's breaking capabilities even further. A Speed-boosting nature is unnecessary due to hitting a whopping 510 Speed in rain, outrunning almost every Pokemon in the tier except for Choice Scarf Kartana and Iron Valiant in Electric Terrain. Surf is a great option as a reliable STAB move, because its above-average Base Power and perfect accuracy allow it to be spammed with little to no drawback, while Hydro Pump is a great option for the raw power, 2HKOing Tera Grass Heatran with minimal chip damage and OHKOing Mega Charizard Y in sun. Both of these moves are perfectly complemented by Basculegion-F's secondary STAB option, Shadow Ball, which provides neutral coverage against a majority of the metagame. Very few Pokemon can resist Basculegion-F's STAB combination, which is even further bolstered by Ice Beam as a coverage option. Ice Beam allows Basculegion-F to deal serious damage to Pokemon like Tera Grass Heatran and Dragonite. Basculegion-F is also a phenomenal Terastallization user, as it's able to use Tera Water to both shed its weakness to Kingambit's Sucker Punch and boost Surf to terrifying levels of power, making it capable of sweeping most teams with little to no chip damage. Basculegion-F pairs extremely well with Pelipper, since it's able to set rain and use U-turn to bring Basculegion-F in safely. It also appreciates support from the likes of Ferrothorn and Zapdos, as Ferrothorn can answer Iron Valiant's Moonblast and spread chip damage very effectively with Iron Barbs, and Zapdos can check Choice Scarf Kartana and Rillaboom defensively and threaten crippling paralyses. In turn, Basculegion-F supports them back by KOing Pokemon that'd normally be able to force them out or pivot around utilizing resistances and immunities. For example, it can bait Leaf Blade from Kartana to guarantee a safe switch into Zapdos or it can lure Grassy Glide from Rillaboom, allowing Ferrothorn to come in and start spreading chip damage.

Swift Swim (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance.description:
Sneasler is a deadly sweeper with its high Attack stat in conjunction with Swords Dance and Unburden. Dire Claw is generally preferred over Gunk Shot for its perfect accuracy and a high chance to cripple the target with status. However, Gunk Shot has considerably more power, allowing Sneasler to OHKO most Zapdos at +2. Acrobatics is Sneasler's most spammable attack, especially if it has Terastallized, as it hits many neutral targets such as Tornadus, Dragapult, and Toxapex for high damage. Sneasler should be brought out when the Terrain matching its item is active, consuming its item and boosting Acrobatics. An Electric Seed or Psychic Seed is recommended to instantly activate Unburden, and the boost to Sneasler's otherwise poor defenses may also facilitate setup. Tera Flying turns Sneasler's Ground weakness into an immunity, which often buys it a turn to set up. Tera Flying also grants STAB on Acrobatics, allowing Sneasler to OHKO Dragapult and physically defensive Great Tusk with Acrobatics after a Swords Dance.

Sneasler serves as an excellent late-game cleaner on hyper offense teams. Entry hazard setters such as Mega Diancie or Landorus-T are useful teammates to help wear down Snealser's checks, such as Toxapex and opposing Landorus-T, into KO range for its attacks. Given Sneasler's item, a Terrain-setting partner such as Tapu Koko or Tapu Lele is mandatory. Tapu Koko provides entry opporunities with Volt Switch and U-turn while also setting Reflect and Light Screen, which facilitates setup. Tapu Lele pressures Toxapex, and its Psychic Terrain blocks priority attacks such as Bullet Punch from Mega Scizor, Fake Out from Mega Lopunny, and Sucker Punch from Kingambit, all of which can otherwise pick off a weakened Sneasler. However, one should be aware that Psychic Terrain will no longer block priority moves against a Tera Flying Snealser that has Terastallized. Other offensive partners that synergize well with Sneasler include Kingambit, Dragonite, and Volcarona, all of which can either assist in breaking through Sneasler's checks, such as Landorus-T, Gliscor, or Toxapex, or finish off a team weakened by Sneasler.

Pivot.description: Sneasler can use its combination of high Attack and Speed to function as a potent pivot, racking up chip damage against defensive Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Zapdos, Great Tusk, and other tanks. Its ability, Poison Touch, alongside Dire Claw allows it to spread status and cripple its checks, mainly to enable Hex Dragapult and hit would-be checks like Toxapex, Gastrodon, and Clefable for massive damage. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Sneasler to ignore Stealth Rock and Spikes to continue switching in and retain its offensive presence throughout the game. However, Sneasler is also hindered by contact punishment from the likes of Ferrothorn, defensive Landorus-T and Garchomp, and Zapdos, so Protective Pads helps provide more longevity. U-turn allows Sneasler to function as a pivot, bringing in other offensive threats such as Dragapult along with other special attackers like Tapu Lele to take advantage of physical tanks that can wall Sneasler such as Toxapex, Gliscor, and Landorus-T. U-turn also allows it to easily spread poison with Poison Touch. Fake Out allows Sneasler to safely chip and poison faster threats like offensive Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf users such as Urshifu-R or Landorus-T, along with powerful priority users like Extreme Killer Dragonite. As such, Sneasler benefits from having a sturdy defensive backbone with Pokemon like Toxapex or Ferrothorn to tank hits that Sneasler dislikes. Sneasler also forces a lot of switches, so it benefits from allies that can set hazards like Ferrothorn, Skarmory, or Heatran, which also switch in on Flying- and Psychic-type moves for Sneasler. Sneasler also has a tendency to be completely walled by the likes of Toxapex, Gliscor, and Landorus-T and benefits greatly from having allies that it can pivot to in order to exploit these checks for damage, like Tapu Lele or Zapdos.

Choice Scarf (Poison).description:
Choice Scarf Sneasler is one of the best cleaners for Poison teams thanks to its powerful STAB moves, like Dire Claw and Close Combat, along with U-turn, which allows Poison teams to preserve momentum while threatening poison with Poison Touch. Choice Scarf allows Sneasler to outspeed Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Regieleki, and opposing Choice Scarf threats like Hisuian Samurott, Enamorus, Iron Treads, Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon and Cinderace. Dire Claw paired with Sneasler's ability Poison Touch gives it a 41.67% chance to inflict poison upon foes, which helps to gradually wear down walls like Ting-Lu and Quagsire, along with a 23.33% chance to inflict paralysis or sleep, disrupting the threat that opposing sweepers pose to the team. While Steel-types are immune to Sneasler's Dire Claw, it can still threaten some of them such as Heatran and Iron Treads with Close Combat. Paired with Switcheroo, it is able to deny opposing walls like Toxapex and Corviknight recovery by passing them the Choice Scarf and forcing them to lock into one move. With the threat of Switcheroo, it also reduces the threat of Pokemon like Dragon Dance Dragonite.

Sneasler pairs well with Amoonguss, which threatens to use Spore against foes and threatens walls like Quagsire and Gastrodon with Giga Drain, along with offensive Pokemon like Great Tusk and Landorus-T. Although Amoonguss can act as a switch-in to Landorus-T, it gets completely countered by its Substitute + Bulk Up set. In addition to that, Amoonguss can use Foul Play to dissuade Ghost-type wallbreakers like Dragapult and Mimikyu from setting up with Dragon Dance and Swords Dance, respectively. Galarian Slowking also synergizes incredibly well with Sneasler, as they form a pivoting core with U-turn and Chilly Reception. Galarian Slowking appreciates Sneasler breaking through Steel-types and spreading status, and Galarian Slowking can support Sneasler by threatening opposing Poison-types with Future Sight, switching in on Gholdengo and threatening it with Flamethrower, and tanking one Earth Power from Landorus and OHKOing it with Ice Beam if Galarian Slowking is running Assault Vest. Toxapex can set up Toxic Spikes for Sneasler to clean easily while the opposing team takes residual damage. It also forms a Regenerator core with Amoonguss and Galarian Slowking and aids Alolan Muk against setup with Haze, thus synergizing well with the momentum provided by Sneasler's U-turn. Alolan Muk is also a great partner for Sneasler, as it provides an immunity to Psychic-type attacks and boasts great special bulk, which allows it to tank attacks from Choice Specs Dragapult and Spectrier and threaten them with Knock Off. Glimmora can set Stealth Rock to support Sneasler's cleaning capability and spin away entry hazards to prevent Sneasler from being worn down, as well as threatening slow Great Tusk with Energy Ball and being a Ground-immune Pokemon that Sneasler can pivot into with Air Balloon. Iron Moth and Salazzle greatly benefit from Choice Scarf Sneasler beating threats like Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, allowing them to take out foes like Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Klefki, which Sneasler can't break. Salazzle and Glimmora also form a Corrosion core, which helps in the Poison mirror matchup, which Sneasler struggles with. Clodsire is a great teammate to absorb attacks from Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Skeledirge.

Boots Pivots (Poison).description:
Sneasler fills a very unique role on Poison teams, as it's the best offensive pivot the type has access to thanks to an incredible base 130 Attack and 120 Speed stats. U-turn combined with Heavy-Duty Boots will allow it to stay safe throughout the entire game by switching out against an opposing threat to bring that can deal with it; in addition, U-turn comes with a 30% chance to poison thanks to Poison Touch ,which helps make progress when Toxic Spikes aren't down or against Flying-types. Close Combat is a strong nuke against many of the tier's common Dark- and Steel-types like Hydreigon, Kingambit, and Heatran along with other notable Fighting-weak threats such as Baxcalibur, Ursaluna and Hisuian Arcanine. Dire Claw's incredible chance to inflect status allows it to not only slash through prominent Fairy-types like Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Hatterene but also to make progress in matchups where its traits aren't as valuable like Ghost by inflicting crippling statuses on targets like Hisuian Zoroark and Skeledirge. Fake Out can chip threats down and rack up poison damage or fish for poison before using U-turn to leave, while Taunt takes advantage of Sneasler's incredible speed can stop the dangerous status effects from Salazzle and Amoonguss or recovery moves from Toxapex and Corviknight on Flying teams.

Thanks to U-turn, Sneasler can bring in teammates such as specially defensive Alolan Muk or physically defensive Amoonguss to handle would-be answers. In particular, Alolan Muk for with special Psychic- and Ghost-types like Galarian Slowking, Gholdengo, and Basculegion-F with its strong STAB Knock Off. Physically defensive Amoonguss can be bought in on many of the Ground- and Water-types that threaten Sneasler like Great Tusk, Quagsire, and Urshifu-R. Any other physical threat that can threaten Sneasler like Kleavor, Hisuian Arcanine, or Swords Dance Mimikyu can be dealt with by physically bulky Rocky Helmet Toxapex thanks to Infestation trapping and Haze to deal with boosts. Galarian Slowking's incredible special bulk can allow it to sponge hits for Sneasler from powerful special attackers such as Zapdos, Articuno, and Moltres and then safely pivot back into Sneasler with Chilly Reception; it can also use Future Sight combined with Sneasler's incredible Fighting STAB move to deal immense damage to any foe wishing to tank the hits for its team. Air Balloon Glimmora is a valuable ally that can fight off Ground-types like Choice Scarf Iron treads and Sandy Shocks, hit powerful Flying-Type threats like Moltres and Dragonite with Power Gem, remove hazards if Sneasler loses its Heavy-Duty Boots, and put threats that Sneasler detests such as Toxapex, Corviknight and Sableye on a timer with Corrosion Toxic. Salazzle can also spread Toxic against these threats and use Encore to punish setup from Hisuian Goodra and Kingambit. Choice Scarf Gengar helps majorly against Ghost-types that can outspeed Sneasler like Spectrier, Dragapult. and Flutter Mane while Choice Specs with Icy Wind can remove high profile threats like Garchomp and both formes of Landorus, with both Choice sets having powerful coverage in Thunderbolt to shock Flying-Types such as Moltres, Corviknight, and Pelipper.

Unburden Sweeper (Poison).description:
Night Slash with Close Combat lets Sneasler make quick work of Steel teams, while Acrobatics lets it greatly damage Great Tusk. Gunk Shot lets Sneasler OHKO Amoongus and Rotom-W at +2.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

GottaGoFast (Unburden Sweeper).description:
• With its good Speed tier and access to Unburden, Sneasler is one of the most potent cleaners in the metagame.

  • Dire Claw: Dire Claw is Sneasler’s preferred Poison STAB move due to its highly disruptive secondary effects, making it a very difficult move to switch into, even for Pokemon that wall it like Dondozo.

  • Fake Out: With a Normal Gem, Fake Out offers both good chip damage and the ability to safely activate Unburden.

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and somewhat risky to go for, Swords Dance allows Sneasler to increase its damage output and clean through teams more reliably.

  • Acrobatics - Acrobatics is a natural pairing with Unburden, providing a massively powerful Flying-type attack once Sneasler’s item is used.

  • Shadow Claw: Shadow Claw is an option to allow Sneasler to better handle otherwise problematic foes, such as Gholdengo.

  • Female Optimization: With the presence of Cute Charm Enamorus, it is recommended that physical attackers be female to avoid potential infatuation upon attacking Enamorus.

Items

  • Normal Gem: When combined with Fake Out, this is Sneasler’s safest way to activate Unburden.

  • White Herb: While less easily activated, not relying on a specific move to activate Unburden allows Sneasler to diversify its move selection more, becoming more of a threat.

EV Spreads

  • 92 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD/ 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread allows Sneasler to outspeed up to Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle well as Choice Scarfed Dragapult once Unburden is active without compromising on Power.

  • 76 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Adamant: This spread sacrifices some Speed to survive Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain, at the cost of no longer outspeeding Choice Scarf Dragapult with Unburden.

  • 60 HP / 228 Atk / 60 Def / 4 SpD / 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread survives Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain without compromising on Speed; however, it loses out on immediate power.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: Tera Flying gives Sneasler an immunity to Ground-type attacks, allowing it to set up on foes such as Landorus while also boosting the power of Acrobatics even further.

  • Ghost-type: Tera Ghost grants Sneasler an immunity to Extreme Speed, notably allowing it to more consistently beat Dragonite.

  • Ice-type: When used alongside Tera Blast, Tera Ice allows Sneasler to more reliably beat foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite.

Choice Scarf (Fighting).description: Choice Scarf Sneasler is an extremely fast revenge killer that decimates Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Quark Drive-boosted Iron Valiant, and Adamant Sand Rush Excadrill for Fighting teams. Close Combat and Dire Claw have near-perfect synergy, aside from Dire Claw's ability to punish passive answers—like Toxapex and Slowbro—that swap into its STAB moves. U-turn pivots Sneasler out of switch-ins such as Skeledirge, Aegislash, and Gliscor, bringing in Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Mega Gallade. Switcheroo further punishes walls like Corviknight if the extra speed is unneeded. Alternatively, Rock Slide lets it revenge kill Quiver Dance Volcarona, freeing up a moveslot on Iron Hands, while Toxic Spikes greatly pressure Fairy teams wary of Dire Claw. Night Slash can also be the final move for Sneasler, as it notably hits Gholdengo and Aegislash, but pivoting out of these threats is usually the better option. Choice Scarf Sneasler is a late-game cleaner, so wallbreakers and setup sweepers such as the aforementioned Kommo-o and Mega Gallade are appreciated, as these deal with Corviknight, Gliscor, and Toxapex. Kommo-o also benefits from Sneasler dealing with Fairy-types, as this allows Kommo-o to use Clangorous Soulblaze. Choice Specs Iron Valiant loves being pivoted in safely against physical walls like Skeledirge and Mega Sableye, which wall Sneasler. Assault Vest Iron Hands is a soft check against Gholdengo and Volcarona and can pivot Sneasler in against walls, which it can inconvenience. Hisuian Lilligant and Breloom deal with Gastrodon and Quagsire and also ease the Water and Ground matchups. As with the other setup sweepers, these also love the setup opportunities Sneasler opens up by being able to punish walls with Dire Claw's additional effects or with Switcheroo. Entry hazard support from Cobalion and Great Tusk is also appreciated, and these provide a secondary answer to Mimikyu and Zeraora, respectively. These teammates also appreciate Sneasler's ability to remove Toxic Spikes, greatly easing the matchup against Water and Poison teams.

Entry Hazard Support (Poison).description:
56 Spe EVs outspeeds Jolly Azumarill.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind Sweeper.description: Enamorus is a potent sweeper, capable of beating common defensive staples in Skarmory, Mega Sableye, and Clefable. Its expansive coverage in Earth Power and Mystical Fire allows it to hit every Steel-type in the tier, such as Celesteela, Skarmory, and Scizor, for super effective damage, securing either an OHKO or a 2HKO on them with a Calm Mind boost. It also allows Enamorus to work around other Fairy-resistant foes such as Skeledirge and Iron Moth as well as offensive checks in Hisuian Arcanine and Victini, while its Speed tier allows it to outspeed and OHKO Nihilego. Taunt is an option to potentially beat and deny recovery from status users like Clefable, Hippowdon, and Chansey that try to slow down or stall Enamorus. Similarly, Iron Moth enjoys many of its checks being removed, particularly Mega Tyranitar and Latias. However, Enamorus's frailty and lack of immediate power makes it difficult for it to break past checks such as Mega Venusaur and Celesteela, which threaten to OHKO it with Sludge Bomb and Heavy Slam, respectively, and aren't OHKOed after a Calm Mind boost. Similarly, Chansey can use Toxic and Seismic Toss to take advantage of Enamorus's lack of longevity. This means it appreciates partners such as Tyranitar and Bisharp, which are capable of Pursuit trapping special walls like Chansey, as well as Cinderace, which can break past Celesteela as well as provide pivoting to bring Enamorus in safely. Its Speed tier also means it is pressured by faster threats such as Iron Moth and Latios. This means it enjoys speed control from partners such as Cinderace and Choice Scarf Hydreigon, which are able to outspeed its offensive checks. To compensate for its relative frailty, it also enjoys slow pivots to bring it in safely, such as Slowbro, Slowking, and Scizor, and in return it provides an offensive check to the Dark-types they are threatened by, such as Mega Tyranitar, Bisharp, and Hydreigon.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs allows Enamorus to be more immediately fearsome against bulky teams, now threatening 2HKOs on most Fairy-resistant foes without the need for a turn of setup. In addition to Earth Power and Mystical Fire, Superpower allows it to threaten a 3HKO on Chansey. This also allows Enamorus to potentially snowball through weakened teams once faster foes like Cinderace have been removed. Alternatively, Psychic hits Poison-types that aren't weak to Earth Power, such as Mega Venusaur and Amoonguss. In addition to Pursuit trappers like Mega Tyranitar, speed control from the likes of Cinderace, and slow pivots like Slowbro, Choice Specs Enamorus functions as an excellent partner to special sweepers such as Iron Moth, Keldeo, and Blacephalon due to its ability to remove checks to it without competing for the same team slot. These options can also be used to remove Steel- and Poison-types to allow Enamorus to use its powerful Moonblast more freely. As Enamorus is weak to Stealth Rock, it appreciates being partnered with strong entry hazard removal options, such as Rapid Spin Excadrill, Defog Salamence, Defog Tapu Fini, and Court Change Cinderace, which allow it to more easily work around opposing entry hazard setters such as Hippowdon and suicide leads like Excadrill. Due to its Choice Specs, however, Enamorus becomes prediction-reliant against teams that stack multiple Fairy-resistant foes, so Stealth Rock and Knock Off support from Clefable, Tyranitar, and Scizor allows it to more effectively break down its checks over the course of a game.

Choice Scarf.description: With Choice Scarf, its high Special Attack, and the utility of Healing Wish, Enamorus is an effective form of speed control that can also sweep or facilitate another partner's sweep late-game. Earth Power targets Steel-types like Excadrill and Aegislash, Fire-types like Victini, Cinderace, and Iron Moth, and it's also Enamorus's strongest attack against Mega Venusaur. Mystical Fire hits specific Steel-types that don't mind Earth Power, namely Skarmory, Scizor, and Celesteela; its Special Attack-lowering effect also provides some utility against Autotomize variants of the latter. Alternatively, Grass Knot can 2HKO Ground-types like Hippowdon and Gastrodon. Finally, Focus Blast serves as a middle ground option against Steel-types like Excadrill and Skarmory while also OHKOing the Tyranitar formes, though its shaky accuracy combined with Enamorus's frailty makes it risky to use. Enamorus best fits on offense teams looking for a form of speed control that can revenge kill fast threats such as Cinderace. Due to its weakness to Stealth Rock, entry hazard removers such as Excadrill and Tapu Fini are essential teammates. Due to Enamorus's low bulk, pivots such as Cinderace can help it safely get onto the field. Enamorus also appreciates the defensive backbone provided by bulky partners such as Amoonguss, Tangrowth, and Skamory; Pokemon that resist Steel like the latter are important as checks to Scizor and Sand Rush Excadrill. Enamorus lacks the power to OHKO certain foes like Victini and Thundurus-T from full health, while they can often cripple or OHKO it back, making hazard setters like Excadrill and Mew good partners as they can chip these foes into KO range. Enamorus struggles to get past certain Poison-types like Mega Venusaur, making checks to them like Choice Specs Latios useful. Enamorus also has no way of getting past Blissey and Chansey, making physical wallbreakers such as Buzzwole necessary teammates. Healing Wish is best used to either give a sweeper like Dragon Dance Tyranitar or Celesteela a second opportunity to sweep, or a bulky wallbreaker like Iron Hands or Scizor the health needed to continue breaking holes into the opposing team.

Choice Scarf (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Enamorus is a potent wallbreaker, utilizing its strong Moonblast alongside colorful coverage to punch severe holes into defensive cores. Earth Power and Mystical Fire complement its STAB Moonblast well, with the former hitting Toxapex, Clodsire, Gholdengo, and Heatran, while the latter OHKOes Ferrothorn and Mega Scizor. Focus Blast grants Enamorus its strongest attack to hit Garganacl and Mega Tyranitar, which could otherwise survive Earth Power and Moonblast, respectively, while Psychic provides a safer middle ground option for Toxapex Clodsire, and Mega Venusaur, which staves off its attacks otherwise. Tera Fairy grants Enamorus a power boost to Moonblast, notably allowing it to secure OHKOs against the likes of Landorus-T and Rotom-W, which would barely survive it otherwise. Enamorus fits best on bulky offense teams that appreciate its wallbreaking power while being able to support it adequately. Pivots such as Mega Lopunny, Landorus-T, and Tornadus-T grant Enamorus free switch in opportunities against Great Tusk, opposing Landorus-T, and Rotom-W. The latter two pivots and Great Tusk, also provide entry hazard removal, which aids Enamorus given its Stealth Rock weakness. Enamorus works well with fast cleaners such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Choice Scarf Kartana, as they appreciate Enamorus punching holes into the likes of Gholdengo and Mega Scizor for the latter two to clean up weakened defensive cores.

Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Enamorus serve as a solid wallbreaker, using forced switches from the likes of Great Tusk and Garchomp to set up. It is incredibly difficult to switch into after a boost given its strong Moonblast alongside coverage options in Earth Power and Mystical Fire to hit Fairy-resistant foes such as Heatran, Toxapex, and Ferrothorn, respectively. Alternatively, Enamorus can forgo Mystical Fire for Substitute to take advantage of pivoting attempts as well as sponge attacks from revenge killers such as Mega Lopunny and Iron Valiant, although it makes it less effective at hitting Ferrothorn and Mega Scizor. If using Substitute, Enamorus can opt for Leftovers instead of the standard Heavy-Duty Boots to potentially set up more Substitutes. Tera Ground boosts the power of Earth Power, allowing it to KO most Toxapex and Gholdengo sets after a boost, as well as giving it an immunity to Tapu Koko and Rotom-W's Electric-type attacks. Enamorus fits best on bulky offense and offense teams that appreciate its use as an early- to mid-game wallbreaker while granting it sufficient opportunities to enter the field. Therefore, pivots such as Mega Lopunny and Landorus-T pair well with it, bringing Enamorus in on physical walls it can exploit such as Great Tusk, Buzzwole, and Skarmory. Additionally, Pursuit trappers such as Mega Tyranitar and Weavile eliminate special walls such as Clodsire and Gholdengo that can serve as a roadblock to Enamorus. Fast late-game cleaners such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Choice Scarf Kartana appreciate Enamorus, as they capitalize on it weakening or removing Steel-types for them to clean up.

Choice Scarf.description: Choice Scarf Enamorus functions as an interesting revenge killer, being able to KO a range of setup sweepers such as Dragonite, Mega Gyarados, Baxcalibur, and even a weakened Volcarona courtesy of its great speed tier. Additionally, it can serve as a late-game cleaner once its checks such as Toxapex, Gholdengo, and Assault Vest Tornadus-T have been weakened by its teammates. However, its Stealth Rock weakness and relative frailty mean Enamorus struggles to withstand repeated switches as well as priority moves from the likes of Urshifu-R and Mega Lopunny. Tera Fairy boosts the power of Moonblast, notably allowing it to 2HKO Assault Vest Tornadus-T after Stealth Rock. Aside from coverage to hit Steel-types in Mystical Fire and Earth Power, Healing Wish can bring back a weakened teammate in a pinch, potentially being able to change the tide of a game. Therefore, Enamorus fits best on offense teams that appreciate its utility in Healing Wish while providing a positive matchup against opposing offensive teams. Powerful wallbreakers such as Baxcalibur and Volcarona appreciate Enamorus's Healing Wish, giving them a second lease on life, while Enamorus in turn capitalizes on them weakening the likes of Toxapex and Mega Scizor to clean late-game. Enamorus also greatly enjoys entry hazard removal support from Rotom-W, Tornadus-T, or Great Tusk, as it minimalizes its Stealth Rock weakness so it can switch in more effectively mid-game. Enamorus struggles with special wall such as Clodsire and Gholdengo, so Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Great Tusk make for good partners that can take advantage of them.

Choice Scarf (Flying).description:
Enamorus is an excellent revenge killer on Flying teams due to its vast coverage, cleric support via Healing Wish, and amazing Speed, allowing it to outpace Hisuian Lilligant after a Victory Dance as well as Choice Specs Greninja, and Chien-Pao, easing the Dark matchup. Moonblast checks foes with Ice-type coverage moves like Pawmot, Chien-Pao, and Greninja, as well as 2HKOing Assault Vest Iron Hands. Superpower hits Steel-types like Kingambit, Hisuian Goodra, and Air Balloon Heatran, allowing Enamorus to snowball Steel teams with Contrary once Gholdengo has been removed. Alternatively, Mystical Fire hits Air Balloon Gholdengo and Corviknight. Earth Power hits Heatran, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, further improving the Steel and Poison matchups. Healing Wish gives new life to setup sweepers like Dragonite, Landorus-T, and Galarian Moltres. Iron Head is another option to hit Flutter Mane and opposing Enamorus; however, Enamorus's other coverage options hit more foes and are generally more valuable.

Corviknight checks a plethora of foes, including Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Greninja, as well as providing Defog support to preserve Enamorus's longevity so it can fight off Sucker Punch Kingambit; however, Landorus-T and Landorus offer an Electric-type immunity, checking threats like Regieleki, Sandy Shocks, and Magnezone. Furthermore, Bulk Up Landorus-T is a massive asset in the Poison and Steel matchups, notably setting up on Amoonguss and forcing Heatran out. Dragonite is fearsome in the Water and Flying mirror matchups and heavily appreciates Healing Wish support in return. Moltres is a great check to Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Gholdengo due to its excellent bulk and ability to burn the former two. Articuno's exemplary bulk and neutrality to Ice-type moves is heavily appreciated, allowing it to check Greninja and Basculegion-F with Freeze-Dry to further improve the Water matchup Zapdos spreads paralysis via Static and Discharge as well as aiding in the Water matchup. In return, Enamorus removes Choice Specs Greninja to let Zapdos effectively wall most Water teams. Galarian Moltres is great in the Ghost matchup, taking on Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Spectrier.

Mixed Attacker (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Mixed Attacker (Fairy).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Contrary Attacker (Fairy).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Double Dance.description:
Enamorus-T's good natural defenses and access to boosting moves in Calm Mind and Iron Defense allow it to serve as a viable wincon that is difficult to remove once it starts setting up. What Draining Kiss may lack in power, it makes up for with its ability to keep Enamorus-T healthy, which is critical, since this set is focused on longevity over raw damage. Earth Power pairs exceedingly well with it, giving Enamorus-T impressive coverage that is resisted by only a few Pokemon while hitting threats like Gholdengo and Heatran super effectively. Leftovers help keep Enamorus-T healthy while it racks up boosts, but Heavy-Duty Boots keeps it safe from Stealth Rock, which poses to cut away a significant amount of HP once Enamorus-T switches in. Grassy Seed can also be run if Enamorus-T is paired with Rillaboom, as the instant Defense boost can aid it greatly in setting up. Terastallization aids Enamorus-T's ability to set up by mixing up its defensive profile;Tera Steel allows it to deal with Poison- and Steel-types, giving it a chance to take Dire Claw from Sneasler and Iron Head from Kingambit, respectively. It also removes its weakness to Electric, giving it a better matchup against Zapdos. In addition, with Overcoat, Tera Steel makes Enamorus-T a very capable Amoonguss switch-in, letting it use it as setup fodder for a potential sweep. Tera Water maintains the resistance to Steel while also giving it a resistance to Ice, and can turn Enamorus-T into a useful Walking Wake check in a pinch. The EV spread is designed to keep Enamorus-T as bulky as possible while still allowing it to outspeed uninvested Kingambit, Azumarill, and Ursaluna.

Enamorus-T fits best on bulky offensive teams that allow it to sweep late-game once its checks have been whittled down or removed. Therefore, offensive wallbreakers like Sneasler and Iron Valiant serve as good teammates for it. The latter in particular is good at wearing down Moltres and Corviknight, two common Pokemon that resist both of Enamorus-T's attacks. Offensive hazard setters like Hisuian Samurott also help by wearing down the opponent's team. If Enamorus-T is not using Heavy-Duty Boots, then hazard removal is a necessity, so Pokemon like Great Tusk and Cinderace are further appreciated.

Calm Mind (Fairy).description:
The last moveslot can utilize Grass Knot to beat Unaware Quagsire or Substitute to avoid status, but being able to make progress against Steel-types like Heatran is generally preferred.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band.description:
• Flower Trick is for non-Choice Band Dondozo, Gastrodon, and non-Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.
  • Knock Off is for Espathra, Sableye, and Magnezone.
  • Giga Impact is for non-Chilan Berry Volcarona and offensive Sylveon.
  • Play Rough beats non-Counter Annihilape and Special Attack Booster Energy Walking Wake, while Thunder Punch beats Corviknight.
  • Trick and Shadow Claw can be used for matchups against Bellibolt and Counter Annihilape but are generally not too reliable, as Bellibolt can 2HKO Meowscarada with Thunder after Trick, while Annihilape can use Rage Fist to beat Shadow Claw Meowscarada instead of Counter.
  • Protean can force opponents to guess what move Meowscarada will use. For example, non-Choice Band Iron Hands has to choose between Close Combat and Wild Charge to beat either Flower Trick or Play Rough from Meowscarada. Choosing incorrectly, however, allows Meowscarada to 2HKO Iron Hands.
  • An Adamant nature allows Meowscarada to have a better chance to beat more defensive Sylveon sets and Iron Defense Corviknight. A Timid nature allows Meowscarada to outspeed Iron Moth, Hisuian Zoroark, and non-Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Flower Trick OHKOes non-defensive Azumarill and Sandy Shocks and beats Rotom-W.
  • Knock Off OHKOes Dragapult and defeats Espathra, Iron Leaves, and non-Metal Burst Sableye.
  • Play Rough hits Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • Low Kick OHKOes Chien-Pao, Tyranitar, and non-Chople Berry Kingambit.
  • Giga Impact OHKOes non-defensive Volcarona and Iron Moth.
  • Trick can potentially catch bulky Pokemon like Endeavor Donphan and Corviknight off guard by locking them into a useless move.
  • Choice Scarf Meowscarada should be used against fast and frail Pokemon it can OHKO with a super effective move, like Dragapult, Espathra, and Hisuian Zoroark, or Pokemon it can 2HKO and survive a hit from with Protean's type change, like Iron Valiant and Walking Wake.

Choice Specs.description:
• Frenzy Plant OHKOes Dondozo, Rotom-W, non-Sap Sipper Azumarill, and some Ting-Lu variants.
  • Dark Pulse beats most Espathra variants, beats non-Metal Burst Sableye, and has a high chance to OHKO Farigiraf.
  • Chilling Water 2HKOes Donphan and usually 2HKOes specially defensive Skeledirge. It also allows Meowscarada to transform into a Water-type and survive Torch Song and Blast Burn from Skeledirge.
  • Power Gem beats Volcarona, Torkoal, and non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Jugulis.
  • Pollen Puff OHKOes Iron Leaves, Wo-Chien, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • While using Dark Pulse beats most Prankster Sableye, using it against Metal Burst Sableye leads to Meowscarada losing, so it should use Frenzy Plant instead.

SubSeed.description:
• Alternating between Substitute and Protect after setting up Leech Seed allows Meowscarada to slowly gain HP if it is not OHKOed by the foe. It is a potent Speed trap, meaning most weaker, slower foes lose to it.
  • With Protean, Meowscarada can gain a more useful defensive typing, such as Normal, Water, or Fairy, for the entire battle.
  • Chilling Water allows Meowscarada to defeat Arcanine and Skeledirge.
  • Charm nets wins against non-Choice Band Iron Hands and Garchomp.
  • Mental Herb gives Meowscarada better matchups against Taunt users like Annihilape, Corviknight, and Kingambit, as well as Encore users like Gardevoir.
  • Alternatively, Chople Berry + Leaf Storm defeats most Great Tusk variants. After Protect, Chople Berry also comes in handy versus other Pokemon with Fighting-type coverage like Arcanine.
  • The Defense and HP investment allows Meowscarada to defeat Choice Band Donphan. With low HP investment, Meowscarada also gains relatively more from Leech Seed. Maximum Speed allows Meowscarada to set up Leech Seed against as many Pokemon as possible.
  • When using four status moves, use a Jolly nature to maximize Struggle damage. With Chilling Water or Leaf Storm, use a Timid nature instead.
  • Using Protect before using Leech Seed against the likes of Donphan and Talonflame allows Meowscarada to survive Gunk Shot, Brave Bird, and Flare Blitz.
  • Use Leech Seed turn 1 to stay a Grass-type against foes like Azumarill, Bellibolt, and Dondozo.
  • Use Taunt turn 1 to maintain positive matchups against Espathra and Prankster Sableye.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description:
Meowscarada is a fantastic revenge killer for any Dark team due to its great Speed, coverage moves, and ability in Protean. Flower Trick makes Meowscarada a great late-game cleaner against Ground and Water teams, or just in general, taking out threats such as Great Tusk, Greninja, and Flutter Mane. Knock Off can target Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon, such as Gholdengo and Espathra, while removing items from walls such as Toxapex's Black Sludge, Klefki's Light Clay, and Skeledirge's Heavy-Duty Boots. Play Rough allows Meowscarada to clean through weakened Dragon teams, and it's a useful move late-game against other Dark teams. Alternatively, Meowscarada can run Toxic Spikes to cripple foes such as Great Tusk. U-turn picks up momentum for its team on forced switches, for example against Greninja. Choice Scarf plus its Speed and Protean allows it to take on threats such as Greninja, Choice Scarf Great Tusk, and Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

Greninja and Meowscarada can break through each other's checks: Greninja can beat Toxapex and Corviknight for Meowscarada, while Choice Scarf Meowscarada can revenge kill Flutter Mane for Greninja. Chien-Pao can prevent walls such as Toxapex from healing with Taunt, allowing Meowscarada to better pressure Water teams; it can also pressure Flying- and Dragon-types for Meowscarada, beating threats such as Dragonite. Chien-Pao can also break past walls such as Clodsire and Amoonguss for Meowscarada. Kingambit is an incredible late-game sweeper, picking off faster threats like Choice Scarf Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch, and it beats down Fairy-types such as Hatterene for Meowscarada. In return, Meowscarada can pick off Iron Valiant, allowing Kingambit to better pressure Fairy teams. Ting-Lu sets Stealth Rock and Spikes, allowing Meowscarada to clean more easily late-game. Additionally, it can check slower Pokemon such as Toxapex, Corviknight, and Clodsire with Taunt alongside Earthquake or Ruination. It can also stomach strong special attacks such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, OHKOing Flutter Mane in return with Heavy Slam. Sableye can switch into Fighting-type attacks for Meowscarada, such as Great Tusk's Close Combat, and either cripple their users with Prankster Will-O-Wisp or force them to switch with Prankster Encore. Sableye can also prevent Pokemon like Clodsire and Brambleghast from setting entry hazards thanks to Prankster Taunt. Skuntank can ease the Fairy matchup by beating Hatterene one-on-one, which lets Meowscarada set Toxic Spikes safely. It can also trap Klefki with Fire Spin, preventing dual screens from staying on the field for too long. Finally, Hydreigon can take on walls such as Toxapex for Meowscarada with Substitute + Nasty Plot, safely setting up and overpowering them.

Choice Scarf (Grass).description:
Meowscarada finds itself as the best revenge killer to threatening setup sweepers such as Dragonite, Hydreigon, and Armarouge available to Grass teams thanks to its good offensive stats paired with a strong ability in Protean. This is further supported by a great Speed tier, which allows it to serve as a strong cleaner in multiple matchups such as versus Water, Fighting, Dark and Ghost teams with a Choice Scarf. Flower Trick enables Meowscarada to break through Defense boosted Pokemon such as Curse Dondozo, as well as Pokemon behind dual screens such as Flutter Mane. Play Rough provides the Fairy coverage that enables Meowscarada to threaten Fighting, Dragon, and Dark teams. U-turn is used to allow Meowscarada to pivot out against checks to it, such as Toxapex and Skeledirge, to bring in a teammate that can break through it, such as Breloom and Toedscruel, while also maintaining momentum.

While Meowscarada is an effective cleaner, it cannot exactly break through certain Pokemon by itself. Choice Band Breloom is a great teammate for Meowscarada, as it can break through Meowscarada's checks such as Toxapex, Kingambit, and Clodsire. Meowscarada is also vulnerable to Pokemon with strong priority and revenge killers faster than it such as Breloom and Choice Scarf Flutter Mane. Defensive walls such as Amoonguss and Wo-Chien can switch into said priority attacks and revenge killing attempts for Meowscarada. Amoonguss in particular also removes Toxic Spikes, which can be useful for Meowscarada and its teammates. Brambleghast and Toedscruel provide entry hazard removal in Rapid Spin, while also setting up hazards of their own in Spikes. Abomasnow gives an important Ice neutrality to Grass teams, which in tandem with the Defense boost provided by Snow allows it to serve as an answer to Ice-type threats such as Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur. Swords Dance Iron Leaves and Rotom-C provide counterplay to Corviknight that Grass teams otherwise lack, with the former appreciating Meowscarada pivoting out to it when facing Poison-types such as Dragalge and Toxapex, threatening Poison teams in general with its Psychic-type STAB moves and Fighting-type coverage attacks, while the latter forms a pivoting core with Meowscarada.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

CRITTY CAT.description:
• With its good Attack, Speed, and access to Flower Trick and Knock Off, Meowscarada is a potent cleaner that is also hard to switch into.

  • Flower Trick: With its guaranteed critical hit, Flower Trick is a dangerous cleaning move once resistances to it have been sufficiently chipped.

  • Trick And Neutral Natures: Trick can help Choice-locked sets incapacitate an annoying wall, such as Dondozo or Wo-Chien, by locking them into a single move. Make sure to use a neutral nature and use a Jolly Mint on Meowscarada, so it won't get confused by eating any Berry after Trick.

  • U-turn: If using Protean, Meowscarada is a pivot that does far more damage than most users of U-turn,

  • Low Kick versus Brick Break: Low Kick OHKOs Chien-Pao, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit if using Protean, but Brick Break deals far more damage against Chi-Yu.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: Jolly is usually preffered for outspeeding fast threats like Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant, but Adamant 's extra power can be justified on Choice Scarf since it still outspeeds Choice Scarf Garchomp.

Abilities

  • Protean: Protean’s type-shifting allows Meowscarada to make the most of its colorful movepool, particularly on Choice-locked sets, where the limitation to only changing types once is effectively nullified.

  • Overgrow: If you intend to make use of a Tera type other than Grass or switch moves often, Overgrow is worth considering, as it allows Meowscarada more flexibility with its moves by not changing type and removing STAB from Flower Trick or Knock Off.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With the Speed offered via Choice Scarf, Meowscarada can threaten otherwise faster foes, such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, potentially putting more pressure on offensive teams.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band boosted Meowscarada hits incredibly hard, and with its naturally high Speed it can serve as a cleaner and a potential wallbreaker.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization overriding Protean means Meowscarada should usually only Terastallize to clean a weakened team late-game.

  • Grass: While Terastallizing does override Protean, Tera Grass Meowscarada can be used to power through teams ill-prepared for it. Dual screens teams in particular are especially vulnerable to the sheer power of Choice Band-boosted Tera Grass Flower Trick.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosted Knock Off isn't as reliable at sweeping as Flower Trick, but it can surprise bulky Steel-types such as Scizor and Corviknight.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Meowscarada a Will-O-Wisp immunity and an Ice resistance that can surprise Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 244 Atk / 108 Def / 4 SpD / 76 Speed with Jolly: This spread allows Meowscarada to outspeed timid Chi-Yu while avoiding an OHKO from Breloom's Mach Punch, Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

Focus Sash.description:
• With its good Speed and wide movepool, Meowscarada makes for a potent lead.

  • Sucker Punch: Sucker Punch allows Meowscarada to better handle foes such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

  • Toxic Spikes: Meowscarada is an excellent offensive choice to lay Toxic Spikes, since it puts immense pressure on Ting-Lu leads.

  • Taunt: Thanks to its good Speed, Meowscarada makes particularly excellent use of Taunt, shutting down other entry hazard leads such as Garchomp, Ting-Lu, and Hippowdon.

  • Play Rough: This provides good coverage for Fighting- and Dragon-types that might otherwise pose issues, such as Roaring Moon.

  • Low Kick versus Brick Break: Low Kick is worth considering if your team struggles with Kingambit, but Brick Break will deal far more damage to Chi-Yu.

  • Overgrow: Since this Meowscarada set aims to be more of a supportive Pokemon, Overgrow is preferred to keep STAB on its attacks after it uses its support moves.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Meowscarada has very little use for Terastallization, only using it in late-game situations where it can sweep.

  • Grass: When paired with an Overgrow boost, Tera Grass lets Flower Trick deal a huge amount of damage.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy eases Meowscarada's matchup against Choice Band Dragapult, who can threaten to KO through Focus Sash via Dragon Darts.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description: Thanks to its fantastic movepool and Protean, Choice Scarf Meowscarada is the best revenge killer available for Dark teams, outrunning the likes of Regieleki, Speed-boosted Kommo-o, and Mega Swampert under rain. Flower Trick is Meowscarada's most powerful move, picking off weakened foes such as Tapu Lele and Terrakion. Play Rough is essential, as it deals with many threats to Dark teams like Galarian Zapdos, Mega Gallade, and Iron Valiant. U-turn allows Meowscarada to switch out of unfavorable situations, pivoting into powerful teammates such as Galarian Moltres and Mega Tyranitar while keeping momentum for the team. Knock Off cripples defensive switch-ins—such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Clefable—as well as offensive Pokemon like Zeraora and Iron Treads. Toxic Spikes can be run instead to better pressure Normal, Fairy, and Fighting teams. Meowscarada's teammates appreciate its ability to check a myriad of threats as well as its revenge killing capabilities. Wallbreakers like Galarian Moltres and Hydreigon are great partners to deal with physical walls like Celesteela and Mega Venusaur. Ting-Lu and Tyranitar provide entry hazard support for Meowscarada—ensuring it is able to net more KO's—and are great defensive pivots for it to fall back upon. Similarly, Mega Sableye provides a Fighting immunity, bounces back status moves, and prevents entry hazards from going up, letting Meowscarada switch in unscathed.

Choice Scarf (Grass).description: Meowscarada is an excellent choice for Grass teams thanks to its high Speed and Protean, enabling it to be a threatening revenge killer that can outspeed common threats such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Gholdengo. Flower Trick is Meowscarada's best STAB option and is capable of dealing with weakened Pokemon like Clodsire and Spectrier. Flower Trick's guaranteed critical hit is also very useful in the Fairy matchup and lets Meowscarada revenge kill Azumarill and a weakened Tapu Lele behind Reflect. U-turn allows Meowscarada to maintain an advantage against its defensive checks like Corviknight by being able to pivot into its teammates like Scovillain. Knock Off is a tool to cripple Meowscarada's defensive switch-ins like Toxapex and Klefki in addition to the aforementioned Corviknight. Play Rough is a strong coverage option to threaten opposing Dragon-type Pokemon like Kommo-o, Kyurem, and Latios, which Grass teams tend to struggle against. Low Kick is a less frequent option but lets Meowscarada OHKO Bisharp while threatening Heatran with a 2HKO; however, Play Rough is preferred to have an easier time against Dragon teams. Meowscarada has an easier time revenge killing foes with entry hazard support from Ferrothorn and Cradily. Ferrothorn appreciates Meowscarada's ability to check Fighting-types like Mega Gallade, Iron Valiant and Galarian Zapdos with STAB Play Rough. Hisuian Lilligant is also a fantastic offensive partner for Meowscarada. It is able to check the Flying-types that switch into Meowscarada like Celesteela and Landorus-T while also assisting in the Dragon matchup, outspeeding common Pokemon like Garchomp and Dragonite. Hisuian Lilligant also makes the Steel matchup easier for Grass; its ability to threaten Heatran is appreciated by Meowscarada, while Meowscarada can threaten Gholdengo with Knock Off, which Lilligant cannot beat. Mega Venusaur is also a mandatory defensive partner for Meowscarada; its Bug neutrality and bulk allows it to act as a consistent check to Mega Scizor, which easily switches into any move of Meowscarada, and Venusaur is able to check it with Hidden Power Fire. Mega Venusaur also checks opposing Fairy-types for Meowscarada like Tapu Koko, Mega Diancie, and Iron Valiant, while Meowscarada is able to threaten the Psychic-types that force out Mega Venusaur such as Latios, Mega Alakazam, and Victini. Whismicott is one of the best hazard removal options on Grass, and Meowscarada appreciates not having Stealth Rock and Spikes chip it down, because it comes in often to threaten a KO. Whimsicott's Fairy typing also allows Meowscarada and its teammates not to be overwhelmed by Dragon-types like Garchomp, and it can encore Calm Mind Mega Latias. Celebi with Nasty Plot and Groundium Z can break defensive Steel-types like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra while also being able to threaten opposing Poison-types like Alolan Muk and Toxapex.

Offensive Pivot.description: Meowscarada is a good offensive pivot that utilizes its high Speed and great coverage to bring its teammates in. Knock Off is excellent for making progress against foes like Heatran, Toxapex, and Landorus-T; it can also cripple switch-ins such as Ferrothorn, Tornadus-T, and Zapdos. U-turn gives coverage against other Grass-types like Rillaboom, Serperior, and opposing Meowscarada, as well as pivoting out Meowscarda from its checks and gaining momentum. Toxic Spikes can be hard to deal with when paired with spinblockers like Ceruledge, Pokemon that pressure Toxic Spikes absorbers like Tapu Lele, and setup sweepers that appreciate Dark-types being put on a timer, such as Mega Latias. Alternatively, Spikes can be used to chip down foes like Ferrothorn and Toxapex. Tera Dark bolsters the power of Knock Off, letting Meowscarada 2HKO Mega Latias and Tornadus-T. Tera Grass allows Meowscarada's Flower Trick to 2HKO defensive Great Tusk and defensive Landorus-T after Stealth Rock chip damage. Entry hazard setters like Heatran, Landorus-T, and Gliscor make for good allies with Meowscarada, as it can remove Heavy-Duty boots from foes such as Toxapex, Zapdos, and Tornadus-T, making the hazards more potent. Meowscarada also pairs well with powerful wallbreakers like Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Ursaluna, as these Pokemon can threaten foes that would otherwise check Meowscarada like Tornadus-T, Heatran, and Ferrothorn, respectively, while Meowscarada can safely bring them in with U-turn.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Meowscarada is a great wallbreaker that can use its high Speed and Protean-boosted attacks effectively to make progress against the opposing team. Knock Off is a strong Dark-type STAB move that provides beneficial item removal, greatly hampering checks such as Toxapex, Zapdos, and Tornadus-T. U-turn hits Grass-types like opposing Meowscarada and Rillaboom while being a strong pivot move when further bolstered by Protean. Thunder Punch hits foes like Tornadus-T, Corviknight, and Skarmory, while Low Kick can be used instead to break through Ferrothorn, Kyurem, and Heatran. Tera Dark boosts Meowscarada's Knock Off, 2HKOing defensive Zapdos, Heatran, and Gliscor. Alternatively, Tera Grass boosts Flower Trick, letting Meowscarada OHKO Mega Tyranitar, Alomomola, and Slowbro, as well as 2HKOing defensive walls like Clefable and Tornadus-T. Entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk can be valuable teammates for Meowscarada, as it removes Heavy-Duty Boots on foes like Toxapex, Zapdos, and Tornadus-T, making them quite susceptible to entry hazards. Meowscarada can pair well with other offensive pivots like Rotom-W and Tapu Koko, as they can form a VoltTurn core with it, pivoting them in to help deal with checks like Dragonite, Kommo-o, and Zapdos.

Choice Item.description: Meowscarada serves as a strong pivot and revenge killer that leverages its excellent STAB combination to threaten some of the tier's strongest physical walls like Quaquaval, Great Tusk, and Garganacl. U-turn allows Meowscarada to pivot out on its switch-ins like Corviknight and defensive Kommo-o. With Choice Band, Low Kick OHKOes Zamazenta-C on the switch and forces out Hiusian Goodra, Play Rough threatens to OHKO Kommo-o while chipping Sap Sipper Great Tusk, and Lash Out punishes chipped Intimidate Corviknight switching in. Choice Scarf is an option over Choice Band that trades the ability to OHKO defensive Kommo-o and 2HKO Scream Tail and Sap Sipper Great Tusk for being an exceptional Speed control option and having the ability to revenge kill slower Choice Scarf users like Azelf and Roaring Moon, as well as unboosted, naturally faster targets like Barraskewda and Hisuian Electrode. Meowscarada's ability to force out special walls like Hisuian Goodra, RegenVest Manaphy, and Roaring Moon is greatly appreciated by special wallbreakers and pivots like Walking Wake, Iron Moth, and Choice Specs Azelf, which in return force out the physical walls that wall Meowscarada like Corviknight and defensive Zapdos. Meowscarada is vulnerable to revenge killers like Dragonite, Zamazenta-C, and Chien-Pao, so teammates that can switch into these threats like Corviknight and Quaquaval make good partners.

Defensive.description:
• Skeledirge functions as a catch-all check to the strongest physical attackers in Ubers, notably taking on Koraidon, Zacian-C, and some variants of E-Killer Arceus.
  • Unaware fully prevents Swords Dance Koraidon and Zacian-C from breaking down Skeledirge through pure force, in contrast to other physical walls like Groudon and Toxapex. Unaware even lets Skeledirge have some use against special attackers like Calm Mind + Will-O-Wisp Arceus-Fairy.
  • Torch Song is a good STAB move that boosts Skeledirge's Special Attack each time it's used, making it a good way to force out foes and turning Skeledirge into a potential late-game wincon.
  • There are two options for the secondary attacking move. Hex pairs very well with Will-O-Wisp, becoming a 130-Base Power STAB move. On the other hand, Earth Power is very useful against Pokemon that use Tera Fire to avoid burns, such as Koraidon, and it also hits Miraidon and Eternatus switch-ins hard.
  • The combination of reliable recovery with Slack Off and Heavy-Duty Boots means that Skeledirge can easily stay healthy throughout the game and not worry about entry hazards.
  • Tera Fairy is useful against Choice Band Koraidon in particular, as it can break through Skeledirge with Dragon Claw or Outrage; the downside is that Tera Fairy makes Skeledirge vulnerable to Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade. Tera Flying gives Skeledirge an immunity to Ground-type moves, which can be helpful against Arceus-Ground and Stomping Tantrum Koraidon. Tera Water provides a good all-around neutral defensive type to use which maintains an Ice-type resistance for Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I.
  • Skeledirge offers a great deal of role compression to teams thanks to its ability to reliably check so many offensive threats.
  • Skeledirge's main flaw is that it can be passive and vulnerable to double switches, U-turn, and Taunt.
  • Koraidon can often take advantage of the predictable switch to Skeledirge to bring in deadly offensive threats such as Chi-Yu, Walking Wake, and Kyogre with U-turn. As a result, it may be advantageous to anticipate U-turn in these scenarios.
  • Taunt is often employed as a method to bypass Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp, especially by Koraidon and E-Killer Arceus. If you expect the foe to use Taunt, taking advantage of the situation and gaining Special Attack boosts with Torch Song is a great way to limit their ability to wallbreak.
  • Ting-Lu and Clodsire are excellent teammates for Skeledirge, as they cover most of the special attackers that come in on it, especially Miraidon, while Skeledirge can in turn handle most physical threats. Together they form a solid defensive backbone.
  • Skeledirge is unable to take on Ground-type physical attackers like Arceus-Ground, Tera Ground Zacian-C, and Groudon without using Tera itself. As a result, Pokemon that resist or are immune to Ground like Corviknight, Giratina-O, Landorus-T, and Arceus-Grass make for good partners. Corviknight has the additional benefit of solidifying the matchup against E-Killer Arceus.
  • Arceus-Fairy is useful as a backup check to Koraidon, and it makes it much more difficult for Koraidon to get easy momentum with U-turn.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Skeledirge is a fantastic defensive Pokemon thanks to its great bulk and Unaware letting it check dangerous Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Volcarona, and Hatterene. Unlike other walls, however, Skeledirge can also be a foreboding wincon with Torch Song and its great offensive typing, which gives it nearly unresisted coverage. Will-O-Wisp gives it value against switch-ins such as Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Clodsire and cripples physical attackers like Great Tusk and Garchomp. Hex benefits from Skeledirge spreading burns, 2HKOing Pokemon such as Dragonite, Iron Hands, and physically defensive Dondozo unboosted, and Toxapex after a single boost from Torch Song. Tera Fairy bolsters Skeledirge against Dragon-types that would otherwise overwhelm it like Dragapult, Dragonite, and Garchomp. It also lets Skeledirge beat Quaquaval and lose its Ground weakness, letting it more easily spread burns against Ground-types like Great Tusk and Garchomp.
