In a pinch, it can bait Dark-type moves from Pokemon like Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Meowscarada, Terastallize the same turn, and punish them with Will-O-Wisp. Tera Fairy also maintains Skeledirge's ability to beat Iron Valiant, Volcarona, and Hatterene.

Skeledirge fits on many bulky offense, balance, and stall teams as a much-appreciated answer to common wallbreakers such as Iron Valiant and Hatterene. Skeledirge often ends up entry hazard fodder for Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Clodsire. Thus, secure hazard removers like Great Tusk and Corviknight are excellent partners. Additionally, Great Tusk can 2HKO the aforementioned Pokemon, helping set Skeledirge up for a potential sweep, while Corviknight walls the aforementioned Ground-types, can bring Skeledirge in later with U-turn, and can absorb Knock Off from the likes of Great Tusk, Meowscarada, and Iron Treads. Pokemon such as Meowscarada and Iron Valiant can overwhelm Skeledirge answers like Gholdengo, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu. In addition to this, they appreciate Skeledirge's ability to beat Hatterene and, after Terastallizing, Dragapult. Covert Cloak Gholdengo can beat any Garganacl using Skeledirge as setup fodder. Bulky Water-types like Rotom-W and Toxapex help deal with offensive Water-types like Greninja and Quaquaval. Additionally, they can both spread status, facilitating Skeledirge's Hex. Rotom-W in particular can offensively check Ground-types like Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Ting-Lu too, although it cannot directly switch into them. Offensive Pokemon like Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, Kingambit, and Dragonite appreciate Skeledirge halting scary Pokemon, like Volcarona and Iron Valiant, and they help it overwhelm checks like Garganacl, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire.

Substitute.description:
With Substitute, Skeledirge can use its typing and bulk to consistently check Garganacl and more easily snowball with Torch Song. Substitute also allows Skeledirge to scout Choice item Pokemon like Roaring Moon and Dragonite, as well as protecting it from revenge killers like Kingambit and Roaring Moon more reliably. Substitute also lets Skeledirge set up against the likes of Garganacl and Cinderace, and it blocks from status from the likes of Toxapex, Clodsire, and Thunder Wave Rotom-W. Maximum HP investment means that Garganacl cannot break Substitute with Salt Cure. 40 Defense EVs let Skeledirge survive two Bulldozes from Focus Sash Breloom, meaning it can consistently outheal Bulldoze, barring a critical hit. 188 Special Defense EVs ensures it survives a Shadow Ball from non-Tera Ghost Choice Specs Dragapult, while 28 Speed EVs let it outspeed Kingambit. Tera Fairy helps stop the likes of Dragapult and Great Tusk from overwhelming Skeledirge, especially the former, which bypasses Substitute with Infiltrator but cannot 2HKO Skeledirge after it Terastallizes. Tera Fairy also prevents Garganacl's Earthquake from breaking Substitute.

Substitute Skeledirge fits best on bulky offense and balance teams as a good check to Garganacl. Pokemon Garganacl can overwhelm such as Dragonite, Hex Dragapult, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon, Calm Mind Hatterene, Corviknight, Toxapex, and Dondozo can lure it in for Skeledirge to set up Substitute on and snowball. Additionally, the former can break through Pokemon that wall Skeledirge, namely Toxapex and Clodsire, and Dragapult and Corviknight also boast U-turn, letting them pivot into Skeledirge on a Garganacl switch-in. The setup sweepers enjoy Skeledirge's potent wallbreaking, too. Toxapex and Dondozo also check Pokemon that overwhelm Skeledirge, such as Dragapult and Greninja. Pokemon that do not mind Knock Off like Great Tusk and Corviknight greatly help this set, as Skeledirge is both weak to Knock Off and reliant on Heavy-Duty Boots due to its Stealth Rock weakness. These Pokemon also double as entry hazard removers, with the former preventing Gholdengo from entering safely and the latter checking Ground-types like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu. Entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Meowscarada can chip down Pokemon that wall Skeledirge like Ting-Lu and Clodsire. In return, Skeledirge can threaten common entry hazard answers like Hatterene and Corviknight, as well as spinblocking in a pinch.

Defensive.description: When it comes to Unaware Pokemon, Skeledirge is one of the best available; it has great physical bulk and a solid move in Torch Song, which boosts its already good Special Attack. These traits make it a hard-to-break physical wall and a potential wincon as well. Will-O-Wisp lets it cripple physical attackers such as Mega Tyranitar, Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Landorus-T while also punishing Water-types such as Rotom-W. Combined with Will-O-Wisp, Hex helps it overwhelm passive checks in Toxapex, Gastrodon, and Clodsire while also allowing Skeledirge to sweep statused teams. While not as strong as Hex, Shadow Ball is a decent option as it's more consistent. Tera Water allows Skeledirge to beat rain teams by spreading burns against rain sweepers such as Mega Swampert, Barraskewda, and Floatzel. On the other hand, Tera Fairy allows it to counter Dragon Dance Dragapult and avoid Pursuit from Kingambit, Mega Tyranitar, and Weavile while also keeping a Fighting resistance, meaning it can still check Zamazenta. It also removes Skeledirge's Ground weakness, allowing it to comfortably burn Pokemon like Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Landorus-T. Skeledirge struggles against Heatran and Garganacl, as it can't burn them nor deal significant damage to them. Therefore, Pokemon that pressure them like Garchomp and Rotom-W for the former and Cover Cloak Gholdengo for the latter make good partners. Skeledirge also hates losing its item, so Knock Off absorbers like Flyinium Z Tornadus-T and Gliscor make for good teammates. The former can also weaken Heatran for it while Skeledirge can burn Mega Tyranitar. Special sponges like Gastrodon, Clodsire, and Toxapex all appreciate Skeledirge's ability to cripple physical attackers such as Kartana, Mega Lopunny, and Kingambit, alleviating the pressure these Pokemon exert on them. In return, they can all handle special attackers like Gholdengo, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Mega Charizard Y.

Physically Defensive.description:
• Will-O-Wisp burns physical attackers like Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and Annihilape.
  • Torch Song provides consistent damage while also ignoring Substitute, which helps versus Espathra, Volcarona, and Corviknight.
  • Encore shuts down slower Pokemon that use status moves like Soak Bellibolt and Fake Tears Sylveon. It also stops foes like Choice item Gardevoir and Choice Scarf Sableye from using Trick freely.
  • Blast Burn allows Skeledirge to OHKO threats like Iron Treads and Kingambit.
  • The investment in HP and Defense allows Skeledirge to survive Knock Off from Choice Band Meowscarada and Headlong Rush from Attack Booster Energy Great Tusk.
  • In combination with Weakness Policy, Blaze allows Skeledirge to OHKO Meowscarada after Meowscarada transforms into a Rock-type and uses Power Gem.
  • Unaware helps versus setup Pokemon like Bulk Up Annihilape, non-Lumina Crash Espathra, Volcarona, and Swords Dance Iron Hands.
  • Sitrus Berry helps against physical attackers and acts as insurance in case Will-O-Wisp misses against threats like Iron Hands.
  • Mental Herb is useful against opposing Encore users like Annihilape and Gardevoir.
  • Air Balloon is helpful against Ground-types like Great Tusk and Donphan.

Physically Defensive (Fire).description:
Skeledirge is a great choice for Fire teams as a non-passive physically defensive wall. With Will-O-Wisp and Unaware, it can check physical set-up sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragonite or Belly Drum Azumarill that threaten Fire. Additionally, Torch Song lets Skeledirge fire back against these threats while raising its Special Attack and reducing passitivity. Hex pairs incredibly well with Will-O-Wisp, as it threatens large amounts of damage on burned foes, while Shadow Ball is a more consistent STAB option that hits opposing Skeledirge for more immediate damage. Heavy-Duty Boots lets Skeledirge avoid entry hazards chipping away at it whenever it switches in.

Volcarona is a great teammate for Skeledirge, as it can threaten Dark-types that annoy Skeledirge such as Ting-Lu and Kingambit. In return, Skeledirge can burn physical attackers, like Dragonite, giving Volcarona more setup opportunities. Paldean Tauros-F is also a good teammate, since it can threaten the aforementioned Dark-types with its Fighting STAB while also having Intimidate to help neutralize physical attackers that Skeledirge cannot handle on its own, such as Roaring Moon. Additionally, its Choice Scarf set can outspeed and KO Greninja. Torkoal pairs well with Skeledirge due to its ability to both remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin and set them up, all while also powering up Skeledirge's Torch Song. Cinderace is a fairly good partner as well due to High Jump Kick, letting it remove Dark-types aiming to threaten Skeledirge, while also being able to remove entry hazards with Court Change and hit Poison-types such as Clodsire and Toxapex with Zen Headbutt. Scovillain is a good partner, since it can remove Water-types such as Dondozo and Rotom-W with its Grass STAB. Both Talonflame and Air Balloon Iron Moth alleviate Skeledirge's weakness to threats such as Great Tusk and Ting-Lu.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Defensive Gator.description:
• Thanks to instant recovery, Unaware, and the snowballing potential of Torch Song, Skeledirge is a viable alternative to Dondozo.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Yawn: Will-O-Wisp vastly improves Skeledirge's match-up against fearsome physical foes such as Kingambit, while Yawn works exceptionally well with Stealth Rock support.

  • Earth Power: If Iron Moth is particularly troubling, Earth Power is the best solution for it. It also hits Chi-Yu switch-ins hard.

  • Substitute: Substitute is a good way around status, especially Garganacl's Salt Cure. It also becomes effective when used on Toxic Spikes teams.

Other Options

  • Encore: When paired with Substitute, Skeledirge can seriously punish passive Pokemon, though at a serious cost in coverage.

  • Flame Charge: Despite Skeledirge's low Speed, stacking Flame Charge boosts can make it difficult to check, though it'll often need multiple boosts to outspeed threats without compromising its bulk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Skeledirge's defensive typing isn't without its merits, but the wide variety of weaknesses it has often forces Skeledirge to Terastallize to check major threats like Chien-Pao and Dragonite.

  • Fairy: Terastallizing into the Fairy typing removes Skeledirges glaring weakness to Dark and provides an overall superior defensive typing. making Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu far more reasonable to deal with. It also provides a neutral typing for the inevitable Shadow Balls that will be thrown at Skeledirge, like from Flutter Mane or Gholdengo.

  • Normal: While Tera Normal isn't fantastic defensively, it lets Skeledirge severely punish attempts from special attacking Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo to check it.

  • Water: A Water Tera type lets Skeledirge take on opposing Water attacks, providing a valuable turn to burn foes like Azumarill and Palafin-H. It should be noted that Tera Water tends to be a safer option versus the common Gholdengo, as it does not often run Thunderbolt.

  • Fire: Despite the defensive nature of this set, Tera Fire's increased power for Torch Song is welcome, and it still helps Skeledirge against Chien-Pao.

Items

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Residual recovery helps Skeledirge use Torch Song more freely. Leftovers is the best option since Skeledirge has instant recovery, but Sitrus Berry with an even HP stat can be used to restore some health after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak ignores the secondary effects of Salt Cure and Acid Spray, improving Skeledirge's match-up against Garganacl, Iron Moth, and Bellibolt.

  • Safety Goggles: The immunity to Spore Skeledirge gains lets it check Breloom, Amoonguss, and Brute Bonnet far more effectively.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: This makes Skeledirge less pressured to Terastallize to rid itself of its Stealth Rock weakness.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 76 Def / 212 SpD with Bold: This EV spread allows both Tera Fairy and Water Skeledirge to avoid a 2HKO from a plethora of offensive threats, such as Focus Sash Chien-Pao, Modest Gholdengo, Adamant Azumarill, and Choice Specs Dragapult, while still boasting significant physical bulk.

Blunder Song.description:
• With Blunder Policy, this Skeledirge provides a unique approach to offense: it'll either put important foes to sleep or threaten to snowball into a sweep with Speed and Special Attack boosts!

  • Shadow Ball: Even with Skeledirge's wide variety of viable Tera types, Shadow Ball is still an excellent secondary STAB attack for hitting Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and opposing Skeledirge.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power is Skeledirge's best option against Garganacl and Chi-Yu, and it makes checking Iron Moth feasible.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Beyond the many weaknesses Skeledirge's typing has, it only has one shot of having +2 Speed, so Terastallizing is preferred over switching when possible.

  • Fairy: With this Skeledirge's more offensive nature, Tera Fairy's immunity to powerful Dragon-type attacks is a big help, and it makes Tera Blast an effective tool against bulky foes such as Ting-Lu, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp.

  • Water: Besides being a fantastic defensive typing, Tera Water gives Skeledirge the chance to pick off weakened Iron Bundle as they use Hydro Pump and gives it a good attack against Chi-Yu, Garganacl, and Iron Moth.

  • Fire: In addition to removing the troublesome Ghost-type weakness, Tera Fire makes sweeping with Torch Song require less setup.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Skeledirge a key Ghost-type immunity, taking advantage of common Choiced Ghost-types such as Gholdengo.

  • Grass: Tera Grass vastly improves Skeledirge's matchup against Breloom, Rotom-W, and Brute Bonnet.

EV Spreads

  • All EV spreads for this set should outspeed Dragapult after missing Sing.

  • 204 HP / 4 Def / 132 SpA / 4 SpD / 164 Spe with Modest: The HP investment in this spread lets Skeledirge survive one Earthquake from Garchomp or one Throat Chop from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao when staying not Terastallizing, and one Choice Specs Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle when Tera Fairy or Tera Normal.

  • 92 HP / 252 SpA / 164 Spe with Modest: This spread sacrifices bulk for being able to OHKO Iron Bundle with Torch Song after Stealth Rock damage and doing the same to Kingambit with Tera Fire.

  • 164 HP / 180 Def / 164 Spe with Bold: This defensive spread allows Tera Skeledirge to always avoid a 2HKO from Jolly Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and avoids getting 2HKOed by Baxcalibur's 4-hit Icicle Spear when Tera Normal or Fairy.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: A huge sacrifice in bulk makes it harder for Skeledirge to set up, but the Speed investment does allow it to outspeed several major Choice Scarf threats after missing Sing. Modest variants will outspeed up to Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu and Jolly Choice Scarf Annihilape, while Timid sets will Speed tie with +1 Espathra.

Offensive Gator.description: This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Spinblocker.description: Thanks to its typing and good physical bulk, Skeledirge serves as an excellent spinblocker that can wall common spinners such as Iron Treads with Earth Eater and Quaquaval with Desolate Land. It also walls threats like Choice Band Cinderace and Zamazenta-C and, depending on its ability, Garchomp and Primordial Sea Zapdos. Skeledirge can then use Torch Song to set up on passive opponents like Scream Tail and non-Well-Baked Body Blissey or Will-O-Wisp to burn an incoming foe, including switch-ins like Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk. Hex alongside Will-O-Wisp does more damage, but Shadow Ball can be used for more consistent damage. Skeledirge pairs well with hazard setters such as Garchomp and Iron Treads, as it allows them to keep their hazards on the field, and they can in turn handle opposing Well-Baked Body Pokemon. Due to its middling Special Defense, Skeledirge appreciates specially defensive teammates like Blissey and Hisuian Goodra. Additionally, a teammate that covers the type that Skeledirge chooses not to be immune to, such as Quaquaval for Earth Eater variants and Corviknight for Desolate Land variants, helps form a strong defensive core. Dark-types like Meowscarada and Chien-Pao also OHKO Skeledirge with a bit of chip damage, so Pokemon like Galarian Zapdos and Slither Wing that can threaten them are appreciated.

Physically Defensive (Ghost).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defensive.description: Skeledirge is a good physical wall, acting as an important check to Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Extreme Killer Arceus. It can switch into these powerful Swords Dance sweepers, beating them or halting their sweep. Torch Song allows it to potentially sweep a weakened team late-game. Earth Power is an option that chips Miraidon and Eternatus as well as giving it a super effective hit against Tera Fire Zacian-C and Koraidon. Fairy is the ideal Tera type, giving Skeledirge an immunity to Koraidon's Dragon-type attacks and removing its weaknesses to Ground- and Ghost-type attacks from foes like Arceus-Ground, Calyrex-S, and Giratina-O. Tera Flying is a niche option that further improves its matchup against Arceus-Ground while avoiding super effective Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C. Skeledirge is a good fit on balance teams that appreciate it checking common setup threats and carrying teammates that make up for its shortcomings and bad matchups. Skeledirge is very vulnerable to Miraidon, Kyogre, Calyrex-S, and Arceus-Ground, so it appreciates teammates like Ting-Lu, Eternatus, Wo-Chien, and Giratina-O to handle these powerful attackers. Likewise, Skeledirge pairs well with fast attackers and priority users such as Calyrex-S, Choice Scarf Koraidon, and Extreme Killer Arceus, which can threaten the foes that force Skeledirge out and revenge kill Pokemon it checks if it is overwhelmed.

Rapid Spin.description: Quaxly is a notable Rapid Spin user in LC due to its access to reliable recovery and good matchup into entry hazard setters like Pawniard and Glimmet; it can also double as a capable sweeper thanks to Moxie. Aqua Cutter gives up some power compared to Liquidation but does not make contact, which avoids activating Greavard's Fluffy and Voltorb's Static, and removes the risk of activating Pawniard's Defiant with a Defense drop. Aqua Jet is STAB priority that OHKOs Hisuian Growlithe, while Brave Bird provides super effective coverage versus Grass- and Fighting-types like Toedscool and Foongus. Encore can lock opposing Pokemon into unfavorable moves, such as weak setup moves, gaining momentum for Quaxly's team. Quaxly can use Tera Grass for a better matchup versus Electric- and Grass-types as well as a valuable immunity to Spore from Foongus and Toedscool. Tera Flying can also be used with Brave Bird to turn Quaxly into a more potent offensive threat. Pokemon weak to Stealth Rock, such as Hisuian Growlithe, Wingull, and Nymble, are great partners for Quaxly, as they appreciate the removal of entry hazards to be used at their full potential. Foongus is another good partner, as it can safely switch into Grass-types and provides valuable Spore support. Pokemon such as Toedscool and Wattrel check Electric-types for Quaxly.

Bulk Up.description:
Quaquaval is an amazing setup sweeper due to Bulk Up, Moxie, and Aqua Step to outpace foes like Hydreigon, Iron Moth, and Garchomp. Bulk Up lets it more easily take out threats like Great Tusk, Armarouge, and Ting-Lu and survive attacks from Pokemon such as Tera Flying Roaring Moon and Azumarill. Close Combat hits Pokemon that can take an Aqua Step, like Kingambit, Roaring Moon, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon, super effectively. Roost gives Quaquaval longevity to accumulate and take advantage of its boosts, and it allows Quaquaval to switch into Kingambit and Cinderace without fearing chip damage. Taunt shuts down Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Skeledirge by preventing the use of recovery and status-inflicting moves. It also blocks Defense-boosting attempts from Curse and Bulk Up users like Great Tusk and Garganacl. Ice Spinner is a great coverage move that hits Pokemon that would otherwise resist Quaquaval's STAB attacks, like Dragonite, Water Absorb Clodsire, and Amoonguss. 112 Speed EVs allow Quaquaval to outspeed Iron Moth after a boost. Tera Water boosts Aqua Step's power and removes Quaquaval's weakness to threats like Iron Valiant, Azumarill, and Future Sight Slowking. Tera Fighting boosts Close Combat’s power to dent threats like Garchomp and Breloom. It also allows Quaquaval to take less damage from Garganacl’s Salt Cure. Tera Poison is a defensive option that allows Quaquaval to resist Fairy-type attacks from Pokemon like Iron Valiant and Azumarill, absorb Toxic Spikes, and be immune to Toxapex and Clodsire's Toxic.

Quaquaval fits best on offense teams that support its ability to set up and sweep. Entry hazards from Pokemon like Meowscarada and Glimmora give Quaquaval an easier time taking out foes. Pivots like Rotom-W and Cinderace bring Quaquaval safely onto the field against threats like Volcarona and Great Tusk. Cinderace in particular is able to provide entry hazard control with Court Change and can burn foes with Will-O-Wisp, giving Quaquaval an easier time to set up and sweep. Quaquaval targets common Fire-, Ground-, and Dark-types; therefore, it can support teammates weak to them like Corviknight and Gholdengo. In return, Corviknight can pivot Quaquaval into battle, come in on Assault Vest Toxapex, and remove entry hazards. Gholdengo blocks status that prevent Quaquaval from sweeping should it not run Taunt. Quaquaval struggles against Pokemon like Dragonite, Dragapult, and Azumarill; therefore, threats to them like Scizor and Iron Valiant make good teammates. Scizor checks Azumarill, while Iron Valiant checks Dragonite and Dragapult.

Choice Scarf (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Rapid Spin (Water).description:
Quaquaval is a great pick for Water teams due to its unique access to Rapid Spin, threatening presence in the Steel and Dark matchups, and potential to snowball unsuspecting teams. Close Combat targets Steel- and Dark-types like Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hydreigon. Alternatively, Brick Break may be used to retain Quaquaval's defensive stats and clear dual screens in the Ice and Fairy matchups at the cost of extra damage. Aqua Step enables Quaquaval to function as a potential late-game cleaner and threatens Pokemon like Volcarona, Skeledirge, and Unaware Clodsire. Rapid Spin is used to clear entry hazards, aiding against entry hazard-stacking teams. The given EV spread allows Quaquaval to outpace Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao after a single Rapid Spin or Aqua Step boost, OHKO Flutter Mane after one Moxie boost, and better deal with priority moves from Breloom and Kingambit.

Greninja breaks past troublesome walls like Toxapex, Sableye, and Water Absorb Clodsire due to its wide range of coverage. Toxapex serves as an answer to threats like Meowscarada, Breloom, and Iron Valiant, sets up Toxic Spikes, and hinders Pokemon like Rotom-W, Dragonite, and Quagsire with Toxic. Gastrodon and Quagsire are valued for their Electric-type immunity against Pokemon like Rotom-W, Sandy Shocks, and Magnezon as well as their entry hazards, supporting Quaquaval as a cleaner. Pelipper can set rain to boost Quaquaval's Aqua Step and pressures Grass-types like Breloom, Infiltrator Brambleghast, and Meowscarada with Hurricane. Slowking can safely pivot into Quaquaval with Chilly Reception and aids in late-game cleaning with Future Sight.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Moxie Sweeper.description:
• Aqua Step and Moxie give Quaquaval a niche as a late-game sweeper that doesn't always need a turn of setup.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet's ability to pick off weakened threats pairs very well with Moxie, giving it new potential win conditions.

  • Ice Spinner: This is Quaquaval's best way of dealing big damage to Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Encore: Encore lets Quaquaval punish slower foes such as Corviknight by getting an easy setup opportunity or by simply forcing them to switch.

Other Options

  • Wave Crash: While Wave Crash is Quaquaval's strongest Water-type attack, the recoil can be problematic for Focus Sash sets.

  • Roost: Recovery might seem odd on such an offensive Pokemon, but it helps Quaquaval avoid getting worn down against bulkier teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: With Moxie and Aqua Step boosting its offensive output, Quaquaval doesn't always have to rely on Terastallization.

  • Water: Boosting Aqua Step's and Aqua Jet's power opens up new sweeping chances late-game.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Quaquaval deal massive damage to Azumarill and wear down Dondozo switch-ins with Tera Blast.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can let Quaquaval get the jump on Fairy- and Dragon-types such as Flutter Mane and Garchomp by resisting their attacks.

Items

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Quaquaval trades potential wallbreaking for getting surprise sweeps against more offensive teams.

  • Assault Vest: Even without defensive investment, Assault Vest can let Quaquaval take a super-effective hit against some naturally faster threats, such as Psychic Chi-Yu and Energy Ball Iron Moth.

  • Mystic Water: The power increase to Aqua Step and Aqua Jet makes sweeping easier, especially when paired with Tera Water.

Bulky.description:
• While Quaquaval's bulk is only serviceable, having both Roost and a great support movepool makes it a reasonable defensive option that does particularly well against Kingambit.

  • Taunt and Bulk Up: Taunt pairs particularly well with Bulk Up, letting it set up on surprising foes such as Corviknight.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Quaquaval stall out OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo, and it protects it from Garganacl's Salt Cure.

  • Encore: Not only does Encore give Quaquaval new chances to set up, but it also punishes passive play from Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Setup Quaquaval will often have to use Terastallization to deal with the checks switching into it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Quauqaval a better matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, who can be fairly problematic otherwise.

  • Flying: While it has very little defensive synergy with Quaquaval's previous typing, Tera Flying lets Quaquaval effectively stall out Dondozo if using Taunt, or Substitute and Encore together.

  • Grass: Tera Grass makes Quaquaval's match-up against Rotom-W much smoother.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Quaquaval can set up against most defensive Garchomp thanks to the Dragon Tail immunity.

Items

  • Leftovers: The passive recovery from Leftovers works great with Substitute sets in particular.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet pairs well with Taunt and Tera Flying, letting Quaquaval easily play around Dondozo and Corviknight while setting up Bulk Up.

  • Covert Cloak: If running Substitute isn't possible, Covert Cloak is Quaquaval's best shot at defeating Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread allows Quaquaval to outspeed Meowscarada after an Aqua Step while raising its special bulk. If not using Bulk Up, running Defense EVs is also viable instead.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 28 Def / 164 SpD / 68 Spe with Careful: The Special Defense investment and Careful nature let Quaquaval survive Timid Flutter Mane's unboosted Moonblast at full health, and the Speed lets it outspeed Garchomp after Aqua Step.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed ensures that Quaquaval outspeeds Choice Scarf Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult after using Aqua Step.

Choice Band.description:
• With Choice Band, Quaquaval goes all-in on attempting to sweep with Aqua Step.

  • Aqua Jet is an alternative way to sweep late-game.

Tera Types

  • Water: Since this set is so focused on Aqua Step, Tera Water is a must-have.

Defensive.description: Defensive Quaquaval uses its good physical bulk and typing to act as a physically defensive pivot, checking dangerous threats like Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hisuian Arcanine. Intimidate allows Quaquaval to weaken foes like Chien-Pao and Cinderace for its teammates, while Fluffy grants better bulk to better check Slither Wing and Roaring Moon. U-turn allows Quaquaval to maintain momentum and allows frailer teammates like Slither Wing and Hydreigon to pivot in safely while Rapid Spin offers role compression by allowing it to remove hazards while having a good matchup against entry hazard setters like Iron Treads and Garchomp. A Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs allow it to pivot out as slow as possible. Meloetta is a valuable teammate that can switch in on special threats such as Iron Moth and Zapdos that force Quaquaval out. Physical wallbreakers like Meowscarada and Talonflame have a good type matchup against Quaquaval, hence teammates that can force them out like Zamazenta-C and Regieleki make solid partners.

Revenge Killer.description: Nymble's unique combination of STAB First Impression and a powerful ability in Tinted Lens allows it to become one of Little Cup's reliable revenge killers, picking off targets such as Toedscool and sweepers such as Shellder. U-turn allows Nymble to pivot on the switches it forces and avoid problematic matchups, such as Wattrel. Sucker Punch revenge kills foes that have Protect or can safely tank a First Impression, such as Drifloon. Tera Bug boosts Nymble's power to absurd levels, letting it OHKO Hisuian Growlithe. Nymble switches out of battle very often, so hazard control from teammates such as Drifloon, Quaxly, and Toedscool are good partners to have. Mareanie and Pawniard can switch into Nymble's common checks such as Hisuian Zorua and Mudbray well. Pokemon weak to Grass- or Dark-types such as Mudbray and Hisuian Zorua appreciate Nymble forcing out or removing their checks. Hisuian Voltorb and Grookey pair well with Nymble, as they can make a deadly VoltTurn combination.

All Out Attacker (Bug).description:
With access to nearly unresisted First Impression and U-turn due to Tinted Lens, Lokix is an amazing revenge killer for Bug teams. Its ability to scare out many common threats such as Espathra, Chien-Pao, and Dragapult is highly valuable. Lokix struggles to break past many physically defensive walls like Quagsire, Dondozo, and Corviknight; however, it can pivot in teammates—such as Vivillon and Volcarona—that can beat them. A Choice Band with an Adamant nature maximizes Lokix's damage output and can utilise Axe Kick to lure and defeat Steel-types like Kingambit and Iron Treads. Alternatively, Life Orb avoids a Choice lock and makes use of Sucker Punch to pick off threats that First Impression alone cannot such as Gholdengo and Flutter Mane. Throat Chop lets Lokix deal good unresisted STAB damage and prevents Skeledirge from using Torch Song, which is extremely valuable and one of the reasons Lokix is a necessity for Bug teams.

Lokix is highly susceptible to entry hazards and is often not quite strong enough to OHKO many Pokemon. Forretress is a great entry hazard remover and entry hazard setter, fixing both of those issues. Forretress also has a good defensive profile, acting as a sponge for absorbing damage, and it can even form a VoltTurn core with Lokix. Scizor removes Fairy-types that threaten Lokix such as Hatterene and Iron Valiant and allows Lokix to clean up after it has done enough damage. Volcarona takes care of Steel-types that don't fall to Axe Kick such as Corviknight and Scizor. Lokix can remove Ghost-types—such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, and Flutter Mane—to enable Slither Wing and Heracross, letting them spam their powerful Fighting-type moves and clean up after Lokix. Frosmoth can deal with many bulky Ground-types—such as Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu—and Vivillon improves the Fighting-type matchup by beating Great Tusk, Gallade, and Paldean Tauros-W and can answer Dondozo with the combination of Sleep Powder and Energy Ball. Masquerain can set up Sticky Web, which gives Lokix an amazing Speed advantage versus Iron Treads, Iron Moth, and Walking Wake, making Life Orb Lokix immensely threatening.

Swords Dance (Dark).description:
Excellent for the Dark mirror and revenge-kills threats such as Barraskewda.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

Tinted Offense.description:
• The combination of First Impression and Tinted Lens make Lokix one of the most threatening revenge killers in the format, able to outprioritize and KO foes regardless of resistance.

  • First Impression is Lokix's most important attack, but it can only be used as the first attack after it switches in.

  • U-turn can be punishing against offensive and slow teams as the lack of resists means Lokix can keep switching in and dealing big damage with First Impression, at the cost of making it vulnerable to hazards.

  • Leech Life is the strongest Bug-type move Lokix learns outside of First Impression, with the added benefit of healing recoil damage.

  • Sucker Punch is a powerful STAB priority move, enabling Lokix to outprioritize foes even after it has used First Impression.

  • Axe Kick is the only coverage move of note in Lokix's moveset due to its high Base Power. Be wary of the low accuracy and recoil that occurs should it miss.

  • Throat Chop is the most powerful Dark-type move Lokix learns. It also has the side benefit of disabling Roar from Hippowdon and Hyper Voice from Sylveon.

  • Swords Dance is an option to make Lokix a sweeper instead of a revenge killer.

Items

Life Orb: Life Orb enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

Silver Powder: Silver Powder raises the power of First Impression without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

Bug: A Bug Tera Type increases the damage of First Impression, allowing Lokix to OHKO foes it could not otherwise, such as Dragapult.

vgc2023.overview:
• Pawmot has a strong niche in being one of only two Pokemon with a potentially game-winning tool in Revival Blessing. It is preferred over Rabsca thanks to its high Speed and better offensive typing, hitting Pokemon such as Murkrow, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon for OHKOs or near OHKOs. This, combined with its access to Fake Out, makes Pawmot useful offensively in addition to bringing Revival Blessing.

  • Powerful teammates such as Dondozo, when paired with Tatsugiri's Commander, and Meowscarada particularly appreciate Pawmot's Revival Blessing, as it gives them another opportunity at denting opposing teams. Choice Band Meowscarada pairs particularly well with Pawmot, as it can hit the only relevant Ground-type in Garchomp with both Flower Trick and Play Rough. Pawmot, in return, covers the few Pokemon that can handle Meowscarada's STAB moves, such as Hydreigon—even when it Terastallizes into a typing such as Steel.

  • Such Pawmot teams can, however, be vulnerable to well-played dual screens teams, which nullify most of the offensive presence from Pawmot's allies, even after it revives one of them. In particular, Pawmot teams must bring Pokemon and moves that can beat Amoonguss, which can be used on these teams.

Revival Blessing Support.description:
• Revival Blessing is an extremely invaluable tool that lets Pawmot revive crucial teammates such as Dondozo and Meowscarada, very likely turning the battle in the user's favor. It is Pawmot's most important move, but an attack is slotted first in case the timer forces Pawmot to use its first move. Double Shock is better here if Pawmot Terastallizes into the Electric typing, which lets it repeatedly use the move without drawback or failure. If running the Fighting Tera type or not Terastallized, Close Combat is better in this moveslot.

  • Focus Sash, in tandem with Pawmot's high Speed, ensures it gets at least two moves off if it is not double targeted.

  • Volt Absorb synergizes with Electric-weak teammates such as Dondozo, while Natural Cure allows Pawmot to brush off status moves such as Amoonguss's Spore.

  • Both the Electric and Fighting Tera types provide offensive benefits to Pawmot, turning an attack into a reliable source of damage against a plethora of common Pokemon such as Murkrow, Dondozo, and/or Hydreigon. The Electric Tera type lets it use Double Shock repeatedly, which avoids the drawback of Close Combat lowering its defenses, turning it into a potent cleaner.

Wallbreaker.description:
Thanks to its high Speed, unique typing, and powerful Electric-type STAB move in Double Shock, Pawmot sets itself apart as one of the premier wallbreakers in UU. Seed Bomb allows Pawmot to lure common checks such as Quagsire and Gastrodon and OHKO them handily. Alternatively, Ice Punch provides a solid middle ground against Ground- and Flying-types, in cases where losing Pawmot's Electric typing via Double Shock is not ideal, as well as allowing Pawmot to hit Brambleghast effectively, although this does require backup for Gastrodon and Quagsire. Natural Cure allows it to not worry about Talonflame's Flame Body and use Rest to improve its longevity, offsetting the damage from Life Orb and entry hazards. Tera Electric allows for Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock without switching out and increases its power, making it even more difficult to handle. This also helps Pawmot's defensive matchup against threats such as Gardevoir, Noivern, and Brave Bird Talonflame; although, one should still be aware of losing important resistances to strong priority attacks such as Slither Wing's First Impression and Bisharp's Sucker Punch. Heavy-Duty Boots is also an option over Life Orb to preserve Pawmot's longevity.

Pawmot fits well on teams that benefit from its ability to handle common threats such as Tinkaton, Slowking, and Tyranitar by breaking through them with raw power, as well as offensive teams that appreciate its excellent Speed. Reliable entry hazard setters such as Tinkaton and Sandy Shocks are worth considering, as the chip damage they provide makes it even easier for Pawmot to break through defensive threats, with the former also boasting Encore to help generate free turns. Grass-types such as Wo-Chien, Brambleghast, and Tsareena are also appreciated to handle Gastrodon and Quagsire, especially if Pawmot chooses Ice Punch, with the latter two also offering reliable hazard removal. Rock-types such as Tyranitar and Lycanroc-D that handle Talonflame as well as other Flying-types such as Iron Jugulis and Noivern are also appreciated. Scream Tail is also a teammate worth considering, as it has access to Stealth Rock and Encore, as well as Wish to keep Pawmot healthy and Thunder Wave to cripple fast threats like Grafaiai and Gengar while also having a strong matchup against revenge killers such as Noivern and Iron Jugulis. Pawmot also appreciates teammates with pivoting moves, such as Scizor, Tsareena, Noivern, and Grafaiai, to allow it to come in safely, especially against targets such as Tinkaton and Slowking.

Choice Scarf.description:
Pawmot is a solid threat in the UU metagame and becomes an excellent revenge killer when paired with Choice Scarf, threatening Pokemon like Talonflame, Wo-Chien, and Salamence. Pawmot's last moveslot can be either Revival Blessing or Seed Bomb. Revival Blessing allows Pawmot to revive a teammate on a forced switch, while Seed Bomb can threaten Pokemon like Quagsire and Gastrodon better. Revival Blessing is more commonly run, as Close Combat can usually do enough damage to break these walls with some entry hazard assistance. An Electric Tera type is vital for Pawmot, as it allows Pawmot to spam Double Shock without repercussion. Natural Cure allows Pawmot to shrug off burns from the likes of Talonflame and Altaria, as they would otherwise hinder Pawmot's offensive presence.

Choice Scarf Pawmot best fits on Spikes stacking teams in need of speed control. This makes Pokemon like Quagsire and Gastrodon good teammates, as they enjoy setting up Stealth Rock or Spikes, and the former can also use Toxic to chip teams down more efficiently for Pawmot. Pawmot struggles to deal with bulky Ground-types like Hippowdon, making teammates like Brambleghast and Wo-Chien appreciated due to their ability to soak up Earthquake while also removing hazards or removing Heavy-Duty Boots to rack up entry hazard damage, respectively. Pokemon that can outspeed Pawmot, like Choice Scarf Gengar and +2 Polteageist, can cause major issues, making priority users like Scizor and Lycanroc-D good partners to KO these threats.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Electric

All-out Attacker: Leppa Berry can be used over Punching Glove to allow Pawmot to use Revival Blessing twice in one game.

All-out Attacker (Electric).description:
Pawmot is a great wallbreaker on Electric teams, outspeeding foes like Garchomp, Landorus, and Sandy Shocks. Close Combat does not receive the benefits of Pawmot's ability and item, but it helps beat pesky foes like Ursaluna-B, Hisuian Goodra, and Baxcalibur, which are immune to or resist its Electric-type attacks. Close Combat is also a good move to beat foes like Ting-Lu and Kingambit which Pawmot's teammates might struggle against. Thunder Punch is an alternative STAB move, as it hits common walls like Corviknight and Toxapex while also threatening Pelipper on rain teams, thus preventing the opponent from setting up rain for Barraskewda repeatedly. Thunder Punch also helps versus Belly Drum Azumarill, preventing it from setting up. Mach Punch is Pawmot's preferred second STAB move, as it offers strong priority, securing an OHKO on foes like Chien-Pao, Meowscarada, and Greninja after a single layer of Spikes. Mach Punch also nullifies Kingambit's Sucker Punch by outspeeding it with priority. Revival Blessing is another alternative that can be used over Mach Punch, as it offers a unique and valuable type of utility by allowing a teammate to be revived. This may prove to be a huge benefit in some matchups like the Electric mirror, where Pawmot can revive teammates like Sandy Shocks after the opposing Rotom-W is low on HP or has already fainted. Ice Punch hits foes like the Landorus formes, Gliscor, Clodsire, and mixed Amoonguss. The last coverage move is Seed Bomb, as it hits Pokemon like Gastrodon, Quagsire, and Rotom-W, which can prove troublesome for Pawmot's teammates to break. Seed Bomb also compounds with Thunder Punch to hit every Water-type in the game for super effective damage, making Pawmot incredibly powerful in the Water matchup. Punching Glove helps Pawmot avoid chip damage from Rocky Helmet on foes like Rough Skin Garchomp while also avoiding status effects like burn from foes like Flame Body Volcarona, Moltres, and Talonflame.

Pawmot greatly benefits from teammates like Regieleki, which can use Rapid Spin to remove entry hazards for Pawmot and pivot well into other teammates with the help of Volt Switch. Regieleki's extremely high Speed tier also allows it to revenge kill foes like Enamorus, weakened Walking Wake, and, if using Magnet and Wild Charge, Flutter Mane. In return, Regieleki appreciates Pawmot dealing with Ground-type Pokemon, like Quagsire and Gliscor, with the help of Seed Bomb and Ice Punch due to Regieleki's lack of coverage moves. Iron Hands is another great teammate, as it allows Pawmot to run alternative sets, like Thunder Punch over Fighting-type STAB moves, since Iron Hands can run these moves in its stead. Assault Vest Iron Hands also has immense bulk and acts like a sponge for special attacks from foes like Choice Scarf Flutter Mane and Volcarona, which can cause great problems for Pawmot, since it is relatively frail. Iron Hands can also slow pivot into Pawmot with the help of Volt Switch. In return, Pawmot deals with walls like Quagsire and offensive Rotom-W, which Iron Hands may face difficulty in breaking. Sandy Shocks sets hazards like Stealth Rock and Spikes to boost Pawmot's wallbreaking potential by providing necessary chip on foes while also being able to provide a Ground immunity thanks to Air Balloon, thus behaving like a switch-in against foes like opposing Sandy Shocks, Choice Scarf Iron Treads, Gholdengo, and Skeledirge. In exchange, Pawmot helps break foes like the Landorus formes and Gliscor that wall Sandy Shocks completely. Pawmot also threatens foes like Baxcalibur, Dragonite, mixed Amoonguss, and Galarian Slowking, which can cause problems for Sandy Shocks. Rotom-W is an essential teammate for Pawmot, as it provides a much-needed Ground immunity while also offering great utility with its defensive sets that run Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave. Hydro Pump on Rotom-W deals with pesky Ground-types like Great Tusk and Mamoswine, which Pawmot struggles against. Defensive Rotom-W benefits from Pawmot's ability to take down foes like Water Absorb Clodsire and Gastrodon. Thus, together they form a strong core on Electric-type teams. Teammates like Thundurus, Thundurus-T and Zapdos provide a Ground immunity for Pawmot while also threatening strong Fighting-type foes like Zamazenta and Great Tusk. Zapdos can break these physically bulky Pokemon with the help of Hurricane, while Thundurus-T can use Psychic as a coverage move for Great Tusk, Zamazenta, and physically defensive Amoonguss. In return, they appreciate Pawmot's ability to break specially defensive walls that hinder Zapdos and Thundurus-T's wallbreaking capability. Thundurus provides great support with Prankster Thunder Wave, paralyzing fast foes like Dragapult and Flutter Mane and allowing Pawmot to outspeed them. Magnezone pairs well with Pawmot, as it can act like a sponge for Fairy-type moves from foes like Hatterene, Iron Valiant, and Flutter Mane and force them out with Flash Cannon. In return, Pawmot helps to break special walls like Galarian Slowking and Clodsire, which Magnezone can't break.

Choice Scarf (Electric).description:
Pawmot is a great Choice Scarf user on Electric teams by virtue of its coverage and utility, being able to deal with Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane. With Revival Blessing, Pawmot can give second chances to fallen offensive Pokemon such as Iron Hands and Choice Specs Zapdos to punch holes in opposing teams. Double Shock allows Pawmot to OHKO threats such as Flutter Mane and Azumarill as well as finishing off Iron Valiant, but this comes with the downside of Pawmot immediately being forced out after using the move. Ice Punch allows Pawmot to deal decent damage to Ground-types that resist both its STAB moves, notably OHKOing both Landorus formes as well as 2HKOing both Iron Leaves and Clodsire. Volt Switch allows Pawmot to pivot out of a check such as Amoonguss into one of its teammates to deal with it. Play Rough and Seed Bomb are usable alternatives, with Play Rough being able to 2HKO Sableye while still hitting Dragon-types and Seed Bomb dealing with Water/Ground types that most Electric-type Pokemon cannot handle efficiently. Notably, Seed Bomb OHKOes specially defensive Gastrodon and 2HKOes physically defensive Quagsire. Grass Knot can also be used, being able to 2HKO Quagsire as well as Great Tusk.

Sandy Shocks provides great hazard support to wear down incoming foes for Pawmot to take advantage of. Ground-immune Pokemon such as Zapdos and Rotom-W are appreciated by Pawmot, being able to switch into an anticipated Ground-type attack from the likes of Great Tusk and Landorus-T. Zapdos can also threaten Grass-types such as Amoonguss, while Rotom-W together with Pawmot can overwhelm Quagsire. In return, Pawmot can revive one of them so it can continue checking Ground-types when needed. Regieleki provides hazard removal and a fast pivot for Electric teams, and in return it appreciates Ground-types being lured in and removed by Seed Bomb Pawmot variants. Assault Vest Iron Hands is another great teammate, being able to switch into attacks that could OHKO Pawmot such as Dragapult's Draco Meteor and Enamorus's Moonblast. Iron Hands can also OHKO the latter when running Heavy Slam. In return, Pawmot can run Seed Bomb to handle Water/Ground types Iron Hands cannot efficiently threaten such as Quagsire, and Swords Dance variants of Iron Hands appreciate it removing Flutter Mane and wearing down Sableye. Magnezone is a great partner, being able to threaten the Fairy-types that can threaten Pawmot such as Hatterene and Flutter Mane.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive Utility.description:
• Pawmot separates itself from Iron Hands by having an excellent support movepool and a good Speed tier.

  • Double Shock and Close Combat: Double Shock and Close Combat are its most important attacks, but note that it can only use Double Shock once without Terastallizing. Once Terastillized, Pawmot you can use Double Shock continuously for big damage, even on foes that resist it.

  • Mach Punch: Priority allows Pawmot to revenge kill better, hitting Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Iron Bundle super effectively.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Pawmot coverage against Ground-types, most notably Great Tusk, Clodsire, and Garchomp, in addition to hitting Dragonite for lots of damage before it Terastallizes.

  • Revival Blessing: Revival Blessing's one shot of reviving a teammate gives Pawmot an extremely unique niche in turning battles around, though it doesn't fit all offensive teams.

  • Nuzzle: This is notably one of the few ways to inflict paralysis on Gholdengo. Nuzzle is best when used with a Focus Sash, as Pawmot can paralyze the foe and outspeed it the next turn, getting another move off before it faints.

  • Encore: Encore does a great job of punishing passive play, and prevents easy setup from slower defensive foes such as Garganacl.

Other Options

  • Fake Out: This can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Situational: Terastallizing is only needed if Pawmot is on the field long enough for repeated uses of Double Shock.

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge.

  • Fake Out can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-o-Wisp from Skeledirge.

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

Tidy Up.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Wish.description:
Dachsbun is the best Wish passer in PU. Its great typing and decent overall bulk give it ample opportunity to keep itself and its teammates healthy while checking threats like Gabite and Alolan Persian. Well-Baked Body also lets Dachsbun switch into Fire-types like Charizard and Houndoom as well as absorb Will-O-Wisp from Misdreavus and Charizard, all of which threaten other Wish passers like Leafeon. Body Press prevents Steel-types from walling Dachsbun and also gets stronger if Well-Baked Body has already been triggered. Play Rough is good coverage alongside Body Press and hits Misdreavus, but Roar can be used instead to force setup sweepers like Gogoat and Carbink out as well as rack up chip damage if entry hazards are up. Copycat can be used to copy entry hazards from Pokemon like Whiscash as well as beat certain setup sweepers like Iron Defense Carbink one-on-one. Tera Steel lets Dachsbun absorb Steel- and Poison-type attacks and gives it an edge against Pokemon such as Sludge Bomb Houndoom, Articuno, and Indeedee-F. Dachsbun can run 64 Speed EVs to outspeed neutral-natured Honchkrow at the cost of some bulk. Dachsbun can also opt for a physically defensive spread to better take on Pokemon like Lycanroc-N and, after Terastallizing, Zangoose.

Dachsbun fits best on balance teams in need of cleric support and a blanket check to various offensive threats. Pokemon like Gabite, Mareanie, and Tinkatuff can check Steel- and Poison-types like Alolan Dugtrio and Skuntank for Dachsbun, and they appreciate Dachsbun coming to their aid against foes such as Articuno and Pyroar. Charizard is another great partner that switches into Steel-types like Perrserker and non-Rock Slide Alolan Dugtrio and can do so repeatedly thanks to the Wishes Dachsbun passes. Setup sweepers like Rotom-F and Gogoat find it easier to boost multiple times in a game with Dachsbun keeping them healthy. Wish support also gives Gogoat an easier time preserving Milk Drink's limited PP, which allows it to play more recklessly early on against threats that Dachsbun baits in, such as Basculin. In return, these setup sweepers make up for Dachsbun's passivity and can threaten out nuisances like Vespiquen and Whiscash. Misdreavus can spread burns to give Dachsbun an easier time against physical attackers like Crabominable and slow opposing walls down with Taunt. Meanwhile, Dachsbun can stand up to Fire-types like non-Tera Steel Charizard, check Dark-types like Alolan Persian and Honchkrow, and reduce Misdreavus's reliance on Pain Split for recovery.

Choice Specs.description:
Giga Drain is a backup Grass STAB move that also keeps Arboliva healthy, but Dazzling Gleam 2HKOes specially defensive Appletun and also hits Trevenant for neutral damage. 92 Speed EVs allow Arboliva to outrun uninvested base 50s like Muk and Perrserker. Tera Poison offers key resistances to Poison and Fighting, letting Arboliva more easily trade with Hisuian Sneasel, Passimian, and Muk. Tera Ground still lets Arboliva resist Poison while also strengthening Earth Power and letting it block Volt Switch. Tera Normal allows Hyper Voice to 2HKO Muk and Articuno and also eliminates almost all of Arboliva’s weaknesses.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Defensive.description:
Earth Power targets Poison-, Steel-, and Fire-types like Skuntank, Tera Steel Appletun, and Pyroar. Giga Drain can be used instead to improve Arboliva’s longevity and also hit Rotom. Protect lets Arboliva scout moves and gives it free recovery from Leftovers, Leech Seed, or Grassy Terrain. Substitute protects Arboliva from status conditions and lets it exploit passive Pokemon like Whiscash and Naclstack. Alternatively, a specially defensive set with a Calm nature can be used to improve Arboliva’s matchup against threats like Trick Room Spiritomb.

Tera Poison lets Arboliva beat Poison- and Fighting-types like Weezing, Hisuian Sneasel, and Passimian one-on-one. Seed Sower summoning Grassy Terrain also mitigates the added Ground weakness that comes with this choice. Tera Water is an alternative that especially helps against Fire- and Ice-type attacks from the likes of Charizard and Rotom-F.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Physically Defensive (Normal).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Assault Vest.description:
• With a superb special stat line, Seed Sower, and good moveset coverage, Arboliva can be a deceptively strong and long-living Assault Vest user!

  • Seed Sower: Once activated, Grassy Terrain’s passive recovery and boosting of Grass-type attacks like Giga Drain can help Arboliva survive longer than expected. Grassy Terrain also halving Earthquake’s power is greatly appreciated by bulky teammates like Skeledirge, Arcanine, and Iron Hands.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This move keeps Arboliva from becoming setup bait against foes like offensive Dragonite, and is also your best move into Wo-Chien before Tera.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast is a great option for hitting types that Arboliva lacks natural coverage for. Tera Fire lets Arboliva hit Steel-types like Scizor and Tera Electric punishes Tera Flying users like Gholdengo. Both Tera Fire and Tera Electric cover Corviknight as well.

  • Mirror Coat: This set’s massive special bulk can make getting one-shots with Mirror Coat awkward, but it is still a great option, particularly against boosted or super effective hits. Bear in mind though that this won’t work against Chi-Yu as long as it keeps its Dark typing.

  • Leaf Storm: Leaf Storm trades consistency for a single turn of high burst damage and can be worth it if investing in Special Attack.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Arboliva’s raw special stats make it capable of tanking super effective hits without using Tera. Nonetheless, Tera is still a strong tool to extend Arboliva’s uptime and contest matchups that would otherwise capitalize on its mediocre defensive typing.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can flip matchups against Focus Sash Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu when healthy. If running Tera Blast, it also gives Arboliva the opportunity to contest Steel-types more effectively. Be aware, though, that this significantly worsens other key matchups, like Rotom-W.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a solid defensive option, especially into Toxic abusers like Toxapex and Clodsire. Notably, it flips several weaknesses, blocks Toxic, and allows for absorbing Toxic Spikes later in the match.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is Gholdengo's worst nightmare. It gives a resistance to Make It Rain, blocks Thunder Wave from defensive sets, and punishes Tera Flying usage that is meant to get around Earth Power. On top of that, Arboliva still hits Corviknight very hard.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is another great defensive option for neutralizing most of Arboliva's weaknesses, and the extra power behind Dazzling Gleam can make it easier to break defensive Dragonite variants.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Arboliva’s Fighting weakness while maintaining Spore immunity, letting it check Breloom. If both Tera and Grassy Terrain are active, Modest Giga Drain can even 2HKO Breloom!

  • Ground: While not as strong defensively, invested Tera Earth Power can OHKO uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 124 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This spread balances bulk and power, avoiding the 2HKO from Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain and almost always surviving Modest Chi-Yu’s Fire Blast before Tera! If running Tera Ground, there are enough Special Attack EV’s to turn Earth Power into an OHKO against uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo. The Speed EV's Speed tie with 4 Speed Gastrodon.

  • 236 HP / 252 SpA / 20 SpD with Modest: This simple spread still provides plenty of bulk while maximizing Special Attack, working nicely with Leaf Storm and Tera Types that boost Arboliva's coverage moves. If Grassy Terrain is present, fully invested Leaf Storm has a 75% chance of OHKOing 4 Special Defense Garchomp. The bulk investment lets Arboliva always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire after Grassy Terrain recovery.

  • 236 HP / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: While maximum Speed investment may seem a bit strange, it can be worth it when running Tera Fire Tera Blast to get the jump on Scizor, Corviknight and the rare Timid Amoonguss.

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 148 SpA / 20 SpD / 100 Spe with Modest: This alternative Speed spread gives Arboliva a nice boost in Special Attack while still letting it outrun 4 Speed Azumarill. This is usually more than enough Speed to outrun Ting-Lu as well.

Curse.description:
Curse Garganacl is a sturdy wall that can spread passive damage and boost to win in the long term. It can take hits from Dragapult, Zapdos, and Iron Moth as well as sit on passive walls like Toxapex, Clodsire, and non-Grass Knot Amoonguss, giving it plenty of opportunites to enter the field. In addition to letting it contest with Attack-boosting foes like Dragonite, Dragapult, and Roaring Moon, Curse boosts Salt Cure's initial damage to threaten Pokemon like Corviknight, which would otherwise exhaust Salt Cure's PP with Pressure. Curse also works well with Earthquake, breaking past Covert Cloak Gholdengo, non-Haze Toxapex, opposing Garganacl, and Skeledirge's Substitute. Stealth Rock is a viable alternative if the team lacks a Stealth Rock user, since Garganacl tends to force multiple switches with Salt Cure and can outlast and annoy common entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and Corviknight. Tera Water lets it take on Kingambit, Gholdengo, Azumarill, and rain teams better, while Tera Fairy improves its matchup against Dragapult, Great Tusk, and Meowscarada, the latter of which can bypass Garganacl's boosts with Flower Trick. The EV spread prevents a 2HKO from offensive Great Tusk's Close Combat or Headlong Rush after Curse, even after its Leftovers is removed by Knock Off.

Curse Garganacl is a valuable asset for balance teams. Defensive teammates such as Corviknight, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Clodsire cover threats like Great Tusk, Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Gholdengo, respectively. Skeledirge in return appreciates Garganacl switching into Shadow Ball from Dragapult and Hisuian Zoroark, with Tera Water variants dealing with Gholdengo and Water-types as well, while Ting-Lu and Clodsire are secondary checks to Dragapult, Heatran, and Iron Moth, which keeps Garganacl moderately healthy early-game so it can have an easier time sweeping later on. Knock Off users such as Great Tusk and Meowscarada are crucial to remove Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots from Pokemon like Amoonguss, Clodsire, Gholdengo, Corviknight, and Slowking. Great Tusk, Meowscarada, Toxapex, and Clodsire can also set entry hazards of their own, either allowing Garganacl to forgo Stealth Rock or forming an entry hazard stacking core. Offensive teammates like Dragapult and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Meowscarada are great against offensive teams that contain the likes of Dragonite and Roaring Moon—which can overwhelm Garganacl prior to boosting—and can clean up late-game in case Garganacl is unable to fully sweep. In return, Garganacl matches up well against defensive foes that they struggle with, such as Clodsire and Toxapex, especially with Dragapult bringing it into them safely via U-turn.

Stealth Rock.description:
Garganacl is a great Stealth Rock setter thanks to its fantastic bulk, longevity with Recover, and ability to easily force switches against Great Tusk and outlast Defog Corviknight one-on-one. Protect alongside Salt Cure wears down entry hazard removal options such as Great Tusk and especially Corviknight due to its limited Roost PP and typing's vulnerability to Salt Cure. Protect also scouts out the intentions of Choice locked Pokemon such as Gholdengo and gives extra Leftovers recovery. Terastallization, lets Garganacl turn the tables on Great Tusk and Iron Treads lacking Iron Head, and makes it an incredibly consistent Stealth Rock setter. Specifically, Tera Fairy lets it completely wall Dragapult, while Tera Water lets it check Gholdengo, though this makes its matchup against opposing Garganacl much tougher. 116 Special Defense EVs let Garganacl take a Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Tera Dragon Dragapult at full health.

Garganacl fits on a wide variety of teams from bulky offense to stall thanks to it setting up Stealth Rock easily and having fantastic longevity. Ting-Lu is a fantastic partner since it can lay Spikes, and check Gholdengo and unboosted Kingambit, and wear down Corviknight much faster with Ruination thanks to Garganacl running Stealth Rock. Meowscarada and Great Tusk provide Knock Off support by removing Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak from Gholdengo and Toxapex to let Garganacl accrue Salt Cure damage more freely. Great Tusk also removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Gholdengo appreciates Great Tusk being worn down, since it shuts down other forms of entry hazard control well and fits alongside Garganacl and other entry hazard setters such as Garchomp. Cinderace lures in and uses U-turn on bulky Water-types such as Dondozo and Toxapex, giving Garganacl free entry to pressure them with Salt Cure.

Iron Defense.description:
The combination of Iron Defense + Body Press lets Garganacl serve as a bulky and dangerous setup sweeper, allowing it to beat Pokemon it otherwise loses to, such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit. Salt Cure wears down common switch-ins such as Great Tusk, Gholdengo, Rotom-W, and Hatterene, as well as passive Pokemon like Toxapex and Corviknight, and forces them to burn recovery PP more often. Recover keeps Garganacl healthy throughout a game to check Pokemon like Ceruledge and Iron Moth and makes it more sustainable as a wincon. Purifying Salt prevents it from being crippled by Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Clodsire. It also provides a handy Ghost resistance, letting Garganacl potentially switch in on predicted Ghost-type moves from Pokemon like Dragapult and Skeledirge. Leftovers provides valuable passive recovery, reducing Garganacl's reliance on Recover. Maximum Special Defense EVs and a Careful nature maximize Garganacl's bulk, making it easier for Garganacl to switch in on Pokemon such as Dragapult, Zapdos, and Heatran and use them as setup fodder. Tera Water provides incredibly valuable resistances, letting Garganacl potentially check Gholdengo and Scizor while retaining its ability to pivot in on Fire-types like Cinderace. Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to turn the tables on Great Tusk while also preventing Breloom from revenge killing it. However, this does remove its resistance to Fire, making it more susceptible to Pokemon like Skeledirge and Ceruledge. Tera Ghost prevents Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk from reliably revenge killing Garganacl, letting it use them as setup fodder. It does negate the Ghost resistance provided by Purifying Salt, however, so another switch-in to Dragapult's Shadow Ball should be used.

Checks to strong wallbreakers like Iron Valiant and Breloom are good teammates; examples include the likes of Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. While Garganacl is given a Ghost resistance from Purifying Salt, it cannot fully check Dragapult and Gholdengo prior to Terastallization, with the latter completely countering it if it uses Covert Cloak. As such, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire make for great teammates. Pokemon like Corviknight and Scizor appreciate Garganacl checking Fire-types like Ceruledge and Skeledirge. Corviknight is notable in that it also forms a strong defensive core with Garganacl, checking Meowscarada for it. Entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and the aforementioned Corviknight are appreciated, as Garganacl is heavily pressured by entry hazards and cannot set up reliably if it is worn down. Frail, offensive Pokemon like Cinderace appreciate chip damage being forced onto their checks and having a strong defensive Pokemon to fall back on. Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Iron Valiant can pave the way for Garganacl to clean late-game, wearing down or significantly pressuring its checks in Gholdengo, Meowscarada, and Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk.

IronPress.description:
Garganacl eases the Water and Steel matchups thanks to its signature move, Salt Cure. Iron Defense allows Garganacl to set up, tanking super effective physical hits due to its astronomical base 130 Defense, while also boosting the power of Body Press, which helps nail Dark- and Steel-types such as Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Kingambit. Curse is another option that can buff its Attack, boosting the damage of Salt Cure, but it prevents Garganacl from easily stonewalling physical attackers—such as Dragonite and defensive Quaquaval—and also lowers Garganacl's Speed. Salt Cure is a fantastic STAB move, neutering setup sweepers such as Mimikyu, Corviknight, and Hatterene, as it puts them on a timer, which Garganacl can potentially stall out as it sets up or heals via Recover. Purifying Salt is particularly useful, as it allows Garganacl to absorb incoming status moves such as Toxic from Quagsire or Toxapex as well as Will-O-Wisp from Dragapult or Sableye and punish them with Salt Cure. Garganacl is also able to tank Ghost-type STAB moves from the likes of Choice-locked Flutter Mane and Dragapult. Leftovers is the best item to provide passive recovery; however, Heavy-Duty Boots can allow Garganacl to come in without taking entry hazard damage, as entry hazard stacking is extremely common. As an alternative to the given EVs, 52 Defense EVs with an Impish nature let Garganacl potentially overwhelm Choice Band Scizor, Tinkaton, and defensive Quaquaval if used with Iron Defense.

Tyranitar is an amazing partner for Garganacl, as it sets sand. Tyranitar can also be used as one of the few special attackers Rock teams have access to to nail physical walls such as Great Tusk with Ice Beam; it is also Rock's best check to Kingambit due to it being able to survive a boosted Sucker Punch and OHKO back with Fire Blast. Choice Scarf Glimmora can take on Grass- and Fighting-types such as Breloom and Iron Valiant that may threaten Garganacl out. Glimmora also has fantastic coverage, being able to take on Steel-types such as Gholdengo with Earth Power and Water-types such as Gastrodon and Quagsire with Energy Ball. Glimmora can also provide Toxic Spikes support thanks to its ability, Toxic Debris, which can help Garganacl further wear down and pressure the opposing Pokemon. Teammates that utilize Air Balloon such as Iron Thorns and Drednaw can switch into powerful Ground-type attacks aimed at Garganacl. Drednaw can also utilize its Water-type STAB move to take out opposing Ground-types such as Iron Treads, Unaware Clodsire, and Ting-Lu. Furthermore, Drednaw can also turn the tide against rain Water teams thanks to its ability, Swift Swim. Lycanroc-D is also a really good partner for Garganacl that appreciates its ability to wear down foes so it can clean up late-game. Coalossal is also a good partner that can not only burn foes but also lay down entry hazards. Coalossal can also clear its side of the field as well with Rapid Spin, alleviating chip damage on the team. It also acts as a soft check to Scizor and Meowscarada due to its neutralities and can potentially neuter them with Flame Body.

IronPress Sweeper.description:
• Purifying Salt protects Garganacl from status moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Rotom-W's Will-O-Wisp.

  • The EV spread slightly optimizes Special Defense and helps Garganacl against special attackers like Armarouge and Hydreigon. Garganacl isn't outspeeding much of anything, so it might as well aim to underspeed opposing Trick Room Pokemon; minimum Speed lets Garganacl Speed tie Mudsdale while easily underspeeding Kingambit and Hariyama.

  • Tera Ghost gives Garganacl an immunity to Fighting and leaves it with effectively just one weakness, since Purifying Salt halves the power of Ghost-type attacks. Tera Grass prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Garganacl's Body Press via Rage Powder, and its Water and Electric resistances are helpful against Rotom-W. Tera Steel gives Garganacl a plethora of resistances like Dragon, Grass, Fairy, and Steel, which are helpful against Pokemon like Hydreigon, Meowscarada, Gholdengo, and Sylveon, and it makes Garganacl immune to Amoonguss's Clear Smog.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Defensive.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Iron Defense and Body Press: Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure: Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Rock has a huge amount of weaknesses as a defensive typing, so Garganacl will usually want to Terastallize to make sweeping more feasible.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers. Note that Curse will no longer boost Garganacl's stats when Terastallized.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Garganacl's chances of defeating Gholdengo and Chien-Pao, thanks to no longer being weak to Make It Rain or Sacred Sword.

  • Flying: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on new foes such as Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, Garchomp, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet, though it makes Garganacl fairly weak to Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao

  • Fairy: Fairy is a fantastic defensive type for Garganacl, giving it a useful Fighting and Dark resistance to help against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and no longer worrying about powerful Dragon-type attacks.

  • Poison: While Garganacl isn't worried about Toxic Spikes itself, it can make an emergency worthy absorber of them with Tera Poison, while also dealing with Fighting-type coverage much better.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type stops Amoonguss from clearing its boosts with Clear Smog and makes Garganacl a decent check to Fairy-types such as offensive Mimikyu and Substitute + Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: If using Tera Flying Garganacl, maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

Salty Stall.description:
• With some entry hazard support, this Garganacl can be very difficult to outstall, thanks to the constant passive damage from Salt Cure.

  • Protect: Not only does Protect scout for surprise Tera types, but it also goes well with the passive healing from Leftovers.

  • Substitute: This makes Garganacl even more difficult to properly switch into, providing protection against Trick, OHKO moves, and opposing Salt Cure.

  • Fissure: Garganacl's great bulk makes it a prime candidate for fishing with Fissure itself, though its low PP can be an issue in mirror matches.

  • Stealth Rock: Since this set benefits so much from Stealth Rock support, running it on its own is a reasonable sacrifice if Garganacl needs to be more self-sufficient.

Other Options

  • Fling with Light Ball, Toxic Orb, or Flame Orb: Although the loss of Leftovers can be a huge blow for Garganacl, Fling and its associated status inducing items can be a devastating surprise for some of its checks, such as Annihilape and Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Rock may be an awful defensive typing, this Garganacl complete focus on taking advantage of Salt Cure means that in some scenarios, it can get away without Terastallizing.

  • Ghost: While removing Purifying Salt's Ghost resistance is a shame, Tera Ghost does wonderfully against Corviknight, Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and opposing Garganacl due to the Body Press immunity, and in general removes all of Garganacl's common weaknesses.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Garganacl a better matchup against Chien-Pao and Gholdengo, in addition to being an excellent defensive typing.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gets rid of the Ground and Fighting weaknesses, giving it a far better chance of beating Great Tusk and Garchomp. It also makes Fissure no longer an issue from Ting-Lu, Dondozo, and opposing Garganacl.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy lets Garganacl tank powerful Fighting coverage such as Chien-Pao's Scared Sword, and shrug off powerful Dragon-type attacks from Garchomp and Dragonite.
