Bulky Pivot.description: 184 Speed allows you to outspeed Hisuian Arcanine, to allow you to freely U-turn for Toxic Chain chances against it.152 Speed allows you to underspeed Moltres and Moltres-Galar for slow U-turns against them, while still outspeeding Rotom-W to prevent it freely using Volt Switch for free damage.

Swords Dance.description: Ogerpon, similar to its masked counterparts, occupies a niche as a Swords Dance wallbreaker and sweeper, but with a few tricks up its sleeve. Ogerpon’s unique Speed boost upon Terastallizing and ability to hold an item give it more potential to clean through a weakened team while outrunning common revenge killers such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Kartana. However, Ogerpon faces stiff competition from other offensive Grass-types such as Rillaboom and Kartana, as well as the other Ogerpon formes that possess a beneficial dual typing and an automatic 1.2x boost to their attacks. Superpower allows Ogerpon to wreak havoc on defensive cores using Ferrothorn and Heatran as Grass-type switch-ins, scoring a clean OHKO on Heatran and heavily denting physically defensive Ferrothorn after a Swords Dance. Meadow Plate is the item of choice, OHKOing Gliscor after Swords Dance with Stealth Rock chip, as well as potentially OHKOing Toxapex after Tera Grass and Swords Dance. Knock Off is Ogerpon's strongest option to hit Tornadus-T, Moltres, Zapdos, and Galarian Slowking. Additionally, Defiant leverages Landorus-T's Intimidate against it; however, its poor matchup versus Defog users such as Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Corviknight render it unable to effectively switch in on Defog attempts and activate Defiant. Teammates that match up effectively into these aforementioned Defog users, such as Ting Lu, Mega Tyranitar, and Gliscor, serve as quality teammates, with Mega Tyranitar in particular being able to chip these foes into range of Ogerpon's attacks. Skarmory and Corviknight are also major roadblocks for Ogerpon, so teammates that can switch into them and force progress like Zapdos and Heatran make for effective teammates.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Water

Power Whip can be run over Horn Leech. Although this sacrifices its longevity, it now has extra power to be able to deal with several Pokemon Horn Leech usually struggles against. Notably, Power Whip 2HKOes Hatterene and bulky Garchomp. Taunt can also be run to prevent several walls, such as Skeledirge and Sableye, from impeding its wallbreaking through status, thus giving Ogerpon-W a better matchup against them. Aside from this, Taunt gives Ogerpon-W a hand in its matchup against Toxapex, and it can set up freely in front of Ting-Lu and Empoleon without fearing phazing. Encore is another option to let Ogerpon-W exploit setup attempts from sweepers such as Kingambit and Manaphy.

Swords Dance (Water).description:
Ogerpon-W is a strong wallbreaker on Water teams by virtue of its access to Swords Dance combined with a damage multiplier from Wellspring Mask. Apart from this, its part Grass typing grants it a neutrality to Electric and Grass, which helps in matchups against foes such as Assault Vest Iron Hands and Thundurus-T. Aside from this, its ability makes it great in the Water mirror matchup, since it is able to switch safely into Manaphy without fearing burn from Scald. Its Water-type Ivy Cudgel is able to 2HKO Corviknight after a Swords Dance. Horn Leech allows Ogerpon-W access to some form of longevity, with the potential to recover a good amount of HP after a Swords Dance. It notably 2HKOes Rotom-W without a Swords Dance boost and 2HKOes Toxapex after one, which most Water-types struggle against; however, it has to be wary of the former carrying Will-O-Wisp. Play Rough grants Ogerpon-W coverage against the Dragon-types that resist both its STAB moves, such as Baxcalibur and Kommo-o, while Trailblaze allows it to outpace the likes of Chien-Pao and unboosted Iron Valiant after it is used once. Knock Off grants Ogerpon-W some degree of utility, being able to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Dragonite and Amoonguss to make them more vulnerable to entry hazards; it also hits Sinistcha and Brambleghast, which resist both of Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

Hisuian Samurott and Empoleon make for good partners for Ogerpon-W, as the two of them are able to stack hazards to make Ogerpon-W's wallbreaking easier. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott is also able to outspeed and remove faster threats to Ogerpon-W like Chien-Pao and Dragapult, while Empoleon can bring it in safely with Flip Turn, wall Alolan Ninetales, and provide a neutrality to Freeze-Dry. In return, Hisuian Samurott appreciates Ogerpon-W breaking through Corviknight, while Empoleon benefits from the removal of Great Tusk. Pelipper makes for another great teammate for Ogerpon-W, setting up rain to strengthen Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel. Aside from rain, Pelipper can pivot into Ogerpon-W via U-turn and threaten Hisuian Lilligant and Amoonguss with Hurricane. Entry hazards from the likes of Gastrodon, Toxapex, and Quagsire can wear down incoming foes for Ogerpon-W to take advantage of. Quagsire can also remove setup sweepers that can outspeed and threaten Ogerpon-W out like Dragonite and Baxcalibur thanks to a combination of Unaware and Toxic, while Toxapex is able to serve as a wall against the likes of Chien-Pao and Meowscarada. As Ogerpon-W struggles with certain bulky Pokemon, such as Galarian Weezing and Zamazenta, it appreciates teammates that can either remove them or wear them down for Ogerpon-W to finish off, such as boosted Manaphy for the former and Basculegion-F under rain for the latter. Urshifu-R pairs well with Ogerpon-W, as it can break bulky Steel-types such as Hisuian Goodra and Empoleon. Lastly, Toxapex and Amoonguss can stop any Ogerpon-W wallbreaking attempts; hence, Choice Specs users such as Walking Wake and Greninja make for great partners.

Swords Dance.description: A complementary typing and a great Attack stat, especially when considering the 1.2x boost from its Wellspring Mask, give Ogerpon-W a niche as a powerful wallbreaker. Water- and Grass-type attacks hit most Pokemon for at least neutral damage, and after a Swords Dance boost, anything that doesn't resist its STAB combination is KOed. Even checks such as Baxcalibur and Tera Grass Heatran struggle to take a Swords Dance-bolstered Ivy Cudgel, and some of the stoutest walls, such as Toxapex, take heavy damage from a boosted Power Whip. Ivy Cudgel is its strongest Water-type STAB option and hits most Pokemon for neutral damage. Power Whip punishes common Water-resistant Pokemon such as Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Alomomola and is preferred to Wood Hammer despite the potential inaccuracy to avoid recoil. Horn Leech can also be used in order to supplement Ogerpon-W's longevity and let it come in more often. Trailblaze is another niche option, usually seen on Aurora Veil or dual screens hyper offense teams, boosting Ogerpon-W's Speed and allowing it to sweep. Play Rough notably hits Dragon-types that otherwise could resist Ogerpon-W's STAB combination such as Baxcalibur and Dragonite. Superpower is another great option, notably KOing Ferrothorn after a Swords Dance boost. Due to its great wallbreaking capability, setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Booster Energy Iron Valiant appreciate defensive cores being heavily weakened, allowing them to sweep. Water Absorb is a particularly useful ability prior to Terastallizing, as Ogerpon-W can find opportunities to set up on Pokemon such as Mega Swampert and Manaphy, as well as block Alomomola's Flip Turn. Ogerpon-W also appreciates entry hazards from Hisuian Samurott and Landorus-T, as the chip helps it pressure defensive cores even further. Despite all this, bulky Grass-types such as Ferrothorn, Amoonguss, and Kartana can check Ogerpon-W, so Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Mega Medicham, and Zapdos are beneficial as teammates. Ogerpon-W is also threatened by faster attackers like Iron Valiant and Mega Lopunny, so defensive pivots such as Landorus-T, Galarian Slowking, and Mega Scizor are also extremely useful. Despite being locked to Tera Water, this is actually very beneficial to Ogerpon-W, taking away its weaknesses to Flying- and Poison-type attacks and letting it stay in on threats such as Tornadus-T and Sneasler. In addition, Tera Water boosts its Ivy Cudgel to stupendous amounts, 2HKOing Ferrothorn after Stealth Rock and minimal chip at +2. The 1.5x Special Defense boost granted upon Terastallizing can also help mitigate attempts to revenge kill Ogerpon-W by foes like Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Ogerpon-W's great support movepool and Embody Aspect's Special Defense boost give it the opportunity to face premier special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Ursaluna-B, and Gholdengo head on.

  • Horn Leech: Horn Leech's recovery can help maintain Ogerpon-W's defensive profile without compromising its offenses.

  • Substitute: Substitute has great synergy alongside Ogerpon-W's other support moves, especially Leech Seed. It's also useful for blocking Toxic from Gliscor, which coupled with Ogerpon-W's Ground resistance allows it to heavily disrupt Gliscor's attempts to cripple foes.

  • Leech Seed: Due to being forced to run Wellspring Mask, Ogerpon-W misses passive recovery from items such as Leftovers, making Leech Seed a solid option for recovery alongside Synthesis.

  • Encore: Locking targets into an undesirable move can discourage setup attempts and passive play and allow opportunities for healing.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 4 Def / 188 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful: This spread aims to maximize Ogerpon-W's special bulk, and it outspeeds positive nature base 70 Speed foes such as Jolly Breloom and neutral nature base 85 Speed foes such as Rillaboom.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-W is locked into a Water Tera type. When it Terastallizes, Water Absorb becomes Embody Aspect. This forme's Embody Aspect boosts Special Defense, making it essentially like an Assault Vest without the downsides, which can be key to taking strong hits such as those from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane and Tera Normal Ursaluna-B.

Swords Dance (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Ogerpon-H can opt to run Power Whip over Horn Leech. With Power Whip, Ogerpon-H is able to OHKO Toxapex after a Swords Dance boost and Stealth Rock support. However, Ogerpon-H sacrifices its longevity by running Power Whip. Knock Off is also an option in the fourth slot to threaten Skeledirge and remove Heavy-Duty Boots from Baxcalibur and Dragonite to make them susceptible to Stealth Rock; however, it leaves Ogerpon-H susceptible to Dragon-types and faster revenge killers without Play Rough and Trailblaze, respectively.

Grass

Knock Off can be used in order to provide coverage against Skeledirge while also removing key items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Dragonite and Pelipper. Power Whip with Rillaboom support can be used to OHKO Toxapex with Grassy Terrain and minimal chip damage.

Swords Dance (Fire).description:
Ogerpon-H makes a terrifying wallbreaker on Fire teams with access to Swords Dance in conjunction with the damage multiplier from Hearthflame Mask. Apart from this, its part Grass typing allows Ogerpon-H to match up well against various Water-, Rock-, and Ground-types such as Dondozo, Garganacl, and Great Tusk. With Hearthflame Mask, Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel becomes a Fire-type move capable of 2HKOing Baxcalibur and Clodsire without a Swords Dance boost while also breaking through sturdy walls such as Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Galarian Weezing after a Swords Dance boost. With Horn Leech, Ogerpon-H has access to some form of recovery especially against the Ground-types that most Fire-types tend to struggle against such as Ursaluna-B and Gastrodon. Play Rough allows Ogerpon-H to threaten the Dragon-types that take little from its STAB moves, OHKOing Kommo-o without a Swords Dance boost and OHKOing tanky Garchomp after a Swords Dance boost. On the other hand, Trailblaze allows Ogerpon-H to outspeed Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane after it is used once.

Ninetales and Torkoal are key teammates for Ogerpon-H, as they set up sun to boost Ogerpon-H's damage from Ivy Cudgel to devastating levels. Notably, it is able to 2HKO Gliscor under sun without a Swords Dance boost. Torkoal is also able to set up Stealth Rock to weaken foes, putting them in OHKO range from Ogerpon-H's attacks. Ogerpon-H appreciates forms of entry hazard removal such as Cinderace's Court Change, Torkoal's Rapid Spin, and Talonflame's Defog. Court Change is notable, since it can possibly gain dual screens placed by foes such as Klefki and Alolan Ninetales, although it is best used when any hazards are not on the opponent's side of the field. Ogerpon-H struggles with certain walls such as Toxapex, so it appreciates Heatran being able to trap and eliminate it with Earth Power. In return, Ogerpon-H is able to threaten Ground-types Heatran struggles with such as Ting-Lu. Volcanion and Hisuian Arcanine make for great partners, as they are able to check various offensive Pokemon Ogerpon-H struggles with. Volcanion, with its immunity Water and its great bulk, checks the likes of Azumarill and Greninja, while Hisuian Arcanine is able to revenge kill sweepers like Dragonite and Baxcalibur. Lastly, Ogerpon-H's wallbreaking allows it to enable sweeps from Ceruledge and Volcarona, with the former appreciating Great Tusk's removal, while the latter appreciates Dondozo's removal.

Swords Dance (Grass).description:
Ogerpon-H is an invaluable asset on Grass teams. With Swords Dance and the damage bonus from Hearthflame Mask, Ogerpon-H serves as a strong wallbreaker, and its Fire typing also gives Grass teams a hand in both the Steel and Ice matchups. Aside from this, its access to Mold Breaker allows it to bypass abilities such as Heatran's Flash Fire, Dondozo's Unaware, and Dragonite's Multiscale. With Hearthflame Mask, Ivy Cudgel turns into a powerful Fire-type move, and combined with its Speed, Ogerpon-H is able to beat the likes of Alolan Ninetales and Corviknight before a Swords Dance boost, as well as Hisuian Goodra after. Horn Leech grants Ogerpon-H some form of longevity. Play Rough allows Ogerpon-H to threaten the likes of Kommo-o, and after a Swords Dance Boost, it can 2HKO Dragonite. Alternatively, Trailblaze gives Ogerpon-H potential as a sweeper. After one Trailblaze, Ogerpon-H outspeeds the likes of Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Greninja. Lastly, with Zen Headbutt, Ogerpon-H can surprise would-be switch-ins such as Toxapex, Clodsire, and Iron Moth.

Entry hazard support from the likes of Brambleghast and Toedscruel is appreciated to wear down foes into OHKO range from Ogerpon-H. Notably, Ogerpon-H has a chance to OHKO Kingambit with one layer of Spikes. The two of them also have access to Rapid Spin, allowing them to remove hazards so that Ogerpon-H has more opportunities to switch in without getting worn down. Toedscruel can also take Fire-type attacks from Iron Moth and KO it back, while Brambleghast can switch into a predicted Flying-type move as well as revenge kill Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak. Amoonguss is another great teammate, as its bulk and access to Spore allow it to either incapacitate or force out foes such as Dragonite. Choice Scarf Meowscarada outspeeds and removes potential threats to Ogerpon-H like Spectrier and faster Dragon-types, and it can bring Ogerpon-H in safely. Ogerpon-H's wallbreaking enables sweepers such as Hisuian Liligant and Torterra. In return, the two of them can handle foes Ogerpon-H struggles with, such as Landorus for the former and Toxapex for the latter. Rillaboom is a great revenge killer and wallbreaker to pair with Ogerpon-H, as with Grassy Glide, it can remove faster threats such as Flutter Mane and Hoopa-U. Aside from this, Rillaboom also provides Grassy Terrain to boost the power of Ogerpon-H's Grass-type moves. In return, Rillaboom appreciates Ogerpon-H removing foes Rillaboom struggles with such as Corviknight and Articuno. Breloom is another great teammate, as due to its Fighting typing and access to Mach Punch, it can easily deal with Kingambit. Lastly, Abomasnow has some niche as a teammate, as it can set up Aurora Veil to make Ogerpon-H and its teammates harder to KO.

vgc2024.overview:
• With a solid stat spread, incredible damage output with Terastallization, a unique typing and access to utility such as Follow Me, Ogerpon-H can provide some unique assets to a team.

  • Ogerpon-H has a strong STAB combination that is only walled by Fire- and Dragon-types. Because of this, some of its best partners include Urshifu-R, Landorus and Flutter Mane, which are all powerful attackers that pair well with Ogerpon-H and enjoy Follow Me support. Another strong partner is Kingambit, which dissuades Intimidate from weakening Ogerpon-H, while Follow Me provides an opportunity for Swords Dance Kingambit to set up.

  • Ogerpon-H becomes an extremely powerful offensive threat once Terastallized, being able to OHKO metagame staples like Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, Rillaboom, and Landorus. Ogerpon-H also has a fantastic matchup against Amoonguss; not only is it able to completely ignore Amoongus's Spore and Rage Powder, but it is also able to OHKO it with Ivy Cudgel or with Wood Hammer should Amoonguss Terastallize into a Water-type. Additionally, Mystic Water variants of Urshifu-R get outsped and OHKOed.

  • Bad matchups for Ogerpon-H include Pokemon such as Entei and Raging Bolt that can wall its STAB combation. For this reason, as well as Intimidate hampering Ogerpon-H's offensive capabilities, Incineroar is a very stable check to it. Lastly, despite having solid bulk, powerful threats that can outspeed Ogerpon-H can OHKO it such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. However, with speed control or Fake Out support from Pokemon like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-H can take on Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Offensive.description:
• Horn Leech trades Wood Hammer's power for greater longevity.

  • Follow Me is by far the best third move on this Pokemon, but if the team does not require a redirector, Ogerpon-H can use Grassy Glide; if this is the case, it is almost always paired with Rillaboom to ensure Grassy Glide is a priority move. Alternatively, Stomping Tantrum allows it to hit opposing Fire-types such as Entei and Chi-Yu.

  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-H to outspeed Modest Landorus and Adamant Urshifu-R. The Attack EVs with the Adamant nature allow it to OHKO Flutter Mane after Terastallization even when Ogerpon-H is Intimidated.

  • The bulk investment allows Ogerpon-H to live most Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes while having a favorable roll to survive Timid Landorus's Sludge Bomb.

ALL STAR.description:
• With its great offensive presence and incredible ability in Mold Breaker, Ogerpon-H is one of the premier threats in Regulation E.

  • Ivy Cudgel: Ivy Cudgel offers a consistent STAB move with an elevated critical hit rate, allowing Ogerpon-H to power through even foes that resist Fire.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is good coverage for foes such as Dragonite and the Urshifu formes, as well as Pokemon that might try to use Tera Dragon to resist Ogerpon-H’s STAB combination.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off provides coverage and team support with its item removal, which also can help Ogerpon-H itself in sweeping, as removing pesky Ability Shields from foes such as Heatran will allow Ogerpon-H to make use of Mold Breaker.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance boosts Ogerpon-H’s Attack to frightening levels, and thanks to Mold Breaker, it cannot be ignored by the likes of Unaware Dondozo.

  • Horn Leech vs Trailblaze: Horn Leech provides a consistent Grass-type STAB move and a form of healing to assist in longevity; however, Trailblaze’s Speed boost can allow Ogerpon-H to take over games on the spot if given the chance.

Other Options

  • Encore: Ogerpon-H’s good Speed allows it to make decent use of encore to lock foes into utility moves, providing itself or its teammates turns to set up.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 100 Atk / 92 Def / 60 Spe with Adamant: This spread outspeeds Iron Bundle after Trailblaze while avoiding a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch; however, it will no longer outspeed Urshifu.

Tera Types

The Hearthflame Mask grants Ogerpon-H a Fire Tera type. When Ogerpon-H Terastallizes, it is given a new ability, Embody Aspect, Which boosts Ogerpon-H’s attack. However, it will no longer have access to Mold Breaker.

Swords Dance.description: Ogerpon-H is a strong wallbreaker that is able to beat many of the tier's premier walls, such as Corviknight, Scream Tail, and Great Tusk thanks to its high Attack, excellent STAB moves, and good Speed tier. Power Whip can be used to get massive damage on Ground- and Water-types, including securing the KO on Intimidate Quaquaval and physically defensive Great Tusk after Swords Dance, while Horn Leech can be run instead to give Ogerpon-H more longevity. Ogerpon-H has a number of options for its last moveslot, such as Play Rough to hit Kommo-o and Roaring Moon, OHKOing both after a Swords Dance, and Knock Off to cripple foes, especially switch-ins like Primordial Sea Zapdos, which gets 2HKOed after Stealth Rock, as well as 2HKOing Well-Baked Body Gholdengo with Sword of Ruin. Desolate Land provides the most power to Ivy Cudgel and lets Ogerpon-H offensively check Water-types like Manaphy and Barraskewda, while Sword of Ruin allows Play Rough to OHKO Kommo-o and 2HKO Garchomp. Due to its average defenses and lack of recovery if not running Horn Leech, Ogerpon-H benefits both from entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and Quaquaval and slow pivots like Corviknight and Empoleon that can get it on the field safely. Ogerpon-H also appreciates hazard setters like Garchomp and Heatran, which can chip down walls like Scream Tail for it to more easily KO.

Swords Dance (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance.description: With a good Speed tier, access to Sturdy, and a good offensive profile, Ogerpon-C cements itself as a solid option for hyper offense teams; it also fits on any team that can reliably keep entry hazards off the field, as Sturdy allows it to act as an emergency button when faced with a setup sweeper such as Volcarona or Mega Gyarados. However, Ogerpon-C should be mindful about using its Tera, as this removes its Sturdy for an arguably worse +1 Defense. Power Whip is used for its higher Base Power, which reduces Ogerpon-C's reliance on Swords Dance for immediate power, while Horn Leech trades damage for healing and reliability. Superpower allows Ogerpon-C to hit Ferrothorn, although this breaks Sturdy, along with Tera Steel foes like Iron Valiant. Ogerpon-C's main weakness lies in its reliance on Sturdy to set up against more powerful foes and its lack of immediate power before setting up. Thus, it is better off being saved as a cleaner for the later stages of a game. Entry hazard support, in particular Spikes, is highly valued to allow Ogerpon-C to KO many more threats; it can capitalize on hazard chip, for instance KOing even bulky foes like defensive Great Tusk unboosted once they are chipped. Thus, allies that can set hazards early-game like Hisuian Samurott and Garchomp are good partners. Ogerpon-C is also held back by its middling Speed tier, which leaves it susceptible to being revenge killed by Mega Lopunny, as it is capable of bypassing Sturdy, along with many other foes like Iron Valiant if Ogerpon-C has already lost Sturdy. Thus, Pokemon like Choice Scarf Tapu Lele that can threaten these frailer foes make for good allies.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Rock

Play Rough is another good option over Superpower, as it hits Kommo-o and gets a guaranteed OHKO on Urshifu-S without a Swords Dance boost; however, it leaves Ogerpon-C without coverage for Steel-types. Knock Off can be used to hit Gholdengo, Jirachi, and create permanent progress by removing items. Low Kick can be used over Superpower as an alternative option that doesn't drop Ogerpon-C's stats while still threatening Steel types. Taunt allows Ogerpon-C to set up in front of Toxapex and prevents burns from Galarian Weezing.

Swords Dance (Rock).description:
Ogerpon-C is an excellent wallbreaker and setup sweeper for Rock teams, not only because of its neutrality to Ground- and Water-type moves, but also because it is able to outspeed and deal with threats like Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and Mamoswine. Sturdy allows Ogerpon-C to take a hit from and remove faster threats like Barraskewda, as well as Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Choice Scarf Galarian Zapdos after a Swords Dance. Ivy Cudgel deals with threats like Ogerpon-H, Baxcalibur, and Enamorus, while also OHKOing Dragonite and Heatran after a Swords Dance. Horn Leech is a good Grass STAB move, being able to hurt Ground- and Water-types like Quagsire and Ting-Lu and OHKO Walking Wake after a boost. Horn Leech's recovery is useful for extending Ogerpon-C's longevity and can let Sturdy be used again if it brings Ogerpon-C back to full HP. Superpower is a strong coverage move as it is able to deal with Steel- and Dark-types like Iron Treads, Hisuian Goodra, Urshifu-S, and Kingambit while being able to OHKO Snorlax at +2.

Choice Scarf Glimmora, with its colorful moveset, deals with faster threats that outspeed Ogerpon-C like non-Choice-Scarf Greninja, Kommo-o, and Iron Valiant. In return, Ogerpon-C deals with Azumarill and Ursaluna-B for Glimmora. Air Balloon Glimmora can switch into threatening Ground-type moves while taking on foes like Great Tusk, clear entry hazards with Mortal Spin to make sure Ogerpon-C's Sturdy isn't broken, and sets its own hazards to enable Ogerpon-C's sweep. Tyranitar sets up sand to allow Ogerpon-C to set up easier due to the Special Defense boost, allowing Ogerpon-C to survive a Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Walking Wake. Tyranitar also acts as a specially defensive tank for Ogerpon-C and deals with Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Spectrier. Ogerpon-C aids Tyranitar by dealing with Landorus-T and non-Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott. Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine is a strong wallbreaker, using Head Smash and Flare Blitz to break through walls like Gholdengo and Corviknight. Hisuian Arcanine appreciates Ogerpon-C being able to deal with pesky Water- and Ground-types like Belly Drum Azumarill, Landorus, and Sandy Shocks. Coalossal is a decent physical wall that can remove hazards, which prevents Ogerpon-C's Sturdy from breaking, and deals with Chien-Pao, Kingambit, Scizor, and Corviknight. Coalossal also sets up Spikes to enhance Ogerpon-C's wallbreaking. Ogerpon-C takes care of Ursaluna-B and Manaphy for Coalossal. Iron Defense + Body Press Garganacl can act as a defensive stallbreaker, using Salt Cure to weaken impediments to Ogerpon-C sweeping, like Skeledirge, Dondozo, and Hisuian Goodra. Ogerpon-C shuts down Choice Band Mamoswine, which would otherwise destroy Garganacl. Lead Kleavor is another option that can set Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, potentially breaking a Focus Sash on Ceruledge, Breloom, and Ribombee that can hinder Ogerpon-C's sweeps otherwise. Assault Vest Diancie eases the Fighting and Dragon matchups by being able to take on non-Choice Band Urshifu-S, Iron Valiant, Baxcalibur, and Dragapult. Alolan Golem can trap and eliminate Steel-types such as Corviknight and Scizor for Ogerpon-C. In return Ogerpon-C destroys Ground-types like Quagsire and Ursaluna-B.

Pseudo-Sash.description:
• Ogerpon-C is arguably the best Sturdy Pokemon in the metagame, functioning like a great Focus Sash lead without conflicting with Item Clause.

  • Horn Leech: While it has stronger Grass-type STAB moves, Horn Leech's recovery can bring Ogerpon-C back to full health while taking advantage of Sturdy.

  • Knock Off: This is Ogerpon-C's best option against Gholdengo.

  • Quick Attack: While weak, Quick Attack gives Ogerpon-C the edge against Focus Sash foes with priority such as Urshifu-R and speedy Focus Sash users like Iron Bundle.

  • Swords Dance and Encore: Swords Dance gives Ogerpon-C more use in late-game situations, with Sturdy making Swords Dance easy to use provided hazards have not been set up. Encore aids this even further, though at the cost of no longer covering Gholdengo with Knock Off.

  • Rock Tomb: Dropping a foe's Speed with Rock Tomb can be a useful and unexpected way to revenge kill them after Ogerpon-C is KOed and prevents Terastallized Dragon Dance foes like Dragonite and Baxcalibur from setting up easily.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 124 Atk / 68 Def / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: This bulkier spread allows Ogerpon-C to survive Jolly Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes and outspeeds Iron Bundle after Rock Tomb's Speed drop. It also naturally outspeeds Jolly Breloom.

Other Options

  • Trailblaze: Ogerpon-C is not nearly as effective at sweeping with Trailblaze as Ogerpon-H, but it's still a potential win condition that can work well with Sturdy due to ease of setup.

  • Leech Seed: While Rock is not a good defensive typing, both Sturdy and Embody Aspect can make good use of Leech Seed's recovery.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-C is locked into a Rock Tera type, with the bonus of getting a Defense boost via Embody Aspect. While the Defense boost can be useful, note that Ogerpon-C loses Sturdy, which ironically can make it easier to OHKO! If needing the Defense boost, it's usually best to do this if Ogerpon-C is not at full health or needs a boosted Ivy Cudgel to KO a threat.

Swords Dance.description: Ogerpon-C, with the combination of Swords Dance + Ivy Cudgel that is further boosted by Rocky Payload and its signature item Cornerstone Mask, is a devastating physical wallbreaker that is able to threaten common physical walls in Corviknight, Zapdos, Great Tusk, and defensive Quaquaval. Power Whip is a more powerful Grass-type STAB move, while Horn Leech is more reliable and provides better longevity. Knock Off hits Gholdengo and wears down Corviknight, Play Rough 2HKOes defensive Kommo-o and chips Sap Sipper Great Tusk, while Trailblaze is an option to make Ogerpon-C a potential sweeping threat. Fast physical attackers like Barraskewda, Roaring Moon, and Meowscarda appreciate Ogerpon-C being able to apply constant offensive pressure to help break down Corviknight, Zapdos, and if running Play Rough, Kommo-o, allowing them to be more efficient cleaners. Ogerpon-C has a poor defensive typing and can be vulnerable to chip damage or entry hazards, thus slow pivots like Corviknight, which can remove hazards, and Manaphy, on balance or more offensive-oriented dual screens teams, are recommended so that Ogerpon-C can come in safely. Ogerpon-C is also vulnerable to faster offensive Pokemon like Chien-Pao, Roaring Moon, and Barraskewda, so speed control like Choice Scarf Azelf and Roaring Moon are also good teammates for it.

Swords Dance (Rock).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive (Steel).description:
56 Speed EVs lets it outspeed Jolly Azumarill and Kingambit. The given Defensive investments allows Archaludon to live Earthquake from Choice Band Excadrill at full HP and OHKO back with Body Press.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Nasty Plot (Grass).description:
140 Speed Evs lets it outspeed Tyranitar, Empoleon, and Hisuian Goodra.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Offensive Dragon Dance.description: Gouging Fire is a devastating wallbreaker and setup sweeper alike that can tear through teams easily. Earthquake allows Gouging Fire to break past Toxapex and Heatran, which would otherwise be able to wall it. Morning Sun gives Gouging Fire the ability to heal off any chip damage from priority or Rocky Helmet, making it even more difficult to take down for defensive teams. Outrage can be used as a nuke with Dragonium Z, letting Gouging Fire muscle past walls such as Dondozo through its sheer strength alone. Tera Ground can be used to power up Gouging Fire's Earthquake while allowing it to remove its weaknesses to revenge killers such as Booster Energy Iron Boulder and Great Tusk, allowing it to potentially win on the spot. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Gouging Fire to come in many times and attempt to set up, while Booster Energy gives Gouging Fire a one-time Attack boost that can be crucial in breaking past foes such as Great Tusk and Landorus-T while still allowing Gouging Fire to Terastallize. Teammates that struggle with Steel-types, like Tapu Lele and Pecharunt, appreciate Gouging Fire breaking through those Steel-types. In return, they dispatch the physical walls that trouble Gouging Fire, such as Dondozo. Gouging Fire is often prone to getting revenge killed by Pokemon such as Iron Boulder and Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, so teammates that can deal with the aforementioned threats, like Mega Scizor and Landorus-T, are appreciated.

Dragon Dance (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Specially Defensive Dragon Dance (Dragon.description:
The given EV spread lets Gouging Fire not be 2HKO'ed by Choice Specs Greninja's Ice Beam, and outspeeds Flutter Mane after a Dragon Dance.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive Dragon Dance (Drago.description:
The given EV spread lets Gouging Fire not be 2HKO'ed by Choice Band Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, and not be revenge-killed by Choice Scarf users like Dragapult and Roaring Moon. 64 Speed EVs lets it outspeed threats like Choice Specs Latios at +1.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind (Electric).description:
132 Speed EVs outspeeds Jolly Kingambit

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind (Dragon).description:
The given EV spread lets Raging Bolt outpace Adamant Azumarill and Kingambit,and survive an unboosted Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and Moonblast from Flutter Mane at +1.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind.description: With access to Calm Mind and a stellar base 137 Special Attack, Raging Bolt is able to act as an excellent bulky setup sweeper. Raging Bolt’s good typing allows it to break through defensive Pokemon like Corviknight and bulky Water-types like Alomomola, Toxapex, and Rotom-W while also checking threats like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Kartana. Thunderclap offsets Raging Bolt’s subpar Speed stat, allowing it to revenge kill offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Ogerpon-W, and Mega Lopunny as well as weakened setup sweepers like Iron Boulder, Volcarona, and Swords Dance Kartana, while Thunderbolt gives Raging Bolt a consistent damaging attack that doesn’t rely on prediction like Thunderclap and has significantly higher PP, allowing Raging Bolt to use its Electric-type moves in longer games. Substitute is an alternative to nullify passive Pokémon that can’t touch Raging Bolt such as Rotom-W, Ferrothorn, and Zapdos and give it more opportunities to set up, while Taunt can be used to deny setup from Garganacl and Mega Scizor but at the cost of a worse matchup against Galarian Slowking. Draco Meteor in tandem with Dragonium Z lets it break through Electric-immune Pokemon such as Gliscor, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu as well as other specially bulky Pokémon that can take on Raging Bolt such as Mega Tyranitar and Galarian Slowking. Alternatively, Leftovers is also an option on Substitute sets to passively heal the chip taken from Substitute and give Raging Bolt some form of recovery. Tera Flying grants Raging Bolt a Ground immunity while giving a Fighting resistance that helps against Great Tusk and Zamazenta while also avoiding any Ground-type coverage from Serperior. Tera Fairy gives this same Fighting resistance while giving Raging Bolt an immunity to Dragon-type moves from the likes of Garchomp and Gouging Fire. The EV spread allows Raging Bolt to live a Choice Scarf Landorus-T Earthquake from full HP and have a chance to OHKO Mega Tyranitar after Stealth Rock; the EVs also give a chance to OHKO Galarian Slowking with a boosted Devastating Drake as well as OHKO Iron Valiant with a boosted Thunderclap after Stealth Rock chip. Raging Bolt struggles against fast Ground- and Fairy-types like Garchomp, Choice Scarf Landorus-T, Great Tusk, Tapu Koko, Iron Valiant, and especially Tapu Lele; Tapu Lele in particular can give Raging Bolt some trouble as well, as its Psychic Surge renders Thunderclap useless. Teammates like Mega Scizor, Ferrothorn, Rillaboom, and Galarian Slowking help beat these checks. Since Raging Bolt has no reliable recovery, Alomomola is a good partner to pass huge HP wishes to it and pivot it in. Other pivots like Tornadus-T, Mega Scizor, and Landorus-T also help bring Raging Bolt in safely. Teammates like Great Tusk and Zamazenta appreciate Raging Bolt taking care of Flying-types like Tornadus-T and Zapdos as well as bulky Waters like Rotom-W and Alomomola. In return, they help check Ferrothorn and Weavile. Great Tusk is another good partner, because it helps remove entry hazards, which harm Raging Bolt greatly, particularly Spikes.

Swords Dance.description: Iron Boulder is an excellent late-game cleaner, with Swords Dance allowing it to sweep and its good Speed stat and Booster Energy letting it outspeed the entire unboosted metagame including most Choice Scarf users. It has access to a strong STAB move in Mighty Cleave that bypasses Protect, which can be useful against a weakened Gliscor. Close Combat has great coverage alongside Mighty Cleave and hits Pokemon like Ferrothorn, Garganacl, Mega Lopunny, and Mega Tyranitar for massive damage, being able to OHKO all of them at +2 Attack with Tera Fighting. Zen Headbutt hits Zamazenta, Great Tusk, and Urshifu-R. Substitute allows Iron Boulder to scout for switches, as well as become immune to certain status moves like Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp. Iron Boulder can use Tera Flying to become immune to Earthquake that would otherwise OHKO it from Ground-types like Landorus-T, Gliscor, Garchomp, and Great Tusk. If your team has Tapu Koko to provide Electric Terrain, one option is to use Rockium Z over Booster Energy to power up Mighty Cleave to insane levels, OHKOing Gliscor and all but the bulkiest Landorus-T with Stealth Rock support after a Swords Dance. However, this option does make Iron Boulder dependent on Electric Terrain to retain its boosted Speed. Tapu Koko can also set up Reflect and Light Screen to help facilitate a sweep. Iron Boulder fits best on highly offensive teams, and functions as a late-game cleaner as well as a emergency check to speedy threats including Dragon Dance users like Gouging Fire and Booster Energy Iron Valiant. Fighting-types like Great Tusk, Mega Lopunny, and Urshifu-R benefit from having Iron Boulder on the team, as Iron Boulder can take advantage of and switch into Flying-types such as Zapdos and Tornadus-T that such allies are weak to. Teammates such as Hawlucha, Kartana and Iron Valiant can appreciate Rockium Z Iron Boulder's massive damage onto Landorus-T and Gliscor. Non-Rockium Z Iron Boulder can struggle with Ground-types like Landorus-T, Gliscor, Garchomp, and Great Tusk. Because of this, having a switch-in like your own Landorus-T or Gliscor is very helpful. Additionally, Iron Boulder can be revenge killed by Mega Scizor's Bullet Punch, so having answers to it like Volcarona and Gouging Fire is important. Iron Boulder appreciates hazard support from Pokemon like Great Tusk, Landorus-T, and Glimmora, as it can chip checks that would otherwise just fall short of a KO. Furthermore, physical wallbreakers such as Kartana and Mega Lopunny that can put Landorus-T and Gliscor in range of a +2 Mighty Cleave are also appreciated, especially since Gliscor can’t use Protect to heal with Poison Heal against Mighty Cleave, and Landorus-T doesn't have any reliable recovery. Finally, Pokemon such as Mega Medicham and Volcarona that can break through foes like Alomomola, Gliscor, Landorus-T, and Mega Scizor are also greatly appreciated.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Megahorn OHKO'es Ogerpon-W while Iron Head OHKO'es Flutter Mane.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Iron Boulder is one of the best single-button clickers imaginable; honestly, the other moves are mostly decorative. Sharpness- and Choice Band-boosted Mighty Cleave has excellent power and coverage, notably 2HKOing Unaware Deoxys-D and OHKOing most slower offensive Pokemon like Galarian Zapdos and Roaring Moon. Psycho Cut covers important targets like Great Tusk, Iron Hands, and Swampert, while Throat Chop reliably beats Gholdengo, and Sacred Sword beats Iron Treads and Hisuian Goodra. Iron Boulder has an awful defensive typing and greatly appreciates being brought in by slow pivots like Manaphy and Corviknight; thanks to its great Speed tier, it can usually force out the wallbreakers that come in on them in return. Iron Boulder also pairs well with other physically offensive threats like Barraskewda and Garchomp that can wear down opposing walls like Intimidate Corviknight with it. Fluffy walls such as Corviknight and Deoxys-D are extremely difficult for Iron Boulder to break past, so a strong Fire-type like Gouging Fire or Ceruledge makes an excellent teammate.

vgc2024.overview:
• Iron Crown is an excellent choice for offensive teams looking to take advantage of the powerful move Expanding Force thanks to its well-rounded stats and access to Booster Energy. It performs best against frailer offensive teams consisting of Pokemon that do not resist Expanding Force, such as Tornadus, Landorus, and Urshifu-R.

  • Although it can be used as a sweeper early-game to soften opposing teams, it is usually better to save Iron Crown for the late-game when its checks have been sufficiently weakened for it to sweep.

  • Indeedee-F is by far Iron Crown's best teammate, offering role compression as a Psychic Terrain setter and redirector. Access to Helping Hand also further amplifies its partner's ridiculous damage output.

  • Iron Crown's best counters are Dark- and Steel-types, namely Incineroar, Kingambit, Archaludon, and Gholdengo, all of which resist both of Iron Crown's STAB moves.

  • Therefore, Iron Crown appreciates Pokemon that can help remove these threats consistently, such as Landorus, Entei, and Urshifu-R. In return, Iron Crown can pressure opposing Urshifu-R and Amoonguss.

  • Rillaboom is another noteworthy check, as it is able to safely pivot in and override Psychic Terrain, weakening Expanding Force significantly. Other Pokemon with access to Ice Spinner like Chien-Pao and Dragonite can also be used to remove Psychic Terrain.

  • Faster Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane serve as good checks as well, but they have to watch out for Follow Me from Indeedee-F as they are vulnerable to Tachyon Cutter.

Booster Energy.description:
• Expanding Force is Iron Crown's go-to STAB move, allowing it to devastate foes under Psychic Terrain.

  • Tachyon Cutter helps secure the OHKO on Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Whimsicott, which commonly hold Focus Sash.

  • Tera Water is a naturally good defensive typing that, when coupled with Tera Blast, gives Iron Crown an out against the aforementioned Dark- and Steel-type Pokemon, which otherwise counter it. Focus Blast can be used over Tera Blast to secure the OHKO on Kingambit, but is rather inconsistent and is unable to hit Gholdengo.

  • An alternative spread of 76 HP / 4 Def / 172 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe allows Iron Crown to outspeed Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao thanks to Speed Booster Energy.

  • This set can also be run with a Modest nature to maximize Iron Crown's damage output, at the risk of underspeeding opposing Pokemon in the same Speed tier such as Modest Landorus and both Urshifu formes.

cap.comments:
Checks and Counters

Fairy-types: Common Fairy-types such as Jumbao and Iron Valiant take a pittance from Arghonaut's attacks and can break through it easily with their STAB moves. Hatterene deserves a special mention, as it can bounce back Arghonaut's Spikes with Magic Bounce. However, Tera Fairy Arghonaut can wall most Iron Valiant sets and phazes it.

Poison-types: Venomicon, Toxapex, and Amoonguss wall Arghonaut with ease and threaten it out with Hurricane or Sludge Bomb. Venomicon-E and Plasmanta can both hit Arghonaut super effectively before and after Terastallizing thanks to their STAB combinations; the former can also absorb Knock Off.

Powerful Wallbreakers: Strong wallbreakers such as Choice Band Great Tusk, Breloom, and Iron Moth are capable of 2HKOing Arghonaut even after it Terastallizes. Meowscarada and Krilowatt deal significant damage to Arghonaut before it Terastallizes, but Arghonaut has little to fear from them after Terastallizing. Furthermore, Krilowatt must be careful when switching in, since it is heavily crippled by Knock Off.

Miasmaw: Miasmaw ignores Unaware thanks to Neutralizing Gas, making it extremely difficult for Arghonaut to handle. After a Swords Dance, Miasmaw can easily 2HKO Arghonaut with Scale Shot or Gunk Shot and OHKO Tera Fairy Arghonaut with the latter move. However, Miasmaw dislikes being phazed due to its Stealth Rock weakness.

Status: Toxic from Pokemon such as Clodsire and Snaelstrom puts Arghonaut on a timer, greatly reducing its ability to stay in and wall powerful threats. On the other hand, burn from threats such as Astrolotl, Rotom-W, and Dragapult makes Arghonaut significantly more passive, reducing its ability to pressure resilient threats such as Gholdengo.

Unaware Wall.description:
Set Details

Great mixed bulk and Unaware make Arghonaut one of the metagame's most formidable walls, capable of taking on threats such as Gholdengo, Volcarona, Stratagem, and Kingambit. Additionally, Arghonaut's ability to force switches and strong matchup into Equilibra make it an excellent user of Spikes. Circle Throw phazes common setup sweepers such as Dragonite and Baxcalibur and whittles down the opposing team in conjunction with Spikes. Knock Off is Arghonaut's best way to force progress against walls such as Garganacl and Venomicon and deals heavy damage to Ghost-types trying to switch into Circle Throw such as Dragapult and Gholdengo. Leftovers provides Arghonaut with extra longevity and makes it less reliant on Recover, while Covert Cloak shields it from chip damage from Salt Cure and other bothersome secondary effects such as Special Defense drops from Shadow Ball. The given EVs allow Arghonaut to avoid the 2HKO from Baxcalibur's Glaive Rush and from Krilowatt's Tera Water Surf. Tera Fairy flips many of Arghonaut's bad matchups, letting it check a wide array of threats including Venomicon lacking Sludge Bomb, Krilowatt, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult.

Arghonaut fits mostly on balance and stall teams that appreciate its ability to blanket check various offensive threats and force progress with Knock Off and Spikes. Stealth Rock setters such as Venomicon, Garganacl, and Ting-Lu are strong partners that can stack entry hazards with Arghonaut. Venomicon additionally handles threats to Arghonaut such as offensive Great Tusk, Meowscarada, and Iron Valiant, while Garganacl appreciates Arghonaut removing Covert Cloak from opposing Arghonaut and Gholdengo. Ground-types such as Equilibra, Great Tusk, and Garchomp can deal with Electric- and Poison-types such as Iron Hands and Toxapex, while in return Arghonaut can switch into Greninja lacking Grass Knot. Skeledirge forms a formidable Unaware core with Arghonaut, taking on Jumbao, Venomicon, and Iron Valiant while Arghonaut covers it against threats like Snaelstrom, Garganacl, and Choice Band Roaring Moon. Bulky setup sweepers such as Naviathan, Ceruledge, and Hatterene take advantage of Arghonaut whittling down their checks with Spikes and Knock Off over the course of the game.

cap.comments:
Checks and Counters

Fire-types: Jumbao has nothing in its arsenal to meaningfully damage Fire-types such as Skeledirge, Volcarona, Iron Moth, and Ceruledge, all of which can take advantage of it by setting up or firing off a powerful attack. While Cinderace has to be more wary of repeated hits, it can switch into Jumbao at least once with relative impunity and force it out.

Poison-types: Amoonguss switches into Jumbao relatively well and can use Spore as it is forced out but must watch out for Tera Blast Fire. Toxapex, Clodsire, and Venomicon can wall Jumbao and use it as an opportunity to set entry hazards or force progress with Toxic or Knock Off. Venomicon-E outspeeds Jumbao and can take at least one hit and OHKO back with Gunk Shot or Brave Bird.

Steel-types: Steel-types such as Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Bulletproof Equilibra can wall and KO Jumbao with their STAB attacks, but they take significant damage from Tera Blast Fire if Jumbao Terastallizes.

Faster Pokemon: If Jumbao does not hold a Choice Scarf, it is vulnerable to faster attackers with super effective coverage such as Greninja, Dragapult, and Stratagem.

Drought Wallbreaker.description:
Set Details

Jumbao is one of the best Pokemon in the metagame thanks to its excellent offensive stats, defensive utility, and incredible ability in Drought, which enables a host of powerful offensive partners. Tera Blast Fire pressures the Steel- and Poison-types that resist Jumbao's STAB combination, such as Gholdengo, Corviknight, and Venomicon. Alternatively, if Jumbao is paired with teammates that rely on Terastallizing, Focus Blast can be used to retain the OHKO on Kingambit. Synthesis lets Jumbao continuously keep sun up with Heat Rock and outlast Pokemon such as Great Tusk and Roaring Moon. Tera Fire allows Jumbao to take advantage of Tera Blast Fire's coverage and improves its matchup against Steel-types such as Scizor and Gholdengo by removing its Steel weakness.

Jumbao can fit comfortably on a variety of playstyles from bulky offense to balance thanks to the team support it provides through Drought. Fire-types such as Skeledirge, Cinderace, Ceruledge, and Iron Moth and Protosynthesis users such as Roaring Moon, Sandy Shocks, and Great Tusk are Jumbao's best offensive partners, as they all become extremely dangerous under sun. Since Jumbao is incredibly vulnerable to opposing Fire-types, defensive Pokemon that can handle them, such as Toxapex, Arghonaut, Ting-Lu, and Garganacl, are excellent partners. The latter three can also set entry hazards to help Jumbao wallbreak, while Toxapex can handle opposing Jumbao and Glimmora. Toxapex and Hatterene can create momentum for sun teams with Eject Button, the latter of which also keeps entry hazards off the field for Fire-type teammates. Bulky Steel-types such as Corviknight and Equilibra can check Poison-types that Jumbao struggles to break such as Amoonguss and Venomicon and appreciate Jumbao handling their checks, such as Krilowatt and Great Tusk.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Details

Choice Scarf Jumbao picks off normally faster threats such as Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and Krilowatt and supports offensive teammates with Healing Wish. Drought allows Jumbao to use Solar Beam quicker and provide sun support for teammates such as Great Tusk and Cinderace. Trace, on the other hand, allows Jumbao to copy valuable abilities such as Toxapex's Regenerator and Venomicon-E's Tinted Lens; however, it requires Jumbao to run Leaf Storm to retain a powerful Grass-type STAB move because of Solar Beam's two-turn wait outside of sun. Tera Fire with Tera Blast grants Jumbao coverage to hit Steel-types such as Corviknight and Gholdengo and resistances to key attacks such as Gholdengo's Make It Rain, Iron Valiant's Moonblast, and Baxcalibur's Ice Shard. Focus Blast, on the other hand, lets Jumbao OHKO Kingambit without Terastallizing.

Choice Scarf Jumbao is a strong asset to bulky offense teams, providing them with speed control and incredibly useful Healing Wish support. Defensive pivots that lack reliable recovery, such as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, Equilibra, and Rotom-W, benefit immensely from Jumbao's ability to bring them back to full health late in the game, which gives them the freedom to take more hits early on. These Pokemon can also handle the Steel- and Fire-types that can take Jumbao's STAB attacks, such as Cinderace, Gholdengo, and Iron Moth. Pivots like Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Cinderace can bring Jumbao in safely against Pokemon it threatens, such as Krilowatt and Hydreigon. Bulky setup sweepers such as Hatterene and Kingambit can break down teams for Jumbao to clean late-game and greatly appreciate Jumbao giving them a second chance to sweep with Healing Wish. Poison-types such as Toxapex, Venomicon, and Clodsire wall Jumbao, so wallbreakers that can threaten them, such as Dragapult, Baxcalibur, and Smokomodo, are good teammates. Lastly, if Jumbao opts to use Drought, it can set sun to support Fire-types such as Skeledirge and Iron Moth and Protosynthesis users such as Great Tusk and Roaring Moon.

cap.comments:
Checks and Counters

Grass-types: Grass-types like Jumbao, Pyroak, and Amoonguss wall Caribolt's STAB combination, forcing it out.

Faster Attackers: Before Caribolt uses Rapid Spin, Pokemon like Cinderace and Ice Beam Greninja can outspeed and OHKO it. Fast Dragon-types like Dragapult, Roaring Moon, and Astrolotl can switch in to check Caribolt once, but they cannot do so if Caribolt reaches both +1 Speed and +2 Attack.

Strong Priority Attacks: Strong priority attacks from Kingambit, Dragonite, and Revenankh can circumvent Caribolt's Speed boosts and KO it after it has taken some chip damage from Double-Edge.

talahbolt (Swords Dance).description:
Set Details

Caribolt is a nuclear wallbreaker for offensive teams. Double-Edge with Galvanize can break through even the tier's most stalwart walls, 2HKOing Pokemon like Skeledirge and Garganacl with ease, especially once Caribolt Terastallizes. Horn Leech provides some modicum of recovery to compensate for Double-Edge's recoil. Rapid Spin both increases Caribolt's Speed, giving it sweeping potential, and supports teammates weak to Stealth Rock like Baxcalibur and Iron Moth, allowing them to forego Heavy-Duty Boots. Leftovers helps make up for Double-Edge's recoil alongside Horn Leech, while Magnet powers up Caribolt's Electric-type attacks even further. A Jolly nature is preferred to outspeed Choice Scarf Jumbao at +1 Speed and Krilowatt at +0, but Adamant is an option to deal as much damage as possible, supporting its hyper offense teammates. Tera Grass is an option to turn Ground-types like Equilibra and Great Tusk into setup fodder, but Caribolt's main focus should be on wallbreaking as much as possible for its teammates.

Caribolt is best utilized on hyper offense teams, which appreciate its incredible wallbreaking ability. Stealth Rock-weak Pokemon like Iron Moth, Baxcalibur, and Venomicon-E appreciate Caribolt removing the hazard, allowing Iron Moth and Baxcalibur to run more offensive items over Heavy-Duty Boots. Other physical sweepers like Dragon Dance Roaring Moon and Dragonite love Caribolt powering through Unaware walls like Skeledirge and Arghonaut; Roaring Moon pairs particularly well with Caribolt, as it can threaten the Grass-types like Jumbao and Amoonguss that give Caribolt trouble with Tera Flying + Acrobatics. This love is shared by special sweepers like Iron Valiant and Hatterene, which need Skeledirge off the table before attempting a sweep. Caribolt appreciates entry hazards weakening physically bulky Ground-types like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu—which can beat Caribolt if it Terastallizes—into KO range of its attacks, so pairing it with a dedicated lead like Greninja or Meowscarada is suggested.

cap.comments:
Checks and Counters

Water-types: Rotom-W hard counters Equilibra, as it takes negligible damage from any of Equilibra's moves and threatens it with Hydro Pump. Arghonaut similarly brushes off Equilibra's attacks and threatens to cripple it with Knock Off. Greninja and Krilowatt can switch in on Flash Cannon and threaten to deal significant damage to Equilibra, but they are 2HKOed by Earth Power.

Bulky Flying-types: Bulky Flying-types such as Corviknight, Venomicon, and Tomohawk give Equilibra trouble, as they don’t take much damage from Equilibra's moves and force it out with super effective attacks.

Ground-types: Offensive Great Tusk sets OHKO Equilibra with Close Combat, while defensive sets can either deal significant damage with Body Press or cripple it with Knock Off. Other bulky Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Clodsire are easily capable of dealing with Bulletproof Equilibra, but it has little to fear from them if it forgoes Bulletproof for Levitate.

Item Manipulation: Equilibra heavily relies on the passive recovery granted by Leftovers, so it must be careful when switching in on Pokemon with Knock Off or Trick, such as Iron Treads and Gholdengo, so as not to risk taking a significant blow to its longevity.

Defensive Pivot.description:
Set Details

Equilibra's solid typing, great stats, and access to Rapid Spin make it one of the premier defensive pivots and entry hazard removers in the metagame. Levitate is the recommended ability, as it drastically improves Equilibra's matchups against opposing Ground-types, such as Clodsire and Garchomp, while also presenting more opportunities to clear entry hazards without worrying about taking Spikes damage. Alternatively, Bulletproof blocks Focus Blast from Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Jumbao and Shadow Ball from Ghost-types such as Dragapult and Hisuian Zoroark. Protect allows Equilibra to scout the foe's moves and get additional healing from Leftovers, while Pain Split gives it an alternative form of recovery, lowering its reliance on Leftovers. Alternatively, Aura Sphere allows Equilibra to beat opposing Levitate Equilibra and improves its matchup against Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Colossoil. The given EV spread allows Equilibra to avoid an OHKO from Choice Specs Greninja's Hydro Pump, survive the combination of Moonblast into Close Combat from mixed Tera Fairy Iron Valiant, and outspeed Adamant Breloom after getting a Speed boost from Rapid Spin. Tera Water allows Equilibra to tank Fire-type attacks from Pokemon such as Iron Moth, Astrolotl, and Skeledirge. Alternatively, Tera Flying flips Equilibra's matchups against Fighting-types such as Great Tusk and Breloom on their heads while allowing Bulletproof Equilibra to safely stay in against opposing Ground-types.

Equilibra struggles against Water- and Flying-types, so Electric-types such as Caribolt, Iron Hands, and Plasmanta make for great partners. Water-types such as Arghonaut and Rotom-W synergize well with Equilibra, since they can switch in on Fire-type attacks aimed at it; they, in turn, appreciate Equilibra's ability to absorb Electric-type attacks and pressure Jumbao, one of their greatest threats. Venomicon is one of the best defensive partners for Equilibra, since it walls many of the Fighting- and Ground-types that Equilibra struggles against such as Great Tusk; in return, Equilibra deals with Pokemon that Venomicon struggles against, such as Stratagem and Hatterene. Equilibra relies heavily on Leftovers for recovery, so it appreciates support from teammates that don't mind taking Knock Off, like Corviknight and Toxapex. Thanks to Equilibra's ability to consistently keep entry hazards off the field, it works well with teammates that are worn down by them, such as Snaelstrom, Iron Moth, and Loaded Dice Baxcalibur.
